review: I usually eat at  2 off Oltorf St. but the food is better than most restaurants and trucks.

Tiny trailer. Tex-Mex food. Cash only. Red sauce is HOT  Tripas were OK and so was the potato and chorizo taco. The number of selections was impressive. If I am in the area again I may drop in. Lots of Tex-Mex food in this area compete with each other.

WoW  My neighbor mentioned this place coming back from HEB and I am so glad he did. My neighbor got the burrito  which looked immense considering the  7. I had been craving a Torta and was happy. What a hidden gem  There seems to be a widely varied menu to choose from. The food was fast and the people friendly. Can t wait to go back.

Wow. We picked a random taco truck on the site of the road  and I m glad we did. 4 tacos for  7  not pictured are the cactus and egg taco and the chorizo and egg taco . Everything was freshly cooked and delicious. And the salsas were
My dad and I both got chorizo  amp  potato and egg  amp  bacon. Very delicious  quick service  great salsa. Will be back

A much needed good fast casual Tex-Mex restaurant in the Four Points area. My prayers have been answered.   The Puffy Tacos are outstanding. Homemade puffy corn tortillas stuffed with delicious picadillo beef. Cooked to perfection and tasty.   The hot sauce and queso are spot on. You could dine on this alone.   Anxious to come back and try other dishes but so far this hits all the marks for simple  good  fast Tex Mex.   Service was friendly and prompt.

I have had the pleasure of eating at a number of Los Palapas locations in the San Antonio area. I have always been very happy with the food and the service.  This Austin location is a franchise and has had a difficult time getting opened up. Now they are open for drive-thru service most every day of the week and dining service in the afternoons a couple of days a week. While dining there this afternoon we were told that the problem has been with Staffing shortages.  My dining partner and I were both very happy with our choices and enjoyed our experience at Las Palapas near the intersection of 620 and 2222.   Each of us had a cup of chicken tortilla soup which was a very good. I ate a plate of two Puffy Tacos with ground beef in them and my partner had an ala carte shrimp taco and a puffy taco.  We will both be back and will likely try breakfast once they open up for early morning hours. Their menu is extensive and the food is good.

This place has only been open at this location for about a week.  We were here for breakfast.  I had the breakfast chalupa plate.  It comes with two chalupas topped with your choice of eggs  beans  lettuce  tomatoes  avocado  and cheese.  It was very  very good.  The plate comes with homemade corn tortillas or flour tortillas.  We chose the corn.  The tortillas were fresh  steaming hot  and delicious.  I also had the chorizo and egg breakfast taco.  It was delicious too.  My hubby had the bacon and egg plate.  It comes with two eggs  three thick slices of bacon  potatoes and beans  and tortillas.  He said it was very good.    We will certainly come back

Had their chips and queso. Chicken and shrimp tacos. They were both really good. The size of the shrimp was big. Thought the whole meal was really good and filling. Shrimp well seasoned  the chicken was juicy  I feel like it was chicken thighs. But I could be wrong. Really good  I ll be back again.
Great big tv to watch the game. I had the LP Breakfast and it s was amazing    Bloody Mary was spot on.

Very disappointed  Waited months for this place to open  every time I would stop by it was close early. We finally got to come in for the first time and the place looked pretty good I love the restroom sink finally a normal sink  Service was good from the young lady that delivered our food.. waiter was ok a lil rushy... unfortunately the food was awful  everything was cold.. cheese was not melted in my enchilada and I ve never ate queso I didn t like .. that was soo strange. Unfortunately we will probably not be returning.. I rather eat Taco Cabana.
Excellent  amp  delicious food  homemade tortillas  Margaritas   amp  service     Finally some real Mexican food.

First time here. Started out on a very high note with the wonderful young lady in the drive-thru. She has fantastic customer service skills. Very friendly and great smile. You don t get that anymore. Food was fresh and tasted good. Tortillas were soooooo good  I m anxious to try several different dishes at this place. Especially breakfast.

My husband and I walked in around lunch time. They were not very busy. We were not acknowledged at all  not even a greeting. After my husband approached an employee  someone came and said  that lady will be with you shortly ...we waited a few more minutes and walked out. A simple greeting goes a long way and they didn t even do that. So they lost business today.

Like most people in Austin  I have a deep love for tacos. But unlike most people who live here  I grew up a hop  skip  jump away from the border so I  know  tacos. Last night  we went to a 50th birthday party that ended up revealing to me that I can actually find border style tacos in Austin... and they come to you.  Taquizas Mariana had a setup there. A plancha style affair with a trompo spit  tiny corn tortillas  fresh salsas  pollo  bistek  and helotes. I felt like the proprietor - Mariana - and I were besties at the end of the night but I d also had a lot of tequila. What I do know for sure is that the food was amazing. I had 6 tacos and an entire corn on the cob and the only reason I didn t go back because I was too damn full. But I wanted to. I wanted to grab the spit and run and make pastor tacos for the rest of the week. She said she ll make whatever - mole  lengua  menudo  etc.   I don t want to write this because it likely means that everyone else will discover how great she is but I also want to keep finding her at backyard parties like some kind of delightful surprise.

Mariana Taquizas was AMAZING  The variety of different tacos  salsas  and  Aguas frescas were a hit  The cactus sales was so delicious  Thank you for making our baby shower a success with such tasty food and great customer service   I will definitely recommend y all and use you again.  Thank you    Veronica

They were over one hour late and our guests were hungry.  But The tacos and quesadillas were deliciouso.  My guests kept going back for more .  And the portions where good...... plus they have a reasonable prices .

Went from CA to a party where these people were contracted  they were 2 hrs late  everyone was starving and to top it off when food was  ready  tacos meat was frozen  quesadillas burned but cheese was cold unmelted  and raw. They were supposed to serve 50 people  we were less than the 50 present at the party and barely half were served rice and beans. My table and the one next to ours didn t get rice or beans because food was not enough   My kids who are not picky with food and were starving just tried it and didn t want to eat  at least beans and rice would ve been enough if there had been any. HOW EXPENSIVE CAN BEANS AND RICE BE . Avoid them unless you want your guests to go buy fast food  want mediocre service and food poisoning.

We requested their catering services for my daughter s graduation. They arrived on time and got to work setting up and cooking  we were eating in 30 minutes. The food was fantastic. Just like a traditional Mexican taco stand. We have eaten in many parts of Mexico and this is honestly mexican food  carne de pollo  bistec  y carne de al pastor with all the fixings. Great salsas  different levels of spiciness. And even aguas frescas with little pieces of fruit  Loved them  Saved their number in my phone   Will 100  use them again

I just can t say enough about Mariana and her husbands delicious cooking    I found her here on yelp. I was a little wary seeing she just had one review but i was mind blown   We hired them for our rehearsal back yard party which I must add was 90  family from Mexico. Which means I needed the best of the best tacos Texas has to offer. My family from out of town were impressed and even went for seconds  I definitely recommend this family owned business for your next party  Call Mariana
Plain and simple  everything was delicious. She had everything set up well  food tasted good. The aguas were great. Hire her for your next event.  Todo estaba delicioso
Best tacos in the round rock austin area  Great service and the workers are so friendly  Cant wait for my next party to call these guys  5 stars.

This was THE BEST catering experience ever  The Taco Stand brought over was amazing. Marianas sons came over and set up everything and cooked everything fresh. They had different jugs of juices  pineapple  horchata and lemonade. They had different toppings for the tacos and different salsas  The meats were delicious  they brought over  trompo pork   steak and chicken. I had family visit  from Mexico and they were raving about the taste and authenticity of these tacos. The guys took care of everything the set up  they brought plates and napkins and cups. If you need a taco stand at any party or wedding HIRE THEM  SO GOOD

I am glad to see others had better experiences than me. The reason for my 1 star  They showed up 1 hour late to our planned event  This was a big deal and a very special event  Mariana s communication was very poor  I thought she would be the one helping at the event and had no idea that she would be sending other people on her behalf  she never mentioned that to me . I found out the day of the event when I called her  after no one showed up  and she told me her team was on the way. To my disappointment  when they did not show up 30 minutes later  I called again but she never answered. I texted her and asked her for a discount for the inconvenience but she never responded to my text either. I voiced my concerns with her team after they finally showed up and they apologized  they were scheduled for 1 hour later than what I had discussed with Mariana by phone and text  but Mariana never bothered to text me back. I am very disappointed in her communication style and her customer service.   To be fair  the food and service of the team that came to host us was good. The guys were very nice and stayed an extra hour to make up for lost time.   Unfortunately  I will not recommend her due to her lack of communication  and to her ignoring not responding to my text. Customer service was very poor.

AWESOME TACOS    I was stressing on finding a good taco truck for my little boy Baptism  amp  happened to find Mariana on here  amp  I just trusted the reviews. We are all 100  Mexican so we are very picky on good authentic tacos and let me tell you the trompo  bistec   amp  barbacoa were AMAZING. Aguas frescas  amp  salsas were on POINT   Super duper recommend service is amazing  amp  very friendly

The wait at Jiffy Lube was long so decided to try this taco stand that opened across the street a couple of months back. I live a few blocks from here so I notice new things come up and a food cart in North Campus   Hyde Park is pretty rare.  The food is really quite cheap   1.50 breakfast tacos   2 lunch tacos  and a few things such as quesadillas a little bit more but all less than  4 .   I ordered a chicken fajita taco   2  and a potato breakfast taco   1.50  with the 50 cent cent tip came out to just  4. Both tacos were on flour and I opted to get lettuce and tomatoes on the chicken taco. The chicken fajita taco and salsa were mediocre pretty mediocre. The chicken didn t taste that fresh although the tortilla and vegetables were fresh. The included salsa  one a green sauce and one a red sauce were also not particularly flavorful although both were spicy  even for someone that indulges in spicy food pretty regularly. However  the breakfast potato taco was excellent. The potatoes and cheese tasted fresh and the tortilla had the same fluffy  chewy quality of the one used in the chicken fajita taco. Luckily for me  these breakfast tacos are served all day.  I definitely recommend stopping by  especially if you live in the area  are looking for cheap eats  or like Mexican food. Also please note unlike some of the food carts  although like most of them   this place is cash only but it should be easy to scrounge up some cash for this place given its price.

Chicanas has set up shop on 38th and Guadalupe  and it is very distinguishable  what with its plain white cart and bright yellow sign. Plus  there is not much in the way of food carts in this neck of the woods. The menu is simple  boasting meat-laden tacos during lunch and breakfast tacos all the day long.  Chicanas was not all that bad  but I just felt like it incited somewhat of a perversion of the homemade appeal of getting a nitty-gritty taco off of a mobile eatery. To explain  I must go deep into the truck.  I looked into the truck and saw Hill Country Fare  for those who know HEB  you will quickly recognize this as the  house  brand  refried beans. First red flag  canned refried beans. The other mark of mediocrity was the microwave. My tortillas were microwaved  when I at least would have preferred some toasting on a skillet. Alas  I can t have it all...  The taco-based grub is pretty good here  but if you are around this part of town thirsting for some quality  though maybe not authentic  fare  you may just want to head over to the haunt in proximity to 42nd and Lamar. This joint is not specifically desirable  though you could eat here if you wanted to avoid paying a pretty penny.
Amazing salsa and breakfast tacos. Takes about 5 minutes. Not long at all. Made to order takes time. Huge portions  3 tacos for 4 bucks is a no brainier.

The food here was great  with one exception  I definitely plan to return. I ordered three tacos  chorizo and egg   1.50   chicken fajita   2   and pastor taco   2 .  You re given a choice of flour or corn tortilla.    The chorizo and egg was great. I was pleasantly surprised that cheese was included.  The egg was fluffy and there was just the right amount of chorizo to add flavor but not make it too greasy.  I order this with a flour tortilla and it had clearly been heated cooked as well.  It tasted fresh made  but I can t be sure. Very delicious.  The chicken and pastor tacos were prepared in authentic Mexican street style  small pieces of meat with only cilantro  onions  and an optional spicy salsa.  The chicken was flavorful and moist.  The pastor seemed a little overcooked and lacking deep flavor  it didn t seem much like the stewed pastor I m used to  so it s possible there was a mistake and I got the wrong taco. Regardless of what it was  there wasn t enough flavor for me to want to order another in the future.  The woman in the trailer was nice and I thought the food overall was great for the price.  I definitely plan to come back to try more.  If I remember right  they also serve gorditas and tortas  so I ll have to try them as well.

I m glad I ignored the mediocre reviews. Their breakfast tacos are great- they are pretty big  very fresh and  best of all  they have my favorite kind of verde sauce  the sort of creamy and spicy kind. Best of all they are inexpensive and fast. Definitely go here

Chicken fajita taco was quite good and the salsas were great. My lunch partner got chorizo and pastor and enjoyed them. Got a breakfast taco and both the potato and the bacon were on the raw side and disappointing. This place does not sell drinks whatsoever and the gas station next door has overpriced drinks so cruise over to natural grocers first.

Hilariously  a taco truck is a rare enough thing in Hyde. Thankfully the tacos here are good and fresh. The guys in the truck are salty and not exactly personable. Doesn t really matter though  it s a taco from a truck -- you re not looking for world class customer service. It s reliably very fresh and very good. They re big tacos  overflowing with made to order ingredients. You re gonna have to wait though. Sometimes 20-25 minutes. There is shaded seating but if you re in a hurry  just go elsewhere.

One of the YUMMIEST breakfast tacos  If your by the area you need to try their breakfast tacos I was wanting some food this morning and THANK GOODNESS for this little food truck by my work  I order a bacon egg and cheese taco and a potato egg and cheese both on flour. They were both a good size and nicely stuffed  Their green salsa is so good not spicy at all and I really liked that because I don t do spicy food. But the salsa gave it a nice kick taste with out the spiciness is that makes any sense   Definitely a quick pick up breakfast spot and I m sure I ll be going back. Now I ll need to try their lunch  I ll keep y all posted

Came here for breakfast and so glad we did  The woman working was super nice and they made the food quickly  The Trojan is huge and so good  I was only able to eat half while there  My husband got the la gringas and they are like quesadillas  so so yummy  This is located in a shell parking lot  can grab a soda from the convenient store  Stop by and get you some good eats
Excellent tacos  great red salsa  great salsa verde  and horchata. Quick made to order Mexican food. They have nopales for vegetarians.

I used to come here almost every other day when the truck was next to the shop . Their food is second to none when it comes to food and taste here in San Marcos. Every thing on their menu is special . You would be satisfied with anything you choose . Service is top tier and the ambiance of a food truck scene is a cool one .
I got the birria tacos and oh my goodness 10 10 they were great   I highly recommend getting them

The birria tacos were as good as the reviews promised--two tacos packed to the gills with tender  quality meat and a cup of chunky broth and chile oil  i think she referred to is as consomm   it s delicious and looked like stew  to dunk them in and a beautiful little lime to finish. It was more than I could eat in one go but I believe it would fill Mr R on a hungry day  and  13 is fair when you appreciate it was all cooked fresh from quality ingredients and tastes great on your plate.  Similarly  the smoothies contain actual recognizable produce full of goodness and are made when you order. There are 3 sizes depending on your appetite and budget. Very filling   The staff were extremely friendly  polite  and kind. When my juice wasn t ready with my food she brought me a water  and she happily offered to explain how the tacos broth are usually eaten.  I look forward to trying more of their menu in the near future. A twitter post said they ve been in business for four years  impressive even in normal times  food industry is tough  and when you taste their cooking you understand why.

I ordered the beef fried rice  Talk about delicious  They use grass fed beef and the cook that cooks here is from Thailand and her recipe is what they serve  it s so good  Not greasy  Packed with flavor  they served it with a peanut sauce and finely chopped peanuts on top  We mainly got it for my daughter so they put most the sauces on the side. I ended up eating it... ALL  lol Hands down best fried rice you ll ever have  And I m telling you  I NEVER order fried rice from anywhere bc I like my own but dang. That was awesome  The staff was super friendly  they give you those feel good vibes  like they ve known you forever  worth the stop  will definitely be coming back  I do want to add this is actually located in the red bus food park on 801 chestnut st. You can buy alcohol from the red bus.
The birria tacos are so full of meat and the taco stays crunchy  Also their mango lime juice is delicious  Definitely coming here again.

I was so pleased with this great business  we were amazed by the quality of the food  and the customer service provided by Marcus. Him and his partner were super helpful and made sure we were taken care of. He was so kind in dealing with a transaction mistake and was super communicative with us  such a good energy all around. The food was ASTOUNDING and we will absolutely be going back. Thank you for a wonderful night

Literally the best food I ve ever eaten and I cook a lot at home. The owner and her family are amazing. Their business and the care that April takes with quality of their items is unmatched. Fav items on the menu right now are the elote  street corn  and the Pambazo. The juices are amazing too.

This place is so good  Birria tacos are excellent and the blueberry lemonade is like nothing you would expect    So good    The owners are super nice too    My husband and I will be making the 2 hour drive to eat here again       And dreaming about the Birria until then

I have to eat GF. Horrid life.  Trying new places but I can tell off the bat if the chefs are knowledgeable. They are MORE than knowledgeable  changed some things on their own so that I could enjoy yumminess. Add in the extreme deliciousness  that combo makes my heart flutter. Will be back for sure
Delicious Birria   Meat is very tender and very flavorful the broth is flavorful as well. Staff is friendly  Definitely coming back and recommend

The Birria tacos go hard as f    man  20 out of 10  It s been a long time since I ve been to a place where the meat and broth have the distinct flavor to the crispy tortilla with cilantro cabbage  onion and cheese. They also serve fresh  amp  tasty beverages instead of the usual fake concentrate juice or powder packets. If you haven t been you should  Because once you try it  YOU WILL WANT TO GO BACK      Great people behind it as well.

This place is sooo good  Just landed in Austin  didn t know what I wanted to eat  Luckily came across a bunch of food trucks and that always a good sign for variety and tons of options. There was Cuban  Thai  BBQ...a few more trucks that I can t remember what they were serving BUT I did find myself coming back to Quick Fix..I should ve known since it was first option  I got the SOMALICIOUS  w shrimp  is DELICIOUS    Tasted fresh  the sauce that it comes with has a kick but so good  If they have a bottle of it I d buy it  The drinks are fresh and soooo GOOD     Blueberry cinnamon    not to mention the owners are down to earth and know good healthy food   I definitely will come back
Shrimp and chorizo tacos are fire   Enjoyed every bite  friendly people and great food.
Stop by to get some drinks. They are amazing   He offered a taste of their 2 new drinks. They were so good I bought both of them.   Cucumber mint and raspberry cinnamon

Great customer service and even better attitude  ingredients. Ordered the birria tacos that come with the consume  and my mouth was already watering just by how they were explaining it. They gave us samples while we waited for our food  and the juices were Incredible. Definitely recommend to anybody that enjoys great street.

Quick Fix was so freaking good  April really cares about the quality of her food and the ingredients she uses. The Birria tacos and the pambazo sandwich were amazing  We will definitely be coming back

y all. i have followed this place on facebook for a long while  but finally ordered food from there yesterday.  this. place. is. AMAZING.  i got the chicken fried rice and the pb amp j. everything was so fresh  especially in the fried rice. it wasn t greasy or stale tasting like most fried rices seem to be from other places. the sauces on it made such a  great  difference.  the pb amp j was to have a sweet  amp  because it sparked my interest. when i say the bread on this sandwich was equivalent to the decadence of a good french toast  that would be modest.  give this place a try if you re on the fence - you won t regret it.
One of my favorite local food trucks - always fresh and healthy food options. I m not vegan but have tried their vegan tacos and can say they are DELICIOUS

We had the most amazing food here. My boyfriend got the tacos with the birria  which was unexpected because we d always seen this on twitter and wanted to try it for ourselves . I had some sweet meat with the rice. We tried their drinks  I got a blueberry one and I think my boyfriend got the one with lime. We absolutely loved our food and our drinks. Please come here and try it out for yourself
Amazing food. They use grass-fed beef which is such a great touch. The owner was there and she was super friendly and informative. Pro tip  order their fresh herb and juice blends

FIVE STARS ISNT ENOUGH      The food is FIRE. El fuego  all the flames in the world.   We got a sweet meat place which is caramelized grass fed beef on a bed of badass rice.  LITERALLY A HEAVEN SENT MEAL. don t even question it.   We also got a Jack flash with chicken  chef style. It s a sandwich made with all the love you could possibly imagine with a side of street freaking corn straight off the cob.   You get a free  shot of life  when you buy food  Which is a shot that s GREAT for your health  They truly care about you here   After you eat here you ll probably start dreaming of the food. But that s okay because it s all worth it    A must check out place            The owners are amazing  the employees are amazing and the food.... It does that talking itself.   To the owners  GOOD JOB ON THE CONCEPT  YALL KILLED IT

After spending 5 minutes looking at menu items on an iPad  my buddy and I decided on the sweet meat. We also had a bottle of water. Total price with tip   36.  Now don t get the wrong the guys running the truck were super friendly but the portion was a little skimpy and face it  a little meat and rice for  13.50 isn t much of a value. I frequent food trucks and get much more elaborate meals for the same or cheaper price point.  The food was pretty tasty but I wouldn t pay over  10 for it in the future.
amazing   10 10 great food and the workers are even better. i will be coming back  great value and quality of food.  thank you april

Every single thing from customer service to the food was AMAZINGGG    They make sure to tell you how everything s made and how fresh everything is  I drove all the way from Austin to try it out and it was worth the drive    The sauces were so good   Their freshly made juices were SO refreshing   I mean just everything   Don t hesitate to give this place a try  even if you don t know what to get they will definitely guide you on the perfect choice  HIGHLY RECOMMEND AND WILL 100  BE BACK FOR MORE

Very expensive.  14.00for two small biria taco.  Customer service is very rude.  I tried bringing up how expensive they are. Very nicely. And they attack me with their words. I will never go back. Friends ask where they can find a good biria and I send them to Austin.  More than half the price of these people.

TEXAN TACOS Remember that name  it s filling  but it s good I would asked for another 3.  This by far is my favorite order  the tacos are fat w  soft pinto beans  avocados  bell peppers  there s more  I forgot the name  see pic TEXAN TACO .  The dressing is mildly sweet  but ask for something else salty  or spicy because the tacos itself is already a good base. A little of any dressing ONLY satisfy your platter a little more. It s good  but teasing good  that is why I said   it s good I would asked for another 3.
The food and hospitality here was perfect. They definitely know how to make some mean dishes  Even their homemade juices are super delicious and refreshing

Although I really don t like the name of this place for some reason  the food is the complete opposite. The whole theme menu ingredients of the food truck is so cool  There are options for anyone- seafood  meat  vegetarian  and vegan  They also give you a free  shot of life  with any order which was great. It has cayenne pepper  honey  apple cider vinegar  and some other stuff for a great concoction good for digestion and woke me up really quick. They also give 10  off if you bring your dog  I ordered the Vegan Somalicious with Chicken and I liked it  but I also didn t. However  that was due to personal preference. For the vegan part  it had fried jackfruit which I do not like at all  even though its a great option. The chicken was really good though  It was grilled nicely and I could tell it was made with the upmost quality. For me  I really needed more spice and flavors but this could be due to not choosing the right dish.  I also tried the power up smoothie which was sweet and tasted just like a smoothie should. However  it does have a lot of seeds in it due to the ingredients in it. There was one drink I tasted that consisted of cucumber and mint which was really good  It was fresh and naturally sweet.   I do want to go back and try the vegan burger  they were sold out   and some more of the smoothies and drinks. The concept is amazing and I love their vibe  The prices of the dishes are quite expensive for being a food truck  but you pay for the concept and quality.

I wasn t particularly enticed by the name or outside of the trailer so I looked at it last in the park. The owners were so friendly  though  that I ended up trying alligator because I ve never had alligator. It was one of the most delicious foods I ve had in ages  I have tried something different off of the menu every time I ve been here since and haven t looked at another trailer in the park. I have also had a Thai-inspired dish with skewered shrimp that knocked it out of the park. Everything is fresh and delicious  nothing overcooked  very flavorful.  The owners also made me a shot of some crazy stuff while I was waiting that probably quick-fixed something in my gut. And their juices are juicy juicy.  On numerous occasions  the owners have run food out to me in the rain. They are kind and delightful folks who will cook for any dietary restrictions you can throw at them.  I really think that if Quick Fix had a name that didn t sound like a convenience store  they d top lists in Austin. As it is  I m glad that one of the best food trucks in Austin to serve delicious  healthy food doesn t have a crazy line.
My FAVORITE spot to stop on the east side. The gang that runs the show is absolutely wonderful  amp  fun. If you need a quick fix  this is literally what you re looking for.
I got the chicken and rice. Super good food  really good price but the thing that I liked best was portion size. Big portions  Also the sweet tea was crazy delicious.

My first review on Yelp and I just felt compelled to spare my awesome experience   This has a variety of healthy but exciting options  from apps to entrees  homemade juices and healthfood shots  and more  Nothing artificial and very conscientious about health while still being satisfying. Options for carnivores to vegans   I happened across Quick Fix while seeking out a different food truck  but this happened to be the only one open. While I was considering the menu  the owner of the truck introduced himself and offered to help me choose something to suit my taste. This was really helpful  as he explained that all of their recipes are their own creation and not based on any specific type of food. I recommend asking for suggestions  you will not be disappointed.  Yelp says this is a  juice bar vegan  food truck  however the majority of their offerings include protein items cooked deliciously without excessive grease or frying.  At the suggestion of the owner  I went with the Shrimp Stacks. They are FANTASTIC  Freshly sauteed jumbo shrimp with avocado atop thinly sliced sweet potato with a homemade slighty spicy sauce. 10 10 for flavor  texture  and creativeness  satisfying after a workout but not heavy or guilt inducing. I would absolutely order this again.  I also got to try their homemade strawberry lemon limeade. Delicious and refreshing  without any added sugars  and a fabulous twist of mint at the finish.  Last of all  service. It wasn t until after I ordered that I realized that they had already been closed for AN HOUR and yet continued to provide excellent service with a smile. Prices are reasonable  it s delicious fresh food and you get what you pay for. I will absolutely bring my friends here. Don t miss out on this great  family owned establishment

I don t usually leave reviews but this place definitely deserves one    Fresh ingredients Immaculate presentation Downright good food  I had the shrimp and chicken fried rice with  the works   Hands-down the best fried rice in Austin  Texas  And if they re serving strawberry lemonade when you visit...do yourself a favor and grab one. Strawberry to lime ratio is on point.

Enjoyed our visit here  Really friendly service  free  shot of life  and a great concept utilizing localized source food. They also accept Litecoin.  Food was great too  I got shrimp skewers and my wife got quesadillas. They also make their own drinks smoothies which I ll have to try next time.
OMG I got Vegan burger  was very delicious tasty and very different  Thank you so much guys I ll definitely be back

Came by the food truck park on a Sunday afternoon and didn t really know what I wanted...  I was promptly greeted by a super friendly guy once I approached the menu and he explained to me that everything is healthy and sourced locally.  I needed a GF option for my boyfriend so he asked the chef to speak with me when she finished cooking.  She recommended the Somalicious over rice  which consists of grilled beef with a green sauce and a spicy raspberry jelly sauce on the side.  I had the Roll It Up  which are onions and peppers wrapped with rib eye strips paired with their delicious fried rice.  Every order comes with a free shot of life--super tasty   Overall we really enjoyed the food and my boyfriend was damn near licking the plate clean.  They have amazing sauces made in-house that paired beautifully with the dishes we had.  I love that the trailer is so conveniently located and can t wait to be back
This is a phenomenal food truck   Healthy  light  fast  delicious and clean   This is definitely going to be a staple in my running arounds.

I would leave 10 stars if I could  Welcoming and accommodating service. Flavorful  fresh  and beautiful food. Austin has a lot of competition when it comes to food trucks  but this is the best experience we ve had  We d make a special trip to come back.

The food here was absolutely amazing  It came out nice and hot and truly five stars isn t enough. The cucumber lemonade taste incredible in the summer heat. What stood out the most...was the service  Marcus at the window guided us through the menu options  and April killed it in the back making the food. We will definitely be returning because this food was sensational and I ve never been more okay with spending money on food.

Love the foods  very tasteful and a friendly order guys. I m not really speak good English but he tried  to figure out which  orderI looking for. This one the second time I tried this place. And my daughter from Hawaii she love it

Noting the review below  I noticed that there was no  paleo  written anywhere on the menu... what I did find when I walked up to the truck were two extremely friendly business owners and some of the best food truck food in Austin.  I ordered  The Sticks  with chicken and  The Block Style . The fried rice wasn t too greasy oily or heavy and the meat was impressively tender  that shrimp is bomb and I don t like shrimp .  I trust the chef though- I d feel safe ordering anything on the menu and looking forward to my next go
My wife and I went yesterday and had the birria tacos for the first time. They were so incredibly good  and the consomme is to die for. I think I found my new favorite food.

super delicious but overpriced especially with a location meant for college students to access. i had the birria tacos and they were so good but 14     most taco places charge anywhere from 4-9  for 3 tacos and the consome  but here it was 2 for 14. that s a little ridiculous in my humble opinion. i d try to find a different spot  especially if you re a broke college student like the rest of us

Habanero berry quesadillas    OMG so so good    Definitely not what I was expecting  we went with an open mind and the guy recommended these and boy was he right  Y all definitely need to try these  So delicious  Thanks so much for being so kind and answering our questions and recommendations  We will be coming back here when we visit Austin again

I ll go ahead and add to the previous great reviews. The roll it up combo  fire. I had it today for lunch and yes  I have leftovers. The grilled shrimp and pineapple skewers  SO DAMN GOOD. And how can you go wrong with peppers and onions wrapped in steak  So good. So good.
I was in the area and stumbled upon this awesome food truck.   So friendly and they even customized my meal to fit my diet.   Very fresh and so delicious
Delicious food    Had the quesadillas with sweet habanero sauce - really unique and just right. The owner and her husband are sweet as can be. Great service  loved it
Great vegan burger  Healthy ingredients  flavorful  and a filling patty. Definitely will be back.
I ate my food too fast to take a picture but the quesadillas were amazing  And customer service is great

Stopped by here on a whim and was not disappointed. I had the Stacks which was excellent. All the food is fresh  nothing fried. They focus on healthy ingredients and as if that weren t enough they re family run. We also tried their newest drink which was a Blueberry Lemonade with locally sourced cinnamon stick boiled in  uhhh yum
Very good smoothies  got a free shot of some spicy ginger thing. The guy was extremely friendly. Will come back to try the food.

Cancel your dinner plans. Eat here. I spent a week basically just eating in Austin  and the food here but everything else  including restaurants that were significantly more expensive. Do yourself a favor  head over ASAP.

It s a food truck with an Amazing menu  Fresh and flavorful    The shrimp quesadillas and the stack were delicious  Fresh gulf shrimp and guacamole made this delicious along with the fresh herbs  cilantro .  I would eat here again at any time. They also have these refreshing homemade lemonades made with things like strawberries and key lime and blueberries with a cinnamon stick. I love their take on vegan  fresh and flavorful without the extra oils. Great job  You won t be disappointed
SHOULD BE ILLEGAL    They say crack is addictive....they have no idea the power of Quick Fix Cuisine. 7 our of 5 stars

Fabulous food and owner. Must try. I got the Roll It up. So juicy when you bite into the meat  you have to keep your mouth closed otherwise some will fish out   Flavorful and the rice was also perfect.

This is truly an excellent place to get food. They have lots of healthy  delicious options that they re happy to adjust to any diet  and the prices are very fair for the amount and quality of food you re getting. In terms of this  paleo  nonsense that other reviewers have referred to  it s everyone s individual responsibility to make sure their diet is accommodated  not the chef s  and I can t imagine the chef having any problem helping someone out if their needs were communicated. We got to spend some time getting to know the owner and talking to his family  who all work in the truck and have great attitudes and personalities. Extremely compassionate people who are genuinely interested in making the meal as good as it can get - and it was  I got the shrimp somalicious  spelling   and it was truly delicious. Well-seasoned  fresh ingredients  and beautiful to look at  The owner showed me pictures of the food instead of handing me a menu full of words and described each dish as it came up. It s clear that he s invested in this business  not just for his own benefit but for the benefit of his customers.  I will absolutely go out of my way to return here in the future  I love this place and cannot recommend it enough.

I ordered the Sweet Tooth via Uber Eats. The food was tasty  and the portion was great  The sweet potato had been roasted just enough  and the turkey and veggies were well-seasoned. My only complaint is that the menu descriptions are not precise enough. I ordered the Sweet Tooth because  as it is described on the menu  it is a paleo dish. When the dish arrived  I was a little disappointed to see that it was topped with corn and cheese  both items outside of the paleo diet. That being said  it was still delicious  and I don t mind the mini-cheat meal. I ll be ordering from here again  making sure to specify the paleo requirements.

The food s extremely good  the guy working the order window is really nice  and your order gets to you pretty fast  I recommend getting either the sweet meat or the fried rice  I can t get enough of either
We stopped in tonight after a run around the lake. Great folks running the trailer and super tasty food. Get one of their fresh drinks and the Sweet Meat. Tasty
Everything is so fresh even the staff. It is family owned and you can tell in the quality of the food. I go every time I m in Austin  Sometimes I even make a drive out just for the fried rice.

A true Austin hidden gem. I don t usually go out and try new foods because my income is pretty limited  but I am so so glad I gave this place a chance  The owners were super nice and took time to show us  explain all the different foods on the menu  and we even got free samples of an amazing fruity lemonade with mint  which we ended up buying the full drink because it was so good . It was really hard to decide what to get because everything looked amazing  but I ended up trying  the stacks   pictured  which was real gulf shrimp  way better than farmed-taste and health wise  and avocado on top of a slice of sweet potato topped with cilantro and cilantro sauce. I even got to try out the fruity habanero sauce and it was amazing-right amount of kick and sweetness. The portion size was great and the presentation was beautiful. Highly recommend this place  I cannot wait to go back and try their other food

I went to quick fix cuisine and ordered the shrimp fried rice and sweet meat. Both were amazing dishes and everything was made fresh to order. As I was ordering  I saw someone s shrimp quesadilla order which look equally amazing. I will be trying the quesadilla for sure next time    So happy with this place  definitely recommend to anyone and everyone  There is something for everyone  can t wait to make my way through their menu.
Came to this place on the way to my workout. Food is delicious. I m not a shrimp fan but I had their kebab and it was awesome. Deff stop by this truck if you re in the area.

if you think this place looks good in the pictures just wait till you try it in person  Wow  they know exactly what they re doing here. Amazing food very friendly and fast  five star for sure and will be back soon

I ve never had anything like it. The peanut butter and jelly sandwich is the best I ve ever had in my life. Ever. Never even thought about doing it the way they do. The coconut rice with blueberries was amazing. The drink  with roasted cinnamon is refreshing. All of it super healthy. Then they give you a cider vinegar shot that s good for your immune system. Great tasting food  and good service

this place is AMAZING  The sweet meat and the Maui wowie  shrimp kabobs  are awesome. I didn t have enough space in my stomach to try everything else but I will definitely be back to eat the rest of the menu.
The food was absolutely amazing and I ll be coming back soon to get the shrimp stacks again  Delicious variety spread across the whole menu

I went to Quick Fix over the weekend because Ive heard so many great things about the food truck. On my visit I was ordering for 10 different people  we ordered the fried rice  sweet potato shrimp stacks  sweet meat  my personal favorite   and the quesdillas with a habanero berry sauce. Everything we ordered was amazing  It was the perfect option for my group because the food was fresh  bright  and more importantly healthy. Besides the food being out of this world  the food truck owners are great people  If you re not sure what to order  ask Marcus or K for recommendations  every recommendation was on point. I recommend everyone in Austin to try the food truck

Downloaded yelp just to leave a good review  this place deserves it  The food is unique  healthy   amp  full of flavor. The workers went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Will definitely be back again

I wasn t sure what to expect when I first came here. But no doubt  the. Best. Quesadilla. I ve. Ever. Had. Their food is so unique and healthy I will definetely be back to try more of the menu. Bonus the people who run it are are just as awesome  10 10 would recommend.

Took a very spontaneous trip for a quick dinner before my flight. My fam decided to go get some BBQ but I decided to go look around the other food trucks. The other one that was only open was Quick Fix Cuisine. The guy was very welcoming and explained everything in the menu as thorough as possible. He recommended the sweet meat with gator. I have never had gator ever in my life.... and let me tell you  this is one of the most delicious food I ve ever tasted. I would definitely come back again and I am definitely gonna bring people and recommended the exact same order that I got. Overall  AMAZING.
Marcus and April are awesome  The food is the bomb    I will totally come eat here again

This place is top notch. Food is as great as the people serving it to you  You can tell they take pride in their product everything from plating to flavors. I unfortunately snapped my food and forgot to save it  ugh. I got the Toasted and my friend got the shrimp quesadillas. Every bite was devoured. Luckily I live in the neighborhood so I will be back
Super friendly people and the sweet meat is the best meal I ve had from a food truck. My girlfriend and I shared it and was more than enough.
Not only is the food amazing  the owners are some of the nicest people I ve met. Nothing but good vibes and phenomenal bites at this one of a kind food truck. Keep it up guys   _

This place was delicious  We stopped by here after a bike ride in the park and we were very happy. Honestly  I was a bit skeptical with the big menu on the sign they had in front of the truck  I couldn t really tell what everything was from the picture or the labels. But one we talked to the guys in the truck we were hooked. Everything is home cooked and super fresh. I can t recommend the  Maui wowie  highly enough. It s shrimp and pineapple skewers and You gets loads of food for the price of the meal that come with rice and guacamole and a spicy sauce. My partner had the Somalicious  which was good but smaller for the price and could have come with more sauce. The best thing about this place though is the drinks. They made a strawberry mint limeade to order which was super fresh. We also had this wonderful coconut banana mint juice which was perfect after a bike ride. Highly recommended.
Friendly  fast  and delicious healthy food  If you re health conscious or if you think healthy food can t taste good this food truck is for you. One of the best in town

Wow  even though J2 Dining Hall and Kinsolving are in the same dining umbrella  for some weird odd reason  Kinsolving serves better buffet cafeteria style food than J2  don t ask me why... I still wonder till this very day .  I feel that Kinsolving has more variety and a better quality of campus food. I appreciate their cleanliness  environment and eating atmosphere inside and out. There is lots of food lines for all different tastes and palettes  and the quality of it is quite impressive   I think one of my favorites is their yogurt bar  where you can add fruit  toppings and other healthy options. It s probably one of the best things that campus has to offer in a buffet line. Along with the other food being offered everyday  we cannot stop this review unless we add the Saturday evening meal  which is so much better than their daily activity of food.  If I had to choose my favorite on campus dining service  go to Kinsolving in North Campus. You won t regret it

There s a lot of good reviews  here. Most of what people say is true  the people are very nice. the  service is fast  and the location is convenient. The food is dirt cheap  if you re a student. Problem is  the food tastes cheap. I think there  should be at least one review that harps on the issues with kinsolving  dining  so here is a list  - The tofu is gross and soft - The soups are bland - The chicken is dry - Vegetables are overcooked and unseasoned -  The carrots manage to be too hard on the inside and too  soft on the outside - The servers put everything on top of everything else. Be prepared to have  those soggy vegetables poured directly on top of your bread - The pita bread is always stale - The day-old pita is instead called  naan  - Anything pasta related is overcooked and almost porridge-like  including ravioli  lasagna  etc.  - All the fruit has been covered in sugar - The cottage cheese is across from the yogurt so there s always cottage cheese in the yogurt - The syrup with breakfast is literally corn syrup - The granola is crushed up nature valley bars. Not bad  but really sweet. - The milk tastes like water - The meat is extremely tough  like inedibly so - Any stand-alone meat is usually not great - Any cheese is velveeta - The rice is stiff minute rice - The broccoli is way too big so it s overcooked on the outside and underdone on the inside - The fries are sometimes wet  like they steamed them - The tomatoes are stiff  cold  and gross - The eggs are powdered - The pizza is absolutely awful. Like  bare crust with ranch and a salad on it.  ...and now for the good parts  - All the fast food is fine  burgers  fried chicken  tater tots  etc. - Salads are fine - Large cereal selection - Decent orange juice - What they call  pass-o-guava  is tasty - Lots of sodas if that s your thing - Good hummus and crackers - The fruit  although sweet  is still decent - Good stir fry  when they have it - Specials are in general decent - Gourmet nights on saturdays that are in general good - Beans are good when they have them - Rice is sometimes better than just minute rice - The head cook is a great guy. I honestly think food tastes better when he serves it. -  Quesadillas  and  flautas  are alright but absolutely not what they advertise to be - Same can be said of their  indian food  - They have this vegetarian brussel sprouts dish and I honestly think it s the only time I ve ever liked brussel sprouts. - Breakfast food is decent - Good tacos - I ve heard they have decent wraps  though I haven t had them myself. - Desserts are decent  if a little sweet - Soft serve is decent  if a little watery - Seriously  a friendly staff makes the food taste twice as good - Sour cream is inoffensive - Coffee is okay  if a little weak  sweet. - Pizza is sometimes ok -  Veggie patties  are tasty.  That s all I can think of right now. It s enough to get you through the year  and is very cost-efficient. I worry about any vegans or vegetarians  because sometimes the fried food line is the only good thing  but for  most people it s decent enough for dorm life. I also heard about people developing celiac disease from just eating fried chicken and burgers  so uh don t do that i guess

Of the two unlimited dining halls on campus  J2 and Kins  I think Kins is slightly better. Kins is smaller  cleaner  friendlier  and it has quiet seating areas  inside and out. Most of the food between the two dining halls is about the same. I think the food taste decent early in the semester but that it gets old. If you re a student  try to diversify your diet by eating off campus and using your dining dollars at the campus cafes.   The food here is just okay.

Sucks I hate it makes me want to mosey on out forever  sad cowboy emoji  does not make me want to yeehaw or ride em cowboy or alright alright alright not 5 7 perfect score big chungus made me drop out of college

Kins has the nicest service and a surprisingly good selection of food  They re super dedicated to responding to student comments and updating their menu frequently  They also serve bagels from wholy bagel which is pretty incredible. Better than J2 by a long shot.

Oh  the grand Kinsolving buffet  With one admission to the Kinsolving buffet  you can help yourself to a marvelous European style continental banquet. Complete with everything  forbidden fruit  tiny plums  orange melons  green leaves  colored platters  and oh so much more delicacies bound to electrify your deepest salivary glands  The Kinsolving buffet is not merely a simple buffet  not just a modest cafeteria  but something fulfilling to the spirit  a flabbergasting yet astonishingly enlightening experience for the ages that questions your existence with every mouthful.  Oh  where should we fly to first  Located at the back of the eatery is Chef s Features  much like a jewel hidden in the warm sands of an oasis. Every day at the Chef s Features contains a novel experience like the joy of twisting the innovative cereal dispensers to the anticipation of the savory crunch of Lucky Charms. Next  buckle up  as we visit the lush fields of Farmer s Garden  Here  the salad is fresh and invigorating while the dressings flow like water cascading down Iguazu Falls in Argentina. A true delight to the senses  Our last destination but surely not for long  Sweet Sensations caresses you in an amiable embrace and fondles your taste buds with a tingling  honeyed touch  sending you off on Whitis Avenue with an insatiable craving for more. And to think that all of this comes with the room  Oh  what will you think of next  Kinsolving buffet

This place was my friends and my favorite place to eat on campus when I lived in Simkins Dorm. In fact  my buds and I still like to come eat here from time to time because of the good times we ve had and the food we enjoyed.  Everyday  groups of us would walk up Dean Keeton St. to  K-town   as I nicknamed it  to enjoy a variety of foods at a reasonable price with our Dine-in Dollars. My favorite dishes were chicken chrispitos  big crunchy taquitos with cheese inside   spicy chicken burgers  a wide variety of wraps  and their quesadillas. Albeit  the food here isn t 5 star  but there is a wide variety everyday and if your a student in the residence halls  its the best option for price and food. There is plenty of seating space and a somewhat homey feel you can get if you re there with plenty of friends.  Price  if you re using dine-in dollars  its a steal. if your paying cash or credit its still a good deal  but there are better options for your buck.  Competition  K-town s biggest competition is J2 the buffet dining hall on the other side of campus . K-town has J2 beat in the aesthetics dept  and the food quality and price is essentially the same.  I d recommend this place to anyone living on campus or looking for a filling meal while at UT  but for everyone else  its not something to go out of your way for.  Why I especially liked it  going to K-town wasn t just going to get food  it was a bonding time with my friends from Simkins  a great place for us all to go hangout  eat  and have the craziest conversations without worrying about making a fool out of ourselves.

Good buffet style dining hall.  The current lunch price is  8.50 total  including tax .  They have sandwiches  wraps  daily entrees  pasta  potatoes  a mediocre salad bar  ice cream  cereal  make-your-own waffles  excellent .    Overall  it s one of the best places to eat on campus when you re hungry for a full meal.

It s inside the Kinsolving dorm building  but it s open to the public.  A decent buffet at a decent price.  Lots of choices  and the main entrees  along the back wall  area different each day.  Decent salad bar  pizza  pasta  sandwiches  cereal  etc.  The make-your-own waffles are great  get the strawberry sauce that s by the other entrance .

This is one of those places you are always looking for. The food was unreal.    The fried chicken was perfect. The pickles sent it over the top. Lamb tacos  wow  just fu  ing wow.  Stop looking for somewhere else and to eat and go.

Located next to Cuantos Tacos and a handful of other food trucks . One of the few trucks open for lunch  on a Saturday when we went . There is plenty of parking and outdoor seating only since this is a food truck. When I went  they offered chicken and waffles and a few other items  but I couldn t resist the breakfast boudin sliders and po boys. Boudin balls were filled with duck  pork  rice  and spices. It was packed full of flavor. Good for sharing if you also want to try their giant po boys. They are huge  I m not vegetarian  but The Swiss mushroom po boy was awesome. Very savory. We were so full  Bring water

Amazing tacos  I tried one of each of the four offered as a mix and match. Extremely delicious  You do have to commit after your first bite as they are juicy. My surprise favorite was the sweet potato taco although the lamb and pork were phenomenal. Attached to Vacancy brewing which is also amazing. Outdoor patio and indoor seating. Great stop
This place is incredible-- food is always fresh and creative. Everything I ve had is a 10 10
Honestly  15 for a plate of sweet potatoes on 4 very small tortillas is pretty ridiculous and can t believe people fall for this.

Amazing  authentic  great quality. Friendly staff and lots of options. Homemade tortillas. Fresh ingredients. Vegetarian vegan options. Salsa with an actual spicy kick. The aromas coming from their kitchen reminded me of my moms cooking when I was growing up. Just awesome. I ll definitely be back.

We got here while the ladies were just opening up. All the groceries like the maza  corn flour   tomatoes  and eggs still hadn t been put away. Which is reassuring that everything is fresh and handmade. The ladies are so sweet  just like Hispanic moms. The green salsa is absolutely amazing and the tacos are stuffed  They re so good and taste so handmade.
Amazing breakfast tacos   Lady was super friendly   Great job  This place is a must go to...Thinking about stopping by for lunch also.

We ordered from here on a whim because they were one of the only places that were still open and taking orders after 10 30PM. I did not expect much other than some food to satisfy our drunchies.   We got the pollo  asada  and al pastor. Oh my goodness  they were all so flavorful  especially with the sauces and toppings that came packaged on the side  The tacos were pretty small  so I would order maybe one or two more than you normally would.   I think the most meaningful food experiences are the good ones that catch you off guard. My only regret is not discovering Arturo s Tacos earlier in my visit.
Tasted really bland and bad. I got quesadilla  amp  street tacos. street tacos had terrible tortilla. This place is not authentic.

Like trying new food trucks  so decided to give this yellow truck one try. Dont even know where to start....the food was bland  the food was extra small. I ordered 2 sopes   at they danced all over the plate. Also ordered 2 tacos  this was a JOKE  I honestly wanted to go back and ask if this was for reals  if the sopes were small  dont be surprised when you see this tacos. I honestly thought the foil wrap was the limes or the cilantro and cebolla  but wow   When I opened the foil... It was the 2 tacos   Let me see in the photos that they are small  dont show them off as being regular size tacos. The torta is also in a small torta bread. The taste is not that great  maybe if the taste was better I would probably swing by to taste other stuff but with this experience I won t waste my time...

This place was okay on a quick hurry  other than that there are better choices. I got the street tacos and they were tiny for the price. In my opinion they shouldn t be more than at most  2.  1.50 preferred. Thats how little they were. my 4yr old ate 3  I also got a quesadilla and it was meh. Not the worst but eatable.
Ordered the carne asada friesZ it was a huge portion and definitely filling and taste great. Will order again if ever in Austin again.
Last week was my first time seeing this food truck. Why not give it a try..... I have to say that they sure didn t disappoint at all. The food was good even my wife enjoy it.
The best taco in Austin Texas      all the meat are fresh... I highly recommend this place
Ordered quesadillas and alambres from here for the coworkers and myself. Good price for great food. Everyone enjoyed

My first legit Mexican food truck experience.  I ordered pastor and barbacoa corn tacos. Not only were they amazing but the presentation was also great -- on a clay-fired platter   I chose tamarind soda for my drink. Amazng as well.  Kudos to the great food and friendly service at this joint

So good. If you re trying to eat tacos made by a lady who only speaks Spanish at 10 30pm on a Wednesday night under the safety of a picnic tarp and Christmas lights  this is it. This is your destiny. This is su Destino.

Hands down THE best tacos in Austin   I ve been coming here for three years and Jessica and her husband are dishing out the finest quality Mexican street food North of the Colorado River. They make a mean tlacoyo as well  and if you don t know what that is  just try it. You won t be disappointed
The Philly Chop Shop is life changing. Ask for the special BBQ sauce with it  The Beef Cake taco was great too. Tasted very fresh and juicy with all the avacado

The trailer looks awesome   but the food is even better  Everything is focused on smoked meat  but there s a good mix of sandwiches and tacos  Everything I ve had has been great  but the Pastrami is the best pastrami I ve ever had. It s also. I ve their menu allows you to get single tacos for  4  tons of meat  They re currently at Friends  amp  Allies brewing on the east side Sundays  check the calendar  it s not every Sunday  and the food pairs great with a brew. Highly recommend checking them out
By far the best bbq good truck in Austin.  He does catering too   You have to try their brisket and smoked pastrami.

My husband and I ate here for dinner last Thursday night.  I was expecting a way different ambiance since it is a restaurant at the top of the Hilton.  Unfortunately  the whole room was brightly lit with cheap furniture.  However  the service and the food were amazing   We ordered some mixed drinks which were very good as well. My husband had the tuna tartar and I had tortilla soup and a chicken Caesar salad.  My food was very good  but the tuna tartar my husband has was awesome   Also  the waitstaff  both a waiter and a waitress that worked together  were very courteous and made sure to inform us that the kitchen was going to take a bit longer with our food since the cooks were preparing meals for the large group behind us.  I gave this place only four stars because they need to make the decor and lighting way more elegant and romantic for evening  and they need way more staff in the kitchen.

The view at this restaurant is the best in Austin  The staff was friendly and accommodating with anything I needed to make my meal better. I had breakfast here three mornings in a row and loved the omelette table. The cook will make them however you wish and they have all the ingredients for any type of omelette you like. I enjoyed having breakfast and watching the sun come up each morning.  It was a great way to start the day  I would like to come back for dinner next time I m in Austin to watch the sun go down. I m sure that view is beautiful as well.

Card machine did not work  no posting or explanation of actual costs. This restaurant is not afraid to charge you for the most expensive option for no reason. Check your receipts. Nice view  better biscuits.

Don t even.  Waitress was sweet.  Food inedible.  Literally.   Went with friends.  Was told not to order steak.  Not with tonight s chef.   Soup so pasty it stuck to the roof of your mouth.  Chicken fried steak burned and totally dry.  Avoid.

For a hotel restaurant  I was impressed with Eighteenth Over Austin. The cook at the omelet waffle station will hook up you with whatever your heart desires. There are also bins of egg  meats  etc bins on other tables as well as pastries  oatmeal  amp  grits on another table. The service could definitely use some work as it takes too long to get water  creamer  etc.

Wow  The view is amazing and ambience is great  The Happy Hour was outstanding with  4 wells and wine from 4 00-6 30PM. With this amazing view  I am not sure why the place was not packed as this is probably the best view in Austin. I would recommend stopping by for Happy Hour and enjoying a good priced sip.

We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Downtown and ate breakfast each day at the top floor restaurant.  We thought it had a nice selection with an agreeable price. The view is fantastic. We ate early enough to essentially watch the sun rise over Austin. That was great

5 stars for the Buffet breakfast. It s awesome. They are very efficient  know that you probably want to get in and out. The food  great omelet station  and service are great and the view is a nice surprise in the morning. Dinner  on the other hand is 3 stars. I sat at the bar and met some other people stuck here from the ice storm. The bartender was quite overwhelmed  it wasn t packed  just a general flow of patrons  so service was slow. I kept it healthy with the Quinoa Wrap which tasted much better than it looked. I would definitely come back and stay here next time I m in town  but might venture down the street for dinner if I didn t have a lot if time.

I tried to take my boyfriend here for his 30th birthday  because he likes skyscrapers- and I thought a view of downtown austin would befit such an interest. Most of the time we like cheap eats  casual places. But it was his 30th birthday so I waned to surprise him with something a little nicer.   So just to make sure  I called ahead and asked to reserve a seat near a window at 7 00 pm. I knew nothing of the place  so I wasn t sure if it was going to be busy or not and I didn t want to chance it. The hostess on the phone giggled when she took down the information  which I admit is hilarious  right  Table for two near a window at a restaurant at 7 00 pm     ROTFLMAO    So that part wierded me out  but we showed up anyway at 7 00pm and walked into...AN EMPTY dining room. No one was in there  No bartender  no hostess  no waiters and most of all  no patrons   At 7 00 pm   What is wrong with this place

If you re staying at the HGI  you ll probably eat here at least once during your stay. Breakfast is free for Platinum and Gold HH members. The breakfast buffet is just okay - typical hotel breakfast - though I was happy they serve grits. I haven t been a fan of their omelette chef - he tends to overcook them and I ve given him a couple chances to get it right.   If you are contemplating whether to eat here for lunch or dinner  I can talk you out of it in a hurry. Their salads are decent and very large  but everything else I ve eaten is just meh. The burger was not well flavored at all. The saving grace was the jalapeno roll  but it s not worth spending  14 on a meh burger with a great bun. My friend s shrimp was overcooked and didn t have any flavor to it even though it was wrapped with bacon.   Coming up here for a drink would be fine - if you get Drew as your bartender  he is nerdy eye candy and makes strong drinks but is easily distracted.  I will say that the view up here is amazing  but that s not a good enough reason to give it more than 2 stars.

How sad.  Came here after not having been here for a long time.  When I came here before  it had just opened and they were were really excited  had a good chef and I was expecting great things.   Well  nothing happened.  They clearly do not have the same chef.   They took everything even remotely yummy off the menu.  The only burger they had was  14.  NUTS.  Everything else was similarly over-priced and unimaginative  obviously catering only to the hotel guests from out -of-town who didn t want to leave the hotel  had expense accounts and didn t know any better.   The inside looked like a hotel banquet room rather than a restaurant  with cheap chairs  tables  etc.  In other words  upscale prices with downscale furniture and food.  Bad value all around  I say.  The burger   Well  it was tasty  but it was actually too big and the bun could not handle the meat.  The bun was good  but fell apart only 1 3 of the way through.    Having an 18th story view gave it such potential.  What a waste.

A very solid hotel breakfast buffet. Features an omelette station  but don t let the name fool you - they do made-to-order eggs  french toast and waffles as well.  The open buffet features an egg scramble  breakfast potatoes  biscuits  n gravy  and a bacon sausage station. Oatmeal  a selection of pastries and a fruit bar round out the offerings.  The fruit could have been a bit fresher  but then again I visited in early January and that s a tough time of year for fresh strawberries  honeydew melon  pineapple  etc.   No espresso service in the morning  which is unfortunate. Coffee is passable  I opted for tea instead.  Lunch dinner is also solid  if not a bit pricey. The menu has the usual American staples  all of which are decent.  A good way to grab some solid food while on the road. Not really the sort of place you d come to if you are a local  except for the great views of downtown Austin.
Meh  typical hotel bar. It does have an ok view. But you have the usual over priced drinks and food.

Nice dining room  beautiful view of downtown and great food...interesting food but not off the wall.  We had grilled yellowfin tuna the night we stayed  cooked perfect...It is a shame the place was empty.  We only knew of the place because we came to visit some friends  stayed at the hotel and one night we stayed in.  Our friends had never heard of the restaurant  we saw no signs anywhere...probably ought to try some advertising.

This place has amazing food and great service  We really stumbled on it and we re so glad we did. We ordered tacos and quesadillas. Portions were good size and everything was really tasty. The owner cook server was friendly and seemed very happy to have us. We would definitely go back and recommend

For selfish reasons I debated writing this review. I m better than that so here it is. This hidden gem needs exposure and recognition  Austin has decent food trucks  but this is one of the most authentic Mexican trucks in town. The cook and waiter make the best duo in town. They make sure to check in on you and strive to make the dine-in experience as close as it is in their house. The mom and pop shop vibe is in full effect in this place.  I ve had the pupusas  tacos  enchiladas and quesadilla. They re all homemade  so be prepared to wait for greatness to be created by the hands of a grill master. The rice was mediocre  so i d skip the plates. I ll be back to try everything in here and update my review as it happens.

Absolutely LOVE this place  They have it all and literally everything is good -- trust me  the husband and I go 1-2 times a week and have pretty much had everything on the menu. Tacos  pupusas  enchiladas  breakfast is all amazing

The employee in the drive thru was very easy to understand and incredibly friendly.  She seemed to truly like her job. That s refreshing to see in a fast food establishment.  I ordered a small hamburger without the ketchup and mustard.  Instead I requested their Secret Sauce. This is the true test of a Jack in the Box employee. More than half of the time employees have no idea what I m talking about.  But not this time  Double stars to her simply for that  I arrived during the beginning of the lunch rush and anticipated a long wait  customers know things are made fresh  so it takes a bit longer here to get food as opposed to other chains--an acceptable trade off .  But to my surprise  my wait was short. Score  I drove away and checked my food and found my onion rings cooked to perfection and the hamburger made to my specifications.  My only complaint is that there was very little Secret Sauce  so much of the burger was dry  see photo   I will be back though  next time I ll just request extra Secret Sauce and see if that fixes the problem.
I got an Uber eats order. Y all gave me no ranch  no taco sauce and I asked for a coke and y all gave me coke cherry.  How do y all not give yalls costumers no sauces for their food.

Had ok experiences before here with only on other mishap on a wrong order on a busy night. Though tonight I m writing this bc I was shocked while waiting in line for 15 min already. Got to the speaker to order and was told directly that they were only taking Uber and DoorDash orders and they I could not place an order myself... wtf...
Usually the tacos are good from this location but they were not properly cooked this time. I got 4 of them and had to throw them all away. I ve never had bad tacos here until today.

I realize that for most  the fast food industry isn t ones dream job but stop treating customers like they are an inconvenience and annoyance to you.  My first job was at a Jack in the Box in West Covina and everything I learned about good customer service I learned from my four years there.    Tonight  just placing my order was daunting.  After each item I ordered I was cut off with a curt  Is that it  .  When ordering for a couple of people and being responded to like that  I really just wanted to leave.  Maybe try  What else can I get for you   Or  Would you care for some dessert with your order  .  Anything but  Is that it  .    When I pulled up to the window she repeated my order total and took my credit card  charged it and then handed it back to me without a word or even a thank you.  She then handed me my food she didn t look at me  say a word to me at all.  When I got home I looked in my bags and for a total of 4 tacos there were 18 packets of hotsauce but no ketchup for my fries.  How challenging can it be to ask which condiments I would like   18 packets is a waste and comes out of the stores bottom line.  Here s the deal  im a guest at your establishment and giving you money in exchange for goods.  With so many other restaurants in your immediate area kindness and appreciation might guarantee regular visits.  It ll be quite some time before I return to this location.  Do better.
They take about 1-2 hrs to take ur order and u have to wait for this kind of food . JUST NASTY if I could give it 0 starts I would of . Just nasty asf

I went to this location which is a 24hr drive through and the guy in the back told me they were closed. Clearly didn t wanna work since it was 24hrs and says 24hr drive through on the sign. I always come around this time but whoever works this shift shouldn t work if they don t wanna do their job

I should be able to leave negative stars....  I went through the drive thru and they gave me the food  which took 15 minutes  but ok. I drove home and realized they did not give me the drink  or soy sauce. So I drove back to get the drink  waited another 10 minutes in line  there was 1 car in front of me  and the guy at the window was totally befuddled as to what to do. He was young and probably just started  but come on  just give me the drink so I can get home. Then the girl who initially helped me came and was equally unhelpful  but not because she was young and inexperienced  but because she had no desire to make it right. What the hell  if you work in food service  you need to understand customer service  especially when YOU were the one that created the problem. By this time I pointed out that the food would be cold by the time I got home and was going to ask for a refund  which is totally reasonable after wasting all my time  being hostile and incompetent. I also said I wanted the receipt  which she never gave me  because I wanted to go online to leave them a review  and she declined. She said  with a snotty tone  where s the food   and I said I would go back and get it. I drove back and got it and drove back for a THIRD time  and there was a line of cars around the parking lot so I walked up to the window and asked the guy in the car if I could hand them the food and he just laughed and said  sure . The people  working  at the window said  where s the receipt      I reminded her I didn t have it because THEY never gave it to me. Then they just closed the window on me. So I got back in my car and drove to the drive thru. I got in the line at 1 38am. I got to the window at 2 02  More incompetence. The kid didn t know what to do  as the girl who messed the order just stood there in the background and watched  I finally waved her over and told her that there was the food. She did EVERYTHING to try avoiding making it right  including threatening to call the police because I wouldn t drive away after they took my money  gave me a partial order  wouldn t make it right  and wouldn t give me a refund. I told them to please call them  but they didn t. The kid leaned out the window and basically said it was messed up but he didn t know what to do  and the girl just continued to argue with me. When she finally realized that I wasn t leaving without the refund she gave it to me  told me I should have gotten the receipt  and checked the order  which may be true  but I pointed out she should have checked the order  it is her JOB  after all   and give me the receipt. She called me an idiot      Thats the short version  but welcome to jack in the box. Ill never go here again  and you probably shouldn t either but if you do  go through your food  and be sure you get a receipt. And if the mess up your order  just call your card and dispute the charge rather than wasting the time driving back and forth  and waiting in line  not even to mention the aggravation with the extraordinary incompetence and arrogance.
Some quality fast food. Zero complaints  great service and very tasty. The burgers are excellent.
Tacos are alot better here then any other jack in the box ive been to in the area very pleased with my order

Look  i understand dealing with drunk people and being In the city but the drive thru lady was incredibly rude  We tried to order 10 tacos and were told  we only have 5 ... what kind of mess is that        And then when we asked for our total we were given 3 different numbers   Do not ever come here if you are hungry bc they are out of everything  ALSO  out food was extremely cold

This was my first time in awhile buying from them  my friends and I went to go get some food pretty late because they were still open. I got the seasoned curly fries and from 2-11am I was throwing up. I have food poisoning now  I looked up if other people have got food poisoning and thousands of people around the US have had it. I don t recommend at all.

So one star for your hours and rude employees - The  a href   redir url http 3A 2F 2FJackinthebox.com amp s 0c114cb11026bddfe62c7572007833f634b356d27229cd9fd8d097ffabecc189  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  Jackinthebox.com  a  website lists this location as 24 hours  but every time  I go later at night now  I am greeted by a voice in the drive-thru that says  we re actually closed  or something to that effect . It doesn t matter if it is right after midnight or 3 in the morning. The very last time there was a handwritten sign saying it was closed  today  it was that boxed voice again - even though there was an employee sitting out front smoking and obviously another inside talking to me.
