Contrary to what television and those stupid pictures you see every ten seconds on facebook would have you believe  one can not buy groceries with swag  which we have in nearly criminal amounts  thus our apartment is nearly devoid of all food.   After about a week of failed attempts at finding ways to cook and eat swag  we decided we better eat something tangible  as the hunger hallucinations seemed to be getting worse by the hour.  We braved the gunfire and bird-sized flying insects and made a frantic  flailing sprint to our vehicle.  Safely  thanks for asking.  We arrived at this Taco Bell  emaciated and disoriented  but alive  having survived on the a fore mentioned swag alone.  The man taking our order was very patient as we struggled through the daunting task of trying to order tacos while hiding hungerections caused by the excitement of being so close to real food for the first time in weeks. If that sounds awkward to you  try being in the car at the time. Moving on.  Minutes  or possibly hours  later  we successfully communicated our desires to the magic food dispensing talking box  which told us to drive up to the window.   The guy at the window was incredibly friendly  and I briefly considered asking him to be my super best friend  but I then felt that may have been too much of a commitment this early into the relationship. Baby steps.  He told us our total  and with doe eyes we held out a wad of crumpled bills and some sweaty coins and asked if this was enough to make our stomach hurts go away.   Yes.  he said  voice shaking ever so slightly.  Yes it is.   and cupping his hands together  collected our humble offerings  disappearing into the fluorescent food  palace of salvation.  It was at this moment that I noticed the huge poster in the window of the Doritos Locos Taco  and because I have the mind of a child  I m all  Oh hellz yeah  gotta get me some of that shit    So as our Mighty Taco Lord came back to give us our change  I ordered one of those too. He wasn t annoyed at this in the slightest  suggesting that either he has kids  or maybe he s actually  for realzies  Jesus. I m thinking Jesus  because not only did he get me that taco...he said it was on the house  if I just did him a solid and took some survey.   I think thats how Scientoligists get people  but whatever  free taco   Our order  including my last minute addition  were made exactly as we asked. No tomatoes on my taco  no ice in our drink  everything was perfect. Not only is Taco Jesus super nice  he s also a good listener  ladies .  Not only was everything made to perfection  it was also ready very quickly. Like  seriously. Ninja fast. Everything was done before we even knew it started  uhh...ladies    So would I recommend this place  I d recommend you thank it for making sunny days and pretty girls every night before you go to bed  fool.  I hope Taco Jesus the Mega Bro reads this so he understands the difference being nice to one person can make. I wish I would ve remembered your name  dude.   P.S. That was my first Doritos Locos taco and it was fucking amazing.   --Stay Rad                                                                                                  Charlie Spleen
Donna is the best cashier server I ve ever experienced in fast food. She is energetic  smiles  acknowledges customers and really shows passion in her job. Kudos more could learn from her.

This is the closest taco bell to my house and it is open late so it is the natural choice to head here when I am heading home from the bars and need something to soak up the drink.   It s cheap  it s fast  it s Taco Bell. That s really all you need to know.

Taco perfection I go out of my way to go to this place  its always superfast And the order is perfect. I m still stuck on the Doritos taco 5 box Its cheap and comes with a drink . O yah and taco bell  has some  Okay treats . To cap it all off the staff was fff great . This is my taco bell

I have never in my life gone to a restaurant were no  one was willing to help customers. This location closed early without anything being posted. There were employees there but they wouldn t help anyone. This is the worst place I have been and they obviously don t care if they are in business. This place is HORRIBLE. Don t waste your time.

I ve driven off from drive-thru at least 3 times after the person was rude for no reason.  I will not pay a business that is not respecting me and automatically gives me attitude instead of welcoming me.  This is by far the worse Taco Bell around me.  I believe managers should really look at reviews on yelp or any other website and make a change.

Worst service ever was waiting for more than 30 min.Once i finally got my food it looked like shit like a 3 year old  preparing it  i asked for my money back i wasnt going to eat the food it was all messy inside the bag alot of ppl were leaving because they were taking so damn long dont come here they cant run a business that slow.
Not open 24 7 like yelp says it is. I don t partake in. Fast food often so this is definitely a bummer
I ve never been to a fast food place that has superb customer service as this place. Taco Bell is taco bell. Can t expect the food to be 5 stars fresh food. But the service is awesome

Ok I think I am done with Taco Bell.  Their customer service is absolutely horrible. What these people need to understand is that there is absolutely nothing convenient about their service.  I would almost be willing to pay a little more to get a better customer experience  but their service is so absolutely fucking atrocious  that it behooves me why I keep going back.  I love the taste of their food  but the fact that I cannot even feel secure in the fact that when I have to walk in EVERY fucking time and tell them that they did not get the order right  something is seriously wrong.         So I go through the drive-thru to order 2 bean and cheese burritos  1 mexican pizza without tomatoes  and 2 volcano burrito s with extra meat and 10 fire sauces.  I had repeat myself to the lady taking the order literally 3 times to make sure that they got it correct.  Well the way Taco Bell Drive through works is that they do not give you the actual receipt till they give you the food and it is included into the bag.  I never quite understood that as its not like they are not supplied with computers to help them facilitate the oder.  But for some reason the receipt was never given until the food is given to the customer.  That being said  I paid for the food and of course did not get 10 ft before I found out that they did it again     They put tomatoes on the Mexican Pizza.  On top of that they only gave me 1 bean and cheese burrito  but then again they only charged me for 1 bean and cheese burrito.  So I go into the store and walk up to the counter with the issue.  There was this very heavy set woman going behind the counter when I asked her if she was the one that I spoke to over the comm.  Her reply was   Do I look like I am wearing a headset    I said   Fair enough  and I asked for the person I was speaking to at.  She came out  and she really didn t say much as I was pretty heated at the time.   The cashier came out  looked onto the receipt and advised me that I never placed the 2nd burrito order.  Also that their sauce on the Mexican pizza comes with tomatoes into the sauce  which BTW when we ordered it without tomatoes  and the fucking sauce did not come with it in it.  Either way he took the pizza back and made another one without any sauce at all.  I mean no sauce    Then they gave me an extra bean and cheese burrito and did not charge me for it which was fine  but the fact that they got the order wrong every time is just absolutely baffling.  I mean even based on statistics  they would have had to get it right once maybe every 10 times or so.  That is just not the case.   On top of that they took the receipt from me so I had a serious time just complaining about it.      So my wife calls when I get back as I was so pissed off about it  that it was best that she call.  She gets the manager who states that there was no person that came in to complain today to them about this.  It s not like I did not even exist and was refusing to give the number of his supervisor  but at the end of the call we were able to obtain it.  My wife spoke to Eddie who was the supervisor over the store and explained the circumstance  which in the end he just wanted to provide us with free food.  When we complain about something  we do not ask for free food based on the fact that it feels that we get something for nothing.  So she politely declined and explained that when we complain about service  it is not about free food  it is about the customer experience that went so horribly awry  that we felt that we had no other option but to complain to someone about this experience that can do something to change this.  But to be honest  I do not feel that anything in the end will ever change with Taco Bell.  I know it is Mexican food  but the fact that they cannot get one person that can understand or comprehend mathematics or english for that matter is amazing to me.  I apologize that I force them to pull out the ESL  English as a second language  courses  but what is the point when they work in a predominantly English speaking country and cannot comprehend the use of the numeric system in English or what you are actually saying except for key words.  It creates a language barrier as well as a poor customer experience overall.  I hate even bringing up the language barrier  but if there is one in a country where people are supposed to understand English  than why is this happening       I am so fucking done with Taco Bell in Texas.  I love the taste of the food but the serious lack of customer service as well as the lack of consistency from store to store is just horrific.

Okay  so I have to admit something here. I don t usually eat this much fast food but I live with my girlfriend and she...she decided we should have some time apart. I know this isn t the place to talk about this but half the people in my office have been sick or something...I don t know but I don t really have many friends. I have trouble with people and I thought that Clara udnerstood me but I don t know if that is going to work out and I don t know what to do.  Anyway Clara would do all the cooking and so I m eating out alot now. So yesterday for lunch I went to Taco Bell on Anderson. I generally really like this place and have gone several times. But yesterday I went in and it was completely empty. There was not a sole there. There were cars in the parking lot but no one at the tables or behind the counter or in the bathroom. I stood there for 15 minutes  I could have gone in the back and made my own darn chicken gordita    Anyway I went back to  work and ate some peanut butter in the break room. I thought about going back to that Mcdonalds with that kid in the bathroom because I m starting to get an infectoin but things have been wierd lately. It feels like people haven t been showing up to life lately  you know

Drive thru was incredibly slow. It litterly took 30 mins after ordering to get up to the window. And by the time I got the food it was cold  I sent a complaint but got no feedback. I find it funny that I was sitting by the back window long enough to read the managers comments to the team on the back office door that said they have 0 speed

I make it my mission to visit this food truck whenever I m in Austin. The tacos are  delicious and reasonably priced. There s something about getting them from a truck on the side of the road that s charming

The food was barely edible. Cold shredded cheese  miniscule shrimp  similar to what you d get in a top ramen cup   flavorless  lukewarm. I was really hungry but tossed over half because I was concerned about getting sick.
Over priced . The food taste like everything is store bought and served straight out of the packaging . I would not recommend this food truck at all .

I am astounded to see the favorable reviews. Maybe the management turned the truck over to a third party during SXSW  The prices are all suspiciously missing from the menu. They are price-gouging  I know it is SXSW but COME ON   and they don t warn you before they take your money that they are out of most of the stuff you want. They just substitute or omit the food and not offer a refund. They charged me extra for a brisket taco and then gave me a chicken taco. I was tired of arguing with them at that point  which I had to do at the top of my lungs because the generator makes it very noisy. I am seriously turned off of taco trucks after this experience.
Worst decision I have ever made during SXSW. Food is disgusting  not what I ordered and paid for  and overpriced. Avoid.
Not that good. They were ok and food was very minimal for price. If I m paying over  3 for taco I expect it to be filling or have enough meat and toppings.

Their truck came to my apartment complex and I absolutely loved the delicious brisket sliders and the potato salad    I was excited to hear that they also do nachos and tacos... I ll have to make my way over to their stationary spot and grab some

These tacos were really good. I ve had their Al Pastor tacos and a bacon and egg taco.   The al pastor was solid. Great flavor and they didn t skimp on the fillings. I felt like I got my money s worth in that department. They have plenty of sauces to try but you can definitely have these solo and be fine.   Now  I have high standards when it comes to breakfast tacos and despite their reputation  the city of Austin is lacking in that department. That said  the bacon and egg taco was really good. The tortilla was warmed up on the grill  the bacon was top notch  and they used real eggs. My only advice would be to cook the eggs and bacon together. That would make this bacon and egg taco the best in town  hands down.   I definitely recommend giving this place a try.
I know the name says tacos... but you must try their brisket nachos... loaded down with goodnessssss
Most amazing tacos ever  Great service and great food  After a night out in Austin I stopped here and I was not disappointed at all  Highly recommend the chicken tacos they re delicious
Kept walking around the city   and found this spot. The brisket burrito was delicious and my mom order the crispy tacos.. very delicious food

The food here is absolutely amazing   I eat here every chance I get. The prices of the food are very fair for the amount of food given. The atmosphere is ever changing as is the menu. This is a must stop food truck in my opinion  which is not given lightly   10 thumbs up
Tried the chicken taco and beef taco   taco style   onions and cilantro . Delicious   Loved the choices of salsas  too. I will definitely be back.

I ordered delivery  they gave nachos since they were out of dip  amp  chips. The nacos came with stadium cheese only. Cheese was all over the bag  amp  my drinks. The pastor tacos were cold  amp  meat was rubbery. Everything was disgusting.

The only positive that I found about this place is that it is open till 3 am. I had the brisket tacos. Food is sub par and not great quality at all. Hands down one of the worst tacos I ve had in Austin. Became sick for the whole day after eating these tacos. I do not recommend unlessOther alternatives in the area that are great quality are Pueblo viejo and las trancas.
Friendly and super honest group. Expectally. The cashier Ethan I think his name is. I over paid him and he was honest and gave back the dollar I over paid. He was a super star today in my book.

Wow. I m not sure what s going on with this location but I ve had multiple attempts  mobile orders  to get a meal only to drive there for pickup and be told that they either couldn t fulfill the order or even take the order.   So. Order at your own risk but have a back up plan.

The kiosk ordering here helps a ton.  You can customize pretty much anything to your heart s content.  You had better like the kiosk  because you re unlikely to be helped at the counter.  Also  this Taco Bell is extremely slow.  But if you re willing to use the kiosk and wait a bit  you can get pretty much any Taco Bell creation you can dream up and it ll be pretty ok.
Maria the manager called me a little sh t. I was confused and frustrated why they canceled my online order that I paid for  and without any explanation  she started calling me profane names.

They stop taking orders way  earlier than before the store displayed closing  hours. You re better off grabbing food somewhere else because chances are they will close early for some unknown reason and you ll be sitting in a line of cars for 20  minutes while the cars ahead of you sit there confused trying to figure out why they can t order. Head to McDonalds or Whataburger instead

I don t usually review fast food places  but this place is awful. If you go anytime after 5 pm  prepare to wait at least 20 minutes in the drive thru. Also with recent items coming back   Mexican pizza  amp  toasted chalupa  they claim to  not be able to make them right now.
By far the slowest T Bell you will ever go to.    BY FAR.    I ve been sitting in line for 19 minutes and I would have left but I m blocked in.  This place is slower than Joe Biden s thought process.
Extremely slow. Not optimized for a drive thru. Understaffed. Pls fix. I do not recommend this place

I ve literally been sitting in the drive-through for 20 minutes now  and only 3 cars have moved. It s as if everyone that works here is asleep. No matter what time you come here there s 10 cars in line and you ll be sitting in the drive-through for 30 minutes. I don t know what the hell the employees in here are doing. I have never ever witnessed a fast food location that is so ridiculously slow. The only conclusion I can draw is  the staff is ridiculously lazy  or they re just horribly understaffed. Can t really tell which one it is.  What the hell is wrong with this place  Absolutely the SLOWEST service imaginable. I ended up leaving after sitting in the drive-through for 23 minutes with only three cars moving. Go to El Tacorido down the street. Do not come here

I always felt like it was stupid and over the top to review a fast food place lol. These poor food service industry folks catch enough Karen s and disrespect as it is. But holy cow  my experience here today was comically sucky. First of all  all the love to the late night crew. They get slammed every day and work their butts off and are generally NICE. Today I went in at around 11 30 AM and apparently really ruined all these horribly rude and apparently miserable women s days by accidentally asking for a sauce they don t have. Pulled up to the window to hear them making fun of me and mocking me LOUDLY in front of an OPEN WINDOW. We all complain about customers but if y all could try rubbing your last few brain cells together and realize that it s probably not the best to do it in front of the open window. Fast food workers already have to deal with so much crap it s insane to me that you d be so rude to a customer that is actually nice and respectful to you  just because they had a slip up and ordered an item you were out of. I m in the food beverage industry and would NEVER be rude to workers but to pull up and hear  DID I F UCKING SAY FIRE SAUCE    Being screamed across the restaurant about me... making fun of me..... over sauce..... y all need hobbies..... or anger management..... who raised you.  Oh yeah  and the real kicker is the food sucked and she gave me THE WRONG SAUCE hahah.  DID I F CKING SAY DIABLO SAUCE

Taco bell owner of this lication..location... you need to see what is happening in your business.  They can only process 1 car at a time.  I have been in line for 18 minutes just to order... yes I would have left by now but I am trapped by other cars.  This is ridiculous.

They said they took their last order 2 hours before they closed tonight and then we just had to sit in the drive thru lane till the cars in front of us left. Nice waste of time and now other actual restaurants are closed

Worst customer service ever  Hispanic lady and young Hispanic male extremely rude and both laughed at me because I asked for a refill while waiting on my dam order. Last time I eat on this shitty Taco Bell on 201E. Oltorf St.
The slowest  fast food  restaurant in austin by far . IS A TACO BELL    Not a fancy restaurant to wait 30 min in a non exit trap drive through
Terrible experience every time always takes way longer than a drive-through should the staff here are just super slow unacceptable for fast food standards
Terrible customer service. Refused to fix leaving out half of my order that I have a receipt for

Here I am coming back from college  ordering Taco Bell and I just met the nicest woman in the whole world  taking my order she was so sincere and nice and I want to give her the biggest hug she is the reason why I had a good Sunday God bless the woman talking to me all the Taco Bell drive-through

Quite possibly the slowest fast food ever. Dining room isn t open ever so drive thru is always backed up  no matter what time of day. Drove by around 11 pm last night and there was a line literally out onto the street. They need to fix their staffing issues ASAP or just close.

I ve been to this taco bell so many times  and usually love it like a normal taco bell. But dude  I ordered 4 chalupas that the shells were all CRAZY STALE.  Super  super gross. Don t know if that s this taco bells fault  or if taco bell has new shells for the chalupas. But super gross. I m put off from taco bell for a while now.   One positive thing-- their baja blast is never out of syrup  so it s never watered-down.

Hispanic or white chick with brown hair in a bun working the drive thru was extremely rude for no reason tonight. Asked how she was doing on the speaker and she said  bad what do you want    then proceeded to tell me  don t make a large order cus I won t take the order  even tho it was just me in the drive thru .. and then finally yelled and cussed at me when I was trying to leave the drive thru. If this is how you guys run y all s business then  I ll take my business elsewhere. I know not to expect much from Taco Bell in general but a little respect goes along way.

There is rushing an order to satisfy the customers appetite  and there is just rushing an order which I experienced this evening. I m all about second chances  and even after my last experience at the Oltorf TB  when adjusting my order at the window by requesting  NO ONIONS  on our burritos  I was shocked when the attendant said they were already made. I gave a shocked face  to give a second to think about that one for second.  Do I force the customer to buy something he doesn t want   A second past  as did I to the Golden Arches. C mon TB Oltorf  please get it together.
This place I had rated at 4 stars  but today I went there at 2pm and was shocked at home w disgusting the men s bathroom was. What made it ironic was the employees must wash sign on the door.

I went through the drive through at 2 04 pm on January 20th and ordered 2 separate orders. On my second order I asked for a Coke and they didn t have it so they offered me a Pepsi and I said yes. Got our food drove off and realized I didn t get my Pepsi  so we went back through the line. First off the lady was very rude claiming she already gave it to us  then she said we never ordered it wanting us to pay for another Pepsi. She shut the door then the what I m assuming was the manager opened it and greeted us with  what s the problem   And I said we didn t get my Pepsi that I paid for and HE instantly responded with  first off watch the attitude  we didn t have attitude we just wanted our drink. And he said  I can read body language so   He just looked at the other lady and said  get them their Pepsi  and slammed the drive through door.   Overall it was a terrible and unprofessional experience. The manager was talking to us as if we weren t paying customers. I will never go back there.

I drive thru here when running late to my job at St. Ed s and always get the same super friendly and competent sweet lady -- she s fast  sharp  sweet. Yes it s a fast food drive through but come on -- NOT BAD for a  4 lunch
For a Taco Bell  it gets 5 stars.  They never mess up my orders  amp  they are always super friendly.

Refused to let us order because we were making a personal order  and not a favor doordash order. ..I mean what   Isn t that discrimination  Yes. Yes it is. Go to taco C instead  this place is trash. Corporate needs to examine this location
This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. I drove 10 minutes to this location only to find out  they only were doing uber eats orders . Is this a joke  New management is needed here

I ordered extra chicken and cheese with my Chipotle Chicken Melts. It wasn t as much as I was expecting  based off previous experiences. That being said the quality was great. The chicken was moist and the cheese was melted well.
8 24 19 drive-through   OK  uh  we re closed due to a shortage of staff.  Man.

Absolutely Horrible Service     No matter how many times I ask for NO ONIONS      Even having them read it back to me and it saying plain as day on my receipt No Onions they get me everytime.  It s annoying to get home after waiting 20 mins for them to even fill the order to find out it s wrong. Like here s my money give me what I specifically asked not for. Lol Dumbest Taco Bell I  Austin. Where do they find these people

I hate to post on yelp but I ll tell you right now that I ve been coming to this location for two years and I ve seen constant terrible service since I ve moved here. I can t believe a business can actually stay floating with the horrible customer service and disgusting attitudes from the staff. I wish I could get what I ordered but I guess that s too much to ask for. This store should be shut down. This has been happening for the past two years. Yeah I keep coming back  but only because I like Taco Bell. This one store is a disgrace.
Poorly ran even for a taco Bell. They jacked up my order and the food was under cooked. How do you make a quesadilla soggy  Also  no ice in the drink station.
Literally my fave taco bell. The cashier is so nice and never judges how hungover i am

I m currently trapped in the drive thru  I ve been here 15 minutes already and haven t moved forward 1 single car.... If I wasn t boxed in I would leave.... I am instantly filled with regret for coming here.

Normally I don t have a problem with Taco Bell. It s just your standard taco and burrito chain restaurant. However every time I come here  my order is always messed up. I usually get the quesadilla with extra jalape o sauce on it. And what do I get   No sauce whatsoever on it  with all my meat and cheese in the two middle pieces  and nothing but tortillas on the sides. I can t tell you how annoyed I get. So I had to start getting extra on the side  which they make me pay for it.  Not only is the food orders incorrect  but the people they have working there  Well I say people  but I really mean person  The day manager there is incompetent  extremely rude and hurries you through your order. I don t know about you  but that to me is the definition of bad customer service

One of the slower taco bells. Only one in drive thru. Ordered about 6 items. Waited 10 minutes. By the time I left there were 5 cars behind me. Food was alright just really slow. Not  fast  food by any means. The new quesaditos are ok. Get the steak one if you are wanting to try one.
I downloaded the Yelp app just to write about this Taco Bell.  Of all Taco Bell s  I genuinely fear for my guts
Their hours are a lie. Every time I try to go there at 1 45am  they are always closed. If they want to close early  then just put that in the hours so people don t waste their time.

They say you learn something new everyday  and today I learned that you can burn a crunch wrap supreme. Now I don t expect much from taco bell  who does  But today the low standards I do have where lowered again like some demented limbo stick. Bad service  burnt food  long wait  no reason to go back
Horrible  horrible  horrible    Rude staff  under cooked food  and waste of money.  Taco Bell please train this franchise  because they need to up their standards and manners.

The worst freaking Taco Bell I ve been to in my life. My entire order was wrong  they didn t have boxes for the 5  box I ordered and they didn t even have receipt paper    I even paid extra for some upgrades on tacos just to receive a regular ole taco like I didn t just pay extra for it. Avoid this Taco Bell  don t waste your time. Uglies

Rudest staff ever  After years I have not eaten at Taco Bell... this reminded me of why I should ve kept avoiding Taco Bell. The guy at the register greeted us while he was on his phone and messed up our order. When we talked to him about our messed up order his manager showed up and still charged us double for the missing item. She was also very rude and as we ate our food she was cursing and talking about the situation that happened. I ll try my best to avoid this restaurant
Great service every time.   After 20 years this place is still here  and still making decent fast food.

Nothing special but if you are expecting something special from a Taco Bell then you need to check your expectations. The food is always hot and tastes as I would expect compared to other Taco Bell experiences. Very risky place to live next to after a night out drinking.

I give this location 5 stars for their lunch time crew  I can t speak for the other hours of the day. I work downtown and grab lunch here once or twice a week. The service is ALWAYS great and they always get my order correct. My biggest reason for giving this location 5 stars is that the food is always fresh and hot. You can go to some locations and get a bean burrito and tell that the beans have been sitting for awhile because they are dry and cold  but not here. The beans are always fresh and have the perfect consistency. They make a perfect cheesy gordita crunch too. I ve never had a bad meal here. Major props to the manager and crew that run the store at lunch time. Y all deserve the recognition. Hope your higher ups see this

Consistently slow service. Can never figure out what the heck is going on at this location. Last time was the last straw. Waited at the counter for a solid 2-3 minutes for a cashier at 5pm on a weekday  wish the counter was furnished with a taco  bell .. The 3 other people waiting to place their order tolerated my dad joke . People walking around in the back made eye contact but didn t seem to care much. Order took much longer than you would expect. The kicker was the sign  ON A NAPKIN  on the napkin dispenser that said they were out of napkins..
I came here on a Saturday night at 1 am and they were closed. The sign on the window says they stay open till 3 am Friday and Saturday. So THATS annoying

Long line at drive thru at lunch on Thursday. I went inside. Oops - big mistake  At least 7 guys in front of me. All construction workers needing to order. All dining in. I overheard the cashier telling one of them it would be 10 minutes for the food. really   And she didn t tell anyone else. Another big group of 6 had just placed their orders so  there were lots of orders ahead of me.    They had one prep line open for both dining in  take out and drive thru. IT took at least 12 minutes. For Taco Bell. For fast food. ugh. I stopped looking at the time. And all of the orders were combo meals. Nothing special. With that kind of wait  for a fast food place  they should have offered a free drink or dessert.

I ve tried all the Taco Bells in the immediate region and this one is the best. The one of Riverside near Pleasant Valley is mediocre. The location on Lamar by Barton is OK. But this Oltorf location has got it right. I always order chicken quesadillas because of the sauce they put in  I have the recipe for their sauce but never make it but occasionally have intense cravings for it . Then I order random entrees from their drive-in menu.  I did not eat at Taco Bell for a long time. But those new Verde green sauce packets are delicious. I actually have some at my desk for ALL the meals.  The price is kinda high for fast food. I often order tacos for later or tacos for friends whereas McD s I usually shamefully order my overcaloried serving. Taco Cabana is far superior if they are nearby  but this local TB is great.

Aight... I ve never been inside  and I haven t eaten anything from here in some time. Nope  the reason I make the run to the border here is for... yep... the Big Ole Pepsi.  I pretty much always get great service in the window here  but it s probably because I m not ordering  30 worth of food one taco at a time. When I need the sweet sweet elixir of relief  these guys got what I need.

This is one of the better Taco Bells around the area that I stay in. The few times I ve been inside  it has been cleaned and they have done some updating so it looks nice. The staff has been very kind and attentive to any needs or mistakes in food. I tend to go through the drive through a bit more and yes there are lines at times. If your going between the hours of 1130-130  you might see a line. Its call an lunch rush and the same for dinner. You expect it. Regardless of it being a fast food restaurant  they do get slammed at times. Get over it    Other than that  my food has always been made to how I need it. I like extra red sauce on my bean burritos and this is one of the only Taco Bells that actually do it  Never had any problems with my food or major mistakes that have upset me. It seems as if they might have had new management  so the service level has increase in general.

Have had bad expereinces  this was the WORST. Let s boil this down  hot chalupa shells are awesome. 8-10 times I order at any Taco Bell I get a luke warm chalupa shell  which totally ruins the chalupa. This time it was not warm but COLD. I get home and I got a Dr Pepper instead of Diet Pepsi... and to top things off  I got a rancid apple empanada. Only thing right about the meal was the taco. WHAT THE HELL  Taco Bell   Rancid     The rancid aftertaste still persists.
Nasty restaurant... Poor service the employee in the lobby looked at me 3 times before finally asking what I needed when they messed up my order...

With regard to the Taco Bell on Oltorf  78704   this place has perennially terrible service.  Yesterday  I purchased 2 Grande Scramblers and another meal  of which the gentleman forgot the second Scramber  drive-thru .  Today  I asked them to replace it with the order I made today  and said  you can decide if you want to or not .  Instead  I was greeted by the manager who began arguing with me  telling me that we got it...he asked me 3 times for a receipt.  I sped off after I gave him the money  without food  because I could tell he was more interested in escalating the argument than just deciding whether he wanted to replace the meal or not.   This place is just terrible  all up the chain.  Too bad  cause the scrambler is great.

First i got there and the cashier was very rude  then i went inside to the restrooms  they were horribly not cleaned well  there was poop next to the toilet  the food was almost frozen if you want cold food then this is got to be the first choice for you because honestly it was very cold  i asked for 3 quesadillas and 2 doritos locos tacos and she didnt gave me the 2 doritos locos so i had to go back and ask for them again so not recommended
Ice cold food that should have been served hot   A squirt of this sauce on this spot and a squirt of another sauce over yonder.  Do these  workers  deserve to to be paid a  livible  wage

Well what a experience   I arrived at 9 45 and ordered the guy at the counter asked in I was doing for here or to go   well I wanted to eat there  really don t like eating in the car  he informs me that there is 15 min till the lobby closes and I said that s cool I won t be long . I still down and start eating and at 9 56 I m approved and asked to leave ... I m like 5 min from being done and leaving and I m asked to leave early   The door was locked as well . A customer walked up as I was leaving and was denied even though it was not 10 .. Keep in Mind the drive through is open till 4 so the kitchen is not shitting down. So what really would it hurt to let me finish   Also the customer that walked up was there before close and was not served .. I ll drive to riverside location from now on

Worst experience EVER   A co-worker and I decided to grab nachos on our lunch break. We work overnight  so this is around 2am.  We pull up and ask of we can place two separate orders. The guy SIGHS LOUDLY and reluctantly says yes. My friend orders first. She asks for a Nacho Bell Grande  no beef  add shredded chicken. No problem paying extra. We don t have the menu memorized  and we don t frequent this place often. She then asks him if the nachos come in a combo. He replies   Well yeah but you didn t ask for that   I m initially shocked. How rude  I tell her   wow  he s pretty rude.  He hears this and begins yelling at us through the loudspeaker  asking us if we have a problem  My friend says no  we just want to order. He proceeds to try to intimidate us and argue with us. We decide not to order and ask for a manager. He tells us he is the manager and his name is  Jim.  I doubt that. We pull around to the window  he refuses to acknowledge us or even apologize for his foolishness. I will Never go there again  and I will be calling corporate.

I don t normally post on these sites but my experience here was beyond terrible  and I think others deserve to know. The service was horrible and the employee incredibly rude.  The employee actually tried verbally picking a fight with our group while we were ordering.  I enjoy Taco Bell  but will officially go out of my way to give anyone business besides this particular franchise

Wonderful and excellent  Can t wait to bring guests here. Loved all the dishes. It s right across from the airport so if your out of town guests want to eat Mexican Food  they will be pleased. Great beer margaritas
Lil  hole in the wall  place. The service was great  The food was awesome  And the beer was cold   Can t wait to go back. If you are near the airport  this is a must stop.
Not very friendly  have a few fans in the back it gets windy and cold. The food is not very good and it s over priced.
Excellent and affordable. Simple street style food made genuine by the low brow building. Food matters here.
Awesome service and great people  Me and my boyfriend always make sure we stop by when we visit the area. The Pastor tacos are to die for  and the fluffy homemade tortillas always hit the spot
We love this place. Great agua frescas.... any time we go to the airport we try and stop By. MY favorite Mexican food in Austin.
Only good thing is about this place  chips and salsa  Very dirty and there is no soap in restroom. Food is good and service is frienbut I would not go back. Too dirty...

This is a hole in the wall type of restaurant but omg the food is amazing. And the salsa  if no one was watching I would have drank it from the bowl. The margaritas went down like water  Highly recommend this place  you won t be disappointed

My sister has been telling me for years that I had to eat at El Michoacano the second I get into Austin from Denver. Since we traveled toget5her this time  we stopped.  twice . First for lunch and breakfast on the way home. And she bought two dozen tortillas to take home which in hindsight was a bad idea as they don t do well in security.   She had a combo platter and I had a carne asada taco for lunch and breakfast was the best breakfast taco. And at breakfast we were joined by two more siblings who are local to Austin and had never eaten there. I think we have some new regulars.  Our waitress was the owners daughter and she was so nice telling us her favorites and family history. They have been opened for 22 years and I think that says it all.

Don t let looks deceive you.... This place is amazing. From the outside the building looks like it has been abandoned for years  however  on the inside this place is a restaurant. The staff was extremely friendly. The inside was definitely a typical authentic Mexican food place. If you are expecting fancy dinning or beautiful ambiance  then this is not the place for you. If you are looking for great food  though  this is your place  I will definitely be back for more.
For the best Menudo  we are willing to drive 30 minutes. Staff is very friendly and   the taco s memorable

Walked in around 8 30 had a couple beers and ate the  House Specialty  Enchiladas Mexicana. One of the best plates I ve ever had. So good I came back to the hotel and wrote this review my first . Service was great and the waitress said they ve been open for almost 25 years. I ll be going back.

Absolutely legit Mexican food. Better yet - we are two peeps originally from SO CAL. We know food.  We were stranded in Austin TX thanks to United Airlines. They put us up at a dumpster of hotel Quality Inn. This place made sleeping on top of the sheets worth it  DON T miss out on this gem  We had shared a 3 tacos combo and I ordered a side a flour tortillas to die for  The service was amazingly friendly as were are total grinos

You need to know the menu to know what to order....I guess. I had the huevos rancheros plate. If you told me they opened canned beans and a bag of potatoes I wouldn t be surprised. Waited an hour for my food to be room temperature. I am giving it a star because of the tortillas and the horchata were pretty good. My boyfriend had Migas and wasn t pleased with it as well. Not worth  30 and an hour wait. Don t waste your time.

Since I ve been here in TX I ve had the pleasure of getting my fill of tacos. I love tacos  My boss brought me in a couple of breakfast tacos from here  and I must say they were so delicious. The tortillas were soft  and so fresh. The hot sauce which I believe to be one of the most important ingredients to a great taco was fresh  amp  had the perfect amount of heat. It s going to be hard to leave TX with all this good food . Seriously TX is like foodie paradise. This is a great place for a quick bite .

Very poor quality Mexico City style food.   Tortillas crumbly  too thin and under cooked.  Service was spotty  staff watching tv rather than tables.  Shredded chicken tacos included shredded bone splinters.   Beef taco was course grounds of beef  not much larger than ground pepper.   Likely due to fatty content  very oily.  Corn tortillas crumbled  but flour tortilla was adequate.  Margaritas were syrup flavored without much tequila flavor...not worth the price and we weren t notified about happy hour pricing  but we just wanted to flee the joint.

81 Well...To start this experience off...NO Queso...on a Saturday ..Wife was ready to leave that very second...would a 1 star from here if she was writing the review...I mean That is part of the whole experience on our quest to 100 different mexican texmex joints...As for the food...wasn t bad...Salsa was spicy  chips crisp..Wife went the usual route beef Chiladas and rice...best part was the guajillo sauce...meat by itself  not much flavor...but all together...pretty good...mine was the Chicken Chiladas with the suiza sauce..was OK   bit much sour cream flavor  and a bit on the thick side...Not the  Suiza  Im used to..Rice and Beans were standard fair...not much stood out..service was good...chances we would come back....No Queso..No Bueno
The food is so good and the salsa is fresh the best salsa I ve had. I would recommend this place   A great hole in the wall
Still fine but not what it was on our first visit. Food came out quicker which may have been the issue. Chips and salsa good as ever.
Authentic Mexican food.  Corn Tortillas were home made  not store bought.  Chicken fajitas were tender and excellent.
Just came back from a weekend trip to NY and we were really craving some REAL tacos. Picked this little gem up on the maps and wow  More delicious than anticipated  homemade tortillas here are great

A morning I was in a rush to work and happened to forget my lunch at home. I ran into this restaurant and ended up having one of the best breakfast tacos. Whether corn or flour they are hand made and are delicious.

If you are a vegetarian there are so many other places in Austin to go. I advise checking out a different place. If you don t have dietary restrictions then this place is great   I was invited out to lunch after a big meeting and they wanted to go here because it was close. I don t live in Austin so I just went with the crowd. Unfortunately this place had no idea why I wouldn t want to eat meat or eat beans that were cooked in lard.   When I first walked in everyone was already sitting at a table so I joined in. There wasn t a large table - just a bunch of tables shoved together so we could all fit. No problems with that. The issue was that some of the tables were different sizes and heights and they wobbles and I was worried that my food would fall into my lap.   The salsa was spicy and amazing on the chips   The waitresses were very nice. They brought the drinks out quickly but I did not see a menu so when she asked what I wanted I jumped to my go-to for mexican restaurants. Veggie Fajitas. She was so confused. She asked  You mean beef fajitas   and I replied with  yes  Beef fajitas with no beef  and she stood around so confused. I then asked if they would be able to do that  Can you grill vegetables - peppers  onions  tomatoes  whatever without meat   and she smiled and said she would check. She asked if I wanted beans and I asked if they were cooked in lard. She said yes so I politely declined.   When the food came out the plate was full of grilled peppers and onions so I was happy. Plus I had some yummy rice with guacamole. The tortillas are hand made and tastes sooooo good  I love hand made flour tortillas. I am pretty sure they grilled the vegetables on the grill where meat had been used previously. They tasted a little .... greasy and it definitely upset my stomach.  I would recommend this place to anyone who loved authentic Mexican food but not if you are vegetarian

This was a very nice surprise to find this place. For a very reasonable price I had a very nice dinner. They have house special enchiladas with meat  I chose quail  with awesome spices. Really appreciated that place.

This place is home of the most legit interior Mexican food in Austin. This was our third visit and worth the mention. The service is efficient  the salsa has the perfect amount of heat and the entrees did not disappoint. Close to the airport if you re just passing through or worth the short drive from central Austin.

I highly recommend El Michoac no to anyone who appreciates excellent homemade family Mexican food... gave it a shot as I didn t really want to have dinner at the Airport... awesome Chile Relleno with fresh Corn Tortillas  Rice Beans  amp  Guacamole... service was great and very friendly... the restaurant itself is pretty old and rundown but I could care less once seated and eating...  -
This place brought back memories of what good....real Mexican food taste like....this is not TexMex   Great family owed and family run...business   Definitely coming back

Just finished one of the best Mexican meals of my life.  It was crazy good.  The salsa was amazing  the tortillas too.  Highly recommend the lemonade.  Fresh made and pulpy.   I come to Austin for work quite a bit  and always stay at the hotel right down the street.  Not sure why I never came here before  but I will be back..... Tomorrow...... And probably the next day.
This was awesome Mexican. Cheap  delicious  and fast. Been there twice and I can t wait to get back to Austin to go a third time.
Really recommend it. Really delicious food   Had some porch chops in ranchero sauce really good u have to try it.

Me and my husband love this place  We usually stop by in the mornings. All their food is homemade you won t be disappointed. Their drinks are homemade as well lemonade is my favorite. I would recommend you try this place out for sure. Liz is great she is always smiling and treats her customers great.

Growing up in Corpus Christi I have been exposed to quality Mexican food. This place is legit. Delicious home made tortillas   the corn are especially tasty. The staff is attentive and swift. Nothing fancy  but plenty of tables so rarely a wait. Right by the airport. It has been in business for 20 years  and it is obvious why. Definitely recommend if you re out this way.

Homemade tortillas homemade tortillas homemade tortillas     I travel up and down 71east quite often and i always  wondered what that orange looking building was. So one Saturday morning i pulled over and ordered some breakfast tacos and i must say they were yummy for my tummy.  I m going  on a regular basis. HOMEMADE TORTILLAS

El Michoacano serves tasty cheap Tex Mex. Homemade tortillas are used to make great tacos. The salsa is good.Mexican coke is available. Great lunch specials. A killer Mexican juke box.  For breakfast or lunch near the airport this was one of my spots. When you find out your best girl is doing your best friend she is no longer your best girl.    The problem is lard. Lard has always been a part of Tex Mex cooking.In the old days people bought fresh lard or made it from pork fat. Today the hydrogenated lard containing trans fats is common in Tex Mex. El Michoacano  uses the cheap trans fat lard. Sold in large tubs it will last forever. After Texas is destroyed in a nuclear war you find only cockroaches feasting on hydrogenated lard. Lard may be an important part of Tex Mex. So if you want to eat lard make it the fresh kind.

Absolutely love their Mexican style enchiladas but can t say the same for the service. When we arrived the staff was seated at a table near the entrance I m assuming because they didn t have any tables at the time. We were then told to seat ourselves and then proceeded to wait about 5 minutes before finally having anyone come bring us the menus and get a drink order. Food came out in a decent amount of time but was just dropped off without asking if we needed anything else like a refill  utensils  etc. I had to get up various time to ask for things like napkins or refill for our table and every time I d find our waitress sitting on her phone. I did notice when a table of about three guys came in she became more attentive to their table so not sure if we were receiving bad service because we weren t guys or she just didn t like us. I am a waitress as well so I understand not wanting to check on customers every couple minutes or taking a small break but this staff lacked customer service completely.

Really bad service and the food was even worse.  Couldn t even eat the fajitas they were so dry and the carnitas were absolutely disgusting. It was mostly pieces of slimy pig skin.  The flour tortillas and chips were really good but everything else was so bad it was left on the plate. I can t imagine why anyone would say this was authentic Mexican food. I happen to have many relatives there and have eaten in Mexico more times then I can count and have never been served such horrible food. I guess maybe we ordered the wrong thing but I would steer clear of this place.  I guess they make good breakfast tacos but news flash they don t make those in Mexico. Paid 35 dollars for food we couldn t eat just because we didn t want to get beaten up if we didn t pay.  Was looking for real Mexican food in Texas but didn t find it here.

Oh boy  Teacher work day  We get to go out to eat like real grown-ups  The only problem with working way out here is...where the heck do we go   El Michoacano fits the bill for very tasty tex-mex in this culinary twilight zone around the airport. As an employee in the Del Valle ISD  I know how hard it is to find good eats around here. And what s up with that  developers  Hardly any place to eat around our airport  Hmmm.  Our  fab  principal picks up big  yummy breakfast tacos for our faculty meetings  every combo imaginable  best homemade flour tortillas in Austin  excellent salsa so hot it makes me sweat. Perfect  in other words. Fresh  crisp chips that taste homemade  too. Very little English spoken  which is always a good sign  divey atmosphere complete with a spanish-only jukebox  spanish language newspapers  a small kitchen and a friendly staff.  I ve had the enchiladas  creamy  gooey goodness   sampled lots of breakfast tacos  and that s about it. They have your typical tex-mex variety of food  four caldos  entrees inlcuding puerco en salsa rojo verde  seafood dishes  barbacoa and the like...all very reasonably priced. The only thing they don t have is a website.  Give  em a try sometime when you re out this way...

I stopped by to pickup lunch and was surprised to pay 13.99 for Mexican enchiladas plate from a restaurant that is literally a hole in the wall  to not say ugly  dirty looking . I was optimistic that maybe the price was due to great quality food. I got to my office to my surprise the Mexican enchiladas have NO CHEESE   upset because not I m at work and I knew I had ordered cheese enchiladas due to Good Friday. I called and the lady that answered the phone stated it was not a mistake the enchiladas had no cheese they make them with grated parmesan   i followed up with saying I had initially asked for cheese enchiladas and she sarcastically stated parmesan cheese is cheese. It made sense why the room smelled like pizza when I opened the plate. No solution was offered   even tho I stated how can a 13.99 dollar plate of cheese enchiladas be made with sprinkles of parmesan cheese    I stated I would just never give them business again. NOT EVEN MY DOG WOULD EAT THE TORTILLAS STUFFED WITH ONIONS SPRINKLED WITH OFF BRAND parmesan Cheese out of a plastic container.

There are two things you need to try here    the flour tortillas - homemade and yum  any taco here is pretty tasty because of the flour tortillas.  i especially like the chorizo and egg breakfast tacos.   the chile relleno   it s probably the best chile rellno I ve had in Austin or the surrounding area - fluffy  eggy batter deliciousness.    avoid the front room  it is not air conditioned well at all.  avoid the queso   it is just horrible  watery and strange.    you might get an authentic waitress that doesn t speak english  so brush up on your basic ordering skills en espanol.

Came here for dinner while on vacation. My husband ordered the chile verde  my daughter the enfrijoladas and I the menudo. My family was happy with their food but the menudo was a bit spicy for me.  The homemade tortillas were delicious as well as the horchata. They don t serve dessert which is a bummer for me.  Overall friendly staff and good service.

I was dropping my man off at the airport for a work trip and since we were early  we decided to stop somewhere close to the airport to grab a beer and a snack.   This place is pretty authentic  but very run down.  It s very small on the inside and pretty ghetto looking - on both the outside and the inside.  We had a couple of modelos and split some tacos.  The tacos were tasty  but the shells looked like they were from the Old El Paso taco kit.  The chips and salsa were decent - the salsa had a kick to it which I liked.   There was a whole back room that was filled with Christmas stuff that the restaurant could visibly see  which I thought was hysterical.   Not a terrible place to grab a snack and a beverage.  I certainly wouldn t take a 1st date here  but overall  not too shabby for a quick stop.

It looks a bit dodgy from the outside  but the food and service is very very good. I had the Caldo de Pollo and it was absolutely delicious. I d come back here for sure. It s a great place for staging for the airport.

Ham  egg  cheese breakfast tacos. Homemade tortillas. Good ham. Bright yellow cheese. Good  but highly variable salsa. Being a little lightheaded from soccer helps with the whole experience.  Convenient to South East Metro Park sports fields  amp  airport   It does sometimes smell like a sewer outside. We call it  stinky taco  for short  El Michoacano is a mouthful.

Was just here on 19 Feb before flying back home. My BFF and I grabbed a few cold Dos Equis and breakfast.  It is not a great looking establishment - in or out - but it is directly across from the airport and the service was very good.  We were attended to frequently enough  with warm smiles and care regarding our food  amp  beverage emjoyment.  The menu is entirely authentic Mexican  so if you are looking for  Chili s   Blech  what s wrong with you    then this is not your place. I think we were the only two people in the place who needed to look at the menu to know what they offered  and we were the only non-Spanish speakers  sorry  BFF  I know you ve had classes  but you still don t speak Spanish very well...YET   but it didn t matter as we were treated with equally good service.  Its a simple place with good food and great service.  Oh and the beer is nice and cold  even on Sunday mornings.  A GREAT alternative to eating inside the airport before you catch a flight  and by the way  the airport doesn t serve any beer until after 12 noon on Sundays  so there you go... .

This restaurant is located near the Austin airport  and is fairly easy to access.  I ve only been there for breakfast.  Their breakfast tacos are excellent  specifically because their tortillas are homemade and delicious.  Don t worry if the outside smells a little stinky.  The inside is fine.
Service has improved greatly   Love the staff  The location is perfect in my commute.
Kind of terrible breakfast tacos but a decent lunch. Slow cooks. Nothing really to brag about at all.

Everything here tastes homemade like my grandma s are in the kitchen cooking. I love the food from here and i love how its so close to my house    It can be busy at times but you just have to know when to get there.

Amazing carnitas.  Their name says it all. Original region of pork carnitas. Traditionally served with onions  cilantro  jalape os  re fried beans and rice. Fresh made corn tortillas. Amazing food. Short  sorta sketchy walk from quality inn along highway. Standard margarita in big plastic glass with salt. Very nice server.
Great Mexican food. This is as authentic as you can get. Enchiladas are really good here and the red sauce that comes with it is mmmmm.
I have to say is is most authentic Mexican place I ve been to in Austin. The flautas are amazing

Just like you ve crossed the border and parked in a small town cantina lot and stepped into Momma s for a meal. You wouldn t complain about the building condition and cleanliness in that environment-think of this place that way and all is good. Best Tex-Mex   Fresh tortillas  good red sauce on the enchiladas and the tamales are yum. Daily lunch specials are reasonably priced as are the other menu items.  It is all the other things folks commented about  so if you re a germy germ type  go to Taco Bell.  If you want authentic Mex  give it a try.

This place is expensive . And the older guy with the glasses at the register is a grouch. I ordered some flautas  and what I got were three soggy tortillas with chicken and cheese . I also had to pick between getting rice and guacamole   or rice and beans. I work at the airport across the way and I am always looking for new spots for lunch and this won t be one. Nine dollars can buy me some good ole airport food.

Rate it a 2 .Ordered the chicken Flautas . They weren t the way I m used to   but tasted decent plus had cheese in the middle which was a good twist . Inside not the nicest   cleanest place   but I m used to that . The service though  had two waitresses come to me . One was friendly and the other not . The non-friendly one was the one who checked me out and didn t even acknowledge me . She was deep into a conversation with some guy next to her and cashed me out and that was it . No have a nice day nothing . So customer service no good in my eyes plus mediocre food  not a great place .

Don t pass this place by. Most authentic Mexican food I ve had in Austin. I had the enchiladas with green chile sauce. Spicy and delicious. It s like a family kitchen not a chain feel. Don t miss out  And it won t break the bank.

The food is really good and cheap.  I used to eat there once or twice a week for 2 yers.  Rated a one for cleanliness.  Last time I ate there  cockroaches came crawling out of the leaf of the table.  Turned me off for good.
This place is a dive. Ugly and gross looking. But  don t let it fool you. Some of the best Mexican food in this area. Breakfast tacos are fantastic. The enchiladas are hardy.
some of the best tex mex in Austin ...get here get in and enjoy .....had the taco plate chicken and beef. very good.

OMG      We got stranded in the airport for about 5 hours  and didn t feel like eating at the airport  so the only place we found was this mom and pop restaurant. At first  we were hesitant but always up for trying new things. Never will I regret it  best mexican food  we have ever tasted. We went on a Sunday Morning  which they were very busy but the staff was very friendly  Definitely going back and will recommend it to everyone. Really YUMMY

Really good red pepper sauce  the best Carne Guisada I have had.  The Chile Relleno is damn good too.  Kind of a hole in the wall place  so don t let the crappy  dirty  run-down feel of the place get to you before you try the food.  Service is so-so  but the food outweighs any negatives.
Waiter provided us such good service. The food and timing was all great and we had a blast  Would recommend for anyone who enjoys large servings and legitimate mexican food

A K A  La Capital de Marisco  First off  this ain t Fonda San Miguel  Guero s  nor Chuy s. It s Mexican-owned and -operated. The woman who owns it and cooks there  not the only cook there  though  had had a restaurant in Mexico  and these are her recipes from there. This style of Mexican food originates from Bejucos  a village inland from Acapulco - hence the emphasis on mariscos  seafood . Everyone who works there is Mexican  and one of them told me the food tastes as authentic as locally-available ingredients will allow.  The first time I ate here  about three years ago  it was on a Thursday  when the lunch special is chicken enchiladas with green sauce. The enchiladas were surprisingly delicious  and the rice perfectly-cooked.  I later learned that the chicken is marinaded in spices  not just tossed-in.  That green salsa  mind-blowingly sabroso. For about an hour after I left  the food was still making me feel like crying  it was that good. I eat here almost weekly  and usually leave repeatedly exclaiming to myself   That food was so GOOD   Once  just after I d devoured my meal  still at the table  I did start to cry. I couldn t help it  I love the food here.  Thus far  I ve had the  green enchiladas   the fajita chicken plate  the shrimp fish soup  the fish platter  both shrimp and fish tacos  the carne asada with nopales  the chicken enchiladas with yellow cheese combo platter  the shrimp enchiladas  and the mole enchiladas. Some I prefer over others  though they re all great  but that has to be the best mole sauce that I ll ever have. Their corn tortillas are handmade  yummy by themselves.  Add to this that the waitresses are really nice  and the murals on the walls are whimsical. I also love the food at Chapala and Las Cazuelas  to the west on Cesar Chavez  and Arandas and Polvo s on South First  but whenever I eat at another Mexican restaurant  I wish that I d eaten here.  Bonus  the Guerrero taco trailer  around the corner on Pleasant Valley Rd.  is primo. That carnitas taco - dang
Servers were so mamonas . Literally took 10 minutes for an extra plate   Ya pa que      Oysters tasted like sink water ...  boooo

Today s visit was a little off. We ordered Caldo de Res beef soup  and 2 al pastor tacos. The tacos arrived but not the soup. We asked about the soup and they said we never ordered it. It took another 20 min for the soup.  Food today was also just average. Missing the flavor we usually experience.

Do not eat at this restaurant unless you want to get sick then by all means go ahead   they have flies Everywhere the restroom stinks like a Port-a potty s stay away from this restaurant at all cost I paid  35 to get sick violently sick within an minutes of eating there take my word for it do not eat there. I repeat do not eat there . Just stay away . save your money. There are way better sea food Restaurants . I suggest going to deckhands they re way better and worth every penny

YUM. I just got two tostadas  one shrimp  one octopus. Tons of perfectly cooked seafood on top of a crispy and delicious tostada with generous slices of fresh  ripe avocado on top. My husband got some grilled fish  and it came with handmade  thick  warm  corn tortillas. Amazing deal  preparation  flavor.

I hope La Catedral de Marisco  1 never closes. The cook at this location is so amazing.  Perfectly made rice  beans  strip steak made to perfection.  Fresh and homemade tortillas.  It s my top three best Mexican food in central Austin.

Come here if you like authentic Mexican food. I had the  7 mares soup   or something like that  and it was extremely good. The soup came with shrimp  crab  clams   and a bunch of other delicious seafood and the broth was to die for

Good food portions and I love this place  Its like a hidden gem... but the last time I had came was sad.   The sever got pissy when we asked for flour tortillas and she brought us corn then when we asked her then the mood was ugly .. She kept forgetting our straws and refills and severed some foreigners way better and faster with no flawless mistakes

Visting Austin we wanted to try something new.  I found this place and was glad I did.  The food is great  chips and salsa are good and the Michelada was awesome.  Our waitress was attentive and made suggestions.

The other reviews are mostly about the food counter.  I have never eaten at the food counter but I go to La Hacienda regularly for a few things   1  The red ribs  aka las costilla marinadas.  These are mind-blowing.  The marinade -which inevitably stains your fingers through the next morning- is made out of beer  pineapple  and other secret things and the ribs are cut across the bone much like Korean style beef ribs.  They have several other meat products behind the counter with the same marinade but the ribs win  hands down.  I have never met a person who didn t like these.  In fact  these are so good that I didn t even tell people where to buy them until a couple years ago.  Don t tell anyone else  okay   It s our little secret.  2  Salsa verde  aka  TacoDeli s Do a salsa  but BETTER because it s not a stupid Tex-Mex chain s  or HEB s  appropriation of a very common Mexican salsa.  This is made out of jalape os  oil and garlic  and it is not for the faint of heart.  Although really  why mild salsa is even an option irks me.  But this green stuff... ohhhh it s good.  We put it on EVERYTHING  from chips and tacos to eggs and brisket sandwiches.  You might just lick the container.  And if it s gone  it s in the refrigerated section across from the eggs  you can always get some from the food counter.  Grab some El Milagro chips on your way out and you can snack on the drive home  because just dunking your fingers in it and licking would be uncouth .  3  Tamales - I think these are seasonal but I m not sure exactly what the season is.  I just know if they have them  I buy them.  They have the more common corn husk variety as well as the extra delicious style wrapped in banana leaves.   4  Mexican spices - big variety.  5  Cheap pi atas.  Like crazy cheap.  Not as huge a selection as the pi ata places on Cesar Chavez  but they ll do in a pinch.  There s a much bigger  much crazier Mexican grocery store across 183 that seems to have cut down on La Hacienda s business  but the ribs and salsa are far superior at LH.

Excellent menudo Saturday morning. Good carnitas with hand made tortillas. You have to come inside the store and order at the checkout counter. Then proceed to the back of the store. The setting is very minimalist with a counter top like a sushi bar. Good authentic tacos.

The little things count  I stop by on a Saturday craving tamales de elote  huchepos  I got 4 from the hot counter I went home to eat them for lunch but they were horrible  dry and hard I couldn t event cut them with a knife is and insult to the clients to sale food that is un edible

Love this place. I work close by. Visit this location for lunch twice a wk. Fresh food and cooked just right. Friendly staff. Only thing I wished was the majority of the staff spoke English. But by no means is it an issue  besides its a Mexican store... I ll make the adjustment. The customer service and patience of the employees make the experience GOOD  Will recommend to anyone.

The hot food counter is awesome. The only thing it s missing is fresh hot tortillas. I saw them pulling the tortillas out of a bag. Sad thing is  I saw a cooler with fresh hot tortillas from a bakery down the street  why couldn t you have used those  I d have loved you even more.  I tried the borrego  pastor  barbacoa  y lengua tacos. The borrego was really good. The meat didn t have too strong of a lamb flavor and I like that in my lamb. It was greasy but I can deal. The pastor seasonings were phenomenal. It had a bit of spice  with a lot of flavor. The barbacoa was super juicy and beyond tender. I wanted more of that greasy  heart stopping goodness. The lengua was chewy and tasty  but I did need some of their salsa verde to complete the taco. I added onions and cilantro to all my tacos. I topped the meal off with some orchata  spelling . MMM. Tasty meal that made me slightly sleepy at work.  I had coworkers try the pork with tomatillo salsa and saiid that it as good as well. I want more. To be continued....

Great little tacos   While this place is definitely more of a grocery market  they have a food counter with an awesome selection of taco options. The cooked meats are on display so you can get a good look at what you re gonna get. I think you can get the meats by the pound as well - which is pretty cool.  Important note - you order food at the regular grocery checkout and then give the ticket to the nice ladies behind the food counter.  They have about 10 stools if you want to eat right at the counter  otherwise it s to-go.  I tried beef fajita and chicken tacos on my visit. The taco tortillas  flour   I got were a touch on the small side  but they piled them up with meat. They added cilantro and onions - which is such a simple thing  but it puts them right up there with other authentic mexican tacos I ve tried. The beef was very tasty and not very fatty. The chicken was fantastic with a very tasty sauce  in the deli display you could see the chicken swimming in the red sauce with chunks of peppers and onions .  They had a great verde salsa in squeeze bottles on the counter. Not as awesome as El Regio s  but close.  There is no Menu  and the ladies at the food counter didn t speak much english  so either brush up on your spanish or know what you want before you order.  The back part of the store is the meat market. It looks very well stocked and they even had a big case of seemingly fresh chicharones.  I think I m going to need to hit these folks up for taco fixings by the pound next time.

The stars remain the same  but I m slightly disappointed with their hot food counter. I ve been on my Great Torta Quest for a while now  and I finally noticed that they have chicken tortas here.   The main impetus for this is that practically every time I ve been here recently  they re out of tamales. I ve been wanting to try their Tamales Veracruzanos  but this time I went for the torta.   There are two types of torta bread. This is the more popular kind  given my experience   but not what my El Paso cohorts would call the  correct  kind. This kind has to either be toasted really really well  or you will just have a really supremely messy torta experience. Which I had.   The good   They put beans on their torta. They give you a side of their awesome green salsa and some limes. They use stewed chicken instead of chicken fajita They put crema on their torta.  The not-so-good  Messy Messy torta experience due to bread falling apart. No avocados  Srsly   I asked  and the lady said they didn t have any. huh  Stewed chicken had more than a couple bites of chicken parts I d rather not eat.   So  I ll be sticking to their tamales  and maybe try something else in the future  but these tortas don t measure up to Matamoros.

I saw this meat market on my way to work one day and I figured I d go in and check it out. I love places where you can get fresh meats produce.  Ok  so I am hispanic....I walk in and everyone stops and stares. Great...I immediately feel out of place. Why  Who the heck knows  Instead of walking out  I grab a cart and push away.  I will NOT be intimidated by the stares.  So  I peruse the aisles in hopes of finding something I can t live without.   The place is decent. They have a nice selection of meats and regular grocery products. However  the aisles are so dang cramped together.  I hate feeling as if I can t breathe or as if the guy next to you will have to rub against you to push his way through the same aisle. ICK  Anyway  I guess this place is ok. I just wish people wouldn t stare at you as if they ve never seen a Hispanic who is native Texan instead of from the heart of Mexico.  I still love to eat  too   I walked out with some cucumbers and a few canned goods. I don t think I ll be back unless I m feeling ornery.
Amazing tortas and sauces. I am sad they have moved to Dripping Springs. For those who can  please support them.

Well if you crave a taco in bee caves  I would suggest to give this food truck a try. The food is fresh and flavorful. Both green and red salsa are also amazing. We usually order the veggie tacos and my wife tried their veggie burrito and till now we have liked everything.
Love this place. California ex-pat and this is my favorite place for a burrito in the Lakeway Bee Cave Westlake area. Pork burrito is my favorite. Red sauce is serious stuff - be careful.

Ok  if you miss street tacos from Los Angeles...come here.   If you know that a good Mexican tacos is not slathered in weird sauces and cheese...come here.   The pastor taco is delicious. Make sure you get the pineapple in it. Slightly sweet. Slightly spicy. All good.   Suadero or  rose meat  is almost like a beef carnitas. Little crunchy bits and really tasty. And yes  put the onions and cilantro on it.   The carne Asada is my third favorite. It s not bad by any means  it s really good on its own...but the two above are my favorite.   We are lucky to have this in the Bee Cave area. Compared to downtown Austin taco places...this is equal to or better.   Had the burrito once. Big and delicious. Had it with carne Asada...can t wait to do a pastor one.   Lots of outdoor seating and covered.   Super nice folks in the taco truck.   I almost did not share this because I wanted to keep it to myself.   Enjoy.

These are the best tacos I ve had  and I ve been searching  a lot  since moving to Austin from Southern CA 8 weeks ago.  Pastor is great with fresh pineapple grilled in and the Suadero is fantastic too.  Look forward to trying the full menu.  Large portions and great prices.  What a great find a few minutes from home

I needed breakfast tacos for my kiddos morning birthday party and tried De La O. I called the day before and was able to order 2dozen tacos to be picked up the next morning. They even opened early for us  The owners were so sweet  And the tacos were amazingggggg. Seriously these are the best tacos I ve found in the bee cave area. Do not pass them up. I can t wait to go back and try their lunch tacos and tortas

Went here for lunch today because the lines at Chick Fila across the street were long  amp  I m so glad that I did. I had a burrito  amp  my daughter had tacos  they are so good that I m worried about other people finding out  amp  causing me to wait in line forever  I m thinking this is the most authentic take out Mexican food in our neighborhood. Highly recommended
One of the authentic  delicious tacos we had. Their tacos are cheap but it doesn t affect the quality of their food.

Finally    A legit taco truck in Lakeway   This place checks just about all of the boxes.  Sampled the breakfast tacos  heuevos mexicana  bean and cheese  bacon and egg  and a Carne Asada taco today and they were all outstanding.  Big thumbs up for the grilled onions and serranos with the Carne Asada.  Salsas are outstanding - especially the jalape o salsa.  Cant wait to go back and try their tortas and al pastor tacos.  Would love to see them add sopes and gorditas  but even without them  this fills a much needed void in Lakeway  and will be getting lots of my business.  Clean  friendly  looks to be a family operation.  So happy to have them here  especially after the apparent demise of Little DF in Spicewood.  Welcome to Lakeway De La O - I hope you stick around for a long time

Me and a friend decided to give these guys a try recently. We made a huge mistake... by not coming here sooner. I have been going everyday now. Well this morning i tweaked my back but decided i still had to go.  Called from my car and said i tweaked my back if i could order from my car right outside and pick up. The young lady was like if u have exact change i ll bring it out to you. What an awesome gesture and I did have exact change... i wish i had another  5 to tip for that. I told her i d be back next time with a bigger tip. Man i wish ppl like her realized that all you have to do is be nice to people. It goes a long way. Made my day with a messed up back

I work in the area and have been looking for a good taco place for breakfast or lunch. While trying many gas stations tacos  that were overpriced and underfilled. I drove by this lot and saw a small turquoise food truck that read out  Mexican Tacos  on the side. I was already expecting to be disappointed but as i walked up and saw a line of people waiting for their food  I became a little hopeful. I placed my order  3 tacos  thinking that they would be small. When I received my order ans felt the heat and the weight of the bag  I knew i had finally found my breakfast lunch spot.    Big  cheap  and delicous. Reminds me of San Antonio tacos.

Came here today and am so happy to have a great taco truck nearby  We got 4 carne asada tacos  they come topped with cilantro and onions  as well as a side of grilled onions and a grilled Serrano pepper. The red salsa is spicy and delicious  It also comes with a green salsa. Will definitely be back. Great prices and great food
Hands down the best breakfast tacos  in the area.  Try it for yourself and you won t be disappointed.  Friendly owners and service with a smile
All the tacos here are delicious  especially their egg and chorizo and al pastor.
Amazing tacos   Their salsas are incredible   My breakfast taco go to place and they are so nice.
By far the best breakfast tacos I ve ever had  I don t know how they do it but they are truly amazing. My go to is potato egg and cheese  Highly recommend
