Excellent breakfast tacos at a  reasonable price. Support local  businesses    I can t wait to go there for lunch and try their tortas

Dropped by for some breakfast tacos.  Pretty damn good   Not greasy.  Very flavorful.  Hot sauce has some bite   They also have corn tortillas    Thank you very much.  Finally  a place in our hood that has tacos that are worthy     very nice people  customer service is to be proud of.
Best breakfast tacos I ve had in a long time. Great to finally have a place like this nearby.
Very very good tacos. I eat here twice a week. Wide variety of meat to choose from. Great prices and very friendly

I love this place   So happy  lucky  to have authentic tacos in Lakeway.  The people who run the truck are super nice and you can tell they care about quality and cleanliness.  I ve eaten there twice in the last week and have tried several different tacos and they were all great   The Al Pastor with pineapple  cilantro  and lime is outstanding.  The grilled serrano pepper that comes with each order is a nice touch.  Muy caliente  They serve breakfast tacos in the morning and waffles on weekend mornings.  Great...now I m hungry again...
3rd time to this family owned taco truck. The carne asada is to die for. Still yummy. I must try.

Jorge is like a scientist that never grows content. Not only does he purchase what seems to be higher quality ingredients but with his ever changing menu  he produces amazing 5 star food at every stop. His food is not boring by any means and he constructs his menus like a culinary puppeteer piecing this with that to produce the tastiest of results.

This food truck came to our apartment complex today. We ordered the nachos and were deeply disappointed.  22 for two orders to get concession stand chips and cheese. The bottom was full of broken chips and the ground beef tasted cold and old. Huge chunks of cilantro and rubbery onions did nothing to improve the taste. How does a food place screw up the easiest thing to make   Definitely NOT worth the money paid for this
The Matamoros street tacos take me back to Mexico. They are so delicious and the closest to actual authentic Mexican food.
The food truck just visited my apartment complex  great and reasonably priced food  I had the chicken tinga and shredded beef tacos  both of which were delicious.
Awesome food and great peeps   I have eaten here numerous time over the last two weeks.
This is the best burrito I ve ever had. The guy was super friendly and nice. He could tell I was hungry and added extra chicken. The sauce is spicy and good. I highly recommend this food truck

Tacos seemed like they were premade and room temp. Wrapped in foil and paper. The quesadilla was small for the price. For two orders of tacos and the quesadilla and cost about 43 . Would have been cheaper to goto cantina512 across the street and get carry out.

Fantastic Mexican food truck The serving guy was very nice and friendly. I tried the vegetarian tacos twice and quesadillas. The taste was very unique and flavorful. Also  It tasted fresh and had good amount of filing. I would definitely definitely recommend it for delicious Mexican food.

The sign says that the chicken fajita tacos come with cilantro and cheese. Wasn t either of these in my taco. I went up and asked the guy and he says to me with a straight face  I put the cheese in there  - and  I can put the cilantro if you want   - um dude it says they come with it   Oh and my tacos are covered with the sour cream that I specifically asked to leave off.   That s not my biggest complaint. My biggest complaint would be the very sparse amount of chicken in these  chicken fajitas.  They are more like a pile of lettuce with a few slivers of chicken hidden at the bottom. Pictures speak for themselves. The salsa is some gross  bright orange  bland liquid that tastes nothing like Mexican salsa.

Came to Rainey street for another food truck in mind  ended up being closed  so decided to eat here as second choice. That being said I didn t have too high of hopes or expectations.   I ordered the Al Pastor and my fianc  ordered the Steak Fajita Burrito with Chips  amp  Salsa. The burrito was huge and filled  closely resembles Chipotle. My two tacos seemed to have a lot of lettuce and some meat. As they were pretty tasty  I didn t receive any cheese  cilantro or tomatoes on either  which they were supposed to come with . Both orders were accompanied by two sauces  a green and red one and they were both very tasty. In fact I don t think my tacos would ve been anything good without them.   As for the  3.00 Chips and Salsa don t even waste your time. Small serving which is probably expected BUT what I wasn t expecting was the mediocre salsa. The chips came straight from a bag  amp  the salsa is PICANTE S SAUCE.

Nowhere near authentic  if I GPS d authentic Mexican food from this food truck it would be at least an hour drive away.  I ordered the street tacos and the chips and salsa.  For one  I couldn t figure out why they were selling the street tacos in pairs.  It was when I received my chips and salsa that I knew I had steered myself wrong.  My chips were like the gas station and ice cream truck nacho chips and the salsa was given to me in two 1 oz. containers.  My street tacos were served on flour tortillas and came with massive chunks of bell peppers in them. Also  my water bottle was room temperature at best. The best thing about my meal was the tiny bit of salsa I received  though I m sure it was store bought.  I feel utterly disrespected and can t figure out for the life of me what tasteless sub-humans are keeping this place in business.  Never again
Chicken fajita tacos  chicken burrito and veggie tacos  all were pleased. Asked for a spoon or a fork  got a spork. Win-win.

Amazing food truck  The vegetarian tacos were my absolute favorite and the al pastor were my boyfriend s  1 choice. Super nice and great service   Absolutely one of my favorite taco trucks in Austin- will be back

I m here a lot  mainly because I m nearby a lot. It s a Jack  and it s a bit of a ghetto Jack. But in general the staff are friendly and responsive.  Five stars for location. Four stars for service. Two stars for food. It s a Jack.

This place on riverside is horrible  I gave them 3 chances  that s fair right    Let s start  number 1 they cancelled my online order and when I got there SHE said  oh did you have an order   Yes... can I have my order   No  we never got your order and we re not taking orders anymore tonight.  Ok  I left peacefully. I asked for a refund but never got it.   I figured it was a fluke  my husband and I love Jack We waited a week and thought  let s try again   My husband walked up and once again they said  oh we never got your order    He asked if we could get reimbursed for our online order and they said  no sir     At this point all I want is a Baconator and I don t know how to to get it   I m reaching out to you for help

With this Jack n The Box it s always a hit or a miss sometimes you get in and out and other times you could be in line for up to an hour. Now On this trip I have no complaining my food was hot and fresh and I was in line for about 7 minutes.

I pulled Up to the drive-through on my lunch break sit at the microphone for a few minutes nobody answered I was saying hello no answer no response pulled up to the window no one at the window no one inside caught three or four times with no answer I m not sure if what s going on

Don t go at 9 00 PM--old  dried out jalapeno poppers--out of eggrolls. Don t seem to care.  Just want folks in and OUT--Gave me fries  thinking that would appease me--UGH.  Never will darken their door again   Shoulda  bought frozen   CP
Whoever was working the drive through on Saturday 10 30 was easily the most charming and kind drive through employee I ve ever encountered. Give her a raise

I have to keep writing on this place. I get it  it s fast food. Who cares  When you re in the mood and this is what comes at you late and you don t see it until you re home drunk craving that box. Pass.
Now I believe the food was tampered with because of the comment the dude at the drive through  window made to me. I enjoy the food as he laughed. Health Dept should investigate this restaurant.

You guessed it back at you with another one star review because they keep emailing me from the block list of exactly sure how they re doing that I hope this is long enough to be posted as a review and narrative stop emailing me nationwide one star reviews nationwide suck at corporate
Just had a  28 and the service was outstanding  Shout out to the lady at the drive thru I really appreciate a friendly and fun employee  Thanks lady
The location known for selling crack from the store and having prostitutes in the parking lot  now has a homeless camp with bicycle parts.  They really just don t care at all.

This place just got raided 3 employees selling crack cocaine out of the establishment. They are still trying to recover as it took 20 mins to get through the drive threw And weird but this time around they handed me the card system and made me insert the chip myself. Thought that was odd. The food was actually fresh for once  Which is why I gave 2 stars. This place needs help
Pick up the pace  Dear lord this Jack in the Box has no urgency and is incapable of handling low volume business levels and small  simple ways orders.

I was told this was a 24 hour fast food establishment. Yet in a long 10 cars deep drive through  we re told that systems maint will be down  4 am  so they couldn t accommodate any more orders    So  why not have someone close off the drive through entrance or have a staff member come out and say we re closed.  Yet many of us are waiting in a LONG line with no expected food on a Saturday night in Austin        20 minutes to leave...  Never will be back

Went yesterday walked in the lobby 3 30 21 at 3 33pm. I told the woman at the register 4 times I would like a crispy chicken southwestern salad with an extra southwest dressing and spicy sticks. She seemed to need help from her coworker to place my order. I get my receipt and eventually the salad. Went to work sat down to eat only to realize they gave me the wrong salad. I looked at the receipt called the restaurant. At first they didn t answer. I kept calling and finally got someone. I asked to speak to the manager. She got on the phone and I tried to explain what happened. I told her the name on my receipt is nancy. She tells me you must have the wrong store. No nancy works here and hangs up in my face. I call back and tried to explain I was just in your lobby. The manager replies the lobby is locked. I told her what I was wearing and she hung up on me again. I called back 2 more times and she hung up 2 more times. During the last time I asked her how is it my fault an ex employees name is on my receipt. I called again someone else answers the phone. This person tells me no nancy works here and hangs up in my face too. I call back and let them know I m on my way. I had to leave work catch the bus back up there. I banged on the door to get their attention when I arrived. No one responded. So I called and told them I m here. The manager answered and told me to calm down as if I was loud and seemed violent. I told her I am calm. She opens the lobby.  They locked it after I left . I follow her and go to the counter. She ask to see my receipt. As clear as day it says the time 3 33pm 3 30 21 I was in the lobby and what do you know the name nancy is on my receipt. First thing out of her mouth is oh I have to change that. I responded so your not going to apologize. She apologized  but it was not genuine she didn t feel bad at all about how she hung up on me 4 times or messing up my order. She kept my receipt. She gave me the correct salad and I told her God Bless You. Then it dawned on me I asked her weren t you the one who took my order. She said yes. I headed back to work. Once I got back to work I looked at my salad and it had bad cucumbers on it  it was starting to change colors . I decided to call back and get the number for corporate to make a complaint. The manager answered I asked for corporate number. She asked me why. I told her I have a complaint. She wasn t  giving me the number so I asked her whats the managers name. She wouldn t give that either. I told her what my complaint was. She responded I am the manager you can look up corporate number online God Bless You and hung up in my face for a 5th time. I wrote my complaint to corporate online. When it got to the portion to put in your phone number to be contacted their system wouldn t accept my number. Whoever this female manager is deserves to be fired. She was really rude and she was the one who made the mistake. She has absolutely no customer service skills. I was completely disrespected even in the end when she said God Bless You before hanging up in my face once again. She said it to be funny  but the jokes on her. You do not play with God. She didn t even offer me anything for the inconvenience of her own mistake and making me have to leave work. I really called to see if they would just replace my salad tomorrow and I was going to go without eating. Instead I was being called a liar and disrespected. Went back today 3 31 21 Lobby was locked. What restaurant locks their doors during the day  If you don t have a car you can t eat there and they don t care

Really bad employee there. I ask for a chocolate shake with extra chocolate and she put more than extra chocolate it was really dark   so i ask if she can change it and with a bad attitude she gave me another chocolate shake.  By the way She wasn t using the name tag.

Oh my God..this jack n a box is a joke.. didn t even toast the sour dough jack that was ordered and didn t give the other half of my order and no recite..when I go back to get the rest of the order the same lame worker who waited on me was of course at the drive thru window and had the ordacity to ask me for the recite that he didn t give the first time I came through..and what s so sad is that it wasn t even busy there I was the only customer to serve other than the one car ahead of me..

Worst jack in the box experience I ve ever had went around 11 because I had a coupon ordered my food when I got to the window Johana was kind of rude and in a rush asked for coupon without a greeting not even a hello gave her the coupon and money she quickly closes the window  and turns around and text on her phone I guess that s why she was in such a rush she gives us our food on our way home check the bag and items are missing pull back up to Jack and tell her on the intercom she says oh yea the fries like she already knew then I had to wait in line for 30  minutes when I get to the window I express to her that my food was cold now could she replace it she tells me no because in her words  it was hot when they gave it to us. Like that BULLS    is unacceptable so I asked for a refund she didn t even apologize or anything and then didn t even give me my coupon back JOHANA should definitely find employment elsewhere

Although the food was still delicious  this restaurant was extra filthy. I observed the kitchen floor to be unswept and many of the dining tables  and customer area floors  were still littered with customer trash and yucky goo  used ketchup packets  liquids  dirty napkins  etc . I did see one employee sweeping the kitchen near the end of my visit  but the customer areas remained soiled.

DONT EAT HERE    NONE of the employees are wearing GLOVES   I saw the lady put fries in the fryer  make  tacos and burgers with her HANDS  Disgusting  And another employee at the window was making drinks and giving food and taking money from customers with no gloves on. I just walked out...I can t believe they are not taking this COVID shit seriously

this is literally the worst fast food restaurant i have ever been to. their employees don t give a flying fuck  it takes 15 mins to get through the drive through  and that s if you re the only one in line. ordered a small curly fries and sat at the window for 5 mins while the 3 employees inside laughed and ignored me.

The worst Jack in the box. I literally don t know how they re still in business. Every time I go by here between 3-5 AM  they ignore us  say their system is resetting or make up some sad excuse not to work. Do not go here.
Just tried to use the restroom and they re locked. What kind of place locks their bathroom but keeps their place as messy as it is. Guess you don t get my business
Best burger ever. I like the staff in this one and I enjoy my lunch every time I take it. Keep it up guys
This by far the worst Jack In The Box in the Austin area. Shitty service and long wait times for FAST food.

I can t include the JIB  because I did not get a receipt  one of many complaints.  I went to this location yesterday to get some tacos  arrived 6 15am. There was a truck in front of me. I sat behind him at the window for at least 10minutes. He leaves  I can see a lady talking to what appears to be the cook  then go through the swinging door  out the front door  get in her car and drive away. I waited at the window 5 more minutes...NO ONE EVER CAME.  Fluke you say  Today I try again  One vehicle in front of me ordering. 5 minutes waiting behind them at the ordering window. I finally get up to the window...I wait approx 4 minutes for anyone to say anything...I place my order. Pull behind the other vehicle  wait another 5minutes. Finally get to the window....low and behold...someone comes to the window ....and says.... what did you order    Seriously....wait...it is a hard one...get a pen out....4 TACOS     The worst 2 fast food drive through experiences I have ever had. The tacos I longed for...were absolutely terrible  had a burnt taste  had to throw them away   Also never got a receipt and was too mad to notice until I was 1 2 way to work

Aww jankiest Jack I ve ever seen. Bless their hearts. Broken machines and confused newbies. Wonky POS systems. The company is failing their wonderful employees who bust their butts doing everything in their power to serve the customers. Corporate needs to get it together.

This is the worst Jack in the Box I have ever been too. When I visited inside there was a large ginger woman who was acting as expo. She had no idea what she was doing. She fell behind on orders and the cute girl and the register was trying her best but the ginger lady prevented her from helping. It was the worst experience I have ever had for take out.

Went there for breakfast  because Hangovers. I had a great time with the manager he seemed very happy to be at work and even though I was slow this morning he was full of energy. Shoutout to this Jack in the Box.

This location should be closed. Everytime I come here it is not clean. When I come through the drive-thru they tell me that I can only order fried items. Most recently  I sat for 10 minutes waiting to order  to be told that I can t order anything but fried food. Service is bad  the place isn t clean. Don t go here.

Awful experience. 20 minutes in the drive thru until someone even took our order. Repeatedly told us they were counting cash. Took even longer to get food. Huge line of cars forming behind us. Won t be back

I ve visited a lot of jack in the box locations in my time  and this one has the friendliest staff and the best service so far. Every other jack in the box runs out of ingredients  are way too slow  and generally have poor customer service. This location always gets my order right  and even sometimes throws in a little extra just for kicks  today I got extra fries  Thanks    Most folks only take the time to review a fast food place if the service was terrible  but I wanted to leave my remarks and my thanks for being consistently awesome

Thank you Jack in the Box on Oltorf for satisfying my hunger quickly and for satisfying my other food vice -- Jack in the Box tacos.  I was in that area for a training class at work and wanted a quick bite.  I satisfied my lunch cravings with a few cheap tacos and a large iced tea.  Kudos for a correctly filled order and having real iced tea.  For those of you who drink Coke products  they also have a Coca-Cola Freestyle machine at this location.
Midnight  4am  5 am  Always closed late night for some stupid reason or another. I don t understand why they pretend to be a 24 hour store. You re lucky if you ever catch them open after 10pm.

Here as i write this. Jib 845 time is 1 08 20 and the date is 3 23 2017. Rude manager  ignored multiple people as i stood patiently waiting for sweet tea since none was made for the loby. Over heard the rude manager tell her employees to speak in Spanish not in English. Then tried to not let me dine in as i had said it was for here when asked.

Walked in and the manager and crew were fighting with each other the entire time. The cashier forgot to ring something up and was very polite about it but the manger on duty lost her temper. They also ran out of change and the crew member gave us change from his pocket and the manager was rude and wouldn t come get him more change for the till. It felt like the crew was trying to deal with the managers temper the entire time.
Ordered western chicken salad in drive through  got home and the salad had no chicken at all . Thanks
Good service. Second time in this location moved from Boston  MA. Jack doesn t live there. Def will be back.

I went to Jack in the Box  as I do pretty often. I placed my order at the drive thru. Everybody was very friendly. I got to the window to pay  and realized I didn t have my wallet. I apologize  and started to pull away. The manager smile  handed me my food  and said Merry Christmas.. It s that kind of customer service that should be taught around the country. In all seriousness  if I could give them 10 stars  I would.
Absolutely the worst Jack in the Box in Texas  the worst staff of  workers  under one roof.

Unfriendly staff and extra long wait times. Set it the drive through for 20 minutes with no sorry or explanation  the lane is also not big enough to get out if you re trapped between cars . Food was cold by the time we got it. Overall one of the worst fast food experiences I ve had.

My bf and i got food poisoning. We contacted the customer service email thing.  I hope they fix the employee problems that they have and especially the food. Sometimes they get it right  other times they don t.
Would have given 0 stars if I could. There was a cockroach in the box of chicken strips. Enough said

I m so disgusted with this jack n the box because first off and foremost I called around 3am asking for a order to go and asked if I could walk up to the window to get my order and the lady proceeds to tell me that first the ice cream machine was broke and then finishes my disappointment with I had to be in side of a vehicle in order to pick up my order... This is the craziest answer that I have ever received from am employer I asked what the difference between the vehicle or just being on my two feet picking up my order and I couldn t even get an answer on y I couldn t walk to the window so I believe that this is racism for one cause that is pretty much in my opinion telling me well your white I can t serve u unless u r a different color... And I feel that that is judging cause I just live right behind this jack in the box so y would I drive to waste gas when I can just walk over there but no it s against their policy to allow someone to walk to the drive thru so I definitely will NOT ever go back to this place. They lost a everyday customer and this lady discriminated me cause I don t have a vehicle to come get my order but that s sure fine cause I will be calling tbe district manager and filing a complaint bout this as well as  how filthy and unprofessional the employer s are and keep the restaurant not clean swept  tables wiped after customer s leave  nothing is kept stocked  and last but not least how I watched the cook the last time i was inside waiting for my order after 20mins of ordering extremely slow nasty cook that doesn t wear gloves while preparing our food...    So there this nasty place has lost a few customers and because of their racial profiling . Will continue to investigate y this has happened to me tonight... Maybe speaking with the district manager and solve these problems ..
Greedy marry the franchisee  wants to make money by charging for water. She was nice but greedy. Corporate need to rectify this.

this location is the slowest i ve ever seen and they are consistent with their slowness. expect a half hour wait for your food no matter how many people are ahead of you. today i went in and ordered a sausage sandwich  and three orders of hash browns. ten minutes after my order they finally told me that they were completely out of hash browns. i changed my order to curly fries. now i m late for work. They never offered to adjust the price  i paid more for the hash browns than i would ve ordering curly fries . I get to work and i have a ham sandwich instead of sausage. never again will i go there.

Literally called ahead to make sure they had rice. That said yes and then 5 minutes later in the drive through they said they wouldn t have rice for 20 minutes. Can t find good honest help these days.
Kind of dirty but the food franchise Ike jack in the box is nice. We don t have it in NY. I loved it .

It s Jack In The Box  so there s that. Cheap tacos  24 hr drive through  great for after the bar.  The downsides  rude staff at the drive through  and they take FOREVER to make your food.  If you can  go to another location.

Yelp has yet to do a 0 star rating feature because I nearly gagged when I stuck my hand in to grab some curly fries. never asked for ketchup but they gladly served me an all over ketchup smothered container for my curly fries. f   ng nasty my dudes     get your act together. it s just fries.

The girl at the Drive thru kept getting my breakfast order wrong. When I got to the window and explained the order face-to-face  literally sausage biscuit  hash brown  and a drink  she just went to the kitchen to have them edit the order this still over charging me  because instead of doing the meal option she charged me for each individual item  when I brought this up she kept saying  next time  with a big smile on her face  the. Telling me how much cheaper it would have been if she had done the meal and said  for next time . Got home and the meal is still wrong.... I should have just gone somewhere else because this place always messes up my order  no matter how simple it is.

By Austin standards  this neighborhood is a dump. But compared to other places like Houston s fourth ward and fifth ward  this place is still very safe and middle class to walk into. The staff are friendly and get your order correct. I ve never had a problem.

They got my order wrong. Which was to be expected at a fast food place at 5 in the morning. But what was most disappointing was that they avoided picking up the phone for literally 15 minutes when I attempted to call and report my incorrect order once I was already home. I made sure to call like literally 20 times in succession UNTIL they answered  simply to try to prove a point. It required much less energy of them to NOT answer the phone then it would have cost them to simply pick up on the first or second try. They even went as far as to take the phone off the hook at one point  so that it would give me a busy signal after they realized I wasn t going to stop calling. After like 4 busy signals  they gave up on ignoring me and finally answered. The girl who answered was rude AS FUCK. I also recognize her voice from the drive thru  but  she insisted on asserting the fact that she had just walked into work and heard the phone ringing. She was very short with me and cutting me off in speech. She then finally put me forcibly on hold to get a manager who finally listened to my gripe with my order. All in all  I give them a negative 10 out of 10. Pure shit service.
Bad service. Cold food. Forgets to give you ketchup or salad dressing. Always out of something essential on the menu. Would avoid this location.

Tables aren t not wiped down often and floor is very sticky with soda or something. The cooks and the drive thru girl normally takes their cigar breaks outside near the entrance. And unsafe neighborhood surrounding. Expect to be pandhandlers inside this Jack in a Box.

I tried this location again just now and they had their drive through closed for some reason. I have no idea why they re so averse to the idea of making money  but they apparently are  since they make it so fucking difficult to order food from them.

Gave this location three chances since it s close to home and it s open late. Every time they were out of whatever it was I wanted. Two of the times I went through the drive-thru the staff was completely unprofessional. One girl made fun of my accent over the intercom while I was ordering and another guy acted like he was high off his     when he was taking my money.  Skip it and go to the Whataburger across the street if you need fast food late at night in this neighborhood.

Good food.  Cheap prices.  Delicious pastries  when in stock .  Homemade tortillas.  Not many places you can get a breakfast plate for under  3.  Or 3 tacos for the same.  I ve eaten breakfast  lunch  and late night dinner here.  All have been hot  made fresh  and cheap.  On the weekends  I order the menudo and I have to admit  it s pretty tasty.

If your into cheap Mexican food  this place has your covered. I think there is nothin over  6. Damn I m old  the last time I stepped into this building it was Dunkin Donuts..   My two meat combo plate combined portions of Al Pastor and Barbacoa. Both were the bottom of the barrel as far as meat quality was concerned. Fatty meat which I normally love was just Meh when not even heated up properly. Rice and beans were good as were the tortillas.   Not bad  just not that good either. Can t we get a Discount Tire near a five star joint

Taco   a tortilla folded over a ground spicy filling.  This taqueria only has a one bullet hole rating according the the front window.  I was a little hesitant when I only saw one hole.  The best Taqerias usually have at least 3 bullet holes in the window out front.    I was greatly surprised on how good the food was.  Try a Torta which is a large fresh baked bun.  Similar to a hamburger bun.  it is filled with your choice of filling.  I like the al pastor.  Or the Pasture Torta.  It is shredded pork with Avocado  lettuce  Tomato  and Mayonnaise.  If you want it a little richer. You can order it  Cubana  which means that they add sliced ham and melted Swiss cheese.    Their salsa is outstanding.  Pretty hot with a great flavor of cilantro and raw onions.    If you go in the morning  you can get three tacos for  1.99.  Tortas for lunch are  2.99 With cubana style a little extra.    The staff barely speaks English  but they will manage to take your order better than some crappy fast food joint.    God bless the Taco

Hunger Crisis Averted  I made a quick stop here looking for take-out tacos and an Ice-Tea. Success   These items were obtained and were reasonably tasty. From my small sample  I found the al pastor better than the chicken taco. Both pretty reasonable for a  1.60 taco.  I will need to try them again for a chicken burrito sometime in the future.  I do have a gripe that they charge  2 for an ice tea.  Seems like any of the other taquerias I frequent charge  1 or  1.50 for tea.  Either way - better than stopping at some chain fast food place.

I think they have this on the wrong side of the frontage road on the map. Anyway - if one was to write an article on how to spend  20 a day in Austin  TX - you d have to throw in Tapatia into the mix for breakfast.   I ve only had the migas but it s pretty yummy  probably too large sized of a portion  and with a slice of ham on top. I think the cost is something ridiculous like  3 before 11am and  4 after 11am. This is the type of place where you go with three friends and someone picks up the entire tab without a fight because it s basically nothing - breakfast with a couple buddies is like  16.   Will have to test out their other food but may be a while as I like my migas on the weekend.
Do not get the chicken enchiladas. If you do there will be all parts of the chicken masked inside. The price is right but you can pay a little more for much better food.

Tacos were pretty good  but even with perfectly cooked chicken  it doesn t remove the hair that was found in the food. Sorry ya ll  I understand these things happen  but when your food is not outstanding  you don t have much room for error.

We just spent the weekend in Austin and we fell in love with this place.  It s super charming in a greasy spoon type of way and lots of people in there.  Anyway  we ordered breakfast tacos 2 mornings  3 for  2.50  I believe and they were delicious.  I ordered chips the second morning just because they looked so good.  And they didn t disappoint.  They were the best chips and salsa of the trip.  I wish we could have gone for lunch.   Love

Well  darn.  I hadn t eaten here in several months  and just picked up some tacos the other morning.  They re not as good as they used to be.  Less cheese than before  and the salsa is watery.  I ll give them another shot  but I m seriously considering checking out the taqueria down the street.

Cheap prices   1 mile from the office   half a dozen lunch time visits with coworkers.  Change anything in that equation and I doubt I would have gone back after the first visit.     The enchiladas verde were okay  and probably the best thing I had there.  Nothing was bad  but nothing was particularly good either.
Great prices  but service and quality were not as good as other Austin area locations.

I found myself with an extra hour while waiting for the hubby to arrive at the airport.  I decided to find a little hole in the wall to get some queso and a margarita to pass the time.  I drove around Burleson  he came in at the International terminal which is WAY on the other side of the airport  looking for my chips and booze and I couldn t find anything that either a  looked safe enough to go into b  wasn t a boobie bar or c  was open.  I finally found Taqueria La Tapatia on the frontage road of Ben White.  I walked in  checked out their menu and found that they did not have any queso or booze.  Damn.  Well  I was already here  so I ordered the chips salsa and a pork taco.   The chips were thick and crunchy and were edible on their own  but the salsa had a nice flavor which kicked up the chips a notch.   The pork taco was disappointing  the meat was slightly dry and was flavorless.  The onions  cilantro and cheese helped out a bit but overall it is not something I would order again.
There isn t much to say about La Tapatia.  Most of their food is tasty and inexpensive.  The service isn t the best  but it is not bad either.  It is a good place for a cheap meal.

This little dive deserves more credit then it s getting...I say dive in the kindest way..it small..a little dark inside but very clean...Staff was very friendly and attentive during our whole visit...Chip  Salsa and Queso to start...they bring 2 bottles of sauce to the table as well...the red had some kick and it kicked up the Queso just right..The granddaughter went with the regular Quesadilla  and she wished she went with a large one...but we gave her a Queso of her own and she was fine..we both went with the Enchilada Mexicanas...wife with ground beef   no beans...mine chicken with beans and rice...it also can with steak cecina...did t know what to expect...but it was actually really good...very thin  crisp and had a great charred flavor..we both enjoyed our food...Beans and rice were solid to...overall a great visit for us...The plates of breakfast grub going by while waiting looked killer...we will try that next round..
Great authentic Mexican Food. Breakfast is our favorite  Try the chilaquiles verdes. Amazing

Great little hole in the wall. As soon as you sit  you get greeted with chips and 3 different fresh salsas. My favorite was the green  it was Smokey in a way. Great service and our food came out really fast. Will be back soon
Excellent food made to order. Tortillas are hand made and service is great. Will recommend to family and friends.
City officials begging  people to wear face covers when around other people  walk in to pick up  not a single employee wearing a face mask. Gross  will never spend a dime with this business.
This spot is amazing  GREAT service  And friendly atmosphere  The food is also amazing and super affordable.
Feeling sick - ordered enchiladas from here ... has to be the worst I ever had.  Smothered with cheese  no sauce and the chicken was dry and definitely had a freezer burnt taste.  NEVER AGAIN

I love how Marisol and Kimberly took care of me. It is cold outside and my storage unit is just down the road. But  this morning I was having issues getting in to my unit  so I came here. Their love for the customer is  mainly why I would come back
Always in and out. Helps save a buck or two. Just remember  Pepsi soda choices. Get your hot sauce on.

Not impressed w service .  As soon as I stood there for about 5 minutes the manager tells me I have to order on kiosk .   I m new still to all this stuff . I asked to order at cashier and was told it better at kiosk. So I ordered on kiosk   that took me a good while to figure out.   Mind you   never once did anyone ask to help . Definitely don t recommend .. Then as I m leaving I asked for hot sauce as It gave option on kiosk to ask for sauce. The young lady says  oh you have to get your own over there .  I m not wanting to be a Karen but it be helpful if they would ask or give option to order.

Yeah it s Taco Bell. We all know Taco Bell isn t a five star restaurant but man.... The two people working the drive thru had some of the best customer service I ve experienced at a fast food joint. Thanks for holding it down for that 11pm taco run and keeping a good attitude making my day a little better. Shout out Taco Bell for existing

When you go to pick up an order  they don t tell you you have to wait in line in the drive-thru. The direction say you can pick up in the lobby but it s closed. I understand you re short staffed and covid but how about updating the apps and or putting a sign outside telling people they need to get on the drive-thru    So inconsiderate.

I was pretty hesitant to go back to any Taco Bell in Austin based on prior experience over the years and the mountain of bad reviews  but that s what the kids wanted so here I am.  I have to give credit where credit is due.  I was surprised to find everything was easy  quick  correct  and good.  The manager on duty at this location reminded me of Gus Fring...in his professional manner only  not his status as television s favorite drug kingpin.  Just go inside  order from the kiosk  and everything will be fine.  I promise.  But it would be nice if they had a better way of labeling what taco burrito is what so you can more easily disperse them to the intended recipients.

Before Im even stopped at the order window im being asked what i want.l twice... i start my order and before im done order hes giving me a total. Theres one car in front if me and me in line  thats it. I complete my order and wait for it. I drive home and start eating two of the tree burritos have no meat or beans. I could somewhat understand if the line was around the corner but it wasn t.  I call to complain and get a fax machine..

Wow THANKS for the Extremely OLD AND HARD AND NASTY naked chicken chalupas. Starving after a long hard shift and I get this  Just wow. I would have waited for it to be fresh I don t care I would rather have food that didn t sound like chewing on rubber bands and taste like it too  Y all can do better.

I am a regular here and I use coupons to get my tacos.  The taco bell app doesn t allow me to use more than one coupon in one order so I have to make two separately orders. Today the ladies asked me rudely why I do that The tall lady that makes the tacos in the back was complaining about it to her coworker and I heard her.  It doesn t cause that big of an inconvenience but it was rude that they made me feel bad for wanting to use coupons.

Even in a city like Austin where taco choices are abundant  sometimes you just want a little Taco Bell.  It s not exactly the greatest Tex Mex  but it reminds me of childhood days.  Not to mention it s got the uniform taste so you know that whichever Taco Bell you hit - it s going to taste exactly the same.  But honestly  we drench it in Fire and Diablo sauce  so really what we re doing is just eating sauce.    I tend to stick to Taco Supremes cause they re basic.  But occasionally I like a tostada  and the guilty pleasure of a Dorito taco  why didn t they make these sooner  .  I also like nachos b c chips and cheese.

If you re going to ask drive through customers to pull around front and wait for their food  can you please not forget about them  After waiting out front for 20 minutes  I was finally able to flag down an employee who was bringing food out to someone else that was parked. I had to remind her what I had been waiting for  and then she forgot items in my order when she finally brought it out.   As you can imagine  after having my food sit on a counter inside for 20 minutes  once I finally got to eat it  it was completely soggy. The crunchy tacos fell apart and the nachos were more like a gross tortilla soup.

So going through the drive thru and uh you left your mic on. To hear they say i don t like these people while our kids are ordering. Then ask about it and they were like I was talking to my co worker. Uhm yeah about us we didn t say anything to warrant that. Yep if my kid wasn t hungry I would have left wont go back.

Never again will I order food from this location. Like once a year I crave TB  but the service is horrible. Staff is rude. This is just a reminder why I don t need to eat crappy food because of crappy service and it s just not good.

The cash register girl wasn t very knowledgeable of her own menu and I tried to essentially recreate the double chalupa that she says doesn t exist anymore and ended up spending  12 for 3 tacos and a burrito. This Taco Bell has a very bad rating and I understand why I should fire the management and retrain the staff.
Decent drive through. The speaker quality is good and the service is quick. The order was accurate.

If i could give this place zero stars i would. Lady got our order wrong then gave us attitude when she realized she had given us 10 tacos instead of the only two we ordered. We definitely could ve driven off with 10 tacos and she still probably wouldn t even noticed. Then after asking us to pull up to the front - she still got our order wrong.. long story short  maybe if you come to this location around 10pm you ll get extra free tacos cause the people who work there obviously don t know how to read .
Hit the drive thru earlier got the food quickly with friendly service and tasted great like usual with TB

The reason for this comment is because I went to this Taco Bell and I ordered the chalupa combo  and my home from this place is like 5 minutes and when I got home I was ready to enjoy my chalupa and gave my first bite it was pretty cold inside and out I hope this comment helps the employees do a better job.
Me and my girl got the Munchies after work and taco bell did the job  5 stars for quick munchies
Made very quick and with love. Love their power chicken bowl. Very friendly too   Never have any issues with speed here.

Extremely disappointed in this place and since I can t give negative reviews they get 1 Star.. my husband went to pick up dinner for our family tonight and they were in a hurry to close down because registers were not working apparently..we ordered food and of course half the order was wrong..EVERY time we go to both locations of Taco Bell they get the order wrong fully or partially..there is NO EXCUSE for this sort of thing..if you are taking money from a customer you are expected to get the order CORRECT EVERY SINGLE TIME   It s not hard to make sure orders are correct. Incompetent teenagers are employed there and it s not right.. no excuse ever  And free food won t make up for the mistakes because we would put you out of business just on free food that s how bad you all SUCK at getting orders right

Messed up my 2 vegetarian burritos I ordered al fresco. They gave me a steak and a chicken burrito. I drive back to the restaurant after getting home to replace my burritos.  The person at the window insisted on inspecting the burrito and made me give them my already purchased burritos back through the drive thru. They didnt seem to believe me like I was trying to scam them out of two 3 dollar burritos.  They told me I was confused  that the meat was actually beans. This was hostile treatment just over me wanting to get the burritos I ordered. Check your food before you drive off maybe even record yourself ordering as ridiculous as that sounds. One star because I cant give zero.

I went to the drive-thru an hour and a half before closing time  and they wouldn t serve me because they  already put everything away .    This was bizarre. I had to drive to another Taco Bell because I d already told my pregnant GF I was getting her a crunch wrap. Don t go here.

Usually you would have to wait for a long time in the drive through even if there are no cars. Today  there was a long line of cars  but I got my food in a minute  thanks to Sebastian s work ethic  He also provided the best customer service. Thank you

This is the most frustrating drive through in Austin   Ive lived in this neighborhood for 4 years  and the staff here is beyond ridiculous. They regularly do not serve customers or claim they are out of ingredients  one time they claimed they were out of every ingredient on the menu.  I do not know why every 6 months I give it another shot  its never changed  and every time I have to drive to William Cannon instead.   Below is a video I took tonight  I sat in line for 5 minutes before they acknowledged I was there  the first time they talked to me was when I started the video below. I asked multiple times if they were there before recording to no response.    a href   redir url https 3A 2F 2Fyoutu.be 2FzUcmm9aNxtg amp s 954f711963d9d36caea0a209b22cd789001955e176c51823f5daabda13e8f33a  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  youtu.be zUcmm9aNxtg  a
My order was correct but I was a little uncomfortable listening to a worker argue with a customer through the window. I dont know what it was about but it didnt sound professional.

The female manager that worked on 7 30 19 at 10 30pm was extremely rude and hateful. I could not understand what the man on the speaker was saying because he was mumbling so she spoke loudly and slowly  mocking me. She spoke to me like I was intellectually disabled. It was extremely offensive. My son is special needs and children have spoken to him that way to make fun of him. I asked for different kinds of sauce at the window. The man said he d get it. The woman in the manager  plaid type  shirt came to the window and refused. I said I just wanted an assortment of sauces and she rolled her eyes. She bagged it up for me then handed it to me. I said thank you and she gave me a hateful look and walked away. I definitely will never go to this location again. That woman should not work on a position like that if she is so hateful.

The last time I was here  they told me they ran out of straws and my food was cold when I ordered through the drive-through. I was the designated driver this evening and I was trying to grab food for everybody  but 30 minutes before they are supposed to close  everything is shut down including the drive-through. Very poor business....  Today  my Mexican Pizza is two tortillas with refuted beans inside and salad on top. NO cheese  NO tomatoes  NOTHING  See picture.  Update  tonight I ordered a combination meal that should have a Mexican pizza and two tacos  and three additional taco Supremes. But I actually got was a burrito supreme with three tacos and nothing else. It s unfortunate that I m not more of a careless driver or I would ve realized this sooner.  If there were literally anything comparable in the area  this would cease to be my last option.  So here s a neat update  I ordered on the app and sat at the drive-through for 10 minutes and when nobody answered I pulled up to the window where I was blatantly ignored. After several minutes of sitting there  because I had already ordered and paid for my food  I honked the horn and still nobody answered. Another several minutes later a female employee and her manager came to the window  which I have on video  and told me they were closed. It was well before closing time  almost an hour  and there were people inside. They refused services even though I already paid for my food. I have it all on video  this place has the single most incompetent failures in employees that it s disgusting. One of the moms of one of the employees tried to harass me for taking a video of their refusal  and was combative to a fault. That s exactly the kind of classy behavior I would expect from the mother of an employee at this location  She seemed like she would probably have been more aggressive if I wasn t also videotaping her  nothing I did was illegal and this place has officially been reported to their corporate office. I can t wait to see how many people get fired over this....
Slowest drive through I think I ve ever experienced.  Horrible  horrible  horrible. Just horrible.
OHMYGODTHATWASSUCHAMISTAKE  I might be dying  I m not sure yet.   This might be the last review I ever write. Death by Taco Bell.  Someone  tell my children I love them.
Very unskilled management with customer service that doesn t even come with a smile. Really shows lack of customer care and the food doesn t seem to come out to what s it s supposed to be.

We ordered 4 items.  A taco  a bean and cheese only burrito  and a beef and cheese only burito.  Got home with a taco no cheese  bean burrito stuffed with onions  and some concoction that had rice  fritos  and something else that I could not  tell what it was.  I called to request a refund only to be told they could not do refunds  She asked if it was a boy or girl that took our order  I told her we were just there  and it was a female.  She then hung up on me.  I think they must have been closing down and just gave us more than what we asked for.  I know good help is hard to find  but this was ridiculous.

I called to make sure they would be open if I drove 15 min out of my way. They did they were open till 1 am. It s 12 45. I m sitting at their drive through. No one... What was the point of answering my call and lying to me

Taco Bell hits the spot. This was my first meal back for a brief furlough since being away from the States for a couple years.  Needless to say  I was excited to fulfill my years long craving with only the best Mexican food that my home country had to offer.  And truly  Taco Bell was the best Mexican food that I had that day.    Now some will argue that Taco Bell is not really Mexican food.  However  if you use the barometer one might use for Asian cuisine  I definitely saw Latinos eating there.  Thus -- it s real Mexican food.  The same cannot be said for the patrons at  Mexican  establishments such as La Condessa  Polvos  and Fonda San Miguel   Gringos   tons.  Latinos   zero.  Speciality items abound and I started my night with the Mexican Pizza  which I ve been told is apparently neither Mexican nor Pizza.  Nonetheless  it arrived masterfully prepared.  The crispy and fluffy crust was nostalgic for many a Mexican Pizza eaten in the waning hours of college nights.  It was a little more tart but much more cheesy than I recall but every bit as delicious--a beautiful combination of tart  savory  smokey  salty.  A new curveball thrown to me since my last run to The Border was the Dorito gordita.  This delight is a basically a taco supreme with a Dorito taco shell and I think a little hint of crack wrapped in a flour tortilla.  I surmise it would have been much better with Cool Ranch flavor but that is pure conjecture.    The pinnacle for this amazing meal was the nacho supreme.  I was equally moved by the mushy texture of this course as I was with the crunchiness of the first two.  Very little chewing was required to enjoy the mushiness of the chips  beans  cheese  sour cream  oh  glorious sour cream   and what I think was indeed some sort of beef product.   Overall  a great experience and wonderful reintroduction into American life.

My husband and I live a couple of blocks from this Taco Bell location  so we figured we d swing by on our way home from a show downtown a couple of weeks ago  as this location is  open until 1 00am.  It was 11 00pm when we arrived... and the staff had turned out all of the lights and were smoking by the dumpsters. They definitely looked closed  but it was only 11 00  so we rolled down our window to ask if they were open. Not a soul replied verbally  but one of the employees looked at us and made some sort of hand gesture that we gather was meant to imply a no  My husband said   So... no   and the one employee just responded  Uh  nah.  It s also worth noting that one of the women present in this group of staff appears to be the manager  as we often see her out by the dumpster with employees when we drive by  almost daily  as it s on the way to most places we go  and she is dressed differently than the other individuals. I mean  we know it s Taco Bell  so we re not expecting The Ritz... but  seriously  I ve never seen a business run so blatantly carelessly.

It is what it is.  It is the same Taco Bell you ll find on any street corner  USA.   If you re in the area  drunk  and the line at Whataburger is atrocious...this place fills a void in your tummy.       You will prob not feel too hot the next morning after throwing a  5 on top of 15 beers.   I didn t.

I ordered 2 of the  1.00 Beefy Cheesy Burritos   1 Burrito Supreme   1 Chips and Salsa. Upon returning home and opening each the ONLY item that even looked like its picture was the Chips and Salsa. The dollar burritos were flat and had what looked like some kind of  mystery spread  on them and the burrito supreme was more like a burrito micro. The only way to get full was on the flour tortillas as there wasn t enough filling to feed a bird.  Certainly THE most awful fast food experience out here. Even Jack in the Crack has better.  Someone PLEASE put this Taco Smell out of its misery

An Ode to Chicken Grilled Stuffed Burritos.....  Driving to school after an eight hour day  my tummy growls  The Bell is calling.  Joy  Rapture  I pass one on my way   I place an order and my burrito is grilling. I drive to class  anticipating that first bite.   Marinated chicken  rice  and beans  pepper jack sauce  salsa  and cheese.   Grilled to perfection  the tortilla is toasty and cooked just right.   I park my car  restrained no more  I know what goodness means  Taco Bell  may I have another grilled stuffed burrito please    OK...... so not EXACTLY an Ode  but hey what do you expect for fast food   The drive through staff was not rude  but not friendly.  They were just doing their job. One thing is for sure  with all the Taco Bells I have gone to around town  I have thoroughly enjoyed my Chicken Grilled Stuffed Burrito every single time  How can you go wrong with grilled meat  beans  rice  and cheese  The pepper jack sauce is creamy and adds a nice touch. For me though  it s the fact that the whole thing is grilled that REALLY makes it good. Mmmmmm  toasty tortilla......

Taco bell is what it is.. Even heard the NIck Swardson joke on this place  lol.. You should google it.   Anyway. I like their crispy tacos  and their Cheesy gordita crunch. That s about it.  Not much to say  not much of a review and I am sorry for that..   Till next time..  Go get you sum ..

I primarily visit the Bell drive thru in order to snag a tall cold Pepsi. Other than the occassional taco  that s pretty much it. I don t consider them  mexican  food... just another snack.  I would like to say I like the newer sauces they ve come up with

I frequent this Taco Bell often as I live really close by and it s my favorite fast food restaurant. Well I ve noticed the last six months or so that the workers are extremely rude. Tonight was by far the worst  While ordering through the drive through the girl kept interrupting me and just had a bad attitude. I knew I should of just off. I m getting all four of my wisdom teeth removed tomorrow that being said I wanted a high calorie meal since I won t be eating eating for however long. I got two separate orders  one for my dad and one for myself and my son. The chola wannabe girl at the window was even worse than she was over the intercom. She gave me one bag of food. I figured it was all in there. I make sure to check my bag every time before I drive off. My entire order for myself was gone. I had to wave this girl down at the window and tell her my food was missing. She pretty much mocked me to whoever she yelled at in the back   The nacho supreme is missing   Some heavy set lady came to the and handed me the bag and said   the first bag was the first order and this is your second order . She had a crappy attitude as well but not as bad as the chola girl. I told her that the other girl handed me my first bag and shut the window and walked off. So I assumed all my food was in one bag. Anywho  I told the heavy set lady that I do come here often and that the other girl is very f      rude and that I would be contacting the manager  She just shut the window. I was not rude to these people so I don t understand why I was treated terribly as a paying customer. Well I got home and opened my bag of food two soft tacos and a nacho supreme. There was lettuce and cheese all over my wrapped tacos. It was obvious this was done on purpose. Well once I get healed up I will be making a call. To corporate. I m pretty sure the crappy employees are a reflection of whoever manages this Taco Bell. I don t know what happened to all the nicer employees that worked here. There is some decent ones that work day shift. Well I will not be bringing my business here EVER AGAIN
This Taco Bell is the slowest place I ve ever been. It took 40 minutes to make 3 tacos. If you have 40 minutes  enjoy
I feel that this taco bell is not one of the good ones... I have been to many. Im not sure how they managed to mess up an order that was just consisting of value meals... but they did...

Very slow service after 5pm. Waiting nearly 20 minutes for my meal. The other times I been there I waited more than 30 minutes and ended up asking for a refund because I had to be somewhere. Management must keep the restaurant staffed on evenings.
I ve never had a bad steak quesadilla at a taco bell. I literally had to pull out grisly pieces out of my mouth

star  1 for cheap food. Yay  Cheap Food. star  2 for GREAT customer service. The receipt says the cashier s name is Jaquline. Super friendly and service with a smile. She said she was sorry for the wait because i was apparently  kinda agged about how long it took for her to get to me  fast food should be fast  but who am i to demand quick service i m just trying to waste time while my car is being serviced for a few hours. As soon as i saw that she was friendly and looked like she enjoyed her job i totally forgot about what neighborhood i was in. star  3 quality of food edibleness... excited i got a choice between bacon or sausage   on my breakfast platter... with the scrambled eggs and hash brown sticks and  mini pancakes. Sure there s better breakfasts to be had elsewhere  but the jack in the box was closest to the Firestone and the food didn t suck. OH    and then there is the coca-cola fountain with the 100  flavors    how awesome ok soooooo..... star  4 for the 100 flavor coca-cola fountain. star  5 for being close to highland mall  Texas Worksource or whatever they call it now  and Firestone and not tooooooo far from greyhound station either  but probably to far for a layover. Of course Jack in the Box was always good stoner food back in high school when i was into being a stoner  b
I ordered 2 chicken sandwiches and 2 tacos and never have I ever been disappointed from jack in the box about my food but today I received the worst thing I could imagen  a mold bread sandwich

Went through the drive-through at lunchtime. The person who helped me at the window had her mask under her mouth  covering nothing. I looked past her and saw that the person working the counter had her mask under her chin  covering nothing. My question is this  if a restaurant manager allows their staff to flout the health measures that are meant to protect us from a pandemic  why would I trust that they re handling my food in a safe way  Needless to say  I won t be back.

I ordered food through the drive through. Got home.. two items I ordered and paid for were missing. Decided to drive back and tell them what was missing and they literally threw the food in our car and didn t listen to the fact that we had to drive back to get our full order. She started taking the order of someone behind us at the window and pretty much slammed the door in our face. Back home again and they only gave us one taco when we ordered two. We tried calling them and the phones are disconnected. Worst experience I ve ever had. I love Jack in The Box  so I am very disappointed.
Why even be open if you don t have the product to sell. If you can t get product close up shop. Disappointing

There s a lady who always looks half asleep and has hickeys at the drive through In the mornings. She always gives the orders wrong. I asked for a large caramel iced coffee and she gave me a regular which is okay  but when my mother nicely told her it was supposed to be a large she screamed at her and of course I said something back. It is not okay for her to be rude to her costumers just because she didnt get enough sleep. Also they never have the iced coffees done in the morning.

First time..... and it will be my last.... ordered two  7 s the ultimate bacon.... and guess what.... both burgers had only 1 strip of bacon cut into 3 small pieces.... REALLY     I paid  23.57 on my meal for this crap..... I didn t want to give any star ratings but I need to put one in order for me to put my review..... I never give bad reviews but this place just made me upset.... WTH.... maybe this is the reason why I never eat at Jack in the crack bc of their shity service.... this place sucks... if any of you all are near this place..... NEVER EVER COME IN HERE N EAT......
If you have coupons they treat you like shit. Horrible customer service. Food is as is at any location.
Clean location  friendly service  and amaaaaaaazing milkshakes. Don t let bad reviews keep you from trying out Jack in the Box

This Jack in the Box has some good longterm employees that I ve seen.  One lady is particularly nice to customers.  I ve never gotten sick eating here and the food taste is fine  for fast food .    One star was deducted for the neighborhood--a stranger once sat next to me and asked for money.  He also wouldn t leave me alone until I gave him something.  If you come here  maybe you should sit closer to the counter.  That was probably an isolated incident  though--usually when I come in there are lots of young mothers with little kids or groups of teenagers.  I probably wouldn t eat here after dark.  This Jack in the Box is conveniently located at an intersection with the Highland Mall Metro Station along Airport Blvd.

Good place for some great  fast 2 for  .99 tacos any time of day or night. It can get a little crowded inside at lunch time  but I usually use the drive thru so no worries. I haven t had any great or horrible experiences here  just consistently normal fast food type interactions. It is convenient to get in and out of  so that s nice.

BUYER BEWARE...when they tell you in the drive through they will give you the total at the window  they re about to overcharge you. Take note of the price on the menu and check your receipt. This place is a RIP OFF

I m a fan. I even order  off the menu  here  Sourdough Breakfast Sandwich . The mango smoothies. are. so. d-lish.  And I don t care what kind of nonmeat is in them  I love the 2 for 99 cents tacos. I order them with extra lettuce because I m not too proud to ask for extra stuff on a 49.5 cent item.   And the mini cows commercial. C mon  that s funny stuff.

OK....... I know its Jack in the Box... but have you tried their Acapulco chicken salad      Cilantro Lime dressing  blue tortilla strips on top  jalap. jack chez  and a lime to squeeze on it.   I double checked the bag.... I was still at Jack in the crack.  That was the best fast-food salad I ve ever had  I just had to tell someone......

This Jack in the Box is filthy. Good fast food service  and decent food. But disgusting. Every table dirty  floor looks like it hasn t been mopped in days.  I had just a few bites of food  and both me and my guest were so grossed out we dumped the food and left.   Stay away from this location

Look  It s a Jack  And it s in a crack   Seriously - how can Jack in the Crack ever get more than 3 stars  Don t get me wrong  this place is convenient to where I work and has been as good as a Jack in the Crack can be  but come on folks.....4 stars for Jack in the Crack
Not very sincere at all  haste full and impatient. Need workers that speak English please.

This location sucks  real bad y all. The people are rude  no matter what time of day  or night. I don t think my order has ever been right  but I live down the street so convenience is what keeps me going back. If you don t have to eat at this location  please don t. Save yourself the frustration  or THOROUGHLY check your food before leaving.

I remember when this place used to be EMPTY. Yes  this was because it was next to the unemployment resource center. As a rule  unemployed people do not have loads of cash to go spend on fast food. And fast food does not take food stamps.   It was so EASY to get your order--and eat in peace.  It was nice to come and just read for uninterupted quiet time.   Well  now that ACC opened their new campus  this place is a madhouse. Students come over here for cheaper snacks than their on-campus concession stand. And the poor staff cannot keep up with the orders. They work as fast as humanly possible. But it s noisy and crowded.  It s best just to get your order and leave  quickly.

I don t know why this place has such good reviews. I visited last night  and couldn t get any sort of service from anyone. They saw me at the counter. I was the only one standing there  waiting. I made eye contact with them. They didn t make a move. I went up the street and gave Wendy s the business I had tried to give to Jack In The Box.

Its good dollar meals if your ever in a rush. Need a quick bite go to jack  but sont expect great food like in any other fast food chain. Nice service  no problems there. But hey its easy spend to get two tacos for at least under two bucks.
Horrible service. Not worth the risk of eating the food. When employees treat you terrible imagine how they treat your food.

I came here last night  amp  got worse service than when I used to go   3 30am on my graveyard lunch break. I got better quality food and customer care in the middle of the night than at actual dinner time. The girl at the window lost my order  amp  asked me three times if I had a strawberry shake. NO. My order did not magically turn into a strawberry shake after you already asked me once. Get me my side salad  amp  value fries  Finally a senior member came  amp  retook my order. After waiting all that time I received old stale fries. They were cold and mushy  not hot  amp  crisp. AND they were packed in the same bag as my chilled salad. Who packs hot foods with a cold salad   Well  if my fries were actually fresh this would have been a problem. Their salads always have freezer burn- adjust your settings  And my mini pancakes were bland lukewarm chewy sponges. Ugh. To finish off this experience was not one napkin in the bag. I know this is fast food  but seriously

Went there late last night  drive thru took forever even though no one was in the line expect for me. The person at the window was rude  I asked for ranch dipping sauce they gave me honey mustard instead 0_o Won t be coming back to this Jack in the Crack
Jack in the box is your standard fast food. Honestly I would never eat there  but it is my favorite hangover remody.

Awful. Just awful  In the bad way if you couldn t tell from my one star .  I ve been there on a late night snack run three times now  so I m basing this review on multiple experiences because I m fair like that.  I don t care how good or bad the food is if the slackawads  TM  that work there can t get a simple order right.    The first time I went   the worker asked me to hand my bag back to him and proceeded to stick his hand in and pull some hash browns out while saying   Oops.  You didn t order hash browns did you   and letting out a stoner s chuckle.  When I arrived home I began pulling food out of my bag only to discover his reach into the bag had flipped my fries over and pulled half of the wrapper off of my sandwich.    Surely that was a fluke.  WRONG.  I went back again a couple of weeks later and they botched my order again.  Once more  the person taking the orders seemed like he had an IQ of an even 100.  Ever met anyone like that   They re the people who work at this Jack In the Box.  Aside from the watery soft drink  my fries were cold and I was given a Jumbo Jack instead of  the Ultimate Cheeseburger that I deserve.  I won t bore you by going over a third  similar experience I had there.  Just save your money and frustration and travel a mile further down the road to Wendy s  or around the corner to Whataburger.  Yours In Solid Advice  Christopher Stephens

went there last night after a 5 hr bus trip. food was ok  staff was less than friendly. every table was dirty and when i sarcastically asked for a towel to wipe the table  i was given one  maybe i shouldn t have asked. when i went to the bathroom  there was water  or urine  all over the floor  felt like i was in a bar bathroom at closing time. also there was an employee in there  i waited for him  that finished his business and just walked out. when i confronted the asst mgr about this  i was told she would look into it and she walked off.

The staff were friendly and the service was good. But seeing the manager drop my chicken on the floor  pick it up off the floor  then reach into the box of frozen chicken for more to drop severely degraded my score. That added to my wife s cold hamburger made the visit less than stellar at best. Will not return.
this jack in the crack has a really cool atmosphere. new building new everything. and the sirlion burger with grilled onions is not bad for a fast food restaurant. mmmm

No food pun this time that s just cheesy   Highlights   Machetes  Aguas Frescas   Huge Portions   Review  They have a very extensive menu that would satisfy any palate. I ordered a machete with half flor de calabaza  squash blossom  and the other campechano  which is a mixture of beef steak and chorizo . Both the sides had nice texture and flavors. But the star was the machete which had hints of smokiness from the charred chorizo  slight saltiness from the steak  delicious melted cheese  slight bitterness from the squash blossom and all layered on to a pan fried handmade tortilla. It was all washed down with a semi sweet and very refreshing Melon  Cantaloupe  agua fresca. Can t wait to go back and try out their other food options.   Rating  10 10  Machete half campechano  beef steak and chorizo  half flor the calabaza  Squash Blossom - 18 inch long quesadilla made with a handmade tortilla and stuffed with cheese and  preferred protein. It comes with rice  beans  salad and avocado.

This is a nice little taco stand that sits just off of Lamar Boulevard. It does help to have a knowledge of the Spanish language since nothing is in English on the menus. They do have three tables enclosed in plastic if you want to dine at this location. They also wear masks and gloves. They have been at this location for about two years. I ordered the beef burrito without the cream and when I looked inside it had two slices of avocado and freshly cut vegetables. It was definitely one of the best beef burritos I ve ever had made fresh to order wrapped in a tortilla that is also made to order. They also sell some drinks but that list is not posted. Basically this little food truck that serves up some darn good food at a reasonable price which makes it an undiscovered little jewel off the main road.
Surprising amount of choices. I got the comically large machete and do not regret it. The group of people I went with liked their food too.

On the search for some birria tacos  I stumbled upon Machetes  Do a Leova . I had never had a machete but when I saw that they had a BIRRIA MACHETE on the menu I had to try it for myself. My boyfriend and I ended up ordering a birria machete and a tinga de pollo gordita. First  the birria machete was so delicious  flavorful and HUGE. The birria was nice and seasoned  without being too salty  which happens quite frequent with birria . Came with some yummy green salsa  red salsa  cebolla curtidas  my favorite  and radishes    Wow it felt like I was back home in MX. The gordita was really good  the chicken tinga was very flavorful and i appreciated that the gordita texture wasn t to thick  personal preference . It is a little pricy but the quality and the amount of meat they stuff in them makes up for it   Will definitely be coming back to try their other items
Hmmm I m confused about these poor reviews. These were some of the best tacos I ve ever had. Lots of good flavors  and quality ingredients. Will definitely be back.

First off  please be aware that they only accept cash  there is a Wells Fargo atm a few blocks down the road .   16 for a birria machete seems overpriced to me especially because there was little cheese and the texture resembled more of a soggy quesadilla. Definitely not worth the price.   We also ordered two tacos. I started eating one and after the first bite noticed a strange mark on the tortilla. It turned out that the heat of the caused somehow loosened the ink on the blue checkered paper the tacos were wrapped in. The ink transferring to the tortilla didn t affect the flavor but I doubt most people would be ok with eating ink.   The beef was meh. Not bad but nothing exciting. Absolutely would not order tacos from this place again and most definitely not worth the  3 they charged for each taco.  If you want great tacos  I highly recommend  tacos de suadero  Tacos El Charly food truck half a mile down the road.   Lastly  they gave us two salsas. A red one that was medium hot - tasted a lot like enchilada sauce. The other salsa was extremely hot  which is fine with me  but I m not a big fan of creamy green salsas as they seem more Tex-Mex  judging from what I ve had in Mexico City  Puebla and every other place I ve ever had green salsa at... and it s in the hundreds . It s as if it had more crema sour cream than avocado.   I ll be keeping an eye out for other places that offer machetes. In the mean time if you want to try their machetes  go with a friend and split one. Although I find the price to be too high for a food truck  unless it s a lobster roll    the portion is good for two people.
This  8 Pastor Burrito was filled with meat  It was an interesting touch having the vegetables on the side to eat as you please. I ll definitely stop by again to try out the other items. Cash only

very poor quality food. I was excited to eat some tacos  but the chicken was undercooked and unseasoned. the machete was not cut in half and soggy.  35 for a machete  four bad chicken tacos and two sodas.
This is where you thr best Machetes in Austin.  They are huge and full of meat. Be sure to bring someone to help eat it. mine last for 2 days. so good.
I had a carne asada machete with hot Cheetos . The carne wasn t very good . The hot Cheetos were stale the tortilla was stale . Not good at all

Wow. Amazing tacos.   I had the asada tacos. My wife had the chicken.   Both the asada and chicken had the perfect crispiness  Rice and beans are awesome.   Both green and red sauce are awesome. The green sauce works a little better than the red for chicken. Red sauce is better for asada.  I have one suggestion to TaConMaye - start selling your sauces in bottles to go    It is better than almost anything at H.E.B

Was able to try this delicious Mexican food truck during the Georgetown PoppyFest. We ordered the Birria tacos and they were amazing  The salsas were medium hot level  but the tacos had plenty of flavor all on their own as well. Enough food with the 3 tacos to share with another person and feel good. I personally would order my own next time so that I can enjoy more of it. I enjoyed that they had a smaller menu to choose from so you don t get overwhelmed by choices and they clearly have perfected the options they offer.   The wait was pretty short  only about 10 minutes and we had piping hot and fresh food. The presentation alone was almost too gorgeous to eat  but well worth absolutely destroying it to consume. Excited to try the others menu options from them soon

Went to the Lakeline Location  Customer service was great. Food not so good asada tacos were a good 4 5 to much fat in the meat and big pieces.   The pastor looked like chorizo 1 5  Never seen purple onion on tacos which they had. Salsas are lacking flavor  Not worth 30

Best street tacos. Period. The only bad thing I can say about this place is that they are not open during the week. If you want authentic  Mexican street tacos  you gotta try this place. Additionally  the nachos portion is huge

Went to the location in the lakeline mall. Been here multiple times since it opened. I won t ever come back. The child working had the worst work ethic. Refusing to give us salsa for our two dinner because he didn t want to refill them. Then his attitude on top of it- clearly does not want to work here- in the most obvious way. He should be fired. He s not worth  5 an hour
Yummy tacos and nachos. Located in a nice outdoor food truck area that has occasional live music.

Finally stopped by this food truck court and went with TaConMaye for my meal and it did not disappoint  Al Pastor Street tacos were AMAZING and their green salsa was also fantastic with just the right amount of spicy-ness  I will definitely be back
Best birria tacos I ve ever had  The consume was so flavorful  I just wish there was more   The green salsa was very good  perfect level of heat. I will definitely be getting more of these

Just whipped into this food truck for a taco. I always like the taxis that have many ingredients in them that are all chosen by the chef. Pick your own ingredients tacos..... I do that at home all the time. I don t want to pay for what I can make at home. Holy cow. The vaquero breakfast taco was crazy good. Now seeing other reviews  I cannot wait to try their lunch tacos.
