So glad we got to check this place out it s literally 5 mins from us and has outdoor seating surrounded by a few other food trucks. They were very busy and only had two ppl working and they had so much patience with everyone. We don t eat meat and there s a vegan soy protein option that is phenomenal. Our non-veggie friend got the vegan plate  2 tacos  beans and rice  and loved it. We had a torta which was prob one of the best ones I ve ever had. Also ordered some veggie nachos which could have had more vegetables  beans  and cheese on it. Next time I ll ask for extra everything or maybe even get the vegan meat on it. Will def be back
We probably come here once a week since we live a mile down the street. So satisfying and so delicious. My partner always craves it and I don t mind it at all  Love

Really good Mexican food  They offer tacos  burritos  tortas  and quesadillas all from one truck  My torta came really thick  filled with lots of different meats and plenty of avacado. Juicy  flavorful  kind of messy  and spicy goodness  The prices are reasonable too.  The truck is located at the back side of a new food truck park off the highway. The new food truck park includes a good amount of picnic tables. The park includes maybe two or three more food trucks when we went  only one other was open at that time. Gorgeous fairy lights hang up overhead illuminating the area at night.

I ve been here a few times because we LoVE the South fork food truck park in Georgetown. It s a great set up with outside seating  a playground for the kids  and delicious food trucks and drinks. I always get the nachos. They re awesome with lots of toppings and delicious cheese. Tonight  I also had the carne asada tacos which came with two tacos filled to the brim with delicious meat. Super solid tacos. Will also absolutely be back again and again.

Stopped by South Fork for Sunday brunch and decided getting main dish from TaConMaye. We ordered up a fully loaded veggie burrito.  Quite delicious and the one burrito was large enough for both of us.

Really great food  We got 4 tacos  2 hicken  1 carne asada  and 1 vegan  plus some chips and queso. Chips and queso were very yummy  The chicken and carne asada tacos were top notch. The vegan taco blew my mind a bit. Outstanding. You can t go wrong here
This place is bomb  for some good tacos. Their portions are good and the tacos are GREAT    Carnitas is where it s at

We were going to place a large order for my daughters swim team  maybe 30 tacos and some fixings. Website says open at 11. We drove from Leander to check it out and it wasn t even opened yet. It s 11 30 and when I called a woman told me they were opening sometime before noon. This is literally the one aspect I hate regarding food trucks.   I ll update when I get to taste it sometime.
Really good food  I tried the Vaquero and the sausage taco  amazing flavor the size was really good too   I was so hungry that a forgot to take a photo  Thank you chef   I ll be back

Never have I ever had better CONSISTENT great food  and I m not just talking Mexican food or breakfast tacos or food truck status.  I have been here at least a dozen times and almost every time I try something different off the menu.  I have NEVER been disappointed.  The truck is primarily run by two guys.  Both very nice and make delicious food.  So here s what makes this truck stand stand out.  1. Calling it simply food truck food is an insult.  This is amaze ballz food. 2. The main chef works hard to please by being accommodating to requests. 3.  Nothing feels or tastes generic. 4.  Taconmaye rests between hidden gem and up and coming. 5.  There is love in every meal. 6.  It s an effort truck  meaning you can t just show up after work.  The hours are early and close well before sundown.  I can go on and on about the food at Taconmaye.  You really have to try for yourself.  The wait is not long so it s still early in the game for the chefs to dish out some amazing dishes with tender loving care.  Definitely one of the best.
The portions are huge for the nachos and quesadillas  and the tacos are generously filled. I love the food and friendly service this food truck offers.

This is a mixed review. My tacos were definitely legit Mexican St tacos. I had the al carbon and brisket. Pork and brisket were seasoned very well with a hint of spiciness. Green chili sauce gave it the required kick.   Plus One ordered pork nachos. Plenty of chips and the right amount of cheese but where s the meat  In all honesty there was maybe a spoonful of meat on a large plate. Fail  I was going to head back to the truck but was persuaded not to. Their tacos were AOK but I still prefer the taco truck at 183 and Spicewood Springs by Jim s.

BEST TACOS IN TOWN     And I am SO picky  my boyfriend and I literally got chills when we took our first bite of our tacos because they were just so amazing   A little of Mexico with authentic Mexican food located in Georgetown.   Who would ve thought   WE ARE SO HAPPY

Oh my oh my  I stopped for gas at the Exxon station at South Bell Blvd. and Riviera Dr on the Austin Cedar Park border  frontage road of 183A heading south  on a very cold  windy yet sunny day and I m so glad I did  After getting gas  I went over to the TacoMaye food truck parked along the side of the parking lot near a few picnic tables and a shaded grass area.  The menu isn t diverse  but offers standard breakfast tacos  egg and...  and about 8 lunch taco choices  a few other staples like burritos  quesadilla s  nachos  tortas  etc.   I had the chicken taco with onion  cilantro  cheese and avocado on a warm flour tortilla with a side of green sauce that perfectly complimented the fire grilled chicken  onions and zesty cilantro. The generous helping of shredded Monterey Jack and the creamy avocado wedge helped to balance out the heat. The green sauce was just the right heat  too  I m still feeling it as I type this- my upper lip is sweating slightly my tongue is tingling and my sinuses are clear-  but even without a beverage  this meal didn t feel like I would die from capsaicin heat.   The next taco I ordered was the brisket  cheese  onion and cilantro on warm  house made corn tortillas. I thought I d had some good tacos before but Wow  The brisket was flavorful and seasoned just right  not greasy  but slightly crispy and cut into manageable bite sized bits. It drives me nuts when you bite into your taco and all the meat comes out in one big piece   And praise needs to be given to those glorious flat rounds of sun drenched corn turned into soft  delectable tortillas. Made in a normal TACO size  not in the smaller fajita style  and doubled up  too  I could eat them with melted butter all day long  Order the corn     Each taco is  2.50  The vegetarian taco is  1.00 more  and well worth it and even worth standing in the cold sunshine for a little over five minutes  too   Thanks TACOMAYE  I ll be seeing you again and soon

We had delicious carne asada tacos and a chicken quesadilla from this food truck at Red Horn brewery. Everything was fresh and super delicious  The quesadilla was grilled perfectly and was so cheesy. I can t wait until they are even closer when the new Red Horn in Leander opens up. Will definitely order again

Thank you for a hot delicious vegetarian meal  First Mexican food in a long time and it did not disappoint  We had the vegetarian Taco Plates that came with two homemade sauces. The helpings were generous and tasty. Refried beans and Mexican rice were included. The price was inexpensive but quality and taste was not cheap     Called in order and it was ready at the time of my arrival. Also appreciated the precautions and steps taken by the entire group to ensure safety of customers. Thank you for being gloved and masked and let me prepay through PayPal. Made the whole transaction super smooth and comfortable.   Can t wait for the next meal

Stopped here for a little lunch  ended up with two stacked carne asada tacos. They asked me if I wanted a fork when I picked up my order and I thought to myself  who needs a fork with a taco  I didn t realize at the time how much meat they put on them  Get the fork  Good food and a really great play area with other trucks serving different food  desserts  and drinks. Nice cold beer at the Box Bar next door.
Carne Asada Lunch Taco Average for the    30 for 2 plate lunch  Especially from a food truck. I probably will not return.
Best vegetarian quesadilla  The vegetables were fresh  right amount of cheese and it was not greasy. It was sooo good  Great food

We moved to Georgetown several months ago and kept hearing about Tacomaye food truck...well we finally tried it.  Delicious.  Flavor was so good  meat so tender  i am not crazy about rice but bous theirs was good.  They had a limited menu the day we orderd....so good I guess they sold out of some stuff...so go early   We will be back

The best of the best  Tacos  Nachos  and Quesadillas to die for. I personally love the Al Pastor. You can get the Gringas which is Al Pastor with avacado. But honestly everything they make is so good. I not only have I been to the truck at multiple breweries and events and had them career my work event. They always deliver great quality food with great toppings and all their meat options are super good.
Very friendly truck. Fast service. The brisket quesadilla is incredible. Cheese for dayssssss.
Friendly staff and great tacos  I got brisket tacos. The meat was tender and tasted great.

This place is excellent. Super nice workers. My kids were fighting over their breakfast quesadilla they we sharing and they ate every bite even though it was giant. We can t wait to come back and try more things.

The food here is phenomenal  They have tons of great options to choose from PLUS a vegan vegetarian option. I got the quesadilla and added bell peppers and I also tried the vegan  soy meat  taco  It was delicious. My husband tried the brisket taco and a carne asada taco and he says it was  amazing . We will definitely come back often. The service was awesome also  he seemed like he really cared about his customers and his food. Over all  a wonderful experience  can t say enough good things
Best tacos in Georgetown I couldn t get a picture cause I ate them too fast. Fast fresh and as authentic as you can get. The chef knows what he s doing

With all of the Mexican food options in the greater Austin area  I would most certainly look to satisfy your cravings elsewhere. I was terribly disappointed with my experience overall  especially after reading so many positive reviews.  I ordered two tacos  ground beef and al pastor  and a carne asada quesadilla. All three menu items were incredibly greasy. Specifically for the tacos  all I could taste was oil and very little seasoning. Much to my dismay  the tortillas were not fresh and only one tiny hot sauce sample was provided for my entire order  which was absolutely neccessary to help flavor the dull meat. I did receive more when I asked  but considering the size of the meal  I don t understand the rationale behind the amount provided.  The quesadilla was the most unsatisfactory item of the order. There was entirely too much cheese and a laughable amount of carne asada in the fold. I could probably fit all of the meat in half of the palm of my hand. The was a single dollop of sour cream on just one of the slices of the three piece order  and just a drop of pico - enough to dress a single bite. My problem with this is that the menu mentioned that these condiments topped the quesadilla. Sure  I suppose you can get away with saying that if you stack three pieces on top of each other....  0

My boyfriend and I stopped by this food truck the other day and am so glad we did   We both got the Carne Asada taco. I ordered as well a brisket  egg and cheese breakfast taco while my boyfriend also ordered a chorizo egg  potato and cheese taco  They are good portions and are very flavorful  We will def be back to have some more
Best taco place in cedar park    They were so big and tasty  They make it really fast. They were all good but my favorite was the  barbacoa.

I stopped by after work last week to grab a burrito. I requested steak but I received a burrito full mostly of beans  rice  amp  cheese. The burrito was huge but only 2 bites had any steak. Taco Bell gives their customers a bigger portion of meat in their burritos lol. Should of known that I was going to be shorted after the guy processing my order just stared at his IPad after processing my CC order. I didn t tip  amp  heard laughter while i looked inside my burrito. I looked over  amp  saw both men who were working watching me look at the toppings. I told one of the guys there that there wasn t much steak in my burrito. He just looked at the ground  amp  walked off. I definitely will never be coming back to this place. I can t believe they would treat their customers like that. If you go there  remember to tip lol

Absolutely LOVE their food.  So fresh  so much flavor. 10 10 highly recommend.  Order the carne Asada tacos      You won t regret it. If you can get out to Southfork it s the best place to bring the kids
We work at the dealership right next door and this guy never disappoints for breakfast tacos
Wow that was a great breakfast taco. I had chorizo and cheese. Really great salsa and tortilla.
Super yummy food  Authentic Mexican food  I haven t tried anything I don t like  We also use them for catering our work meetings for breakfast or lunch
At Rentsch Brewery in April...half of us had gotten sick from eating the food...even 3 children under the age of 3...terrible quality

Food here was great   Order wasn t made correctly.  I said I d take them  amp  not to worry about it   I didn t really care too much  they both were good .   I guess he checked the order ticket because the cook showed up with the correct taco at no charge.  I told him he did not have to do that  amp  I would pay for it.  He declined  amp  said it was no problem.

Indulged in some tacos for Taco Tuesday at Whitestone Brewery. I ordered 2 carne asada and 1 pastor taco. Seriously some of the best tacos I ve ever had and definitely the best pastor I ve ever had. I can t wait to try more from their menu
I had two brisket tacos  and one bacon egg and cheese. Friendly owner  and tasted amazing. I will definitely be back.

I ordered the Torta al pastor. And a Carne Asada Taco. He gave me a Al pastor taco instead I was too hungry to care . The Torta was average nothing special   and the Taco was a generic Taco as well. However I did like the green salsa. Would I go back to this taco truck   Probably not.
These Tacos are the bomb  the menu is limited but it is a taco truck.  I highly recommend the tacos de barbacoa on corn tortilla.
Stopped by for some breakfast tacos and they were so delicious  The meat is so tender and the flavor is on point. The salsas go well with the tacos. Will be back to try their regular tacos soon

WHOA.. I just stopped here for a gordita  as the sign on the fence indicated that they had  Authentic  ones.. so I  after having seen that TACO sign on the side of the Shell Gas station for YEARS  decided to take a walk on the wild side and try a gas station meal.  I thought  well  I will start with a bean and cheese gordita and secretly hoped that they would have shredded cabbage and sour cream.. after all  the sign does say  Authentic .  When I walked in  I expected to see a big window for ordering or some portion of the interior of the gas station to be designated for the Taco Shop.. but nope.. just a small glass case with pre-made tacos of varied filling.. But in the back of the case  I spotted a gordita shaped foil form.. and noticed  beyond the case a door opening up to a kitchen that was in full swing... A huge pot of masa.. a big grill  lots of stacks of pots and pans.. This IS the real deal  I thought to myself.. One of the two ladies working the kitchen came out to greet me and I asked if I could have a bean and cheese gordita.  She quickly began getting my elements together.. the fresh  uncut  gordita.. at that point  I thought.. Weeelll... If they are this legit  I wonder if I could ask for nopales inside.. she  in a smooth move  a salesperson can surely appreciate  offered me  instead  any one of 6 or 8 other fillings as she lifted lids of the stainless steel catering trays filled with options... Beef picadillo  which I went with   tripe  fajitas  barbacoa  etc.. So  I ended up with beans  cheese  beef picadillo.. I grabbed some shredded lettuce  sliced and pickled fresh jalapenos  the 3 salsa options  have to figure out which one I was going to like best  and some sour cream..  The man at the counter was very welcoming and gave me the back story on the taco business that had occupied that space for many years trough a couple of operators.    At last  I tell you about the flavor.. GOOD.. I decteded a tiny touch of cinnamon or something.. So good. the gordita itself was just right.. and the favorite salsa.. hard to say but prolly the red.. it was really rich and flavorful.. go.. soon..
Great place for breakfast tacos and gorgitas. Great salsas and condiments. Will cook whatever you want if not already in the grab-and-go section. This is my spot for tacos

This hidden gem has great breakfast tacos and delicious agua fresca. My personal fav is the cantaloupe agua fresca  but watermelon and pineapple are good too.  Great place to stop while you fighting the morning drive into the city.
This location is truly head and shoulders above many other T-Cabs in town  Josh and Cindy will take care of you and handle any issues  GREAT BEAN AND CHEESE TACOSSSS

Went at 6 05.  Not crowded inside.  Only a few staff workers.  Took a very long to get our fast food.  First  we did not get our drink cups.   All four soft and hard tacos had about a teaspoon of meat.   Two soft tacos were ordered with no cheese and no lettuce.  Did not get them that way.  The taco fries were cold.  The cheesy potatoes were chewey and cold.   I understand the long wait caused by Uber Dash and other delivery services.  Taco Bell puts these services ahead of inside customers.  But  the food was poor even by fast food standards.  Also  you HAD to use the digital app  no counter sales.  Got a refund.

If you added up the IQ of everyone working at once at this location it would be a shock if it exceeded twenty points. Might as well be self-service. Places like this are why there will never be minimum wage increases.
In door dining is closed for no reason  no sign on the door just locked doors with drive through open.

wish i could give less than 1 star  seems like they re extremely understaffed and the people they do have working there are at their wits end. typically takes 45 minutes to get food  they re extremely rude over the intercom. i asked for 2 separate tickets and i hear in the background this woman scream  NO        she then takes over the intercom and explains that they aren t doing separate tickets. i said ok and proceeded to order and could barely stop to breathe without the cashier barking  what else     it was so off-putting and weird that we just left mid order and went to a different location. please get more staff here  pay your workers better  and maybe replace some of these folks. awful awful location  avoid at all costs.

Waited over an hour 20 mins in line to order through the drive through. Took about 1.5hours to get through the line and pull out with my food. Thought it was a one-off thing.. it s not. Showed up about a week later  waited about 25 mins the line literally didn t move once. Only time it moved was when people were driving off  leaving the line. If you are showing up in line after dark  you can expect to wait minimum 45 mins to put your order in. Another 30 mins to actually get to the window. I would also suggest checking everything before pulling away from the window because you are screwed if they mess up the order- as the inside is always closed.

I m pretty sure the entire staff is on drugs.    Every  time we order from this location  the results are something out of the twilight zone.   Examples include   - Soft drinks that are 100  void of syrup.   Just carbonated water. - A  chicken quesadilla  that s literally just an uncut tortilla folded in half.  No cheese  chicken  sauce -- nothing. - A single cinnabon crumpled flatted into a taco wrapper  we ordered a pack of 2  which  should  have come in one of the small sleeves  - Items frequently missing entirely.  Today we got cheese sauce  and no chips  for our  nacho  order. - Things we didn t even remotely order.  They just tossed random things into the bag. - Zero sauce packets  even though they were specifically requested and are listed on the receipt  Whoever manages this location should be utterly ashamed of themselves.
Bowl was good  but had to throw it out halfway when I opened the extra sauce and found a hair in it. Should ve listened to the reviews.
The assistant manager Cameron stayed open for my husband to bring me  his pregnant wife  food at 1am. Absolutely a nice guy and wonderful service. Thank you so much

I waited over 20 minutes at the drive through ordering kiosk until I finally gave up thinking they forgot about me. I drove up to the window and they refused to serve me because I didn t tell them at the ordering kiosk  at which they ignored me  that I was picking up an order. I said this is ridiculous I m not waiting in line for another half hour of your incredibly poor service - just hand me the bags. They refused and said they would call the cops if I didn t leave. I couldn t believe it so I said call the cops instead of handing me a bag   Then the kid actually called the police and bold faced liar said I was being belligerent and cussing at them. I never did say one cuss word at them and they were being belligerent. I will be making a complaint to corporate headquarters.

Intensely unfriendly  slow  and unhygienic. Wouldn t help at all with questions about the app  took forever to fill a small  simple order  and people working in the kitchen were wearing masks below their noses. It s cheap food that could potentially come at a grave cost. AVOID.

They usually get the food right- most of the time they don t have a specific drink available  I understand the current shortages   but they ve also been recently forgetting the drinks they do have in stock. Kinda disappointing.

Best rice  amp  bean burritos I ve had from a T-Bell.  I got potatoes in it too - usually they re really fried and have no substance to them  but these were solid potatoes.  Everything seemed fresher than I ve had from others.  The service was good too  very quick  amp  the guy was friendly.  And they didn t skimp on the hot sauce either.  I ll be back

I ordered an order but forgot to say no cheese. I called to make sure they didn t put any on it because I have a milk allergy. I was being polite but the person on the phone was being very rude to me  I have a dairy allergy  Be respectful there was absolutely no reason to be so rude to me.

The drive thru here closes at 1am. Bad enough that they changed it from 2 to 1  but tonight I pulled in at 12 40 which  having worked in the service industry before  I realize is annoying as hell  but sometimes you gotta do it. But I pull in and am told they are  closed . 20 min before they re closed. I said  I thought y all closed at 1  and he says  ....we do. But we already...shut down the system because...we were having issues with it  so...we decided to close . Cool thanks. You could genuinely tell from his tone and the way he hesitated while speaking that he was making sh t up  and knew it was a b tch move. I wouldn t be grumbling about it and I m normally not the type to go around posting petty 1 star reviews. but tonight was one of those nights when I was in a sad spiral  and really looking forward to Taco Bell comfort food. if you close at 1  you close at 1 fam  come on. It s super lame to just decide to close 20 min early because you supposedly don t feel like dealing with your  system . Grumble grumble. Just glad it was already on my route and I hadn t gone out of my way to go there  and hoping this doesn t become a regular thing.  Edit  welp  upon reading past reviews  it looks like this  is a regular thing at this location. Hey TBell  pls get some employees who actually honor the hours of operation. Totally get that it s late and you re 17 yrs old and wanna go home  amp  smoke a blunt  amp  play Xbox Live or whatever  but this is a business. And this is your job. Just do it  it s really not that hard.
Please update your hours of operation on google so people do not waste time driving to your restaurant only to find it closed.
They crunchy tacos actually crunchy  Like frfr I was so damn happy with my tacos being right because in Houston the Taco Bell I go too ALLLLLLLLL the time is fucked up.. never crunchy

Ordered online at midnight since they close at 2AM. Got there at 1 10AM and the screen was off. I pulled up to the window and there were at least two people inside. I waited and then honked my horn to get someone s attention since I had already paid. Nobody came. After repeated honks someone just motioned they were closed. Nobody bothered to say anything prior  hell even put up a sign. Sheer laziness and disregard. Not surprised - just annoyed

Why is your inside closed in the middle of the day  You sign says you are open and should be open. Why not put a simple sign in the door saying the lobby is closed  You only give stupid looks at customers who park and try to walk into the lobby. Here s a hint  the only thing more stupid than your looks is not putting a sign on your door saying the lobby is closed.
if their life depened on it and rhey had to get an order right. they wouldnt get it right and die

Third person inside ordering food and 20 minutes later still no food. Couldn t find order from their own kiosk. Workers walking all around each other  no organization  and no customer service. I wouldn t recommend ever.

If you have any expectation of getting what you actually order  you will be sorely disappointed. Nothing in our order was correct. News flash Taco Bell employees- if a customer customizes their order  it s because that s the way they want the food they pay you to make them. Pay attention  How hard is it    Plus rude employees lying about how the app works. Ridiculous  pathetic  incompetent.

This is where Tacos go to die. This is a dumpster Taco Bell with dumpster quality and service especially at drive thru. Want to eat dumpster undercooked and under served garbage   Then you have come to the right place amigo.
Closed 15 minutes before they were supposed to... not fun to learn when you drove out of the way just to get a taco lol
Waited 30 minutes for my order to be taken. I couldn t leave the drive thru line so I had to stay.

It was just another day  i got hungry so decided to order 2 of their mini chicken quesadillas. I had got home and took a bite in to the first one only to discover a hard object inside my mouth  I spat it out in disgust and saw what it was. A dirty fingernail. I immediately lost my appetite and called them. The only response I got was   Well  you re gonna need to bring it over here so we can see for ourselfs.  Okay  first of all. I drove to that resturaunt and home  I m NOT going all the way over there to show them their mistakes. I think I m taking a break from taco bell.

Long time Taco Bell supporter  yes  I know when the 7-layer burrito used to be  0.99   1.29   1.39  etc    I also know when the  Cheesy Gordita Crunch  first came out  possibly an embarrassed admission   Lol .  Used to know the manager of this store  who advanced to District  then Regional  and now beyond  Rick - you were da bomb  . All I can say as of today is  STAY AWAY from this Taco Bell  I don t know who s in charge  but not only from this day s attempt but also a former attempt that resulted in incorrect order and seriously poor food quality   underweight in size. If you are doing the drive-thru  be sure you check your order BEFORE you drive away. I m 2 for 2 in receiving an incorrect order of only 2 items  Didn t complain before because I didn t notice until I arrived at my destination. This time  I waited thru the line again and didn t even get an apology. This location has taken a serious nose-dive in every aspect. Oh  but they still start the drive-thru question with   How are you    Um  doesn t matter how I am and I know you don t care - I m just here to place an order... Sorry  if that s a Taco Bell  thing   but I find it annoying when all I want to do is order . And when I end my order with   and that is ALL   WHY do you come back with   And would you like to add a drink with that   I don t care about scripted responses  one should LISTEN to the customer     Frustrated. But more angry with 2 consecutive incorrect orders and no apology when I had the time to go back and get what I wanted  ordered  and paid for. I m absolutely dying to hear a reply from this manager or regional  I think y all  need  to - this location currently SUCKS

I have a deep  long  loving history with Taco Bell. We go way back. Remember when you could get a Mexican pizza with green onions  Oh yeah. I m an OG.  This Taco Bell is pretty good. The food is always good and the restaurant is always clean  I loved the old staff a lot  they were personable  nice  and just really good people. It s different  now  which is why I m giving this location 3 stars.   Tonight  the girl taking our order was rude. She stood at the register with an  Are you going to order or what   look on her face  instead of asking if we were ready to order. This is becoming a thing with people lately. I might be getting old  where are their manners  I digress.  Another phrase of the Elders.   I told her my order  a steak cantina bowl  and she typed it into the keyboard and just stared at me. I looked at Husbae  because I was done with my portion of the order. As he began to answer  she kept looking at me and interrupted him by rudely saying   Is that it     It was a very awkward experience. The food was good. I just miss the old staff.

Terrible service. For the past few days  or more  the pink lemonade has been out. They literally gave me water in the drive thru and charged us for it  not to mention the girl taking cash in the first window said NOTHING to us. When I went back inside  they pretty much refused to change the pink lemonade syrup. I ve worked in the industry. I know all about soda machines. It s laziness at its finest.   The pregnant manager was extremely rude to me and didn t once try to resolve the situation. As a non soda drinker due to reactions with carbonation  I have very few options.   I love Taco Bell. I really have had it with this shit staff  It shouldn t take 20 minutes in the drive through at 2pm to get this kind of  service

Let me start by saying  I rarely eat fast food  mostly due to the lack of nutritional value as well as the quality of both the preparation and the  food  itself. When I do though  I tend to go with Mexican or a burger  depending what s most convenient and how much I ve had to drink.  Having been to this Taco Bell a few times  with the same unfavorable result  I recently found myself craving a good ol  fashion crispy taco. Upon arrival to the drive through  as usual  my eyes instantly become bigger than my stomach as I viewed the menu and realized I could get so many items for so little. But then I instantly am reminded that the food NEVER looks as it does on the menu board. That being said  you at least expect to get the items you ordered ie  chicken on a chicken bowl or cheese on a combo burrito  both of which we realized we didn t get after we returned home.  Unfortunately service here isn t much better than the food. Taco Bell management needs to take a trip through a Chick-fil-A or Bush s Chicken to understand what I m talking about.  Again  I realize it s fast food and not a Michelin Star restaurant  however give a smile  act like you appreciate my business and give me what I paid for

I ve been here multiple times - I ve only left happy once. I ve gone in and stood around  and then sat around  and spent 25 minutes waiting for food. If I wanted to wait  I d go to a sit-down restaurant where a waiter comes to my table.   I ve started going through the drive thru so i can at least choose the music selection  and because it s a tad bit faster.   Maybe 1 person knows how to take orders without sounding like a complete arse. I ve never seen an employee here smile. I m starting to think this is a franchise location and corporate can t do much  because I ve complained plenty to corporate and they just send me a coupon. There is something wrong with this location. I ve been to many Taco Bells in my lifetime..and no Taco Bell as disappointed me as much as this one. I feel bad for the workers - they re clearly unhappy.   Not only are the people depressing or abrasive  pick your poison I guess    but they really skimp you on the food at this location. Expect your taco to have half of it s normal filling  cold  or to be missing a few ingredients  or all of the above. I ve been handed a bag that was cold in my hand and I figured the sauce was at the bottom and they gave me a lot. NOPE. I got a taco straight out of the freezer. I had to do the most horrible thing you could ever do to Taco Bell food   re heat it in the microwave.   So I m a huge fan of Taco Bell  but I prefer to drive to the one on Burnet near 183 - they re super friendly  my order is usually at least semi-correct  and they don t get cheap on you with the ingredients.

Taco Bell is not real mexican food . It gets the job done for half the price  what s not real mexican about that. And in the case of the new smothered burrito  it gets the job done handsomely. This particular taco bell was clean  looked to be recently remodeled   and not busy. One taco assembler on the line was new and didn t know yet how to make the food  but his trainer did so while it took a few seconds longer than usual all was good.
Great food. Great deals. Delivers on time. Love the skittles drink  and the Mexican pizzas

The worst service of all of the chains  was there tonight  waited 8 minutes in the drive through and no one waited on me  finally drove around to see another car sitting in the window with lights out and someone inside looking down at phone  no one visible inside  another vehicle behind that leg like they also got tired of waiting  backed up and left. I am not coming back to this location  you will waste your time  1 star was too much for this review

On Oster  On Waring  On Hamilton Beach...   There is the occasional frijole  grain of rice  or scrap of vegetable that narrowly escapes the clutches of the blender  but they are few and far between.  Don t bother looking for the meat  because they are still chasing it through the woods behind the restaurant.  I think if there ever would be a market for Taco Smoothies  this place wouldn t have to change any of their food prep to add them to the menu.  The place is really not that bad  it s just that the food barely passes for  well  food.  And  when you peel back the wrapper and open the tortilla  no matter what you thought you had ordered  the guts inside are pretty much all the same mushy goo of ingredients.  When it comes right down to it  all the Yum  Brands franchises are very much the same in terms of quality and satisfaction.  You eat there because it s fast and convenient  not necssarily because it s good.  I shouldn t take it out just on this location  but it s the closest one to my house.
So slow every time. Zero lack of energy. No consideration of the customers time. Years ago it was fast. Bad management
Absolutely horrible....35mins to get through drive through....only 5 cars in line. As if the food wasn t bad enough.

I love Taco Bell but this one here is by far the worst one  The cashier Leocadio was rude  disrespectful and has horrible customer service skills  I let the manager know and she had the nerve to tell me that she knows he wouldn t be rude and wouldn t do that. She doesn t even know because she was cleaning the Lobby   I had to go thru the drive through 3 times because first they forgot something that I ordered and then I went back through because a combo I order was all wrong and the third time was because I wanted to let the manager know what happened but that didn t do any good so I asked her for the district manager s name. I get it if the cashier was having a bad day or it was busy all at once but you dont treat your customers like shit  This is why I give this Taco Bell 1 star

Food was ok  I asked for Jalapenos  and I was given 3 slices   and charged extra for them     3   are you kidding...ok then we asked for Verde sauce and give 2..    Then we asked for more  for three orders of food  they looked at us like we were from Mars. I mean are the employees paying for the condiments themselves ....

I visited this location tonight  as I do many nights. The first guy we talked to was friendly and polite. He told us they were short staffed and it would take about 15 minutes for our food which was okay with us. However the second lady we talked to was rude  short   and unfriendly. Our food was tossed to us and no offer of sauce was given. Upon driving home we noticed that the Baja blast was all soda water  no flavor and undrinkable. Once we got home the crunch wrap supreme was missing half the hard shell and the cheese was all on one side.

I m not expecting gourmet food when I go to a Taco Bell  generally I m here for speed and convenience.  I really never thought to review it even though I probably went here a couple times a month.  This last visit on Saturday changed that.  I found  by biting into  a ten inch strip of plastic in my Taco Supreme.  It looked liked it came off a plastic bag of some kind.  The really disturbing part is it does not appear to be something the employee would miss due to size  leaving me to think it was out in the food intentionally.  Totally disgusting and the last time I eat at any Taco Bell.  I filed a complaint with the city and saved the remaining part and non-food item in it.  When I called and reported this to the manager he told me   Come back and we will remake your taco.  No thanks dude.  I also emailed Taco Bell on Monday but they did not respond.  Avoid  folks  unless you like eating things that are not food.

So  I dont usually do this kind of thing  but I feel like I need to warn everyone. I know Taco Bell usually gets a bad rap for being rough on the stomach  but this is ridiculous. Ever since my late night snack at this location last night  I ve been married to my toilet.   Seriously reconsider stopping by late at night  as its pretty obvious proper care wasn t exercised with food safety on my order. I ve never had a case of food poisoning this bad.

If anyone in Austin visits Taco Bell and orders the new  Cantina  tacos  please send in your Austin  TX citizenship card.  Mine is in the mail.   The carnitas  Cantina  taco was a soggy piece of crap. Seriously  just go to one of our many taquerias.   And Justin  Taco Bell cashier  here s how it works. I come up to the counter  you stop whatever you are doing and greet me with a friendly  Welcome to Taco Bell  May I take your order   or something along those lines. What you should not do  is glance at me  say nothing  walk to the back  and when you return give me a creepy yet vacant stare while holding the cash register with both hands. That s how people mistake you for a sociopath  Got it  OK  great. Work on those people skills  buddy.  Two stars because I am forever enamored with the bean burritos   extra onions - my college drunk food of choice.

I m fairly positive that my boyfriend and I both got salmonella from this location during the great tomato scare of 2008. I haven t eaten at a taco bell since. 1 order of nachos supreme   5 days of disgusting misery.  Run for the border  No. Just run. Get away from this place as fast as you can.

It didn t make me sick   haha  I love it   Just what you want to see in a food review.  Exactly  Michelle and Michael  if you live in Austin  or honestly anywhere  then you have literally no excuse for eating at Taco Bell.  With delicious taco stands on every corner at all hours of the night  the only thing sickening about it is how addicted you may become to these affordable AND deliciously authentic treats   Last night  er this morning  I found myself in my car driving to my old neighborhood haunt for some al pastor and puerco verde.  I woke up smiling today  and none-the-broker   And hey  no hepatitis
I think it you are in a hurry and want something quick.  It is for you.  Not the place for long sit sown meal.
People were rude and snippy. Bean burrito was not right seriously... . My little cherry limeade sparkler was good  sonic is better drink wise.  Otherwise it was taco bell. Didn t make me sick    D

I went in and got a  complicated order  which i paid extra for. But in the end i got the standard item. When i called the manager wanted to argue with me of i ordered and what i got. This is the Second time in a row that they messed up. And they won t own up to their mistake. I can t wait for the day they close down completely.
An ordering miscommunication was fixed immediately. Prompt and professional  Great clean place with friendly employees

Why did I go here  There were only a couple people in there when I went in. I had a small family in front of me and they ordered quickly. After they ordered we walked up to the counter and the cashier disappeared for almost 5 minutes  without saying anything to us . There were at least 5 people prepping food  none of them are trained as cashiers   We finally placed our order  3 calupas and a drink. It took almost 20 minutes to get our food. I wasn t even going to eat there I wanted it TO GO. The food tastes fine  but it shouldn t have taken 20 minutes  even the people in front of us were waiting for ever.   No one stayed at the counter and people coming in were stuck waiting there for at least 5 minutes. One kid was standing there for almost 10 minutes waiting for someone to come forward. Absolutely terrible.
the lady here didn t take my order for like 5 minutes and that s very mcr00d bye im taking my business elsewhere thank you sike i hate u tako beel

Fast food is always a last resort and I try my best to avoid it but when you re hungry and in a hurry the only option is horrible food that is over priced. Why can t corporations serve healthy food instead of foods that are bad for our health

Since they reopened the quality has improved drastically  now instead of 100  certainty that the chalupa flatbread will be cold and not toasty like all the other Taco Bells in town it s more like 50  chance that they will be good  I was so shocked when I went back and the chalupa was just perfect like the first time I had them 13 years ago in Chicago. Obviously something happened and they are under new management. Service is better too.

The inside of this taco bell is really dingy  and pretty creepy.  Now the people that have worked the drive through are always very professional. The people that work have worked at the cash register are always rude  sloppy and mess up all my orders.  I would recommend skipping the inside and just doing the drive through.

Even for Taco Bell  this place is one of the worst. The interaction with the employees is just fine. No one is rude. However  the food is terrible  yes  I know  even for Taco Bell. But if you re reading this  you  too  eat there  . The beans are runny  the burritos are smaller than tacos should be  there is rarely any  meat  on whatever you order  the nacho sauce is always less than half filled  they get your order wrong every time ... etc  etc  etc. This is a Taco Bell location to avoid.

This location is pretty close to where I live and I often stop by here for a quick bite.  Personally  I have never had a problem with my orders. Say what you will about the food   it s taco bell-what do you expect   the service here is excellent. The people working here are the nicest I have ever come across at a fast food restaurant. Every time I go to the drive through  which is at various times of the day  the people taking my order are always extremely friendly.  If you re in the mood for a quick taco  this is the place to go.

Perfect location for a lunch stop  No matter how long the line  they re fast  Of course there is the pre order ahead through the app. Lunch team is always on top of the process  fresh meats and veggies. The dining area is clean as well as the drink area. I recommend the pollo asado with corn salsa.

The brown rice was only half cooked and very hard on the teeth. Could not eat more than a few bites because of the raw rice. Had to waste all 3 items we had ordered for our family of 3 and rethink what we had to eat for dinner. Disappointed.

WORST Chipotle I ve ever been to  by far. They were starting to close at 9 35pm when sign says open to 10pm. I would have just left  but hadn t eaten since breakfast  amp  nothing else was open. MOST DISGUSTING burrito I ve ever tasted. Took one bite  brought it back inside   amp  manager gave me a bad attitude. So I just left HORRIBLE BURRITO on the counter  amp  walked out  No food  No refund. The 1 star reviews are accurate. I took a chance thinking  Could it really be that bad   Unfortunately  yes. HORRIBLE

The only reason I still bother to come to this location is because I live 2 min away. Every time I order  about once a week  the portions get smaller and smaller. This order I got today  attached picture  is the most laughably and pathetically small portion I ve ever recieved at any chipotle ever. Not to mention  it was cold somehow.   To make matters worse  online orders are never ready on time and you always have to either wait  or show up later than your scheduled time.

Understaffed Stressed No in-store ordering  When they do open in-store  they fall behind on on-line orders  Often 45 min behind schedule Staff is scared to complain Morale is low The staff that is there has not gotten the training they need Like the first scene of a Kitchen Nightmares episode No Chips No Iced Tea  Not sure what is happening  but I feel so bad for the staff. All three of them.  Taking a pause on grab and go food for the kiddos until this S-storm passes.

I have enjoyed Chipotle for many years at several different locations but this location is the absolute worst. On a Saturday afternoon there were only 2 people working and there didn t appear to be any management.  One employee in the front was moving slower than molasses and looked like they really didn t want to be there. The other employee  the cook in the back  was at least trying to get things under control as they were coming up to the front to help with orders in between preparing food. Tables weren t wiped down  trash bins were overflowing  and there was no ice in the ice dispenser. They didn t even have music on here which gave the place a dead atmosphere.  By the way as I write this review I still haven t gotten my order after 30 minutes.   I don t blame the employees for this at all. This is a management issue 100 . What a waste of an opportunity for being such a great location.

Never had a problem with a Chipotle until the one. Twice now the restaurant has closed after we ve placing an online order because they are understaffed. They don t bother to close the online ordering on the app for the store so we show up to pick up our food and they say sorry we re closed  like what  They just throw up the corporate number on the door and expect you to handle a refund yourself. Either fix the Chipotle or just close it.

I ve always seen stuff about people getting things in there food that don t belong  I TRULY think it s not chipotles fault  it has to be from shipping or these things are in the bag before. Because how can a whole ass leaf just be thrown in my bowl without notice before cooking  They cook everything so how is it not noticed  Honestly never thought i d be one of those people that gets these type of things in my bowls... going to have to find a new place to replace chipotle

They never have ice tea made and when you order to go or pick up it s not the same as getting it in line... and paying in the store.. they scrimp to go orders and always forget Burrsomething. The food is good but totally inconsistent.

I just stopped in this location to get a simple burrito. The employee did not seem to care how he made my food. I asked for chicken and was given a 1 4  of a spoon full not the usual full scoop when I asked him to put the correct amount on he got really annoyed and walked to the back. I visit this location at least once or twice a week if this is the caliber of employees you hire I ll go elsewhere to spend my money. Young lady at register is always nice  helpful.

First they were only taking online orders and I m really not sure why but ok placed my order online.  Waited pretty much 30 mins altogether to get my food last over other ppl in who I know I did it before them and then their new drink was empty so I asked the cashier if they have anymore and she said they have to make it and she was on her way out so she didn t tell anyone or do it herself so I had to ask again when the whole place was empty and they were able to go back and make some   First time at this location and I more than likely will go somewhere else.

chipotle is the best. this location is horrible. terrible experience 98  of the time. incorrect  sloppy assembly  late  never taking in person cc orders  lock the front doors during open peak hours  unfriendly staff. needs to management on the highest end.

The worst customer experience in my life was at this restaurant. Went in around 1230 on a Saturday and very surprised to see it was empty.  Got in line behind a woman and her son and neither of the 2 people behind the counter said anything to us for a full 5 minutes. When I finally asked if they could wait on us the server told me they were working on online order s and we had to wait. When I protested the fact that we came in person  the woman who was also ignoring us  named Marita  told us we could wait or go elsewhere  when I asked to speak to the manager she said She was the Manager and then ignored me and the other lady in line. After a few minutes the lady in front of me asked how much more time we would need to wait she told they had 2to make 3 more large online orders first They put Chipotle to shame

Ordered online from this location  this is what I received. This is the picture right after I took the lid off. Very dissatisfied Not sure what happened  but someone is fuckinh with me. Do not order online  unless you want someone to eat your plate and then give you the leftovers. This is ridiculous. Wish I could put 0 stars.

Dont order on the app.   Order is wrong as they dont double check.   When you ask them to make it right or refund the order they tell you to call a phone number.    I m right there in the store talking with the  manager  and they dont do anything.    Manager was not interested in making the order right.   Got a carnitas bowl paid in full with no carnitas meat     How does that happen.   Have you even gone to chick-fil-a and your sandwhich has no chicken    Or P-Terry and the burger comes with no burger     After two trips into the store the manager would do nothing.  They already took my money through the app.   Called into the phone number.   Have to wait on hold for over 20 mins.   Get a hold of some one in New Jersey.   They wanted to offer me a 30 day one time discount on my next order.   Did not want to refund me for not getting my order right.   Never use their app it does not save you any time and will cause you much time to get it right in the future.   My wifes order was correct but the amount of chicken they put on her bowl was sad to say the least.    If you go to this location along go in and order yourself to make sure the order is right.   If it is wrong it will be a long disapointing road to get taken care of  if ever.

This chipotle is absolutely terrible. They never get mobile orders right  and the food is never ready on time. My food was supposed to be ready at 1 30 PM. I got there at 1 31 PM and had to wait until 1 47 PM for my food to be made. Mind you  there was only three other people in the entire store and they were all waiting on food orders to go. This is not the first time this has happened  I should ve learned my lesson the first three or four times this happen but I keep giving it another try and every time I am disappointed. Chipotle used to be such a good experience but in the last year or so it has definitely gone way downhill. Additionally  when I did finally get to eat my food it look like someone had sat on it. So disappointing.

Six of us went in for a quick lunch around noon.  When we went to the counter  they told us they were only taking online orders.  So we sat down and started placing an online order.  The manager came to our table and told us that we could not sit in the restaurant and had to leave. There was another person sitting at a table eating his lunch. There was no sign on the door stating that they were closed for in store dining.  The manager made no apology for asking us to leave. I will be taking my business elsewhere in the future.

Big Chipote fan but please stop forgetting things. It s happened multiple times here where something like salad dressing fails to get pushed down the line and I discover it when I get to work... I understand it s a petty complaint but I m going to have to start playing babysitter...

I wish they would pull it together here.  Due to Covid we have been ordering with the app.  So far 3 out of 4 orders have been wrong.    1  All toppings for my burrito were on my wife s bowl.  The only thing correct was the meats.  2  Got the toppings correct but left Guacamole off the bowl...  that s over  2 we were jipped.  3  I ordered a burrito and got a bowl...  WTF get it together      And wife is done as she said there was almost no meat on her bowl.   No consistency     I want to support you  but your quality and attention to detail really in need of improvement   Then the app will let you add reward  birthday guacamole  to the order...  but will not let you check out with it.  For an app that has  what I would consider an excellent user interface  that is a fail big time.  Cheers   Jim
Found a wood chip inside my bowl.... so grossed out and pretty sure I ate wood shavings.

Turns out i am not a chipotle person  it s taken me 7 years of living in America and seeing endless Chipotle tweets   memes to venture into one... maybe I ve been spoiled by taco deli   Maudie s  maybe those are an unfair comparison  I had a rice bowl   my husband had a burrito. It was entirely edible but all tastes a bit cludgy and bland.   It s clean. The servers are friendly. It s not bad. It s just meh. I guess if you like chipotle this one is probably a good one. But I don t.

Never make a phone order. If you call the Yelp number  it will ask you to out in a phone order. It will take your credit card info but then the store will not have a record of the order but WILL CHARGE you anyway.

As a big fan of chipotle and having been to multiple locations in the Austin area  I can truly say this location needs to figure it out. They consistently under deliver when it comes to Food Quality  portion size and customer service. I will gladly take my business to the South Lamar location before I go here. It s unfortunate but I do not recommend this location to anyone in the 78746 and surrounding area codes

Chipotle definitely has the most superior tortilla chips of any Mexican restaurant I ve been to. They have a little bit of a lime taste to it and very salty. Unfortunately  their chips aren t always consistently fresh. I love their medium salsa  the green one  and pico de gallo salsa to pair with the chips. They have a great selection of meat  beans  rice  veggies  salsas  etc. This location is definitely just a take-out kind of restaurant. There was a line when I went at 12 30pm on a weekday but it moved pretty fast  Definitely just a good place to grab lunch to-go. If Torchy s had better chips  I probably wouldn t be frequenting Chipotle as much.

The food was really bad at this location. Underseasoned  sloppily thrown in my bowl. My husband picked up our order and they had it sitting there for 10 minutes before handing it to him. I called to let them know my guacamole was brown and unappetizing and the manager told me I was wrong--that all of it was fresh. You tell me how good that looks to you. I now have to email corporate to get my money back.
Hands down the worst chipotle I have ever had. Not only was it generally gross  but somehow a poblano pepper got into the fajitas and I couldn t stop coughing. I expected more from this neighborhood

I had a long day and I was craving their chips and salsa. The were really sweet and polite when I ordered and left  but when I got home less than 5 mins later  I bit into my chips and they were stale  Not just stale but when I bit into it there was no crunch. I was so sad and disappointed.

Long slow slow moving line  Employees seem less than interested in moving the line along quickly.   I suggested they add a second person to apply toppings  which is where they were way backed up  and received a very rude response.  Wow thank you so much for your advice    Typical good Chipotle food  but not worth the wait.

This location gets our order wrong EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. We order for delivery at least once a week  and it s so bad we ve come to expect something to be wrong.  If you re the one family member out of six in my house that actually gets their order right  you ve learned to celebrate silently.  Today was one of the worst mix ups. They left off the chicken in my son s kids meal  completely. They mixed up ingredients on my husband and daughter s meal  and they left rice and beans off of mine  so I was basically served sour cream and guacamole soup. We keep ordering because at this point we have so many free rewards from wrong orders  but we are also big chipotle fans. We d rather skip the free rewards and pay full price for the meals we actually wanted  and we wish a different location would deliver to us. There s got to be a better way to quality check and get things right. Mistakes are human and we ve tried to give Grace  but consistent error for months on end is why I m leaving this review.

Worst quality food I have ever been served.  Guacamole was brown and rotten  rice and veggies were mushed  and the meat was cold.  I m embarrassed that this is the quality of food I served to my family.
Joke of an operations team. I wouldn t trust them to run a lemonade stand. Twice I ve walked in at 9 15pm and have had been told were out of cheese and meat.

I m not sure this even deserves two stars but I was so hungry that it still tasted good.  A bunch of high schoolers were working and were too busy talking about their ever-so-important social lives to hear my order.  And then I d get a  huh   and have to keep repeating myself.  When there was a half of scoop of rice left it was put in my bowl... the chick looked around and when more rice didn t magically appear without effort on her part... she thought she d just continue on and pretend that I didn t get screwed on rice.  Um  nope... get me more rice damn it.

Been to this location several times and it is by far the worst Chipotle location I have ever been to. They are always out of ingredients and the ingredients they do have are old stale and disgusting. Had to stop the poor kid from folding my Burrito as I had just finished watching him smash the previous soggy mess. Needs major management improvements...avoid at all cost.
One young lady doing a great job to work the line all by herself.  But she is only one making orders for a long line. Out of guacamole. Manager in back. Not organized at all.
My son picked up a meal here recently and said the place was packed but the service was very fast and the guy on the line was flying through assembly. We will be going back again   Chipotle rocks

I love my neighborhood Chipotle HOWEVER I am frustrated that they run out of salad dressing by evening. This is my 5th time in 8 weeks to be disappointed because they are out.  PLEASE figure this out so I can leave a great review and return to  being happy about eating your yummy salads

I have not had food from here in years and will not bother again.  Very boring  rather tasteless salad.  The chicken seemed rubbery and the fajita vegetables were beyond bland.  Very little lettuce and the beans were also dull.  Honestly like taco cabana a million times better

The chips were completely stale  but that s not the worst part. The reason for only one star is I had to get my burrito made twice  because the rice was half-raw. The first time  I can t imagine how nobody else had complained because a few people got their meals before me and dined in. They tossed out the rice when I complained and had a brand new batch that they used to make my replacement burrito. The second burrito had crunchy rice as well.  This is absolutely nuts. How do you make a product in a restaurant and not make sure that it s fit to serve to customers  This is lazy and careless. I hadn t had Chipotle in too long and was excited to get a burrito today. I had to go way out of my way  and drive over a half hour to get here  because there s not a Chipotle near where I live. And the result is stale chips and crunchy rice. I don t even blame the employees because this is a training issue. The manager is absolutely to blame for this nonsense.  Also  how do you run out of corn salsa  It s one of my favourite things and I was told they were out. Then the woman behind the counter admitted they had corn  they just hadn t mixed it up yet. There were very few people eating here  I can only guess why   but nobody wanted to take the time to mix up a batch. Again  this is a management and training issue.

The worst Chipotle in Austin. The regional manager of this store should be absolutely ashamed of their embarrassing store. Maybe an entire team reset revalidation  The lobby and line were in total disarray  the crew literally couldn t care less and they weren t taking anything seriously...they were just like  you should just go to the south Lamar location . I did just that and it is possibly the best location in Austin. Do yourself a favor and don t go to the westlake chipotle.
This is honestly the worst chipotle in the US. Slow  slow  slow. Get mgmt to take a look as it s giving a bad reputation to the brand.

Do yourself a favor and go to another chipotle. Avoid at all costs. This was the most disgusting location I have ever been to. The glass was dirty  the cook and line server were not wearing any kind of hair net or personal protective gear. I saw the guacamole was brown and asked if I could get some guac from a fresh batch and she told me that all of the guac is brown    No  its definitely not and that was the first time I ve experienced brown guac at a chipotle. She even pulled out the second batch and it looked the exact same which is super concerting as it hadn t even been sitting out. The beans were over cooked and the rice was crunchy. Absolutely disgusting. The location in sunset valley on Brodie is great-do yourself the favor and drive the extra few miles south to that one. I am honestly afraid I will get sick eating this meal. I think its time management and corporate looks into this location as all of the reviews are less than desirable Scary

This Chipotle is as good as any other Chipotle  so I m giving it 4 stars.  This one is clean  there are manageable lines  they do get longer at lunch   there are enough tables generally  and the staff is courteous.  They were recently willing to accommodate my request for a large side of white rice here  which was nice since that s all my kid will eat from here.  There are about three small outdoor tables and a stack of Austin Chronicles if you need something to read.  I am digging the Chiptopia rewards program they have going this summer  so I ll be back at least two more times in the next 11 days.  If you like Chipotle  you will like this one too.  And that s a wrap  pun intended .

Great food for a quick mexican bite. It s definitely tex-mex so don t expect any home cooking here..but it is a good place and on the higher end of fast food chains and foods. You can customize any order with several different options- into a bowl  a burrito  or a large taco    Pretty much the mexican version of Subway  Quick and efficient

This was probably one of my worst experiences at a Chipotle. I was in Westlake and had lunch at the Beecave road location. The food was disgusting. The lettuce was soggy and brown. The guacamole was also brown. The staff was busy talking to each other and I felt like I was bothering them. I would not eat at that location again.
I ve been here multiple times between 11-12  lunch  and they are not prepared. Missing multiple ingredients. This time they didn t have black beans... What   Management - figure it out.

Clean  fast  and the sofritas are made well. Service is pretty friendly and helpful. The seating is ok but crowded when busy and one set of the doors intersects the line which can get annoying when the line gets pretty long packed. Portion sized are about average for a Chipotle.

They reduce their portion size  or did I just happen to get jipped today  I got what I always get  and i m small so it lasts me two meals easily.   I noticed how small the portion was when I opened the lid  and sure enough I blew through the whole thing. I ve never been able to finish a bowl.   If they ve done it intentionally  I wish they would let the customers know about the change. I wasted my dollars.

This is a bad chipotle location. It seems like there has been bad reviews for this location for a while and I ve had the same experience as all of the other reviewers  bad service  missing ingredients  SUPER skimpy- like half portion of what chipotle normally is . Maybe if we keep rating them badly someone from upper management will pay attention and come fix this place

If there were zero stars  I would give it that. I absolutely love chipotle and it s my favorite  fast food  place but I will never go back here. I waited so long in a line of 3 people because the guy behind the bar couldn t have moved any slower. Then they ran out of white rice and instead of asking the other customers if they were getting white rice or brown they decided to hold up the entire line until I spoke up that I wanted brown rice so I don t need to wait 15 minutes for the white rice. They didn t have corn or guacamole which was disappointing. The food was awful...old  not fresh  and really missing something without the guacamole and corn. The meat was awful. Fatty and overcooked. Sad I paid for the steak. Super bummed I spent  12 on a bowl and chips that ended up in the trash. Terrible service. Terrible food. A disappointment to the franchise.

This was  by far  the worse experience I have ever had at any Chipotle. I walked in and was immediately assaulted by the blaring music. Unable to talk with my 2 friends without yelling  we just waited in line for food.   After I yelled the first part of my order to the first guy behind the counter  Burrito  Double rice  No beans    he proceeded to make the burrito and add rice. Then he yelled  No beans   to the guy standing right next to him who was attempting to flirt with the cashier. This guy then  very slowly  starts to scoop some undesired beans onto my burrito as I yelled  No beans   no less than 3 times as he continued to try and flirt with the cashier. He finally turned to me to ask what meat and I informed him how he had already screwed up my order and would need to remake it. I m not sure he could tell the difference between me yelling over the music vs. yelling because he was a moron who couldn t even do his simple job.   The next 2 people handled their job semi-successfully  other than making me ask for my drink cup repeatedly and finally just taking it myself. Apparently this was just too much for the cashier as she decided to go on hiatus.   5 minutes later  my 2 friends were finally able to pay for their order when someone new came to the register. Unfortunately  the new cashier had the same listening skills as beans-dude and  without verifying  charged both orders to the first card presented him. Even cruelly  was the discovery that my friends burrito contained all of 4 pieces of very fatty chicken.   After that debacle  We attempted to find a place to sit only to discover that people in this area are narcissistic a-holes who all need to sit  by themselves  at a 4 seat table  all of them texting away happily and most without food to even eat. But I guess 1 person at a 4 seat table isn t much worse than the 2 people in each of the multi-seat  wrap around party tables. Resigned to the fact that we couldn t use one of the several open 2-seat tables both inside and out  we managed to find 3 empty stools in a row at the bar  between all the individuals spaced 2 to 4 seats apart  and sat shoulder to shoulder the entire lunch. If that wasn t claustrophobic enough  the lunch rush that began 5 or 10 minutes after we sat revealed to us that the way this restaurant handled its rush was to have the line run immediately behind the backs of the people eating at the bar.  While we survived and lived to tell the tale  we will not be going back.
The manager Joe needs to fired. I could not believe the way I was spoken to or treated by him. Chipotle is usually so friendly  this guy must go. I m never visiting this location again.

I love chipotle but will NEVER return to this location again. THE WORST customer service I have ever experienced. I totally get not wanting to be at work on a nice day - but like cheer up and don t be rude to my family. Also  I m just here to get my food...don t have an attitude with me because I interrupted your chat time with your coworkers. And maybe clean up a little bit because the tables were filthy and the drink station was a disgusting mess.
Food is good.  Service is good.  Music is too loud. Gets REALLY BUSY during lunch.   Guacamole is delicious.

Love the food here. Prices reasonable for the taste and quality. Love Chipotle in general. Won t earn 5star rating until customer experience includes WIFI. Even as little as 20 or 30 minutes of WIFI let s me have a working lunch without hosing up their eating area. Until then  I sometimes have to skip Chipotle as I need to update a spreadsheet while I eat. Alas.

Made my burrito way too full which made it a struggle to eat. I appreciate the extra chicken an guac that was in my burrito  but eating it wasn t what I had planned. Originally planned on ordering it to-go  but it was impossible to eat without sitting down at a table. This chipotle only had forks as utensils which made eating the overflowing burrito even harder to eat.

Decent chipotle. I ve found that the portions I get here seem bigger than other chipotles and the service has been friendly in my experience. The ambiance is typical chipotle and parking shouldn t be an issue. I was a bit annoyed by the fact that they didn t have wifi though. Other than that  good experience.
The food was terrible.  Our guacamole was brown and tasted like they used rotten avocados.  We got the bowl  and they barely gave us any chicken.

I might as well have said   I eat babies . I m pretty sure it would have registered the same level of shock and disbelief from my friend upon hearing I had never. eaten. at. Chipotle.   So sue me. Better yet  treat me to lunch  Muahahaha  And she did     I have to admit  it was good. Like really  really good. And fresh. I am now just a little embarrassed to have been so out of the loop on this one. What can I say  Big ass burritos just aren t my thing. But  Wow  The tortilla-less burrito bowl was soooo good  I highly recommend the shredded pork  but will also be going back to try the steak....it looked damn tasty  too.   Having only been to this one location  I can t compare  but I will say it seemed a little small. We kind of inhaled our food and as we sat there visiting I m pretty sure there were folks pissed we weren t leaving. C mon....Give a girl a little time to digest    And ummmm  who knew  Apparently they have their own ordering app that you can download to your phone to send your order in  Now that s some serious Burrito-ing

As a person who loves Chipotle and consumes it 3-4 times a week  I was really disappointed that this Chipotle close to my new house was so sub-par.  I order a vegetarian salad  and they were skimpy on the black beans  fajita vegetables  pico  and guacamole.  That s 4 out of the 5 ingredients in my salad.  When I asked for more guacamole  the woman making my order rolled her eyes.  RUDE   I only received more guacamole when I told her they could charge me for it.  I decided to give the place a second try  and again received less than expected service and portions.  The S Lamar location is a lot further  but not only is the staff nicer  they are also polite if you ask for a little more black beans or guacamole.    One thing that does often bother me about Chipotle is that in general  they will give customers huge portions of meat  cheese  and sour cream  but tend to put meager portions of black beans  vegetables  and guacamole in orders.  Of course  I ll still eat Chipotle  just at another location.  This particular one does not deserve my business.

I ve been told previously that Chipotle is supposedly owned by McDonalds  but a fellow Yelper set me straight. McDonald s was an investor after there were 15 locations already going. They later sold their shares of Chipotle in October 2006  and the two companies are no longer related. Little trivia for ya there   I love Chipotle  If only they had a drive-through and a location near Four Points. The main reason for this review  however  is their GUACAMOLE. It is  in my my humble but well-informed opinon  the BEST of any restaurant I ve been to. Always fresh  yummy and with the right amount of heat. No tomatoes  which is probably a bone of contention for some  but I prefer it that way. It s soft and creamy with fresh avocados  and never mushy like most places. So even though the burritos and tacos are great here  go for the guac if nothing else

How could you disappoint me like this oh maker of the Burrito Bowl   You were out of steak --just ran out one bowl before mine--and you had no reserve ready.  So I had to order chicken.  And then you went skimpy on the lettuce--not good    Then  to add insult to injury  the tomatoes were crunchier than the onions.  Why--WHY did you make me a sub-par burrito bowl

Like I have said before I have been eating at Chipotle s for a few years and have always enjoyed their food.  Lately though I have experienced quite an increase of oil in their chicken dices so I decided to test it out.  I put about 8 of them in a napkin and gave them a good squeeze....not pretty.  There is more than enough oil to go all the way through the napkin in about 2 seconds.    I have spoken with the management about it but they just tell me it is from the grill.  Starting to give me second thoughts...

When it comes burritos  I consider Chipotle to be on a rung below Freebirds.  But unfortunately  I live a lot closer to a Chipotle and my wife likes it  so sometimes that ends up being the meal choice - as it was today.  The steak burrito with rice  pinto beans  corn  pico  lettuce  and cheese wasn t terrible  but it also wasn t anything special.  A couple of bites were notable for how salty they were - almost like some undissolved salt wasn t mixed-in enough.  Oh well  i wasn t expecting a whole lot anyway.

Chipotle. Clean. Quick and Easy.  Folks working here are nice. And for all the south park fans  as am I    it doesn t make you crap blood.  I would like them to include sliced avocados as an option for my burrito bowl though.  mmmm Avocados

This was a good experience. I arrived at 12 30 and there was plenty of seating and the staff were efficient. I waited in line for an amount of time that is not even memorable. All the food was fresh  the line moved quickly  and paying was not an issue. The drink station was clean and full. I could not ask for more.

We rarely get enough time during lunch to get away... but when we do  we want to take some time out of our stressful schedule.  Not happening at this Chipotle location.  The employees here have a huge attitude problem.  Smile people   It doesn t hurt   Be friendly with your customers so that they will come back.  Ever heard of  check your problems at the door      If you don t like your job then maybe you should find another one.  Something that suits you better and that you would love doing.  Food is great except the chips...  a little on the stale side.  And sometimes  depending on the server  they tend to get a little stingy with the serving.  I ve experienced better.

I love this particular location.  On a weekday if I come before 11 30  I can be in and out in roughly 4 to 5 minutes and they never skimp on the sour cream. The lady that works at the beginning of the serving line can PUT those orders away like a boss. That s a good quality in a busy place around lunchtime when a bunch of Westlake professionals can be briskly demanding their weekly Chipotle.   Last year I ate nothing but exclusively Freebirds  but then I discovered the greatness of their crunchy tacos which brought me back to this Chipotle addiction and only solidifies my biweekly to weekly fill  which in progress leads me to demand why they don t have a loyalty card because I need to rack up these points  mayn

If you re in a hurry and looking for a good spot to stop in for lunch  Chipotle is the spot.  It s not your everyday fast food  it tastes good and you re in and out fairly quick.    Not something to go out of your way for though.

This location plays the music at the loudest setting possible. The noise level is outrageous - we have stopped going here due to the lack of concern for customer service. Avoid this restaurant location.

OK  I LOVE Chipotle because it s one of the only quick serve places where I can enjoy a non-fried  no bread  low carb meal quickly. I always order a Chicken bowl with small amount of brown rice  heaping helping of the grilled veggies  toped off with pico  corn and lettuce. And the ingredients are fresh and taste great.  But at this particular location  the last two times in a row I ve gone in  they were out of veggies and had none cooking. Then they ask me  rhetorically I guess   do you want to wait .   Uh  do I have a choice if I want my veggies  Of course I ll wait  even though you should be doing a better job of managing the food line and not running out of grilled veggies.  This sucks because now I m just some weirdo standing there aimlessly while others come through the line  skipping veggies  and I m just tapping my toe watching the cook finally drop a bunch of veggies into the wok back there  which takes about 7 minutes to cook up properly.  At least this last time I was offered a free drink while a wait  which gave me something to do for 30 seconds before I continued waiting.   Other than this grievance  I like this location. It s clean  service is good and fast and the food is great.
