I ve eaten here twice. Both times the people working here were really nice and the service was fast. The problem is that some of the ingredients were lukewarm both times and the rice had super hard kernels in it. Also  they barely drain the black beans before throwing them on your burrito and then it just drips everywhere.  HEY BURRITO MAKERS ALL AROUND THE WORLD  DRAIN THE BLACK BEANS  DRAIN EM GOOD   Yesterday  I got a burrito with a bunch of super hard rice kernels  please replace the rice when it s been sitting there  y all   and super wet bean juices  on top of that the sofritas was borderline cold. I was hungry and already at home so I finished it but it left me not wanting Chipotle for a long time.  This place would be good if they put your burrito together like someone who is about to eat a burrito  not someone who wants to get it over with as fast as possible. Speed isn t everything.   Also they need to switch out ingredients more so they stay fresh.  I m not against Chipotle. Not even against this location  but the people who work here need to take the freshness of their ingredients more seriously.  Thankfully Cabo Bob s exists.
I have been to a lot of Chipotle Mexican Grills across America. And this one in the Westlake area  is the best ever. So I highly recommend that you check them out.

Awful service   I had to ask the cashier to print me a receipt  the knives and spoons are apparently kept under lock and key so I had to back to the counter for a knife and most annoyingly the soda fountain had no carbonation so I had to go back to he counter again to inform them of that.  After waiting for 10 minutes and no one bothering to come to do anything about the sofa fountain I went back to the counter to ask why nothing had been done.  He had no answer so he walked to the back and another person walked up.  He apparently was the manger and told me that the cashier was supposed to tell me when I ordered my drink that the sofa fountain had no carbonation.  I explained to him that he didn t  nor did he bother to mention it when I came and told him that there was no carbonation or when I came back to ask why nothing had been done about it.  By this time I was extremely upset with the poor service and the very apparent lack of concern by any of the employees in so I walked out with my meal not even half finished.

I love this place.  The food is tasty  fresh and so very filling.  I try to eat just half a burrito - also definitely a wise idea.  But I usually end up eating the whole thing.  They have a burrito bowl - without the tortilla. I like the veggie - but understand the pork is really good.  I love that they have natural pork and chicken.  Fewer hormones and antibiotics are always a good thing. The service is quick and friendly.  I usually get it to go - but I like eating there too   in the round booths.

I eat here 3-4 times a week mostly because I like the burrito bowl option. The only reason I don t give it 4 stars is at lunch this place is packed  and the seating is limited. it would be nice if they moved to a larger location with a bit more room.

Don t get me wrong  I love me some Chipotle  but this location has it all wrong. Very unprofessional of the woman to snap at me because she couldn t understand my order in line... It consisted of tacos and a bowl. The bowl was barely half full and the guac didn t even help that situation. The people at the check out area did not ask if I would like a drink. I guess the people ordering on the phone were priority... The man standing next to the girl at the register told me to  hold on real fast ... Luckily I had cash. Later goons.... Not coming back to this one.
Always good. I ALWAYS have the same thing  which  for me  is awesome  flour tortilla  extra white rice  barbacoa  sour cream  cheese. I think I could live off the barbacoa alone

I ordered online to avoid the lunch rush.  This location tends to get pretty crowded.  Service was friendly and fast  but I wont make the mistake of ordering online again.  I ended up receiving a steak burrito made almost exclusively of rice.  even the  cheaper  ingredients like salsa were non existent. I recommend ordering at the store so the servers are held accountable.  Unless you really like rice  in which case you ll love this place.
Lifelong fan of Chipotle  from Denver .  This location was very stingy on guacamole and chicken.

Are you really reading reviews of Chipotle    I know  I know...you re all thinking   Why the hell did he write a review of Chipotle if he was going to hate on me for reading his review   Well  I m only writing this review because today I won 10 free lunches  which they arbitrarily upgraded to 20.  Aside from that this place is fast as hell and packed during lunch hours. But it s still just fast food burritos.
Nothing but wanna be fresh ingredients  terrible parking  The only reason this place is still open because the snobby rich Westlake kids come here and share giggles

So sad to see a once friendly  good neighborhood restaurant go so far downhill.  In a town busting with great taco places you would think that they would at least try to be courteous.  Has management changed   1.  When my vegetarian daughter asked for a little more rice on her 3 item soft taco  white rice  black beans  and guacamole  they said no.  Considering the price of rice and how much they charge for their three tiny tacos this is ridiculous.  Just how much profit do they want to make off of her  2.  She was ordering for the whole family from a list that she brought.  When she didn t move down the line fast enough  for their liking   they rudely told her she would have to hurry up.   3.  When she got home she discovered her tiny taco tortillas torn up so much she had to eat it with a fork. 4.  Her  1.90 soda didn t have any syrup in it.  I tasted it and it was  flat soda water.  She had to throw it out.    Bad parking  marginal tacos  rude service  diminishing portions   lost loyal customer  Maria s Taco Express  Taco Deli  Torchy s Tacos all friendlier places with better food  better portions and worth the drive.

I will never eat at this chipotle again     I ordered 2 burrito bowls and presented with a coupon for one free the cashier ripped the coupon before applying it apologized for doing so and said may be next time     They are very stingy with all ingredients always salty and poor service. A friend of mine found a ladybug in her lettuce  went back to the store and was told  we don t wash our lettuce         I say Eat at your own risk

clean  simple  and delicious burritos  tacos  salads. good value  generous portions. national chain but usually very consistent with high quality.  This one usually hits the mark.  Good value for the  .
Pretty dang good. Prices are on point too. Highly recommend. After eating heeded you will feel heavy tho.
Come here for the fajita and suadero 100  order both salsas and some line to go with it
Best chicken fajita tacos in town   They are located on 760 Airport now
Beef tacos lacked flavor. What flavor was possibly in there was drowned out by the spicy hot sauce. Would not return here.
Love this place. Always consistent and pretty quick. Fresh corn and flour tortillas  The green sauce is legit  Also  knowing a little Spanish will ordering a lot easier. Enjoy peeps.
Incredible tacos. The barbacoa and pastor are not to be looked over  Thank you for the great service too

Was running Saturday morning errands and had some time to kill to grab some breakfast somewhere new. The staff very nice and kind. We shared the Abuela s Plate.  It comes with fajita beef  chicken and pork with rice  beans  lettuce  tomato  guac and sour cream for  16.49. It comes with 2 tortillas so we ordered two more. I would say you could probably make 5 to 6 tacos out of the whole platter if you are wanting to share. Portion size wasn t bad  but the meat wasn t amazing. It wasn t horrible  but I like a bit more flavor. They do not serve chips and salsa complimentary. If you like super spicy they don t have it  but were nice and brought us a store bought bottle of habanero salsa so that did the trick  Overall cozy spot with sweet staff  but the food just didn t hit the spot for me.

This was sooo legit and good  and it could be a 5  but because there was some kind of meat in my potatoes on the huevos plate  after I said no meat  I took it down a star  but only one because the waitress offered to bring new ones. That aside  I am sooooooo happy by boyfriend decided to come here instead of another taco truck on his first visit to Austin. This is definitely an unsuspecting gem of a find  traditional Mexican  good cheaper food  made with love by Abuela.

After having many good experiences at this restaurant and writing a stellarreview  coming here since they just opened and buying their food throughout the pandemic. This little waitress has an attitude. So for whatever reason they only put a tablespoon of onions on the side of the plate for the chilaquiles. Everybody knows that the onions go on top. Anyway so I asked for more onions and she just gets irritated with me about the whole thing and then charges me a dollar for it and then goes into some big justification about how people don t like onions. I do not care. Anyway I didn t tip her. She s got some kind of attitude. Anyway I work service industry I give absolute best customer service in my field and here I am on my day off at 8 30 in the morning and she s charging me a dollar for onions because they only gave me a tablespoon. Who puts a tablespoon of onions on chilaquiles  Anyway I think I m going to start going someplace else for my Mexican food. Especially seeing that I have brought so many people over here all of my family eats here I ve introduced all of my friends. This place doesn t know how to value their customers. In addition the food wasn t hot. What s the deal with that  The beans were like tepid. And the chilaquiles weren t even hot. It was so weird. I mean a dollar so I ll have a total of two tablespoons of onions on my chilaquiles. People don t know anything about customer service. So here she s being a little witch because she s got an attitude and now I m giving this terrible review. So there you have it
Excellent down-home Mexican food with two very good salsas. Small place  not fancy but table service by nice people. Much Spanish spoken.

Taco Man is my new love. Taco Man 512 only does catering and hopefully will open a store front soon. He specializes in pork tacos and if you ask for it Toms style  the tack shell is crispy cheese only and oh so tasty. Also I loved El Dorado Cafe s beef taco which was on the yellowest of corn tortillas and flavored very delicious. I m pumped to learn El Dorado is near one of my yoga studios. Also I liked Hurache s beef taco which was simply delicious. I definitely will visit their restaurant.   Now that taco chat is over I ll spill the beans about the festival. Super smiley taco hosts welcomed us into the gate. We arrived early and there were not many people when we walked in which was great. We were able to walk around and talk to each booth to get our taco mouths really watering. We decided our top 6 ones to try then lost track of taco time. My friend wouldn t share hers so I had to double back and get more. Hahaha and by friend I mean me. We hung out in the VIP area and tasted a few margaritas which were a little too tasty. Then heard the band Fertility House. I tried to throw my eggs at them. They were terrific very good feeling band and handsome chaps. But still they didn t want to fertilize my eggs. We saw some Mexican wrestlers in panties and dressed up chicauawa  sp   dog models strutting the runway.   Austin was the first stop of this festival tour  Finale is in Sin City. Bring on the Vegas Taco War. Double Down. Split the Aces Always.

Fun time  Many many choices. Lucha  food  drinks and you CAN pay when you get here  More to follow  Wow   More  At last got seated in a spot  wiped the tacos from my beard and then a bit of rain started. The event is very easy to get dropped off by someone or a rideshare. There is plenty of security and I did not see any problems  except for trying to decide what to eat next. Once you tightened your wristband  and they did have people there to guide you through the process of having your wristband activated. One thing that was not really clear to me was if you could purchase the wristbands there. Now I know  you can. I don t really like purchasing early and save a few bucks and then something happens and I can t go. The wristbands I purchased ahead were  12.00 and they were  20.00 if you purchased upon arrival  Another YELPER and I had arrived early  and actually found a place to park    The vast amount of taco representatives were amazing  even from as far away as  Brownsville. You had the fancy setups and the simple. I made a beeline right for those who you could see were cooking border style and then also tried several who come from other parts of the city. You went down one line of vendors  then up another set  with Lucha set up   then another  then a nice soundstage. It was simply impossible to eat even a small selection as there were so many from which to choose. So I stuffed myself with all I could eat and be able to still move.  One of my gut instincts was to watch for tortillas being made and especially those in the smaller size of Mexico City street tacos. Tacos ran  3.00 so I stuck to what I could not easily get routinely. I was not going for  size but quality that fit my taste. This was a home run for me. I would have stayed even longer  but I was so full I couldn t even order a shot of tequila or a margarita as I would explode  Hopefully it will be here next year again.

VIP tickets were great  but no tacos  with meat  in the VIP lounge  ran out by 3 45 . Otherwise a great time and fun. Watched the taco eating contest - 6 tacos in 6 minutes  Torchy s Trailer Parks  . No one could do it. My son says he easily could have done it

Tacos  tacos  tacos  Fun  albeit disorganized time. The staff were less than friendly and gave us no rundown on where the VIP area was located or how anything worked. Turns out you can get tacos at any stand  but can only get beverages in the lounge. Unnecessarily confusing. That being said  the taco purveyors were super-friendly and there was something for everyone - vegan  meaty  and everything in between. With a little more attention to logistics  this could become a great annual Austin tradition.

Spent some time looking up tacos for this event in preparation and headed into Austin. Parking found by Butler Park and less than a mile walk. Yelp elite tickets waiting for us at will call  and we were excited to try this out. However the 2 guest services members could not locate our tickets. They appeared  extremely unmotivated to try. We left as we came hungry. 2 hours later we were told they were there all along. Food smelled good and bands seemed okay. Would have loved to spend the day sampling tacos and listening to music. My advice is if you can avoid will call do it.
Honestly have been here a dozen times and have never had a bad experience. I realized I only write reviews for bad experiences but never good ones. So I thought I d change.

This location is a flaming trash fire. Whoever this GM is  if they even have one  has no clue how to run any establishment  unless it s simply into the ground.   I just came in 9 14 to a sign on the door saying lobby closed take out only  okay no worries I don t sit and eat-- it s a fast eat establishment.   I left 17 minutes later after having seen one of three people in front of me get their burrito.   Okay so you re slow  okay.  Your lobby is closed during operating hours  okay.   Here s where we ve crossed the line  your team has endless stacks of dishes piled on food prep bar  food sitting out of temp control while you reach in and out of your line looking for ingredients.   Then the real kicker and the one OSHA would have a field day about is the hazardous cleaning products on the service line- yikes yikes and yikes.   Also  I d like to mention while waiting in line I placed a pick up order at the slaughter location.   Get it together  sincerely a former Chipotle employee who s manager would have NEVER allowed such a simple concept to burn down.   This location is a reoccurring disaster and this will be the last time we come
Sad  comically wrapped square cold burrito with the tiniest portions I ve ever seen at a Chipotle. This store needs a management overhaul.
If you re going to make me wait for my pre-paid online order  at least say  thank you for your patience  or  sorry for that wait  Really wish this wasn t my local Chipotle

This is the dirtiest chipotle I ve ever seen  No attempts to clean the serving counter. Yea they were busy but a quick wipe down doesn t hurt between orders. The food was getting mixed a bit  sour cream was a mystery what was dropped in there. All tables were dirty.. would suggest a different chipotle.

Went to chipotle last night around 6 pm to grab a couple bowls to go. Got my wife a veggie bowl with  double rice   picture speaks for itself. My chicken bowl was no better. C mon  chipotle do better.

Negative 5 starsrude staff  dirty dining room  order wrong  COCKROACH  After making an order online I went inside and waiting about 7 mins for my order to be ready which was a veggie quesadilla. Once I receive my order I checked it in the car and noticed I received the sides and chips but no veggie quesadilla. I went back inside to let them know it was missing and said they would make it right then. I patiently waited over 20 mins and finally after serving everyone else--even people who arrived after myself  did the staff member begin to make my quesadilla. I watched as his set his cup straight on top of the stack of tortillas. Outside of the package mind you. When I confronted him to start with a fresh tortilla he gave me so much attitude. When I was finally about to get my order which was stillllll wrong   received a cheese quesadilla   I noticed there was a COCKROACH crawling on the counter
If you want a good warm burrito  you re at the wrong place.  Right now it s 50 degrees outside and there s nothing I love more than a half hearted Icee burrito made by shitpotle .

This location blows. When the workers actually get the order right it often tastes bad. Placing an online order means waiting inside after your pickup time and asserting yourself since no one will offer to help. If you do order here  I d recommend checking your order before you drive off. You may have received the wrong one.

Red headed girl turned her back on me after asking if I had a mask. I just said I didn t have one. I ve just been in around rock and nobody was requiring them. Instead of just being incredible disrespectful and not even having a conversation  try talking to people. I will never go here again and am considering banning chipotle all together. If these are the people you chose to hire  it says a lot about your company.
Filthy. Reported to Austin Health Department. It s that bad.  Completely indifferent and immobile staff unwilling to attempt to care.

This location is just bad.  Every single time I get the chips they re chewy  cold and stale.  They constantly give you very small portions.  And don t even think about ordering the brisket...they roll their eyes and shake their heads no.  Not a big deal  just take down the 7 signs you have promoting it.
It s chipotle. You get exactly what you d expect  and I m happy with that. The employees do their job  you get to eat  it s all good

I can t believe I m writing a review on Yelp for a chipotle but I cannot with this location always giving me a half scoop of everything. I usually could never finish my chipotle bowl in under five minutes but never fail to with this location. Half of my bowl was literally empty. With how many food options are in this area  just skip it. I regret going every single time because of this location. Do better

Don t go to this location   They always take forever and order always manages to have something wrong with it. Also  don t even bother ordering ahead of time for a specific pick up time  because odds are you ll still have to wait 30  minutes. This location needs to get it together.   The stassney location isn t very far and is very prompt with online orders.

Chipotle needs to get it together. Food was wrong  mangled  missing items  and served with a side of attitude.  Freebirds has many more options  more flavor  and friendly people. I usually opt for free birds and thought I want some chipotle this time. What a headache just trying to get the food I ordered. They really got one piece of lettuce in my whole burrito bowl and then said it wasn t their problem  basically. No thanks sis.

Horrible portions. I always order double everything down the line and the person preparing my food usually has to double wrap my burrito since it s so much food. Today I ordered double everything and it was the smallest pathetic burrito I have ever received. It was the size of a a pack of ice breaker mints. I don t mind paying  15 for a burrito but when I pay for double everything and the portions are equivalent if not less than a normal burrito I have an issue. Does this look like double everything to you  Giving two stars because the cashier was very kind.

Fast  amp  Furious. Fajita bowls were quickly made. Food was consistently as good as other Chipotles. But the past couple of times we ve visited this location  at one or more of the employees have been in a crappy mood and it SHOWS   Thumbs Down.

This is my very first bad review. Went in for lunch today and they were pretty busy and thats expected  however I wait behind a good amount of people to get up to order which took about 10-15 minutes. I begin to place mine and my coworkers order to bring back to the office and they have no steak. I asked the woman helping me if she knew how long it would take and she kindly told me she would find out. She asks the cook and the cook himself had no eta on the steak. It just really aggravated me to have waited and walked out with no food. I had to go back to the office and miss out on lunch. I just dont understand how the cooks were not prepared for a lunch shift in one of the most busiest locations.

Everything is good in restaurant just don t you dare ever try to order anything off DoorDash Uber eats etc. they seriously short you on portion size and say you have to add extra rice which is free but there s no options. Extremely unsatisfied and I love chipotle.

After giving up on the Slaughter Monaco location due to their inability to get an order correct  I ve come to this location twice. The first time was fine four stars. The second time half of our order was missing - zero stars. Hence the average of two stars. After arriving home with the botched order  I called the restaurant. After probably 20 rings  I talked to someone who could only say  ok  but eventually put me on a long hold and  finally  a manager came on the line. The manager offered to refund the order  which I assume will happen . I think this was the right thing to do since two of us were planning on having Chipotle for lunch and that didn t happen. When two bowls are ordered and charged for  it should not be difficult to count two bowls in the bag. My lesson - always double-check.
Welp this is still the worst chipotle in all of Texas. Half the staff wasn t wearing masks  food flung all over every surface. Only person that was not rude was the girl at the register.

Came today to try the cauliflower rice. Waited in line 20 min before leaving. They prioritized 10 online orders before helping the people in the stores. Ridiculous and rude. Would not recommend this location.
I come here for the tea  Quesorito is amazing   Don t order it  It holds up the line a lot  Ok... order it. You ll like it

They give you little to nothing. Not even a full scoop of rice. Girl who works at the front of the line to take your order gave me the most pathetic scoop of rice ever. My bowl is the equivalent of a toddler s meal. Do better.

This evening  10 15   1730  the staff very friendly and efficient. I really appreciated the small talk with Dennis. He even thanked me for being a nurse. I appreciate that. This place is y all s pretty packed  but not tonight. All staff this evening was great and I got my order to go in no time.

Chipotle is my favorite  fast food  restaurant. I order here basically once a week  This is the closest location to my work. I ve had good experiences with the staff and my orders when I go in to order however EVERY time I order delivery items are missing or incorrect.   I try not to exaggerate in reviews but it s gotten to the point where I have to closely watch my order on the app and intercept the door dash driver between when they accept the order and when they leave the restaurant and I have to text them to confirm with the restaurant that they included my side items  chips and guac  etc. it has now happened 4 times in a row  April 15  April 30  May 11 and today June 29 . When I do not contact the door dash driver the order is always incorrect. Unfortunately at work I don t always have time to stalk my order. I got busy today and missed the notification my order had been picked up and knew I would be disappointed. An item was missing. It s super frustrating to pay for items and not receive them unless you strictly micromanage. It s upsetting because when you re ordering delivery there s just nothing you can do unless you spend the money to reorder and meet the  10 delivery minimum just to get items you already paid for. On the bright side all 4 times I ve done this Chipotle customer service has refunded me. They wouldn t have to do this if the store paid more attention to ALL items on the orders.  I m excited for the Slaughter Ln location to open and give them a try. Hopefully they put more care into their mobile orders.

Came in with a bogo coupon and my order wasn t ready. No biggie and I didn t mind the wait. However  only 1 out of the 7 employees were wearing masks. The lady doing the toppings was sweating like a pig. In these times of a pandemic it s just crazy how these employees at this particular chipotle are breathing directly over fresh food going into your plate or burrito

20 years of eating Chipotle and this is by far the worst burrito I ve ever had at one. Stale rice  small portions  super strong onion flavor to the salsa. Yuck. Go to ANY OTHER CHIPOTLE until they revamp whatever mess is causing this poor excuse for a burrito. The Chipotle on Riverside rules
This chipotle has terrible service. 10 people in line and all they care about is online ordering. Their system is horribly inefficient compared to other local chipotle s. I d avoid at all cost.

Chipotle is my favorite place to eat  however I downloaded their app and ordered online  picked up my order and went home. It was super easy and I got to pass the line. However it is SO disappointing to find out that they FORGOT to put guacamole in my veggie bowl after making it all the way home    wow how ridiculous.
Normally love the burrito bowls with guacamole.  However today they had a the grossest brown guacamole.  When I asked if they had fresher guacamole they said no this and this what they are selling.

This review hurts to write because Chipotle is one of my favorite chains to eat at. This location however leaves a lot to be desired. The employees all seemed out of it and made multiple mistakes as we were ordering including telling us there was no more white rice and then when we went to the next step in line  the rice was brought out. They also dropped food in other food so it mixed when we asked for certain  items  forgot we ordered an extra tortilla twice  and when we asked for a bigger scoop of guac we were told quIte rudely the exact qt. size we could have. We didn t know scooping out quacamole was such a science as every time we ve been to Chipotle we ve seemed to get a different amount. In addition to the terrible service experience  the music plying was terrible and the restaurant was not clean.

Worse Chipotle ever. Dirty floors and tables. Rude staff unwilling to answer questions because they seem hurried. The cooking are looked ok but the serving are not as good. One wonders how they didn t have yet another outbreak. Terribly disappointed be I liked stopping there every now and then. Not anymore. Much rather go to any good locally owned mom and pop texmex restaurant in the neighborhood  and there are many

I ve gone to this Chipotle so may times and haven t been disappointed. But the last few times I ve ordered online with this location they have messed up my order  and I ve been asking for extra scoops of some things but it seems like they ve been giving half scoops of almost everything to the point where every order has been getting smaller and smaller. I will try to come in next time to see if they just don t pay attention to online orders.
White rice wasn t full cook and it was disappointed because I can t finish whole burrito to continue eat half hard rice that I wouldn t able enjoy to eat rest of stuff in burrito

I went into this Chipotle location to get a veggie bowl.  Walked inside and the dining room was a mess.  Chipotle food scraps were all over the tables and the floor.  Trash cans were overflowing with lots of trash on the floor. It looked like the dining room hadn t been cleaned in a couple of days.  Basically  disgusting.  I stood in line for a few minutes and then I decided to leave.  Get with it  Chipotle   Clean your dining room

I love chipotle. Hell  I use to work for them.. But this location is terrible with portions.  Moving here I thought with it being the Tex-Mex  cause it s texas  feel it d be the same as in Orlando  but it wasn t. I m not sure about other locations in Austin  but this one has made me stay away from chipotle in general. Which is a shame because I use to give chipotle my business everyday in Florida.   Every time I go in it s a terrible attitude from high school employees. I ve wrote in SEVERAL TIMES  and was given the typical coupons. That s not the point.. I want chipotle back..  I waited to give them time to improve  which was an entire year  came in  and the SAME TERRIBLE service. Eyerolls  no cares  and ridiculously small portions.   I worked for chipotle  I know the portion sizes... I m not sure what s going on with the store  but whoever is running it is skimping on sizes for costs  and is hiring the bare minimum.   Sorry chipotle  but you aren t gonna last in Austin with this type of business model. There s a TON of other taco burrito options here  and you need to step your game up.  I won t be returning to another chipotle  and that hurts my soul  but this Sunset Valley location ruined it for good for me.

Unfortunately this is the closest location for me and that s certainly unfortunate.  The staff is a revolving door  and the portions are TINY  never an issue at other locations  I always ask for more rice and meat  COME ON   On several occasions the rice has been undercooked and too many pieces of chicken have been overally chewy   not edible.  I ve filled out several surveys with constructive feedback and now I m Yelping.  I m starting to think nobody reads the surveys

Do you want some hair with your food   One of the front male employees that is preparing the food during lunch time has so much curly hair under his hat that you can barely see his eyes or face. It is disgusting to see a big tuft of hair just hanging over the food he is preparing for customers. That is a health violation. Who knows how much hair this kids had shedded in peoples food. I called and spoke to a female that said she was a manager. She didn t present herself as a manager and had an attitude. I explained to her how that is a violation of the health code. She said all that they require is a hat and that he has a lot of hair to under the hat. I said then he should wear a hair net or go preform a job that doesn t require him to handle food with all that hair. She didn t care. It s pitiful that even with the COVID and all the health requirements put in place by the CDC that she could care less. I called on 7 30 20 to complain. Please research who the PM manager is and please retrain her.

Least favorite Chipotle location  and I ve been multiple times . Employees were complaining and absolutely rude. They were out of just about everything and literally filled my bowl with food scrapped from the bottom of the container. Definitely take the time to drive to another one  will not be back.

I literally loathe going to this location. In my old town out of state I d do chipotle 3-4 times a week  but since moving to Austin it has dwindled down to once every 6 months to a year and today after almost a year I tried again and it s the same thing.. Just terrible service. Everybody looks miserable  doesn t look you in the eye  mumbles  keeps their head down and is in robot mode...  By far the worst Chipotle I ve been too out of at least 11-12 I ve been too  and unfortunately this is the closes one to me.
ROACH IN THE FOOD  AND IT WAS ALIVE. This is absolutely disgusting and unacceptable. I was in the middle of my meal when I discovered it. So grossed out.
Painfully slow  constantly running out of items and increasing the wait time.   Happens frequently  not a one time occurrence.

Amazing service   When I arrived there was a bit of a line  but the employees were all kind and informative letting the next person in line know they would be right with them. Just the acknowledgement when people have been waiting and are hungry alleviates the hanger and impatience. After ordering  I noticed I would have liked a bit more cheese on top of the tacos. The staff were kind enough to add a bit more and even offer an additional clean lid  while socially distancing. Best Chipotle service I ve had in a while

Guac wasn t made with any seasoning...plain and flavorless  Handful of chips with guac. very pinchpenny  Rushed from the tortilla guy on through the whole line. Ignored my asking for a side of beans  saying  here you go  and sliding the tortillas down the line. As in  I m not going to tell you I m not the condiment side guy  you   amp  4 .   They forgot my daughter s chicken for her make-your-own tacos.   Needs a serious attitude adjustment all around.

Ordered 3 rice bowls carried out.  When we got home the rice was raw.  This isn t the first time the rice or beans have been undercooked but this time the rice was not edible.  Tried to call twice and no one answered the phone.  Very displeased.

This chipotle was very rude with one of my recent visits. I had gone to chipotle on my lunch from work  unfortunately I forgot my wallet at home. I had some gold dollars and change in the car luckily because I didn t have time to go Home. I sat in the line going out the door because there doing mobile orders while you sit there. The lady had Schaffed at me off when I had handed her the gold dollars to pay for my meal. She then said I had to have exact change. I explained that I didn t have my wallet and she could keep the extra 24 cents. Instead she told me no and I had to leave super embarrassing and rude. Especially since there were no signs saying they had to have exact change or you can t pay in cash.
One of those chipotle locations that gives you half a scoop of everything and like 5 chips so you re paying  12 for a snack. Just go to the one on BeeCave road

I like this Chipotle  I ve been here several times over the past few month  amp  NEVER had a bad experience. Sometimes they are busy with a long line  but they get through it quickly like any other Chipotle. Maybe the other reviewers were here on days when they were overwhelmingly busy due to popularity  Anyway  I personally recommend this Chipotle location and I enjoyed lunch here today.

Hey Chipotle franchise owner for this location on Brodie  do you simply not care about what s going on     This is the 2nd time this happens  so I had to speak up.  Today at 7ish pm we went in to order a few things to go.  There was no chicken we were informed.  The steak they did have was burnt and dry.  I asked to wait for more to be cooked  as I was informed it was almost done   it looked raw.  I asked if more was coming soon  maybe I just received the undercooked batch   I was very rudely told that was all they had.    With all of the buzz in the news and the lack of lines you re experiencing these days  you d think you d place customer service and quality at the top of your list.  Unfortunately  neither were there today or the previous visit.  There are too many amazing places to eat to bother with this location again  and from the reviews other s have left  I think sadly for this location on Brodie  it s not us  it s you that s causing this break up.

What the hell was up with this    Mr. Grill Master in the back was showing off his grilling skills to apparently VIP access members with no hair nets and long hair flopping all over my food. Idk if the Health Inspector would have enjoyed that  but I certainly did not. As a Chiptopia Survivor  I am seriously disappointed with the quality of this establishment.

For the love of everything that is holy in this world STOP and I mean STOP putting sweet tea in every tea container even when it s labeled  unsweetened     This is just so stupid I have to write this but the last 4 times I have been in whoever is making the tea only knows how to make sweet tea and it s disgusting    My food was fine enough. The chips are always stale and have so much salt on them they are almost inedible. So imagine trying to wash that salt out of your mouth with a big gulp of the unsweetened ice tea you believed you got. Only to find out it was SWEET TEA  It was an assault on my mouth.   Am I being dramatic....yes  of course.  However  come on Chipotle...it s not rocket science.
The queso is not good. It s gritty. The amount you get in a serving  for 2 people  is a joke. I think real ingredients are great  but please add some sodium citrate or something to make it smooth.

I know it s hard to find good employees that work hard and are friendly and act like they want to help customers. But it s not impossible. It starts with leadership - managers that model the behaviours. If the managers are hustling to clean dirty tables and greet customers with a smile and hello  then that can become the standard. And then you can ask young kids to do it and they will have a standard to emulate. The food is the same at every Chipotle. It s a factory. Pretty hard to mess that up. But I don t see managers that care and then the employees don t care enough to to greet customers or maybe they don t care enough to wash their hands. This can be and needs to be improved.

The three girls working at the counter were not polite to me and my friend. They forgot about my quesadilla  didn t let me add more ingredients to it  and didn t even cut it in half before they sent me out the door. They were not responsive and made the experience very uncomfortable. They continued to check people out as I stood in the corner  finally asking if they forgot about my food. They put it in the bag with the food falling out onto everything else  1 10 experience.

Usually chipotle is a good compromise between fast food and good food.  Never great  but reliable  eatable and relatively fast. Sure  the  barbacoa  is really just roast  but it works for what it is.  Not today. Everything was a hassle. No tea  disjointed service  dry steak  no baskets for our burritos.  The usual well-oiled machine was dry and out of time today.  My guess is that they have a lot of new staff and waiting for a few weeks is a good idea.

I eat at chipotle all the time and usually it s great. However  this location was awful. The guacamole I received was brown and not fresh  lettuce was left off my bowl  and the white and brown rice were doused with so much lime juice it was basically inedible. The server was so stingy with ingredients my bowl was maybe half full. Not sure what s going on with this location but I was very disappointed.

I picked up an online order yesterday afternoon and every one of my items was wrong. On top of that the quantity was about 1 2 to 1 3 of what they normally give. They put probably 2 full spoons of sour cream on my bowl which 3 ingredients were left off of  which made the bowl a creamy gross mess.  I usually don t have an experience this bad here but I m probably not going back. I understand getting one order wrong. That s a mistake. But seriously I ordered 3 bowls and they were all wrong and missing about 1 2 the food.  This wasn t a case of getting someone else s order either as our names were on the lids.  The food was not fresh tasting either. We ate what they gave us even though it was not what we ordered. It was not good and I had immediately wished I would not have eaten it. I was so irritated that I was not willing to drive 30 min to get the order corrected.  I called to complain and ask for a refund and was told to send a comment to their website. I have not had any response to my complaint as of now.  Very bad.  UPDATE   I heard back from their support and have been offered a free meal card which I am happy to accept. Updated to 2 stars for now.
Great Service and food  Very consistent.

I hate when I have a craving for chipotle   I normally don t feel the urge because the line is Usually too long and I know I ll talk myself out of it before I reach the end of the line   but last weekend I waited it out.... well  it was ok. It wasn t terrible and I realize my bowl is very basic compared to all the possibilities but still..... I do not like fatty chunks of unchewable meat in my bowl    I went with the steak bowl and very little rice   lettuce red salsa tiny bit of corn too.  Everything had tons of flavor but the meat was a bit rare even for me and then the fact there were literal chunks of fat mixed in with the meat.  I had to spit them out cuz I couldn t quite get through it   no bueno.    Service was mediocre not sure what to even expect  so meh. I m good for awhile chipotle .
Honestly one of the worst Chipotle s I ve ever been too. Waited 30 min for an online order  did not taste fresh at all and overall just a bad experience.

We rediscovered Chipotle and didn t die of food poisoning. The good news and bad news is that nothing has changed.  Their food has always been quite tasty and I m super happy that their animals are raised humanely  so it was as good as ever on that front. It s also convenient and the people there are friendly.  The atmosphere is also the same  boooooring. That said tasty beans  yummy meats and fresh produce. I recommend it

I have been to this location  on Brodie Lane twice. Both times it was dirty. The food area was messy  the floor was dirty  and there were dirty dishes on uncleaned tables. The food was fine but not worth the mess. I would strongly suggest patronizing the South Lamar location.
We ordered two items for pick up. Both items had the correct label but were made wrong. Not only that but the wait was an additional 20 mins. Don t online order from this place.

I ordered a single single burrito on the app yesterday at 3 PM and it told me it was gonna be ready at 3 30 PM. So I show up at 3 30 and the line was very long and my food wasn t ready so I took a seat and waited patiently. I have 10 minutes went by I went up to the front counter and asked if it was ready and the man assured me that it was on the way and they were working on it. I waited another 20 minutes and still nothing so I decided to get in line and order some chips and guac. As I approach the register to pay I told the man that I was still waiting for a burrito from my mobile order and once again he assured me that it would be out soon. I then waited another 20 minutes and still nothing and other people had come in and grab their mobile orders. So once again I go to the front register and ask him about it and he acts completely shocked and tells me he can make it right then and there but after waiting for almost an hour I told him I wanted a refund and I was going to eat somewhere else. I have worked in the food industry for the last 4 years and understand places can get busy. But that is no excuse to not check up on a costumer who has been standing in your lobby for over 40 minutes waiting for his mobile order that he places over an hour ago. I will not be coming back to this chipotle until they fix their management.

I love chipotle  but today was my last trip to this location. Portions are smaller than other locations. I even paid for double steak to have extra for lunch the next day. However  the  double  was an intentional half scoop  I mean he picked up a full spoon and dumped half of it back . When I asked if they could a full serving like the 1st spoonful since I was happy to pay for it... I got a look.   Why I m not going back  Much of the steak  like others have commented  is half fat and it s a 50 50 chance that the meat is actually marinated. Unfortunately both happened again today  so bland

This location is infuriating to go to. It s seemingly run by disrespectful children who take priority over cracking jokes and talking about customers  instead of handing orders or having any sense of customer service or efficiency. Literally the worst run Chipolte I ve ever been to. Dont go here.
Went in at 10 45 when they opened. The store was very clean  the food very fresh  and most of all very gracious employees. Loved my visit

I stopped in this chipotle for a late lunch this past Sunday afternoon. Place was a mess. Tables were dirty. There were no utensils stocked. I ordered a chicken bowl with brown rice  black beans and all the veggies and some chips  amp  queso. First off the chips were stale and the queso was luke warm. As fkr tge bowl  I have to say I was surprised by how little chicken they actually put in it. I mean it was very hard finding any chicken in my bowl. It seemed like every spoonful I was eating was mostly rice  beans and veggies. I don t think there was more than 2 oz of chicken in my entire bowl  Has the price of chicken gone up overnight  Or perhaps they re trying to save money by skimping out on people s orders  Maybe they re trying to make up for the money they lost in that food contamination crisis they had a while back. All I know is for  12 and change they should ve put a helluva lot more chicken in my bowl. Well then I guess it s Buh-bye Chipotle   Time to go back to good ol Cabo Bob s   That place is always on point. It s just a farther drive for me. But after this last encounter I de rather drive there. The food tastes better at Cabo Bob s and also seems fresher plus they always pack your food with plenty of protein.

Teenagers  Check  Angsty teenagers  Check  Angsty teenagers that work here that don t really care to make your meal  want to rush you through the line without listening to your order  and give you tiny portion sizes  Check   That checklist has never failed me at this locaiton  I have the same experience every time. Chipolte  however  is freaking delicious  and nothing will deter me from getting my corn salsa fix   So  if you want Chipolte and this is your nearest location  go  It tastes just like the rest of them  Just be prepared to say   Just a little more  please   or  Can I get a lot of sour cream    Yum

Writing this review makes me so sad        I LOVE Chipotle so much  I have been going to Chipotle for years and have never experienced disappointment until last Thursday. I picked up to burrito bowls for take out. My boyfriend and I were both shocked at the size of the bowl  it s half the size of the normal portion given by Chipotle locations. The tortilla on the side we ordered ended up being 1 single tiny tortilla that you would use for a taco and was hard as a bone. The amount of meat in my boyfriends bowl left a whole lot to be desired.   The only reason why I am giving this a 2 star instead of a 1 star is because of my overall love for Chipotle  but there is NO love for this location. I am deeply disappointed.

Service was not good. Asked for light rice and got about 3 grains of rice--the bottom of the bowl was barely filled. Asked for a side of guac and it was halfway filled up. The guac looked like it was leftover from the night before. We were the first customers of the day--expected much better.

I stopped at this chipotle and bit into my burrito  it contained frozen corn salsa.   It was inedible  even though I m usually not picky  I couldn t eat it.  I quietly took my burrito back to the register and the employee laughed  said he was sorry and proceeded to ignore me.  I continued to stand there in hopes he d either offer to make me a new one  or give me my money back  and he seemed frustrated.  Finally  out of annoyance  he said  do you want a new one or something   As if it was an unreasonable request.  I was so embarrassed and annoyed myself that I just answered no and walked out.  It was terrible customer service.
Probably my worst experience at chipotle. The rice was undercooked and my burrito bowl was flavorless.

Let me start off by saying that I love Chipotle. I ve been going to Chipotle for years. I have lived in Oak Hill for about a year now  and unfortunately this is the closest Chipotle to my house.   They are extremely slow at preparing food  and there s always staff that seems to be standing around doing nothing. The productivity at this chipotle reminds me more of a city construction team than a fast food restaurant.   They are also always out of food. They were out of chips at one point. I asked them how long u till they would be finished  and they said they were not making them the rest of the day.   To top this all off  the staff is often rude. I asked for tomatoes in my burrito  and the rude little child behind the counter said  you mean pico de gallo   No  I mean the other salsa made primarily from diced tomatoes. How about you just make my food and not give me an attitude    Avoid this place if you can

Horrible  I love chipotle  but this location in particular was horrible.  Walked in today   on Monday at 430pm. This place smelled like a restroom   and there was not one table clean.. although the restaurant was empty.   The floor looked like a kid had a free for all.  Trash cans were pouring over.   Chips were stale.   Sad. ..very sad...   I d give it a zero star of I could.   Talked to the manager and he seemed incompetent.   I had to ask for my refund and stormed out after.

Watch out for the Cockroaches  A cockroach was on the food line counter when I walked up to order  and not even one employee seemed concerned while we watched it crawl on the food counter          I pointed it out and alerted 4 different employees and they acted like it would be a regular event   We waited for someone to apologize or offer some sort of customer serviceinstead all of the employees completely ignored us  Really disappointing

They get 2 stars for the food but nothing else. This place is dirty  poorly managed  and the workers don t listen to your order. I asked for a kids meal  and the guy was like..  Where is the rest of your meal   when looking at a foiled quesadilla.    Ummm.. You haven t made it yet.  I replied.  then I had to ask for lettuce to be the main ingredient in a SALAD bowl. Like for real  And they acted like I asked for tequila in the dang thing. It s just lettuce    They have a line out the door because they can t serve people quickly. 3 people on the front and 2 in the back not wearing gloves..
Y all the queso tastes like bland chalk dust... even after they have supposedly revised the issue. I d rather go to freebirds.

Don t go to this location  First of all  I have never left a bad review anywhere and Chipotle is my favorite quick place to eat but since I travel a lot  I have eaten at locations all over the U.S  but this particular location is bar-none the worst Chipotle branch I have ever experienced. I have ordered from here many times  in-person mostly with a few times ordering ahead on the app  since moving here this year and every single time they are unprofessional. The past two times I was the only person standing in line and I had to wait for over 5 minutes while the employee ran their cleaning hand towel painstakingly slowly over the counter multiple times  pushing dried corn laying on the metal counter back in with the fresh corn  without ever saying anything to me or giving me eye contact when I stepped up to the counter. Very bizarre. Then they give me smaller portions  half a spoonful  of rice  beans and protein than any other location I ve been to. The cashier lady the past 3 times has TEXTED on her phone while I stand there with my credit card and talks about unprofessional things with her coworker while I wait for her to ring me up. I always ask for lemons at the cashier and all the other locations have always opened up the little fridge behind the counter and handed me one of their pre-cut lemon cups with the lid. This location always tells me I can t have lemons because they didn t have any cut up. One time I politely asked if they could cut a lemon for my lemon water and the cashier ROLLED their eyes at me  went into the back for 3 minutes and handed me a whole lemon in a sauce cup without a lid. I have tried giving them the benefit of the doubt many times at the is location and it is a shame that it is here in particular  would be unfortunate anywhere though  because this is the area most convenient for me to grab lunch dinner  but I won t put up with this unprofessional  RUDE location anymore. Note to MGMT - you need to vet who you are hiring because I know this location has a very high turnover rate and a lot of unhappy customers.
This particular location really skimps you on the meat. Worse than any other Chipotle.  -

Probably the worst run Chipotle in Austin especially when compared to the great Stassney location.  Rather than write out a long review here is what is wrong at this location  - Bathrooms are almost never clean  sink is all rusty and smells like urine - Often booths are left dirty - How are there ALWAYS crushed chips all over the floors  - Rice is pretty much always low or out so they give meager portions. - They never seem to strain the beans enough so it soaks into my burrito and is a mess if I take it to go. - Ordering online  Why bother. They won t start it until AFTER your pick up time anyways.  Really though the most frustrating thing is the last bullet point. Why even OFFER online ordering if my wait will be longer than if I had just come in and waited in line  This isn t a one time deal either but a repeated and very frustrating problem. NONE of the other locations have this issue and the worst part about it is that I normally order in non peak times like 1 30 PM or 7 PM  and it is STILL an issue.

I had a terrible Chipotle experience at the Sunset Valley location.   First the amount of ingredients I was given in my bowl was definitely less than normal. The chicken was almost out so I got the scraps which was not the usual amount.  The employee doing the vegetables was busy filling guac and salsa cups and finished that before asking me what I wanted.  The last employee I interacted with smelled like cigarettes and was OBVIOUSLY under the influence of drugs. I don t find the smell of cigarettes appetizing  and I think most people would agree with me on that. Not only did he smell like it  but the bowl I got smelled like cigarettes as well.   I also got chips and guac and did not get enough chips.   Overall the amount of food I got was far less consistent that every other Chipotle I ve gone to. The employees did not care about my experience  and they did not act like they cared AT ALL.   This was one of the worst dining experiences I ve ever had and I m very surprised it came at a Chipotle. I don t know who the manager was or if there even was a manager  but it is very disappointing to me that they would let this continue or even start in the first place.

Place was ok  nothing that would make it stand out  next to the other Chipotles. Long line of course  and always out if something. Burrito wasn t hot at all  food tasted kind of bland. Super packed  so not a lot of seating. Wasn t a big fan of this location at all.

Now I realize that evangelizing Chipotle on some level seems akin to blasphemy  what with them once climbing under the covers with the golden arches and all  a union since undone  I believe   and hell  it s a chain.  Reviewing some chains separately  and this one would likely fall under that umbrella  is a little bit of folly.  Bring your meats  beans  salsas  torillas and loads of black  amp  white artwork  snarky typefaces  and corrugated metal   rinse  repeat.    But something occurred to me today when I sat down here for lunch  staving off the last of a heavy duty sugar crash.  I may well prefer Chipotle to  say  Freebirds.  Not a popular opinion  and there certainly aren t the options here you see at FB s.  Certainly isn t the quirky Austin-friendly goofball vibe you get at the other place  but on a day when I needed a big fat taco and enough rice and cilantro to make my face sweat  there was Chipotle  with a heapin  helping of lovin . This week they sent out a free burrito coupon  so everyone and their dog was in there on the cheap  but hey  it s occasionally good to remember that there is such a thing as a free lunch.    Just not often.
Terrible location  dirty tables and sticky floor. Rude unhelpful staff and bad customer service I had. My burrito was cold  when I mentioned that  they just ignored me. The soda station is a mess.

I have been going to Chipotle for years  and almost took a picture of the taco-sized burrito they tried to make me when I ordered online. The staff is rude  they are constantly out of things like Tabasco  and every single one of the workers tries to skimp on every single ingredient like they were trained to withhold food from us or something. This location is an absolute joke and I hope you read this before trying to come here.

Dirtiest  messiest Chipotle I ve ever eaten at   There was unwanted red bell pepper in my beans which the employee picked out with her hand  gloved at least  .  Food items all along the serving area were mixed and spilled.

What is their problem when one person orders for multiple people  e.g. My wife or I order for us and our children   They are always irritated and stressed.  Today they basically insisted we order ahead online.  Say what you will about people from Mexico and South America taking our jobs and all  but since this Chipotle replaced the line servers with  North Americans  the experience has gone down hill for us.  The Hispanic workers are still there cooking in the back and cleaning the restaurant  but the snarly  American  line servers look like deer caught in headlights when things get busy.  Hey Chipotle  take a tip from Freebirds and Torchy s and let your servers smoke a few bowls before work so they mellow out and go with the flow making burritos and tacos

I ve recently been to this location twice. Both times the employees on the line register have been obnoxious and paid very little attention to me as I was trying to order. They seemed much more interested in their childish conversation than making sure they got my order right.  The food tasted bland compared to other locations. The chicken and fajita veggies were burnt and overcooked. I m very disappointed with this location which is unfortunate because it s the closest one to where I live.  I m a big fan of Chipotle  but I would avoid this location if you can

I really enjoy Chipotle.  For some reason  I feel slightly embarrassed admitting this.  I order the burrito bowl with black beans  no rice  chicken  corn salsa  extra scoop please   tons of cheese  more  more  more   guacamole and lettuce.  The chicken is so good.  It is marinated and grilled to yumminess.  I am not a huge fan of chicken breast  but when it is this flavorful I am.  The corn salsa is delicious and fresh.  The guacamole is one of my favorites and worth the extra charge.    Here is my secret.  I eat my bowl with their tortilla chips  which are delicious with a hint of lime.  I essentially use the bowl as dip.  A friend turned me onto this and I have never looked back.  It is a healthy meal without the tortilla chips  but so much less enjoyable.  I like that they try to be more sustainable and healthy.

Dear Chipotle  I had never eaten at a Chipotle restaurant but had stuck my head in at one nearer my house  Barbara Jordan Blvd. 78723 . One of my friends on staff at my work loves it because the food choices are so healthy. So I decided to try it - the one near me looked great. How about a different one  Sunset Valley   This location was dirty. There were 4-5 booths  either 3-4 were dirty. Food on the seats. The floor was dirty. The other tables hadn t been bussed. Yikes  My husband thought the same.  Why did I stay  My friends were meeting us before our movie and I have lots of food allergies and couldn t find another place in time.   Out of the shoot  no corn tortillas. Apparently you had trouble with your supplier and weren t carrying them anymore. Not so good for someone who needs gluten free but would like a tortilla. The fried ones you had were  fried.  I should have known not to eat one because of the amount of oil that showed when I cracked one in half  not so healthy.  When we asked for salt  we were directed to the drink stand area where there was a small open container of salt - that I - and everyone else in the restaurant would have to pinch with our fingers. It s flu season so I declined. Later our friend asked for some and pointed out that there was only the  let s make people sick  one and was given another open container of salt. Nice for us to have salt - difficult to use amongst four as we didn t want to stick our fingers in it so we poured it in our hands.   It was a horrible first impression. Dirty  unsanitary  and my stomach really hurt that night. Also  I did note that not everyone was wearing gloves as they handled food items.   Read a few of the Yelp reviews  wish I had  apparently  I am not the only one that felt it was sub-sub-par.https   www.yelp.com biz chipotle-mexican-grill-austin osq Chipotle Mexican Grill  P.S. Haven t gotten up the courage to try another Chipotle since I was sick that night  wonder if it was the workers without gloves or the oily tortilla  .

Let me start by saying I love Chipotle. My son and me eat there at least once a week. We usually grab some grub from the restaurant on Lamar. We are always more than completely satisfied with the service  the food  and the portion size. Also the food is always hot and fresh.  Tonight we stopped at the Brodie Lane location. Underwhelmed and disappointed are the first things that come to mind.  I ordered the chicken bowl and my son and his friend had the barbacoa burrito. This was my sons friend first time eating at a Chipotle so we were somewhat excited to introduce him to a great place for an overstuffed burrito.  I should have listened to the voice in my head when I looked at the containers in the serving station. All of the container were do low with contents that I couldn t see the ingredients from the other side of the counter. Anyhow my son ordered first. He had the barbacoa burrito.  The young man behind the counter wasn t putting enough ingredients on the tortilla so I mentioned that he was being a little stingy with the helpings and he just shrugged his shoulders as if to say so what. He didn t put anymore than 1 tablespoon of Barbacoa on the tortilla  not even a good grab with the tongs being use.  My sons friend ordered the same thing with the same result. I wasn t going to order anything for myself. I wish I listened to the voice in my head.  I ended up getting the chicken bowl. The final product was added and the ingredients didn t even reach the rim of the bowl. Now if I didn t know what is usually the standard I may have been okay with the amount of ingredients.  Not only were the amount of ingredients not the usual standard  the food did not have that fresh taste that keeps me coming back.  I just asked my son what he thought of his burrito and his response was   pretty small burrito.  His friends response was  not impressed   Bottom line is food wasn t fresh and portions for the price paid were not what I usually receive from other stores I ve visited-weekly.  So  my advice is to stay away from the Brodie lane store. The kid could have so easily just added more ingredients instead of shoulder shrugging me .  For the price Taco Bell would have been a better choice. At least I wouldn t still be hungry. Who is ever still hungry after eating at Chipotle-usually no one.

Three stars is being generous because when it s good it s good but I have to agree with a lot of the bad reviews for this location.  It s the closest to us and so we order from here a lot because we love the food.  My last three online orders were screwed up.  I had to drive back on one of them because the orders were so screwed up that nobody wanted them  40 minutes round trip .I ve arrived at the house twice now to find the kids build your own box nearly empty.  Tonight s had only the chicken in it and one small tortilla in it.  One of the burritos was so poorly wrapped that it was falling apart.  It wasn t even crowded tonight.  Just sloppiness.  These aren t isolated incidents any more and are becoming more commonplace.  Seems like a lot more supervision is needed here.  I ve had great meals there so I know they can do but it s often a hit and miss.  You guys can do better  come on   And AGAIN   When the manager isn t there it s complete chaos.  The line keeps running out of items.  I ve had people behind the counter double team me on orders so that they distract me on one an then screw up the other.    When the manager is there it all flows well.

They re open until 10  but that doesn t mean they have all the ingredients until closing time. Veggie bowl usually includes guacamole  but not at 9 30. Don t go to this location if you re looking for a late-night spot.

If I could give this Chipotle location 0 stars  I would. It was the absolute worst experience I ve ever had in my life in any food joint.   I am anemic and suffer from low blood sugar if I don t eat every couple hours. Within the span of a couple minutes  my blood sugar dipped and I stumbled and fainted in front of the cashier. I hit my head and was on the ground and no one did A THING. My friend was frantically trying to get my attention and help me up and finally the cashier tells me  doesn t ask  tells me to sit down as if I was fooling around and a huge inconvenience.   To top that  when I finally get to my table with the food  the burrito I ordered had barely any rice  the main part of my burrito since I wanted very little chicken and was almost entirely toppings. My first bite was nothing but pico and I almost threw it up after having my fainting spell.   No one did or said anything at all during this whole ordeal and I am disgusted by the lack of respect from this establishment. I will never be eating here again.

I ve eaten lunch here a few times in the last year.  Food always seems fresh and the service is adequate. I mean you go down the line and they scoop in whatever you want - what could go wrong. I guess the chain survived the poisoning of people since they seem to be busy. I ll go back if I m close at feeding time but I won t go out of my way to get here.
I ve been coming here a lot over past year and I always get the same thing. The bowl over time got smaller and smaller. This is today s  It s just becoming less worth for me to buy it for lunch.
My husband  myself  and my 2 year old ate here for lunch on Saturday 9 8 18. We ALL got food poisoning the following day. I did report this to management.

I m not sure if I ve just been lucky  but I love this location. Their portions are fair  if not generous and I can t say that I ve gotten bad service - which I totally have at other places. I will drive all the way across town to this location until they give me a reason not to.

I m guessing this place pays their employees next to nothing judging from the horrible customer service provided by the staff.  Food is average at best here but this is my 3rd and last visit here due to the poor service.  Or maybe they are all deaf     Oh how I wish Baja Fresh or Rubio s was nearby

I love Chipotle  and frequent different locations around Austin regularly.  The Brodie location is the worst in town. The staff is consistently rude  online orders are incorrect  and the quality of the food is much lower than other locations in town.   Drive an extra few miles to Lamar for a better burrito.

I love chipotle  but this particular store is VERY POORLY MANAGED. I m giving it couple more years before it closes for lack of Management if they don t take dramatic measures to turn the store performance around.

I just went here to grab lunch before coming home and got my order to go. I didn t realize till I got home my food was cold. Since it was just after 11am my guess is they had left over meat from last night and pulled it out of the fridge to serve for lunch today. I guess it hadn t warmed up yet. For a company that prides itself on fresh  ingredients left overs from the night before are not fresh. This is one of the worst meals I ve wasted  10 on. My beans and rice were not hot either. When I say my food was cold in spots I mean cold.  Not luke warm but cold.
They have crappy corn tortillas  it fell apart when I picked it up after waiting in line 25 minutes. They used to have good food  but today crappy.

Chipotle is my go to when I need something fast and relatively healthy. I normally run by the store on south Lamar  but decided to stop at the one at sunset valley because it was closer.  Never again  The standards of Chipotle definitely don t apply to this location. First initial impression  they were out of lettuce. How does that happen  I told them I would wait for them to cut more and their response was  It will be awhile because we have to wash it 3 times.  What  Okay so I had to get shredded lettuce for my salad  I ll live. After my order was completed  I stood at the cashier line and waited for someone to help me  for what seemed like 4 or 5 minutes. To my surprise  that person was loading and unloading dirty trays while they watched me wait. Also  while looking around I discovered how filthy everything was around me. Food all over the floor and a completely unorganized team running the line. If the cashier was at least pleasant  I probably wouldn t have wrote this review. However  she was quite rude and barely looked up at me or made eye contact while taking my money. I am still in the parking lot while writing this review because I am so appalled at the experience I just had. Definitely will not be back to this location

I Placed an order online and it wasn t made when I got there. That s fine. Guy at the counter proceeds to serve 15 people in line after being told that I m there and waiting on my food. I won t be back here.

I realized all of my reviews are positive and I need to balance that out by reviewing some of the  businesses I was not impressed with. This Chipotle location came to mind first. Consistently sloppy  luke warm cold burritos. And don t even think about ordering a quesadilla to go  unless you just want to eat it from the bottom of the bag with a spoon.  Why do I still go here  My family loves Chipotle. I like Chipotle as a whole just fine. This one.... thumbs down with a fart noise. It doesn t matter. No one checks the reviews on Yelp before ordering Chipotle.
Compared to the other Chipotles I ve been to  this one seems slightly larger and capable of handling the large lunch crowd.
The workers were using bleach at 7 30pm and the smell was over powering the food. Aren t they suppose to wait till they are closed  The outside area was so dirty and needed to be cleaned.

This is THE worst location I have ever bought food from. I went to this location to try another chipotle location other than the good south lamar location. BIG MISTAKE. First off their food tasted gross. Just plain and no flavor. Haven t been back since and don t plan on it. My only complaint was about the food. Seems this location has LOTS of problems though.

Been here many time. However  today line workers were soooooO slow....molasses city usa  Mainly there were two too many working the line...tripping over each other and no elbow room to scoop food items.  Also  I did not recognize any faces...Second reason line movement was slow...slowest meat scooper ever. She must have thought she was the protein picasso  4 Stars for food  2 Stars for line workers

Will never go back   The poor staff was completely untrained. We got home with a burrito that was split apart and had to be eaten like a salad  bowl of mush  and my bowl consisted of a few grains of rice dotted with steak but piled high with lettuce and corn   I tried to tell the kid it was not right but he was so nervous I just gave up. Done
Seems inconsistent on the quality and service front. Not worth my time to review but definitely worst Chipotle I ve been to

Love this place   The line can be a little long at times but worth the wait. The food is always amazing. I get the same thing now every time I go but many other things there look really good as well. The place is always clean and the service is fast. The staff is friendly. I have no complaints about this place other then I have to pay extra for their amazing guac and that they have no queso option. If chipotle was to do queso I would probably be buying it every time I went. Over all though the portions are generous for what you pay. I give this place a two thumbs up

Just a quickie  Yummy deliciousness - as I find at most Chipotles.  However  the customer service at this location is 5 Star.  About a week ago  one of the burritos  contained the wrong meat  I should have noticed  but instead  believing that as a woman I could multi-task with two different orders  talking on the phone  and searching through my purse for my method of payment...I somehow missed it during the burrito building process   Today  my dinning companion  nicely mentioned the mess up and the manager was more than friendly.  He comped my companions burrito and informed us that he would take care of us the next time we came in.  Awesome -- seriously great service that will keep me coming back to this location for sure.

Burrito bowls are the way too go. Always filling. This Chipotle is a great franchise with hard working staff. Fresh ingredients and honest marketing menus. Clean restaurant and fast service  though sometimes there is a rush at lunch and the line gets crazy. I m a regular here.

Incoming Chipotle Virgin    I recently watched an episode of Oprah where the founder of Chipotle was on and talking about the fresh  hormone free  local  sustainable  organic  bla bla bla integrity of Chipotle. Intrigued that you can get fast food  from a large chain  that is so wholesome  I had to try it. I had avoided them in the past  because I thought I was going to get a burrito the size of my arm  like at FreeBirds  and that has never appealed to me.   So if you have never been here... the menu looks like a secret society cult menu... You have to know how to read it. Enter nice older gentleman behind me in line to assist.   --  Nice Older Gentleman    6.25 gets you a Burrito  2 tacos  a bowl OR a Salad and you get to pick the meat and other ingredients. Add  1.75 if you want Guacamole.   Me   So it s kind of like FreeBirds but you don t have to get the jumbo burrito    Nice Older Gentleman   Exactly.   Me   Seems like too much food.   Nice Older Gentleman   My co-worker gets the salad so she can save the rest for leftovers.   Me   Good idea. Do you think I can get tortillas on the side to build my own tacos    Nice Older Gentleman   I think so.   Me   Thanks    Me   feeling all expert now  ordered a salad with 1 2 steak and 1 2 Carnitas  light black and pinto beans  peppers and onions  toasted chili-corn salsa and fresh tomato salsa  aka. pico de gallo   cheese and lettuce. On the side  sour cream   Tomatillo Green Chili Salsa  and 2 corn tortillas.   --  Loud clap  thunder  the skies opened up...  literally  it began to rain outside . I headed home with my healthy  taco kit  and gobbled down 2 tacos and there was enough left  if I had more tortillas to make 4 more . OK  So I was being all  girl healthy dainty  and thought I would save the rest  but I ate it with a fork. You could make 2 meals out of it...  4-6 tacos depending on the tortillas  but the damn Carnitas are so addicting  I could not stop myself. They were moist  mouth watering and perfectly seasoned.   I wonder how much just the Carnitas sell for  by the pound           My name is Darla A. and I am no longer a Chipotle Virgin... and it was definitely good for me. I will be returning... multiple times.
I enjoy being able to eat Chipotle on just about every corner in Austin.  It never fails that the line is quick  the food is tasty and the workers are happy

Like Camron  I got a coupon for a free burrito in the mail yesterday. And judging by how packed it was at lunch yesterday  I m guessing everyone in my zip code got a coupon for a free burrito.  The food here is good  but it lacks all the options you can get at a local burrito place  like Freebird s  for instance. Only 1 type of tortilla  1 type of cheese  2 choices of beans  etc. They do make up for it  by stuffing that burrito to its limits.

After reading reviews on yelp for places to go and celebrate birthdays  you know places that offer birthday deals  I stopped into this Chipotle because I heard they had a birthday special on Yelp. After I told the cashier it was my birthday she asked the manager and his response to me was  are you used to people giving you free burritos on your birthday     I was under the impression that Chipotle has a birthday special and I guess I made a mistake but that was no reason for them to be mean.  So I paid for my friends burrito and left. That was my first and last time at Chipotle.

I love Chiptole. I know that is blasphemous in this land of amazing tacos  i.e. Central Texas   but you ll be hard pressed to find another taco place that offers tasty responsibly raised   grown food with such a small impact to your wallet.    Having said that  I have found this particular location of Chipotle to be awful. Given that it is so close to me  I still visit it once a week... but I m trying to cut back because I get more frustrated with every visit.  I have several complaints  but I ll focus on two. First  if you arrive for lunch before 11 45  you ll find that many of the food options have yet to be prepared. I recently showed up at 11 30 for lunch and 3 of the 5 proteins had not yet been cooked. The fajita veggies had also not been cooked. Come on  It isn t like I walked in the moment you unlocked your doors. Second  and more importantly... I question how clean the food prep-area is because I saw a roach. Ugh. For this reason my wife refuses to eat there anymore. I m honestly not sure why I do.
