chipotle is my happy place.   doctor visit. sick day from work. got medicine from walgreens. passed out in my bed. woke up hungry. drove to chipotle to get food because it was all I could think about. drove home. ate part of my burrito bowl. climbed back in bed.   good day or bad day  chipotle is a great addition. my usual is a massive burrito bowl. The brodie location has great staff--they are friendly and for me give HUGE portions. I m talking...burrito bowl that last 3-4 meals.   steak burrito bowl rice black beans corn  pico and green salsa cheese sour cream lettuce  SO TASTY    I love that their ingredients are fresh  they move people through the line quickly and efficiently  without being rude   and you don t have to sign your credit card receipt. yum yum yum. leftovers tonight.

Staff is friendly enough. Very unorganized. There was a funky smell today  think wet-dog meets spoiled seafood. I love chipotle. After visiting the newer chipotle on Riverside last week I was craving another bowl today. My wife and I went to dine-in but because her being 6months prego we couldn t due to the awful smell. We got it to go. Dude was nice  all workers had gloves  there was a line about 20people deep. It was 645p. The line did move fast. But they food prep was rushing the order that he didn t ask about lettuce  guacamole or salsa. I had to ask him for salsa and received the  why didn t you say something earlier  look. I didn t even bother with the lettuce and guac. My wife gave me the  we re not coming to this location again.   19 from me and we weren t satisfied. I admire chipotle and love what they stand for. For food they get one star. For location they get one star. Frequent this area so maybe in a few months things will be better.

Chipotle is my crack. I swear they add some secret drug to the salsa that makes me crave a burrito bol. While I feel a little weird reviewing a  gasp  national chain  I am compelled to share the beauty of Chipotle with the non believers.   The food  is awesome. The sour cream is creamy and tangy  the salsas are fresh and flavorful  and the cilantro lime rice is the ONLY rice I will eat in a burrito. The guacamole is the only guac I actually crave - for some reason I never feel the guac I get at local Tex Mex places is fresh like the stuff at Chipotle. Do you wanna know my order  Every time I get a Burrito Bol  no rice  just fajita veggies  black beans  roasted corn salsa  pico de gallo  sour cream  cheese  guac  and lettuce.  Pure vegetable heaven in a bol.   The service  I ve never had any problems with the service at this  Chipotle location. At lunchtime it seems like the entire population of Sunset Valley wants a burrito. So order online or fax your order in. I also love the fact that I don t get weird stares from the staff when I give them my unconventional order  see above   just smiles.   The location  Is close to my condo  but traffic around this area is horrible during lunch time. Horrible I tell you. The streets resemble my  arteries post-queso consumption. Sometimes I don t want to go to Chipotle because I hate the lunchtime and weekend traffic in this area so much. But alas. A pilgrim must suffer in order to reach the holy burrito grail. Onward  burrito devotees

I agree with the others who say that nationwide Chipotle is great  but this location has sanitary issues. For one  the restrooms are often out of soap. That may not be the biggest deal until you realize that the employees probably use the same restrooms. Eww    Let s just hope that none of them have to go number two during work hours ....  Also the rice is often undercooked and they run out of supplies a lot. I love the reviewer who was told by the manager to just eat her salad with a spoon. The tables stay dirty and most patrons just end up cleaning off the tables from the previous customers just so they can sit down and eat. Twice we paid for items that were not received. Today our kids sat and waited for their quesadillas and they finally arrived burnt to a crisp  We told them we couldn t eat those and they said they would bring new ones out but forgot about them again.   Unfortunately this store is not managed well. we used to visit often but will probably stop going now.

My  ex boyfriend would live here if he could.  He would eat Chipotle for breakfast  lunch and dinner.  He d never get sick of it. On a whole  Chipotle s got something for everyone.  The tacos are yummy  I like the corn  amp  mango salsa.  I also really like the rice that they put in their burritos. Their meat is fresh and their guacamole and chips are mouth-watering good.

Today I went to this Chipotle. I got my veggie burrito  and as the guy was folding it  the side slit open a bit. I told him it was fine  I was going to eat it with a fork and didn t want to be wasteful. Before I knew it 3 people were fussing at me about how they can t serve it to me and how horrible it is. I insisted it was fine and that I really wanted it and didn t want to waste a tortilla for no reason. Finally they gave it to me  but said they couldn t charge me for it. What was it  garbage    I think this is one instance of a larger food issue in America. Why when the side of a tortilla splits is a burrito suddenly worthless  It is ridiculous and absolutely stupid. Food is not infinite  it is finite  and it depends on many other finite resources.   This wouldn t be a big deal to other people  but I guess as the daughter of a farmer and as someone who believes in sustainable food  they picked the wrong customer to act this way with today.   The burrito was good though. I honestly would ve rather just paid for it and had a normal eating experience. But I guess not being wasteful is no longer normal.

I am not a fan of this location. Came here at an off peak time and do not remember having too much of a problem with the service. One big issue I did have however  was with the portion size. Chipotle is known for their huge overstuffed burritos which typically leave me full for the rest of the day. This was not the case here.

UGH... and this is coming from someone who dreams about Chipotle burritos...  Good  Your typical ingredients. Clean location.  Bad  The service  They were terrible. They had 3 workers standing around. One must ve just gotten on her break... since another one was taking LITERALLY 5 minutes to carefully stuff that other lady s 3 tacos. The lines were getting long and they all just completely regarded everyone else. I ve never seen any employees at another Chipotle location look like they hate their job so much  It really makes me hate coming here too. My boyfriend and I decided that we re never coming back. They gave the PUNIEST burrito ever. Seriously - taco bell style.  sigh. and i love chipotle

I have always loved chipotle  It s my go to place when I m in need of something quick. This location is in a busy shopping center but I ve never had trouble with parking or the line being too long  Very friendly employees... My only complaint was I noticed the drink area was pretty dirty

When I am craving Mexican food and  need food fast I head here. On my way there I decide what I want Burrito  Taco or Salad.  I get in line and proceed down the line up of food choices as the guy gal behind the food bar builds a meal designed specific to my taste buds.  On my most recent visit I ordered a romaine salad and added chicken  very nicely seasoned marinated  pinto beans  jack cheese  and the salsa with corn.  Very good and what I would consider a light Tex-Mex meal - no need for a siesta afterward     Forgot to add Cheap meal

Staff is generally upbeat but not quite as professional as other stores.  Cleanliness of the restroom grades just above roadside filling station  not smelly but definitely not maintained. Never seen this in a chipotle before .  Outside dining area is a mess  amp  tables not maintained well.  Portion size is small especially considering extra charge for the guacamole.  Food is good.

This place is awesome  It s pretty much like any other Chipotle  which would warrant a 5 star rating from me too  unless something was off  but I ve never experienced this .  I m not a rice and beans in my sandwich kind of person  I need CRUNCH  so I tend to opt for the fajitas with grilled onions and green peppers or the salad bowls. I ve had the chicken and steak and both are really yummy  as are all the other ingredients. The salad bowls are pretty good too and their slightly tangy honey something dressing is absolutely delicious.   It also makes me feel good eating something that s really healthy for me  their sandwiches taste good without being loaded with fatty dressing    And you can t beat the prices either  it s extremely reasonable for how much food you get. I can t usually eat a whole burrito in one seating    The service is always fast and efficient and the food is always consistently good. I will be back here again and again and again.
It s just like all the other chipotles I ve been too. Good food  decent service  clean establishment and overpriced guacamole.

As others have stated  this is one of the worst run locations of Chipotle s in Austin. I had stopped eating at this location prior to all the food safety issues last year  mostly because the lines were always long and slow. Additionally  when you finally got to order your food -- I go for the bowls -- you d have to practically beg to get more than half a spoon of rice and beans. Staffing hint  a goth waif verging on anorexia is probably not the best person to be portioning out the food. And even with the stingy portions  they still managed to always be out low on some ingredient  rice  beans  meat  sauce  etc .   So  fast-forward to last night when I was running errands in the area. I thought  instead of hitting the good Mama Fu s or the excellent Tarka for dinner  I d check out how Chipotle was doing. I cruised by in the car first to check if it had the same long line. Surprisingly  there was no line  not sure if I just timed it right  or if all the bad press has taken it s toll. I went in. First thing I noticed was that the staff looked new. The waifish rice-nazi wasn t there. I walked right up to the counter hoping for a better experience. Nope. It took more than a minute to start my order  because that s how long it took the girl to wrestle her rubber plastic gloves on. If I hadn t been hungry  it would have been comical. Second problem  again  stingy portions    I asked for double chicken in my bowl  and got two spoons maybe 2 3rds full. Sigh. This was most surprising given all the  free food  campaigns they ve done recently. The final issue was an overly animated and friendly cashier. If it has seemed genuine  that would have been one thing  but it seemed force -- and a bit creepy. Like the staff had been ordered to be  Happy  happy  happy  with the customers  or risk getting an electric shock as punishment.   So  I ve written this Chipotle location off. If I want a burrito  I ll stick with Freebirds or one of the other Chipotle locations. Better yet  I ll go to a  real  Tex-Mex place.

This chiplotle location deserves like negative a gagillion stars  They have the ABSOLUTE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. I know I am not at freaking Uchi or Uchiko but this is worse than ANY fast food joint I ve ever been to. Everytime you go  the line is outrageously long -- not bc it s busy but bc the employees are DAMN SLOW. Today is the last time I will go to this location. Today I was about to blowup and insisted to see a manager  but for me -- my lunch break is only 30 minutes  I work nearby . And more than half of that time is spent in the line  So I had no time to argue.  I ve been here many times  and it is consistently bad. But what happened today  I finally got someone to take my order after standing in line for like over 20 minutes. So a nice polite blond chick starts my salad bowl  then hands it to the next dude. And I m waiting for this dude to start asking me other toppings to put in. And the blond chick keeps sliding the other customers food along. So  I patiently still wait  but in my head im like... uh...what is this dude waiting for  So the blond chick obviously took control of situation and started putting my meat on salad and the next customers toppings. And the dude BLOWS UP at her   EXCUSE ME  I DON T TELL U WHAT TO DO. HERE S THE LINE BETWEEN YOU AND ME  YOU DO YOUR JOB AND I DO MINE  STOP INTERFEREING WITH MY DUTIES   etc...  in this childish  loud and dramatic way   that stunned me and the customers next to me  He was throwing a huge tantrum  embarassed himself  and the blond co-worker. I couldn t believe how unprofessional he was and what I was witnessing. I felt so bad for the  blond chick. She continued to be professional  smiled  and tried to like calm him down and assessed the situation   while still trying to take people s orders. And me   I M STILL WAITING FOR YOU TO PUT TOPPINGS ON MY SALAD DUDE. Looking at my watch - I only have like 10 left to eat  So I go  Um Can you put topings for me   And he obviously is upset at everyone and like throws corn onto my salad and like slides it to the next person and she finishes my bowl finally. That whole tantrum took a lot of time  I was so upset - I couldn t even finish my food    AND NOW I KNOW WHY the line is always so long and slow here. Because this location hires IDIOTS AND DRAMATIC UNPROFESSIONAL people      Wasiting customers times with your damn drama. Take that to the back of the house. Where the hell is the manager ANYWAY   I bet this dude would ve been fired on the spot if the manager was present. And now I just read all these other yelp reviews how this place is roach infested  UGH  This place needs to be shut down

This popped up on my check-in list so I might as well review...but this will be short.  Chipoodle is easily my favorite  fast food  place because   1  It is  Food with integrity   I appreciate Chipotle s mission and goals  2  I can stick to my Paleo plan and order a salad bowl and get a tasty lunch while avoiding those items I wish to  3  Guacamole. Yup  even though it s  1.50 extra. 4  It s quick and easy  line always moves fast 5  There is always one last parking spot 6  There is always a seat and a Chronicle 6  Margaritas  at a fast food joint  Score

This location is awesome and consistent as others have posted.  All food is fresh and they never scrape the bottom of the barrel for your order.  I always have to park in the Subway parking lot during lunch because Chipotle is so busy.  Fast and friendly staff.   A

This location is not bad for a cheap lunch  but sometimes I have gotten meat that was a bit dried out  veggies that were burned  and the staff does not seem particularly happy to be there. I mean  who could blame them  But at least fake it.

Yes  it s a chain. No  I am not ashamed to be reviewing this chain. Because it s SO. DAMN. GOOD.  Most people have probably been here multiple times by now  but if you are one of  those  that have not...seriously missing out.  You really can t get more fresh than this place. All of their ingredients are made daily  and you can tell by the taste and appearance. Their burritos  tacos  amp  burrito bowls are all so yummy  no matter what you put in them. I ve only had their chicken and pork  because I can t bring myself to try the other meats  which I ve also heard are delicious  just because I am so stuck on my  usual.    The staff is always so friendly  every single time and they do not skimp on anything. It s also very cheap for the amount you are getting. Great for lunch and an empty stomach

Been to. A LOT of Chipotles before. This is by and far the slowest. Ever. 30  minute wait and that was with 3 people working the line. Make that 4. The line weaved through the restaurant. Find another location.

This is a fairly typical Chipotle.  The food always seems fresh and tastes great.  I usually get the same thing  a veggie bowl  and it seems consistent most of the time.  The service is pretty hit or miss  but it does seem to be better lately.  When my husband and I first started going a couple of years ago  it seemed like the people there didn t like their job or weren t interested in making your food.  Occasionally the portion sizes are off  but if you ask for more they will usually give you more  unless it s meat or guac.

When we first moved to south Austin we started going to this Chipotle. Staff was friendly and food was good. But we ve had bad experiences since there was a change in staff. The manager with the mustache one time didn t listen to my order and had to remake my bowl three times because he was too busy talking to other staff . Then tried to argue with me when I said I didn t want the chicken   which he kept putting in my bowl   because it gave me bad heartburn his reply was like well it all has the same seasoning. The cashiers don t know how to ring up stuff properly and have overcharged a few times. I m  disappointed in the way this location has gone downhill. Chipotle is a great company but they need to retrain this store.

For the most part I ve tried the whole menu the consistency at this location can be off  perhaps due to changes in the cooks  A few times I walked in they had water leaking out into the lobby floor from the back area. This not good for sanitary reasons. No complaints on the food other than Ty consistency. Service is great.whenever I get a quesidilla I do however sometimes get different price some around  4 sometimes close to  7 and that is for a large with chicken. I always dispute it and let then know what I paid last time. Overall I do recommend place outside of lunch hours  because it gets very busy.
Just had the least flavorful burrito of my life. Additionally  the guy who fixed my meal adjusted his hat with the same gloves on that he made my burrito with. Fun times

I have enjoyed Chipotle for many years.  However  I will not be returning to this location.  Like the other recent Yelpers  I too had a bad experience today at this location.  The store smells of dirty mop water and the floor looked like it had not been swept.  Employees seemed more interested in talking to each other than taking orders and getting them correct. I had to repeat myself twice to two different people.  My to-go order was cold and the chips were stale.  Chipotle  please take a look at management at this location and get it cleaned up   In the meantime  I ll stick to the other eateries in the area.  There are too many other great choices to waste money in this  particular store.

Shameful   Just came here for a much anticipated dinner and was dissapointed from the second i walked in.  A very musty  wet rag smell was in the air.  As i got in line  the guy behind the counter that starts your order was just there talking to his buddy and not paying attention.  I took several minutes for him to finally look at us and even then he waited unitl he fully put on his gloves to talk and start taking the order.  After we completed our order  we walked to sit at a booth but it was dirty.  Went over to a second booth  also dirty.  We looked around and that s when we noticed that all the booths and tables were filthy.  The floors looked like a kid has a free for all and no one had swept the floor since lunch time  it was 430 when i went   we grabbed some napkins and cleaned a table so we could sit down.  I asked to talk to the manager  when he finally arrived i told him my concerns about the cleaniness of the resturant.  He just looked at me without any emotion and said ill let my people know and walked off.  When it came to the food the bags of chip that we had gotten were both stale and did not taste fresh.  This was a bit too much to take we asked for our money back and left...the girl at the counter didn t  seem to happy that we asked for our money back and basically just shoved the money back in my hand.  Not good for a place that holds itself on high food standards.
live roaches  i wish i could leave no stars  found a live roach in my food  most disgusting experience ever

Slowest chipotle I ve ever seen. Standing in line right now watching 4 people trying to handle a line of at least 25 people with the pace of a sloth. Where is their manager  Why isn t anyone picking up the pace  Get moving people

This continues to be the worst chipotle. The young man wrapping up my order gave it to the person after me and gave me her food. Got home and it was not even close to my meal. Portions are weak... you pay extra for guac and you still get half a dollop. Manager and ownership suck.

I went in April 13  2015 and ordered a burrito bowl. I paid for my food and was about to take it to a table when I saw a live cockroach on the counter. An employee killed it  did not disinfect the area.  Who knows if he washed his hands before serving more food     I took my food and attempted to find a table. Every booth and table was dirty. Dried hit sauce  cheese  on every table. Meanwhile  the employees were hanging out at one booth not doing their jobs.  I took the uneaten food to the register and got a refund. I also asked for the manager. I tried to show her that the cleanliness was an issue at the restaurant and that I would contact the health department. She said that I didn t need to be upset because I got a refund. And this is a manager    I contacted their corporate office and they have responded via email but claim when they call my phone isn t working. So I will just assume they are not disgusted by the situation.  Will not eat there again.

So apparently I m a late bloomer to Chipotle because this year was the first time I ve ever been.......why did i wait so long.  My life is now complete  thanks chipolte   Everything is so yummy  and i just found out all the meat is naturally raised and everything is organic. Not to mention patron margaritas.  This is the best place for my new thyroid gluten free diet. who could ask for more
Usually a pretty good location but today at 4pm not so good  No veggies and they did apologize or seam to care and food was barely warm.
Burrito bowl      Love it that they use free range products and no antibiotics

Chipotle has always been great  The food at this location is my favorite and the service is fast  as always . The only drawback is the long line I often face when I m craving Chipotle the most. But  thanks to ordering online  that problem is no longer an issue.

Soooo.... I ve never really had a bad experience with Chipotle  and I m sad to have to write this.  I literally just left there with a salad and the lettuce was disgusting.  They were out of lettuce from the beginning of the line  so the guy went down to the end and got some...it looked wilted and more yellows than green.  I should have spoken up.  Got home  had a bite or two and threw the rest away.  Low standards on fresh lettuce Chipotle...

Literally the worst customer service EVER  They were rude to my mom and me all because we showed up early to pick up an online order. Also refused to serve me and my friends because we can in 10 minutes before they technically opened. So we walked over to Mama Fu s and they were happy to serve us before they opened.

The food is always fresh at Chipotle  any franchise  for that matter. Yet  I am still to get a properly wrapped burrito from this  and other Chipotle franchises  that does not fall apart. The quantity of food that goes into the burrito might have an effect in the difficulty of actually keeping everything nicely packed in with the tortilla. A burrito that size wrapped in aluminum foil should look like a big silver bullet and not like a bunch of stuff bundled in a piece of foil. I will be back  sight  as I have not found a place in Austin with a decent burrito that is fresh and that is aesthetically pleasing to the eye.

Was my first visit ever to a Chipotle  and was very pleased. Everything was so fresh and flavorful. The entire restaurant was spotless. The associate serving us explained the process to this newbie.  Had a bowl with carnitas  veggies  rice  beans  cheese  green salsa  and the roasted corn topping. The carnitas were moist and well seasoned. Everything blended together  and the corn add just a touch of sweetness. Couldn t finished it all. An associate manager stopped by for a visit  which it s always nice. Looking forward to going again.

I love this Chipotle location.  I don t know what it is but they seem to do burritos tacos just a little bit better than the other locations.  The staff really know how to roll a burrito and definitely do not skimp on the portions.  At some point I was put on their mailing list and get offers for buy one get one burritos every once in a while in the mail.  You can t beat that.  Their ingredients are always fresh and the prices are cheap.  I could eat Chipotle every day if it wouldn t result in me gaining astronomical amounts of weight.
This location has roaches  My family and I finished our food when we spotted a medium size roach roaming our booth. We will not be returning to this location. Come on Chipotle

If you want great carnita or barbacoa  GO HERE       There food is moist and fresh every single time and their customer service is great.  I hadn t been here in a while but ate it last night.  I always get the crispy tacos the best  .    The last time I was here though  they gave you 4 tacos and now you only get three and they have raised their prices.  The guy told me the tacos are bigger and they give more meat no they aren t and no they don t .......I d still go back because it s the best meat you re going to get

This is one of my all time favs to eat at. You really never have to worry about waiting too long to order your food. They serve fast to keep the line moving  since it s very popular  and great food  I m not one to eat spicy foods and their food isn t very spicy  but I m a sweatter and hate sweating while I m eating. My favorite dish is the Carnita bowl  with white rice  pinto beans  a little cheese  and sour cream...yum yum     I ve had their tacos too. It s pretty rare for them to run out of a meat  because the line crew always stay on point to keep the line moving. So  really you can t go wrong here  fast service and good  fresh ingredients made right in front of you.

The food is cheap. Staff is very friendly. Great Fajitas Bowl. The chips are good as long you love lots of salt on them. The guacamole is good also and the place clean. Lots of parking space in the area.

I ve probably been to half a dozen Chipolte stores. The quality and uniformity tends to be pretty good from store to store. But this one on Brodie Lane is not good. The tables  chairs  floors  windows are dirty. Portions stingy  food is cold  employee attitudes colder. We tried it twice and won t go back.

Tried Chipotle twice  and twice this place served us bitter charcoal which started life as fajita vegetables before being burned black. Even at its best  this place can t hold a candle to great local taquerias like Taco Deli. We won t be giving Chipotle a third chance.

Something has changed in the last few months.  New staff  Yes. New management  Yes. Remodeled kitchen   serving area  Yes.  Has this changed my opinion on this particular Chipotle   YES.  I m really glad to see that this place has gotten better with all of the issues in my previous post and will continue to keep coming here for my Chipotle fix.

My son and I were eating dinner the other day and he mentioned how he missed San Francisco burritos which we used to probably eat at least once a week. These are far from the best burritos Ive ever had but they are not bad either.  A burrito from here equals dinner plus a lunch leftover for me  so not a bad deal plus I can indulge the kid in his San Francisco cravings. I am bitter that I let my free burrito coupon expire even though I had it hanging on the fridge for weeks. Maybe they will send me another one.

I love Chipotle    but it needs some management.  The dining area was a big mess.  A pile of beans on a chair   food all over the floor   trash overflowing...   And then   the workers were a mess.  Chewing gum   nasty dirty shirts and shorts.   This place needs some corporate oversight.

This is a great place to get filled up without emptying the wallet. Yesterday my husband and I were full for hours after splitting a burrito.  We also got chips  salsa and guacamole all for under  10.  I have to say  the service is great too. Even at different locations  the managers are always present and eager to explain.  The only complaint was a sticky table but  we can overlook that.

I passed by this place for years before trying it  thinking that is just another stupid burrito place.  Man was I surprised about a year ago when I finally gave it a try.  I ve never had a bad experienc e here and was totally addicted for a time  but now I go less often.  I don t know what is the  secret ingredient  as someone has said on these reviews.  Somehow  the simple goodness is all there is to it.  I recently tried to make a burrito at home the same way that they do it and it came pretty close.  I just never though to put things together that way.  Here is what I get.  Chicken burrito with rice  black beans  chicken  chunky salsa  mild   cheese and lettuce.  That s it  and it s fabulous.   If there is a secret ingredient  it is the Jasmine rice with lime juice and cilantro.  That is what makes it so special I think  and why my homemade version came so close.   I also get chips and chunky salsa to go with it.  The chips are overcrusted with big salt crystals  which is fantastic.  I like salt stuck to my chip.  Chips need salt.  These burritos are huge and I split one with my wife.  As a younger fella  I would have killed a whole one myself  but now I have got watch the calories.  You ll be over a thousand calories if you eat a whole one.   Or 22  Weight Watcher points  almost a day s worth.   The Dr. Pepper at this place is really  really good fountain soda.
That place was dirty  dirty  dirty. Plus being out of forks  beef and water   Hard to eat a salad with a spoon   Bathroom was nasty--hadn t been cleaned in a while   I won t go back

This Chipotle location has really taken a nosedive  in my opinion.  Our last time here it took literally 10 minutes to place our order  not a complicated order  I just wanted a combination of corn and flour tortillas   on top of that one of the  employees was cleaning dirty tables  emptying trashcans and prepping food  all without a single hand wash.   We let all  that go and tried again today.  The chicken was burned and the line employee gave my wife  a lot of attitude for requesting new chicken.  When they refused to put out fresh chicken  my wife switched to steak instead.  The employee continued to press my wife  insisting the chicken wasn t burned  merely charred .  I think we will stick to the Southpark Meadows location.
That make and serve a great product.  I work close and they are always friendly and fast with service so I can enjoy my lunch at leisure.
Chipotle is Chipotle  but this Chipotle has a really good attitude about customer service. They take care of problems in a  hassle-free manner.   They re also fast and the food is good.
The place smells as if they use old products to wipe down the tables and or mop... This doesn t help when the kitchen seems dirty too

Dirty  untrained  and mismanaged. Easily the worst chipotle I ve been too and I ve been to many. This used to be a decent location but the turnover of the staff has made everything suffer from inattentive service to the poorer than normal quality of the food. Got fajita veggies in my bowl the other day and got large hunks of onion stuck together in massive bundles. Been to some chipotles with suspect service but never a chipotle with food quality issues until this location. The managers don t know how to ring up a side of rice and beans rather they charge for a veggie bowl which is a  4 difference. A gentlemen up front stood there and did nothing while our food sat on the counter next to the bag  and when we told him that was our order he nudged the food in our direction still out of the bag  not to mention they still hadn t put the chips we paid for in the bag...or the guac. THIS CHIPOTLE NEEDS HELP.

My wife is making me write this review  because she s brushing her teeth.  She was very impressed to see the Brodie Ln. Chipotle staff using sign language with a customer today - apparently listing ingredients.  My wife is the kind of person who likes to acknowledge the good in the world - me not so much  what I mean to say is she acknowledges me  but that I don t really like acknowledging do-gooders.   I personally thought the food was great and they were very nice to sell us sliced avocado  not on the menu  for our baby.  I have deducted one star for the surprise trifecta of no soap  no toilet paper and no paper towels in the bathroom.  So  there... I hope you re happy Chipotle

I stared at the burrito man when we started to build my food and told him more more more more more and by the end of it all I had was a tortilla with rice in it  I think it was my own fault great atmosphere 4 stars

I just wanted to give my thanks to a young woman there  Lauren  who helped me and my two small kids out today.  I don t usually frequent chipotle with them  so it was a little chaotic ordering for the three of us and having people accumulate in line behind us  Lauren was patient and extremely helpful and calm  not impatient   she guided the rest of the staff there and made our experience very pleasant.  Thank you Chipotle and Lauren for a job well done
Chipotle is my favorite fast food. Fast  fresh and heathy. It s also pretty consistent across the country. Very cheap too

I love the fact that this Chipoltle is so close to my house. It s a solid go-to place when I want something tasty and filling. I usually get the burrito bowl  now with brown rice  whoot    and it s so big that I can have it for lunch AND dinner. So it s not only good  it s economical
While I like the food  THIS location cannot handle a lunch rush  and has the head banging music turned up WAY TOO LOUD   The employee who we asked about it seemed to care less.

I love Chipotle and have gone to countless locations all over the country. This one is by far the slowest service and dirtiest I ve been in. It s Saturday evening and the line only has two or three people at a time. There s a putrid  mildewy smell lingering that the food aroma can t cover. There are six employees behind the counter  all mingling and doing nothing.  And not one of them checked to see if the tables are cleaned   which they are not. Food crumbs are all over the tables and floors.  This is just not your typical Chipotle at all. And it s too bad since it s in a great convenient location.
Service was terrible  Food  acceptable. Like being served by teenage delinquents in boot camp. Not going back.

I used to go to Chipotle often up north with good experiences but my last visit to this location left me so disappointed I may never go back to any location.  When we walked in my wife had our 10 month old in her arms and out comes the manager who didn t even hold the door for her.  There was a line and I m 2 deep when a slovenly kid loudly and rudely asks us what we want.  I ask for a steak burrito to which he reaches to an empty pan and asks the grill how long it will be   it s gonna be 5 minutes for steak   just give me chicken I reply.  He chucks a small portion of chicken on the plate and the girl next to him rolls her eyes and puts more in because he clearly wasn t trained whatsoever.  Burrito was bland at best.  Attention to detail is completely absent from this location  seems like corporate hubris has ruined this spot and I m sure many others.  Don t waste your time or money.

Chipotle is not like other fast food places.  I know Mexican food probably can t get any better than what you can find in Texas  but Chipotle was a tasty and healthy alternative.  The great thing about Chipotle is the choices you have when you first walk in.  You can choose to have a burrito  taco  burrito bowl  etc.  I ordered the burrito bowl with chicken  brown rice  pinto beans and veggies.  It was excellent.  The chicken was excellent  the brown rice was seasoned perfectly and the salsa was tasty.  It was quick  filling and tasty.  I would recommend this to anyone.
Food was great  but I was expecting a better taste. I prefer Qdoba on taste  but I enjoy Chipotle s organic approach to Tex Mex cuisine.

My hat is off to the manager and staff of this restaurant.  I just stopped by to grab a burrito for lunch - place was PACKED - the line was at least 20 people long.  First thing I noticed was how cheerful the staff seemed - even though they were absolutely slammed.  As I approached the counter  I noticed the front people were smiling  laughing with customers  engaging and friendly - absolutely NOT what you normally encounter at  fast-food  places.  Every single staff member  including the people back in the kitchen cutting meat and cleaning  was cheerful  happy  at least outwardly  and welcoming - I honestly will go back there again JUST for that  but the food was absolutely AWESOME as well - I got a super tasty carnitas  pork  burrito with black beans  salsa and corn - couldn t have been better  and with a side of chips and salsa it was still well under  10.   Well done  Chipotle - you ll be seeing me again

This place was everything a lady on the go could ask for. Clean  fast  moderately cheap  with a no fuss attitude. I ordered the catbirds bowl and shared some chips with a gal pal. The pork was tender and lean with minimal fat which surprised me  but the guacamole was nothing special   I m sure it was a bagged product considering Chipotle is a franchise . All in all not bad  a step up from a Taco Bell and below La Fonda San Miguel.

I have tried this place for lunch many times because it is close to my work. I regret it everytime. They have no salsa that is mild enough for me. All of there meat is spicy. Maybe I m weak but shouldn t you have something for everyone.

Okay we all love Chipotle. I love Chipotle. But this is honestly the worst Chipotle I have ever been to. I have been here time and time again over a year because it is the closest one to my home. The only reason I keep going back is because well  it s Chipotle. It s easy  it s fast  and it s healthy-ish. What makes this Chipotle so bad is I guess the management  the employees have changed some but the problem keeps happening. The portions are small  they are continuously out of ingredients  and about every other time I get home and half of my order isn t even in my bag. I understand that things happen  but these things honestly happen every time I m in there. Not to mention the employees always seem to be entertained with something else. We can all have fun at work but when you aren t making my dish correct that s a problem. My boyfriend got gift a coupon to the Chipotle in South Park Meadows and wow  what a difference. It even just felt cleaner. The portions were normal Chipotle sized  the employees were paying attention to me so a long line didn t take long to run through and when I got home everything was in my bag. It was crazy how much better of a Chipotle experience there could be. We went one more time and it was the same outcome. Great service  I went back to the Brodie and 290 Chipotle tonight  they didn t put my guacamole in my bag that I watched them make and ring me up for. I m done. Never going back. I will be making the drive to South Park Meadows from now on.

I recently stopped in to have a mexican style lunch. Ordered my food  paid  and sat down to eat. While i was unwrapping my burrito i noticed there was a strand of hair in the aluminum foil. So i went back to the counter and no questions asked they remade the burrito. Awesome food and great service just need to be cleaner
My favorite fast food restaurant  At times the quantity varies  per the person   other than that no complaints.
Excellent breakfast tacos Freshest  tastiest pico de gallo I ve had in a restaurant  Borrego tacos were fantastic  Homemade corn tortillas

Stopped in for lunch today and was surprised to find this place as close to where I  live. I ve probably seen it or driven by a million times without considering stopping. The restaurant is nothing special  probably was an old fast food restaurant from years ago  seating is plenty and it was clean staff were definitely friendly and helpful with what I wanted to order on the menu. I chose the Jalisco cheese enchiladas with beef  the server suggested fajita meat which is what I ultimately ended up having. The fajita meat wasn t traditional like you see it a lot of other places  it seemed to be diced up and then grilled with some crunchiness in the enchilada  Still I thought it was pretty good. The rice and beans were good  very traditional  but I liked them. All in all this was a lot of food  enough for me to take half of it home  not sure if I would have it again because of the heat of meat being diced and a little bit crunchy  but I might. I would definitely want to come back and try some other things on the menu. The prices are definitely good for your wallet.

Hidden gem. Indistinguishable from any other little Mexican joint you see around Austin. But believe me you will regret passing it up   Very generous portions of delicious  authentic MEXICAN food   My wife got the 4  mini  tacos which were overstuffed with cooked to order asada  grilled onions  amp  cilantro. I got a pastor taco which was as good as I have ever had   We ll be back for sure.

Their own space has finally opened so I stopped by yesterday for breakfast. I was really underwhelmed and didn t think  14 for one taco and small chai was delivered upon with quality or creativity.   The  5.50 taco was simply a corn tortilla with potatoes and a tiny bit of vegan eggs. No seasoning  no flavor  no texture - an average basic taco.   The chai was also simply average.   The person at the counter pre-selected 20  tip for my takeout order. I am okay with the price if I m getting something delicious  fresh or creative for it. None of those boxes could be checked here.

I really wanted to like this place more than I did. The vibe was nice and I love The Beer Plant.  We went at night for their  Oaxacan  food. Look  it s probably not fair to bring a group of 8 latinos to this place  but the food had nothing to do with Oaxaca. It reminded me of something akin to Arlo s in that it had a bit of fast-food vegan food taste going for it... except everything was 20-30ish dollars...  The highlights were the cocktails  the frozen black one was  great    and the Aguachile  which actually tasted close to a fish based one-- impressive .  That said  the rest of the food was either bland or somewhat strange in flavor that it just really didn t do it for any of us.   To quote my friend   the tlayuda reminded me of food my mom cooked when she didn t feel like cooking   I m hoping these are just growing pains and I ll try it again in a few months  because it _could_ be a good addition to the vegan scene.

We had great service.  I loved the atmosphere...  our cocktail was delicious.    The food was extremely underwhelming.  I love Beer Plant  so I was looking forward to this place...  but it was rough...  I ordered a tlayuda  and it was possibly the saddest meal I have ever been served.  It was a beet tlayuda  smothered in a such a thick layer of black beans  that that is the only thing you could taste...  it was sprinkled with a couple pieces of unseasoned flavorless zucchini  that really didn t add anything  and drizzled with a  salsa macha   which was more like infused oil.  This place was such a dissapointment.

A little hard to find  but is clearly listed  It s a sign right next to Beerplant on the door. The inside is a little bare but  it s a very chic minimalist vibe going on. The girl at the counter was very nice. I came pretty early on a Sunday and there was nobody in there  which is a rare sight for coffee shops in Austin. It s in a neighborhood so might get busier later on the weekdays.   I ordered the coconut mint cold brew and it was totally delicious. It has peppermint and coconut flavor which I never thought would go together so well. It was strong so beware you might get heartburn    I also ordered a breakfast sandwich which I then realized after the fact that this place is a vegan spot. The sandwich was really good and I couldn t tell it was fake meat at all.   Overall  I would return

The shop s exterior was pretty nondescript  but the interior nice enough and of the standard gentrified-Austin variety and felt vaguely...Californian. Did not have high hopes for the breakfast tacos  but they were actually very good  Not greasy at all and salsa green sauce are available on the side  so I was pleased. The tacos do come a lot smaller if you opt for corn tortillas instead  and the  migas  on the menu are actually just...eggs  or whatever vegan replacement they use -- didn t taste like JUST egg to me  but I could be wrong  with some green onion and everything bagel seasoning sprinkled on them.

I m going to have to disagree with some folks here and say that I liked the simple atmosphere. It s peaceful. And if you are looking for a regular breakfast tacos   don t stop here because my taco was different and incredible tasty. The food is prepared at the vegan place next door.  I was feeling adventurous one day and went for a house specialty. The Trailblazer has avocado  migas  pickled celery  cabbage and buffalo sauce. I thought it was a fair price for something unique and delicious.  I looked forward to my second visit and the taco did not disappoint. No complaints about my mocha or americano.  Also  bonus points for plenty of free parking and no traffic.

The evening food was super delicious  And the cocktails too  It s a cute  small place with Mexican inspired vegan food that is just off the chain. We had the fish tacos  tlayuda  a gin taco and chocolate mousse. Loved everything and had a nice server as well
Walked in. Waited and waited while the barista talked to her coworker. Finally was told she will get with us in a second only to keep ignoring us. Beer plant is great this place sucks.

this place is so incredibly mediocre  it frustrates me. If the food was reasonably priced  I d be less so  but everything here is stupidly expensive. Today I payed  7 for a dirty chai tea latte that tasted more like water than chai spice or espresso. I got a COVID test to see if it was me or the latte  and it was the latte. There s also a taco with ranch on it  I m sorry  but that is WRONG. You can t wrap salad dressing in a tortilla  call it Mexican breakfast cuisine  and then peddle it to me for  6. I suppose Tellus Joe dares to dream. I will just dare to take my money elsewhere

The decor and customer service is good but  6 breakfast tacos  Come on man  For that price they should be two tacos in one.  The taste was average which in a city that claims to be Taco city you need to up your game. But maybe just maybe they only want a certain demographic as their patrons. If your looking for a breakfast taco that s worth is weight try another option.

One of the better taco trucks I ve found in Austin.  Nondescript truck with yummy tacos.  Great choice for a snack after drinking at Bender Bar right down the block.    I ve had the Pastor  Fajita  Carnitas  Barbacoa  nothing disappointing.  Favorites so far are the Carnitas and one with beef and chorizo whose name escapes me.  If you like tacos al pastor  these are pretty good for Austin.

Mexican mobile taquerias have been around long before airstream cafes were even a bleep on the Austin map.  These underrated  or non-rated  spots don t get enough attention because they don t have retro signage  Twitter accounts  or even a name sometimes.    This particular taco place is quite nondescript - it s pained red and white  and it simply says  Taqueria  on the sign.  There is  however  a flashing strobe light  and that s what first caught our attention.  We only tried the beef fajita tacos  but let me tell you - I don t think I ve ever fallen in love with a taco  and I did with this one. Amor   Tender and juicy beef  perfectly grilled onions and green peppers  plenty of cilantro  and tortillas with just the right flexibility and flavor.  When were were done with our late-night snack  I inquired about the name of the taco trailer  and the woman informed me they were named Taqueria Olivas. She was super nice and asked if we liked our tacos. We ll be back for more   p.s. I had been suffering from a stomach bug  and after this taco  I actually felt better.
This stand has some of the best tacos in Austin.  carnitas- some of the best i have ever had.  chorizo- top quality  not floating in grease.

Hands down the best tacos in austin. Its a taco stand  and their open very late. Perfect on so many levels. I cant even begin to discribe how scrumptious these things are. They are little nuggets sent from above  and its every time I go. Cheap  delicious  late night  south austin  damn.. I think Im gonna go get one right now. You gotta check it out

would have liked to try the tacos  but the horrible customer service got in the way... ordered with friend late probably around two. i wasn t paying attention  cook put bag on counter  friend picked up bag. Only two tacos in bag as we come to find out  hey we ordered 4...go back to taco stand to get other two tacos...cook insistant that he made and gave us tacos even tho we did not have them  insisted that someone else stole them and it was not his problem that we left them here  even tho we ordered together and had only two tacos in bag...keep in mind we tipped as well...cook offered to make me two more tacos for 2.00  even tho i just wanted my origanal two i paid 3.50 for...then threatened to call police when i insisted on my money back or my tacos...bad experience

The food here was outstanding  My mother  amp  grandmother  both from Mexico City  cook authenticity  so I m a little spoiled on taqueria foods. I felt like Vivi  the lady that took the order  went the extra mile and gave me a sample taco of her special. It was delicious barbacoa with a Consume WOW   I felt like I had just traveled to my grandparent s house. The food was outstanding    Note   There were two Taqueria trucks side-by-side  and I took food from each to sample. I have to say the same here at Mi Zacazonapan is outstanding    There is another truck next door. The  the truck was named Yucat n  and the breakfast taco was fair and gave you a lot. I ordered potato  egg cheese  and beans. It had so many potatoes  and it tasted like I was eating a potato burrito.   Thank you  Vivi  Emy  amp  Gaby  for the great food.

Delicious tacos   Stopped by to try different trucks at the Sunoco and decided to give Taqueria mi Zacazonapan a go  since I ve had the Taqueria los Regios before. Wanted to pick a truck with lengua tacos  and Zacazonapan delivered with the taste  I ordered the barbacoa  lengua and al pastor on flour tortillas and cilantro onions. Squeeze a little lime and sprinkle a pinch of salt  and all the variety of their salsas make the tacos  So yummy  Barbacoa was tender and the best bite. I ve got to go back and try the other kinds of tacos

Breakfast tacos   2.25 for two ingredients  35 cents for additional ingredient.  We had two bacon egg  1 cactus egg  1 potato egg.  All of the tacos were very reasonable size and filled appropriately  not too much or too little.  This truck is located at the gas station next to the soccer stadium with about 7 other trucks.  Parking can be slightly challenging with all of the food trucks and gas pumps in use  Would definitely do again  the tacos were really good. Note  the red sauce was hot but the verde sauce was like lava. Watch out

You have to try the Beef Fajita Bowl  Something this healthful rarely tastes so good  It starts with a broccoli and cabbage slaw base  topped with meat  cheese  corn  guacamole  pepitas  pico  radish slices and some fresh limes to juice. Some sort of creamy dressing comes on the side  but I didn t think it needed it  because the guac served as dressing enough. You can customize it more to fit your tastes and diet. I don t normally like broccoli and cabbage slaw  but everything else was so flavorful that I didn t notice the tastes I usually dislike from those vegetables. Now I m going to have a hard time not ordering one of these each time I go grocery shopping
Everything tasted good but some of the textures were weird  like I thought the broccoli greens were not the best base for a salad bowl and the queso was runny.

My husband and I ordered a side of chips. We had also ordered brisket at Texas BBQ place right next door to make brisket nachos. The chips come with queso but we were able to sub for guacamole. The worker was nice and helpful but even added a small side of pico de Gallo to our order. Overall the chips were solid. The guacamole was good but it was hard to scoop with the chips as they kept breaking. My husband thinks the guacamole was sitting in the fridge too long and wasn t closer to room temperature.

My guy and I shared an order of Pastor tacos  and another of Carnitas Quesadillas. Both were very tasty  and very filling even without sides.  The pastor tacos were unexpectedly spicy. It was good  but didn t have the balance of heat and sweet that I find in the best pastor. In my taco  I found only one discernible bit of pineapple  and wanted a little more   Red and green salsa came with the tacos. I m used to getting one mild and one hot sauce  but I found both really hot. I admit I m a wimp in this area  though.  The quesadillas were deliciously greasy and overstuffed with yummy carnitas  a generous serving with pico de Gallo and a lime wedge on the side.  At  8 an entree  this place isn t  quite  as overpriced as the other HEB Main Streat options  but in a town full of 2-3  tacos and full Mexican meals for 8-10   in sit-down restaurants where in non pandemic times you can feast on chips  amp  salsa   this wouldn t be a high priority taco destination for a value-hound like me.

Meh.  They have tacos  tortas and bowls.  They have four kinds of protein  one of which is a vegan Impossible Picadillo.  I had a pastor torta and street corn.  The street corn was forgetable.  The torta had a lot of different stuff on it and a strong spicy salsa.  You can get better tortas in food trucks all over Austin ...  But this was not terrible.  The draw for many people might be the Impossible Picadillo.  There are other vegan Mexican places out there ... but I am not sure they would be better than Calle Taqueria.  A lot of those vegan trucks are pretty weak.  If I was positively absolutely having lunch at Mueller HEB  I would think about the duck fat fried chicken place.  But then HEB premade salads are pretty good.  I would probably forget about the food stands  get a ready-to-eat salad  and have that and a drink out on the patio.

For an inside-HEB little  affordable restaurant  I truly feel like Calle Taqueria is great. We got 2 bowls  a trompo and an impossible picadillo on broccoli slaw. We thought these were tasty and enjoyed the guacamole  pico  and corn that came with it. We also got the side of beets and pepita. However  menu does not say it comes with a type of spread cheese. I LOVED the combination of whatever the spread was mixed with the beets and pepitas. I had low expectations but would definitely go again   We did not try the tacos or anything else  but they advertise as having homemade corn and flour tortillas. We look forward to trying them soon.

I am not one to usually complain about fast food restaurants because I do get that society typically treats them lower than they deserve. Also I understand that they have a lot going on and some people just suck to deal with. With that in mind  this location has given me multiple incidents or poor behavior.   This current trip was at 11 45 pm on 9 10 2015. Now  I understand that they close at 12 I get this  but  I work late and do not get off until 11 and this location is close to my house. I pulled up to the drive-thru and am greeted accordingly. As I begin to give my order I can hear a male voice yelling in the background  no  no you can t have it  and laughing every time I asked for something. It was hard to even hear the guy I was speaking with because of this person.   On top of that  they were out of everything I wanted. Chicken  beef  beans and chulupas  I do get that it was the end of the night  but business s have scheduled hours for a reason and as a food establishment you should be able to provide your  food  inside those hours.   They were not polite   I get it last customers before you close  I m sorry I was hungry I just got off work. I didn t want to but  my stomach overruled my decision to just go home. I finally just told them never mind and left. This is just one of many occasions that they have not got my order correct or they were just completely incompetent.

See all the other comments. This place is always out of everything  meaning the garbage service I get every time I come here starts from the top. Today s episode started when I went to get breakfast at 9 45 AM. They said they were only serving lunch. I asked when breakfast ended and they told me 11. So I confirmed they were not serving breakfast and they said  that s what I just said.   I know fast food isn t fine dining  but this location has the worst  most rude employees I ve even seen. And this has been their standard for years.
If I could give 0 stars I would. Not only was my order incorrect  the guy at the window was super rude.

Terrible service. Have placed multiple orders through Uber eats and door dash. Every single time parts of my order are missing  details in the order are missed. Absolutely ridiculous  this place needs some detail oriented employees.   This is just one example of the terrible execution on their end  this is a dorito taco in the picture down below. What a joke. Thanks for the taco shell guys.

This location sucks. Don t go here. They will mess up your order time and time again and not help you order a simple black bean quesarito unless you order it on the app that never works  I need someone to explain to me how this makes sense..  we can make it for you if you ordered it on an app that doesn t work but we can t make it happen if you drive up to the window because they discontinued the button  that s some bull. They just made me one last week.... Get it together Taco Bell. You have just lost business because of a simple quesarito. Way to go.   Sincerely the pissed off pregnant woman
A shame the employees can t do their job    Didn t  Bsbdbdjdjdjdjdj bend rhe rn end r. End

Drove here to pick up an online order I d placed at 12 30  because they are open til 1.  I got there at 12 40 and no one was responding. I knocked on the window and said I was there to pick up my order and they said they were closed and that they closed at midnight. 1AM is literally plastered all over the building  on the drive thru  in the app  and here on yelp.

I haven t had Taco Bell in like two years or so. Finally decided it s time again lol . The chicken quesadilla wasn t even sliced   barely grilled and the inside wasn t warm or melty. The Crunchwrap was super flat with almost nothing but the lettuce . Chalupa was ok but super poor compared to ones I ve had in other locations. They forgot to include one of the burritos we ordered so that was a waste of money. The entire order was basically a whole bunch of mostly empty tortillas. I will never be back here again.

okay i have never ever not liked taco bell in my entire life but last night i had the chicken quesadilla from this taco bell and my food tasted like it had chemicals or literally butane in it or something. i had multiple other friends order the same night from this same taco bell and they all said the same thing. three different parties. just beware bc i ve never had this happen before and it was awful.

Once again this location sucks. Couple days ago I came by and they could only accept cash. I came tonight at around midnight and was told the fryer was down  there is no nacho cheese  and several other things meals that were not available  including both meals that my boyfriend and I wanted to order.   Also  get yourself unlisted from favor door dash if you re not going to allow pickups. Twice I have tried to order bc it shows as available but nope. They actually don t do it.   What the hell. Either be a functional restaurant or close.

If the place is even open during the hours it s supposed to  guarantee they will make a mistake on your order and guarantee they will be rude to you over the mic  interrupt you while you re taking and make you feel stupid for even choosing to go to Taco Bell. Shut this place down and fire everyone who works here. Go to McDonald s next door instead.

Both soft potato tacos we got had like hard scraps. My crunchwrap had something super hard which grossed me out bc I have sensory issues and I had to spit it all out. All of their tables were dirty and they forgot 2 of our items and we had to ask for them. Wish I could leave a 0

This Taco Bell leaves a lot to be desired when it comes to even giving you what you ordered. Missing products and even when I got the right thing  it s got 7 soggy fries filling the box by 1 3. Unfortunate because it s in my area but I m not sure I ll be going back. By the way  either figure out that Baja blast zero supply situation or take it off your menu. Been months of it out.

Please fire the employees that work at night  They are unprofessional and disrespectful. They go outside and park their cars sideways in the parking spots and smoke and turn their music loud like they are at a club. Then when people pull up to order food they are drag ass inside smelling of smoke. The short one about 5 5 is the biggest pos ever. He is so arrogant and cocky and he sags he s pants so his underwear are exposed to everyone. I know a lot about this location bc I work door dash and I ve seen him get in a fight with a customer before bc the order was taking to long. It was taking to long bc none of the employees care they are all worthless it s almost criminal. I ve never seen anything like this. I don t even like doing orders from here bc I know half the time the order will be missing something and then I get a bad review. Worst wait  service  and management I ve ever had to deal with  They lie and say there s no button on their menu and you have to order it online  ok I did and it s not available online. Y all need to fix your closing time if you re going to close an HOUR early. I drove about 25 min only to get told they are closing. No explanation or anything. Very rude. If I could give ZERO stars  I would. Also says they re open on doordash  fix that too.
They never  ever get the order right for me. Double meat chicken quesdailla wasn t. Just bad.
Ginger dude holding it down solo. Mad respect. Very nice and helpful staff. Management needs to help him out.
This is my third strike here. I don t even have to say much the picture says it all. My orders are never right. Staff is always talking laughing and this is how my food comes out

So I already hate Taco Bell and this is exactly why... Taco Bell never takes pride in their service nor the quality of the frozen food they serve as I used to work there in my high school days so I know everything comes in a bag and is just heated over hot water... that s exactly how it tastes too... disgusting.... This one burrito was all they had to make and I asked for extra sauce and cheese... I had NONE OF THAT... just what you see is what I got... a clump of old beans that I mashed out with no sauce and NO CHEESE EITHER... what in the heck     These people have screens with orders and they don t bother to make sure you get what you ask for... the order is right there... Taco Bell needs to close.... The food is just horrible and has always been horrible... why did I go  In hopes something has changed but only to find it s still the same where staff just don t pay attention and BAD FOOD    Never AGAIN... had to add my own got darn cheese
