Wow  What an experience that I ve had at this particular Taco Bell. So I think we can all agree  it would outlandish to expect great service from any Taco Bell. I ve never been at a Taco Bell where I was wowed by great customer service  a clean restaurant or having my food come out good or the way I ordered it. However  this particular Taco Bell... WOW   So I placed an order through the app  because it s save not only me time but the employees when they can just look up the order without having to type and change everything. I go through the drive thru  get my food and pull into the parking spot because very rarely is my order correct. To no surprise to me  the order wasn t made correctly. It was close  the Gordita Crunch was made with the wrong shell which is an easy mistake but my Potato Griller was made outrageously small. I almost laughed in my car when I showed my friend it  because there s no way someone can think this is normal.  So I went inside  where a gentleman from the front desk immediately asked  Was there something wrong with your order   I said yes  took out the two particular items in question  explaining that my Gordita Crunch was supposed to be made with the Doritos Nacho Cheese shell. I then explained that the Potato Griller was laughably small. I took it out of the wrapper to show that it s literally the length of my fingers and very thin. The manager comes over to look  and informed me that the Potato Griller was made correctly and that is the size it s supposed to be.  I just smiled and said that s fine. I just figured I would take a picture of the burrito and ask the public if they think this is acceptable. I also was going to send the picture to Taco Bell and see what they think. I ll post the pictures to my review.  Here s my version of expectations vs reality

This location always skimps on the fillings. I m not sure if they think lettuce and tomato are that expensive  but I ve paid extra for  extra  lettuce and tomato and still received less than standard.  The last time I went they managed to mess up every item that we ordered  including giving us some of the wrong items. The staff was rude and didn t greet us at the window or even make eye contact. 0 10  would not recommend and will not be back.
I went inside the restaurant to pick up the order  I didn t know It was open for drive-through only  here it was a surprise  I can t believe how dirty it is

I have a new theory  there is a black hole of suck centered on the 620 2222 intersection where the majority of places fall into the meh-awful zone.  My other reviews will bear this out  as the farther they are from this intersection the better things tend to get.  This Taco Bell falls on the  awful  side of the zone.  Like the other places in the area  it s understaffed and the staff that does bother to show up seems bummed out.  I ve had bean burritos that were watery  and quesadillas which have been rimmed with burned cheese.  Everything else is as dispirited tasting as the staff looks.  This place gets a 1 on the  CTJ Scale  as noted below.  5 out of 5 stars  Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing on after finishing a plate here. 4 out of 5 stars  Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary. 3 out of 5 stars  Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus  Dad. 2 out of 5 stars  Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn t have my last supper here. 1 out of 5 stars  Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn t have my penultimate supper here  either.

I love this place my food is always made very well and I get my order very good and some people hate Taco Bell but I m in love with Taco Bell .  There is very good service there there was this lady who complimented me and she made me very happy because it was the day my uncle died and ever since that day Taco Bell has been my to-go place. Thanks you Taco Bell for being there and making the best place in Texas for me that my be the place I start my career because I m still in school . I tell my mom to take me there when I get money because I love Taco Bell and when I go out with my friends we always end up going to Taco Bell because of me . So thank you Taco Bell for everything

Order placed  four crunchy tacos with sour cream added and a supreme beef burrito. They were out of sauce. Received three crunchy tacos no sour cream and a bean burrito. Just lazy  mess up   who cares  teenage bull shit. Go to Whataburger after the bar.  This place can t find their own ass.   CB

Ordered online  had my relative pick up the order.  Got home  NO Nacho s.  Called and they said Oh yeah  we left that out of your order.  Asked for refund and was told that was not possible.  CAll Tacala.  WTF   Ridiculous.  Rip.  No one cares anymore.  Pitiful.  Was told come back and we will make the order.  Duh.  Only live 10 miles away.  1 way.  Really.

This was a great place until tonight. The food tasted like rotten fish  there was no lettuce in it like usual  and they just threw in a cheese empanada in there after the girl at the drive thru told them I was vegan. Really disgusting food tonight. Also a guy answered the phone and lied about being the manager. I ve never had a problem at any Taco Bell until tonight. Really shocking...  esp.after years of having gone to Taco Bell....

Idk why I keep giving this place a chance  I guess it s due to my kids and myself being hungry and this is our only option since I didn t have my car today. But they get something wrong every time and barely put meat in the tacos. I will stop spending my money here.

The management at this Taco Bell needs to go. Do not eat here. Sarah was completely rude and uninterested in needs of the customer. A new employee  Emilio  was the only person who stepped up to help assist. Side Note   This was a Thursday morning at 11 30 AM. There were no other patrons in the restaurant and it was slow.  We placed an office order with 30  tacos burritos bowls etc. Nothing was labeled to determine what was chicken  which had no tomato  which were vegetarian  continued on. When the manager was asked to help identify the food  she turned her back and didn t communicate with me at all. She stated they were wrapped with what they were. However  the wrapping listed 4 or more types of food the taco could have been and nothing was circled or indicating which order it was. I asked for the District Manager s name and number. They gave me Mike s name and a number where I was to leave a VM.  We all know what that means  i ll never get a call back.   After picking through every taco to make sure the order was correct  only to discover items missing. I left feeling extremely frustrated for wasting 15 minutes there  tacos became soggy and no hot sauce or silverware or napkins included.  I ve worked in customer service a long time and there s a reason places like Chik-Fil-A are thriving.

Wow. Taco Bell out of meat and anything resembling something to eat. They told us to come back in 20 minutes if we wanted to be served. Not the optimal outcome especially with a car full of kids that were hoping for the Bell. We took our business elsewhere.
This place has great customer service    we made a mistake in ordering and they were so kind    Mike and Michael were amazing

This is fast food I don t expect greatness but I do expect my order. If you have children check your orders. Over the last couple of years I have gone here off and on  the kids really love it. Unfortunately the food is different every visit. Sometimes it s gross and runny and unrecognizable and sometimes it s fine. I can t prove it was taco bell but sometimes i get a little sick after eating here.  Sometimes a Mexican pizza looks like some one relieved themselves on  a tostada shell and sometimes it looks like a Mexican pizza. The quality of the food is hit or miss without a doubt. How you can screw up beans from a can is beyond me.  I pay extra every time for sour cream  but you could flip a coin on whether or not I m going to get it. I don t like getting ripped off but when you short me on orders for the kids and now I ve got upset kids because someone is missing a couple of tacos  then ripping me off becomes a big problem. Will I still go  Yes  begrudgingly but I will check each and every item  and I will go in...no more drive through because you guys have consistently proven you can t be trusted.   I ve lived for quite a while with taco bells close to my places more than once and I have to say this is the worst taco bell ever. Avoid it and steer the kids elsewhere if you can help it or be diligent and check every thing in your order. If it looks like diarrhea chances are that s how its coming out too.

Most disappointing Taco Bell EVER  Walked in at 8 pm and was promptly informed that the location was  out of food.  What does that even mean  They said that the morning shift did not prep for them  but this is FAST food for a reason. Shouldn t it be fast to prepare

I give two stars for the food  the service has gone to crap. The last 6 months has been a steady drop in service and now the wait times are 20 minutes when there is an empty parking lot and 3 cars in front  tired of hearing that  employees just walked off the job  forgetting that they ve been saying that for a couple of months due to the delays.  Management has it all wrong  the people on day shift are as slow as slugs  night shift just is never there.  When will this one go the way of Taco Cabana - bad staff eliminates the customer base. Call it a day and end it.

WORST TACO BELL EVER. We went in for a remake because our entire order was incorrect the night before and we contacted the store and was told by Micheal come in to have our order corrected or refunded. Dalia was extremely rude to use for the moment we said we were there for a refund remake. She explained that the notes only had 2 items incorrect and we stated well if it is too much to remake we would take a refund in which she kept saying  I will not give you a refund   which makes so sense as I AM THE CUSTOMER. If i did not want the food remade i should absolutely have the option to have my money back. If she simply looked at the ticket and spoke to us like adults rather than some hoodlums that were trying to get free food we would have happily explained our drinks and ONE item from the night before was correct. Instead she had a horrible attitude the entire time made us feel as though we were in the wrong for not only wanting the items we already called about but for also saying we would take a refund. I could easily tell she was judging us based off the color of our skin  I don t know about her but  20 of Taco bell isn t breaking my bank and we literally only wanted our food. She made us feel uncomfortable  unwelcome and honestly uneasy the entire time.

The worst Taco Bell and should be shut down. They never get my order right  they close earlier than they are supposed to  give me attitude everytime I correct my order and the people that work there don t do their jobs.

I have to admit that Taco Bell is one of my guilty pleasures.... But this particular location is one that I try to stay away from  which is sad because it s the closest one to my house.    I will say that I have had more terrible experiences here than I have good experiences  and really how hard can it be    Let s start off with the fact that there is always something that they are out of for the night. Now I m not talking at 1am after a huge rush of people going home from the bar  I m talking at 9pm on a Friday or Saturday. And these are not ingredients a Taco Bell can survive without. When you are out of ground beef  chicken  beans  and cheese  you might as well shut the place down. My sister and I went 3 times and every time there was something they were out of.   Second  the orders are normally wrong  and if they arnt consider yourself lucky. I once stopped on my way home and did not check the bag because honestly you shouldn t have to. When I got home 15 minutes later I realized half the order was gone. I drove back up there and let them know this was the case they made me my  missing  items. By this time I had learned to check the bag after pulling forward  and immediately noticed that the order was still not completely there. I pulled back around and sat at the window  inside was closed  and finally  after 5 minutes  someone came to the window. I asked for a manager to personally make my last items as I figured they would at least try to make it correctly.  Which brings me to my last point. The staff is rude and incompetent. The manager that I spoke to just asked  Well what do you want me to do about it   I wanted to try and be nice because everyone knows a horror story of someone spitting in food  but at this point I was just irritated. I told him that honestly I just want what I payed  20 for so my family could eat dinner. He gave me the rest of my food and lucky for me  provided me a lovely little flier for a  free  breakfast item. After reading the flier I realize it s just a normal event they were doing to promote the items and that was for everyone. Gee thanks sir.   So it s safe to say I will stay away as best as possible until corporate takes action.... Which I seriously doubt they will since everyone in my family has called multiple times to complain and it still remains just as terrible.

Been coming here for years. I see alot of new faces now. Looks liked they cleaned house. Service has gotten much faster. The quality has stepped up alot. Lunch will always be busy though. Theres an extremely nice staff there now only getting better. The night manager very impressive. Puts a smile to my face every time i come in. Hes a comedian which nakes my visit through drive thru and very fun experience. Im very impressed.

Wife and I went in the drive-thru last night. When we got our order it was evident that it was hastily thrown together and the quality of the food was just awful. Called the manager Michael to make our complaint and he was very kind and assured us we would be taken care of when we went in the following day... Following day comes  we go in expecting either a refund or a new order  and as Michael had promised the night before some coupons. Instead we were greeted with a manager  Dalia  who from the jump was giving us a less than friendly attitude. While my wife spoke to her about the incident it looked like she didn t care. My wife and I are colored  and by the way we were treated it felt like we were profiled  black people trying to get something for free . She kept repeating  I will not be issuing a refund  and each time with more attitude. We weren t asking for anything specific  but we demanded that the situation be remedied for the subpar service we were given the night before. And to be frank Dalia made my wife and I very uncomfortable and upset.  Don t go here  we saw a woman trying to go in last night with an order that was wrong  it s evident they have no sense of care or customer service here.

This Taco Bell is the worst  They always have long wait times only Because of their own incompetence. At the drive through they now let people know there is a 25 minute waiting period. At 2 pm on a Wednesday. When they aren t waiting for glaciers to melt before serving you your food  the order you receive is normally INCORRECT and the employees couldn t give a shit. Even for a Taco Bell  the standard is low. In need of new management for sure

This place has gone downhill  hiring rude and lazy workers who could care less. Make sure you check everything you order here because there is a 90  chance it s wrong and overdone underdone. Ordering online is also a joke  they just ignore what your customizations are.

Okay  so I went to this taco bell this morning and I just want to say to anyone reading this JUST GO TO ANOTHER TACO BELL OR TACO RESTAURANT. Customer service was awful  and I will tell my story here   Sunday April 28  9 30 10 30 AM.  I pull up to the drive through and see NOBODY in the parking lot or drive through. I am greeted over the speaker by a woman  and since I have never been to taco bell for breakfast I know  I m lame  I ask her  do you guys have a protein bowl   her answer  no.  That s it  just a blunt  no  and then silence. So I ask  is there a way I could add egg to the power bowl or maybe substitute for something in the power bowl  Her answer  I mean...you can add egg on the side.  After that  silence. I then say to her  there isn t anyone in line behind me  do you mind if I have a second to look at everything   and she doesn t even respond. Typically  I would think a  sure let me know when you re ready  or something along those lines would suffice. But instead  she immediately replaced herself with a different guy. Literally maybe 10 seconds after I asked for a second  I hear a male voice say  what can I get for you today   So at this point  I am feeling rushed and I just order random stuff off the breakfast menu that I didn t even want. I pulled up to the window  gave the young man my money  and then was told to wait at the pit for my food. Seconds before I drove away  I looked through the window and literally saw the lady YELL at this guy  come on  hurry up   First of all  that is NOT how you treat your employees. You do not need to yell at them like they are in a sweat shop. When he came over  I asked him what had happened  Because she didn t even give me a response  but just put him on the headset instead  He then told me that she was  in a bad mood because of stress from the night crew.  I then responded to him with the fact that I too work in a stressful  fast paced environment and have to deal with hundreds of angry customers in my face daily. Just because you are stressed or having a bad day DOES NOT MEAN YOU TAKE IT OUT ON CUSTOMERS. Also  there was NO ONE in the drive through or parking lot  so it s not like there were a bunch of customers inside or out. I wish I knew this lady s name but her attitude was so awful and I promise you I will just go to the taco bell on 620 in Lakeway instead because they are always very kind and hook it up big time for me with the power bowls  Again  I wound up ordering random stuff I didn t really want. I wasted money and time  and I probably should have just driven away. I hope you can hear me Taco Bell at Four Points  because I am very upset with the way I was treated today. What s funny is  I am never that person to go on a tangent like this unless I find it very necessary. I can t believe this chick is a manager. I will leave with this--the young man whose name I didn t get was a tall brown haired white guy with colored eyes I believe. He was very nice and did nothing wrong. Another time  a young lady with long blonde hair  Chelsea I think   was so sweet and got my order right  So my one other time going here was not so bad  but man did this one specific time just ruin it for me.

Just left after being their first customer and the young man that helped me was unbelievably courteous. He advised me of my wait and offered me a drink and even insisted when I refused  Then  he mentioned he threw in an empanada in my bag just for the trouble. Unbelievable customer service  that guy deserves a raise or at least a promotion  Completely satisfying experience

One out of ten visits my food is made correctly the first time. Constantly having to send most of it back. Then I get eye rolls and attitude. Most of the time I ll arrive when I know there will be few customers and quite a few of these experiences I was the only one ordering. I discussed this with one of the managers and he said they just hired a bunch of new people. They either need to train better or make sure employees can read their screens. This location is one of the worst I ve visited in my life and I love stopping to get their food

I typically do not walk in and eat at Taco Bell. I usually go through the drive thru.  Today I decided to walk in and I m glad I did. We were greeted by Bryanne. she was so sweet and welcoming. Thumbs up to her   She definitely made my bad day amazing.

HORRIBLE customer service  I like Taco Bell food and that s the only reason I would go here.  They laughed at me when I tried to open the doors after hours and hid under the counter and Bella  the drive through attendant  told me  and I quote  please don t come to Taco Bell again  when we went through the drive through.  Also  who makes someone drive around the building three times for three different orders   It s not fast food when it takes us 20 minutes just to get a couple of burritos in the middle of the night with no business and six workers.  Like I said  Taco Bell food is great  but if I were to give this one a rate 1-10 based on customer service i d give it a solid 1.  If you really love Taco Bell and can deal with crappy people  go here.

Worst service I have ever got. Yea... I know it s a Taco Bell but come on... 23 minutes to get 2 bean burritos inside. On my lunch hour that really is tough. No apologies from anyone working there for waiting  as was everyone else inside this place. Always seemed like Taco Bell was fast in the past when I went. Very disappointed.
They constantly get our order wrong. Regardless of if the order screen is correct  the order is almost always incorrect. This location is pathetic. Don t EVER go there
Consistently the shittiest Taco Bell experience. Can t even make a quesadilla. Won t be going to this Taco Bell anymore.

Literally the worst Taco Bell I ve ever encountered. I was a tried and true Taco Bell lover in college  and since becoming pregnant have been CRAVING a crunch wrap.   All the ingredients were in a small clump on ONE SIDE so my pregnancy dreams of the  meat  covered in  cheese  were dashed as I bit into a taco she ll wrapped in a tortilla. What. The. Hell.   I will NEVER EVER EVER go here again. Complete waste of time. I m actually going to call Taco Bell corporate and ask for an investigation to the fraud.
I m sitting here eating right now and it just hit me...This is by far the friendliest  cleanest  most well kept Taco Bell I ve ever been in in my entire life. Pretty surprised....

I go here because it s the closest one to my home. Tomatoes and sour cream left out of my Taco supreme 10 30 pm and the only person in the drive thru so there should be NO excuse to rush or mess up orders. On top of screwing up a taco supreme they also managed to mess up the nacho cheese chalupa by forgetting the nacho cheese. It s always something every time I come here. Get it together and hire staff that isn t stoned out of their minds.

I wish I could give this location less than a one star. It s the closest location to me so I usually go to it more than often. When I order my food not only does it take forever but most of the toppings are missing. Last time i ordered a cheesy Frito burrito and the only thing that was in it was a tortila  cheese sauce and rice. No meat or fritos. Fuck this taco bell and all the dumbass who work there. Good luck at being successful human beings in life when you forget the Fritos in a friros burrito.

Service at this Taco Bell used to be good  it was polite and fast  the food has always been...well  Taco Bell lol. Now it is garbage. Went by 6-7 weeks ago  was told it will be 20 minutes before I could order because it was only the manager and 1 other person there  went else where. Tried again maybe 4-5 weeks ago  ordered a  3  3 crunchy taco supreme s   asked for no tomatoes  the manager told me that it did not come with tomatoes  only the taco supreme s did... I left. Tried again tonight  Pulled up to any empty drive through lane  employee came over the drive through speaker to tell me that the drive through was closed. Well 3 strikes and you re out. Lost my business for good. I ll go to the Bell up the street at 183  amp  Pecan Park from here on  hopefully that one will have competent employees that show up to work.

Taco Bell food is the same everywhere  so you always know what you re getting.  ...or do you   At least not at the drive-through window at this location    Several times my drive through order was incorrect.   It wasn t like we got someone else s order.   No - they generally got it close but not entirely correct.    Usually a missing or wrong item  but  hey  we once got a bonus burrito.   I don t know why I keep going back there.  I guess I m an optimist.  ...or a gambler

Welp  today was my last day as a customer at this location.  Once again  closed at breakfast.  Inside lights were darkened and when you pull up to the speaker  you get a recording that says they are closed. Between the poor management  continuous 20 minute food waits  out of food  out of ice  and sporadic closures during breakfast hours when they should be open  I ve finally had enough.  It s too bad because it isn t failing because of customers.  It s because the workers and management don t care and are driving business away because of their poor efforts.  If you aren t open to take business  you can t make money for your franchise owner.  I m sure your franchise owner thinks it s because there aren t enough customers to draw business and not because of how poorly run it is.  This area is growing exponentially and fast food restaurants are few and far between and lack in variety  so there are plenty of people to patron this location. Taco Cabana failed in our area due to poor management.  This Taco Bell is on it s way to the same fate it seems.  It s unfortunate.

I went here at about 10pm on Friday night and after placing our order they notified us that they were out of beans. Seriously  more than 80  of their menu requires beans   Needless to say we cancelled our order and needed to find some other options in the food desert that is Lakeway after 9pm.
Slow AF took 30 minutes to get food 2nd person in the drive through line then the guy didn t give us napkins sauce and didn t even ask if we needed any would most definitely avoid if possible...

Piece of advice  don t waist your or money at this location.  Food is half done and the service is really slow - 28 minutes from order to receiving food.  We ate and was on the way out of the restaurant when the guys behind us had finally got their food - 6 regular tacos smh

Out of taco meet at 8 30 on a Saturday night. It s not like they were busy. No customers were in the restaurant when we came in. We stood at the counter for a couple of minutes before someone came out from the office area. There wasn t even anyone in the food prep area. The only reason why they got 2 starts was because the manager came up and corrected the clerk before we paid.

- Gluten Free Menu  Yes - On-line - Size of G Free Menu   limited but at least they are aware  a href   redir url http 3A 2F 2Fwww.yum.com 2F 2Fnutrition 2Fallergen 2Fallergen_tb.asp amp s e692bd3ce4e95f9899c0a0b457b663dc8b10c00515504d923bf048806bc3264f  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  yum.com  nutrition aller   a  - Waiter Aware of the Gluten Free Menu Options  I wouldn t bet on it.  So come prepared. - Food   It is Taco Bell..  What do you expect.  But it is good to see they are thinking about people with food allergens  sensitivities  and intolerances.  So they get an extra star in my book.  They have the following suggestion   Suggestions for Wheat and Gluten Sensitive Individuals  - Tostada  - Chicken Fiesta Taco Salad  order without the shell and without the Red Strips   - Chicken Express Taco Salad  order Chicken instead of Beef   - Zesty Chicken Border Bow l  order without the Zesty Dressing and without the Red Strips   - Southwest Steak Bowl  order without the Creamy Jalapeno Sauce  I am not sure why they say to order without the Creamy Jalapeno Sauce.  According to their ingredient statement it should be OK to eat.  - Other   Stay away from the Fire Hot Sauce  the normal Mild  amp  Hot Sauce is OK There is a posting of their ingredients  a href   redir url http 3A 2F 2Fwww.yum.com 2Fnutrition 2Fdocuments 2Ftb_ingredient_statement.pdf amp s 02363f2eb7fa69f7628f4af0ee277c38175ab48b9b90491a1432c1bdfead8d5b  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  yum.com nutrition docume   a

This is my favorite Taco Bell  It s really close to my house and I always get great service and my food is always hot. Unfortunately Taco Bell has a reputation for being not very nice and bad with food handling. I ve definitely been to a few of those but I ve never had that experience here. How often do you get fast food service that not only was patient while you decided what to get and then ordered something complicated but also asked how my day was when i got to the window   They seem to have a good time working here too. One time a girl saw me looking at the hiring poster and started telling me why it s worth it to work there. Most fast food places the people look like they hate their life but I haven t seen much of that here. Even when I m not in the area I make the effort to specifically come to this one because I know I can trust them.

We live closest to this location but they repeatedly do not give you all of your order and we don t find out until we get home. I called this time because they actually only gave us one of our two nacho bell grandes  how can you miss that  . We even asked  is that it   and she said  yes  quickly but as to get rid of us asap and move on. Even the nacho dorito taco requested was the fire one instead. Last time.. a burrito supreme.  I spoke to Leslie the manager  we think it was her at the window  and she said she put me down on the list to receive a bell grande and a burrito supreme and something else at no charge for our repeated inconvenience. I then asked her if she d like my actual  name  to put on the list so I can actually  be on it . Ridiculous.  I ll be going out of my way to Parmer or Lake Creek from now on if I even decide on Taco Bell anymore. Not going to worry about going back to get these things. Fix this about this location please
Staff were supah dupah friendly and helpful. Food was amazing  I have ordered the vegan cauliflower tacos and it was delicious

Ordered combo platter of 2 tacos beef and fish that came with chips and salsa and a Agua frescas watermelon drink. Also ordered the chicken quesadilla.  Service was pretty fast on a not so busy Thursday night.   Tacos were very good. They were deep fried and the the green and orange spicy sauce that came with them were really good.  They have double tortillas like street tacos but these were dep fries and crunchy. Loved bother the fish and beef tacos very tasty. Chips were homemade and very crunchy and went well with the fresh guacamole.   The chicken quesadilla was good but next time I would probably order the El Pastor or beef quesadilla.  This also came with the green and orange sauce.    I would definitely come back and either get the same tacos or maybe try something new. Almost forgot the agua frescas watermelons was really good. Not to sweet but really refreshing.  I would get that again for sure.

So so excited to have Veracruz All Natural tacos out in LA. The migas taco in a homemade flour tortilla instantly took me back to Austin mornings  I could eat a grilled fish taco all day and especially this one  and the cochinita pibil was so juicy and crunchy in the fried shell. And the salsas   Really great to have this in the Line Hotel parking lot. I can t wait to come back.  You can also preorder for pickup   a href   redir url https 3A 2F 2Forder.dripos.com 2FHot-Tacos- 2B-Line-Hotel amp s 86a8ec8dd6932eb4d8b21b43bd921fc7553aae9ddd9fd3e152a4c22251a9b5b1  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  order.dripos.com Hot-Tac   a

Excellent. They open at noon on Sundays. Got the steak taco and pork quesadilla. Taco shell was crispy and flavorful  steak was juicy and tender. Loved the cabbage and toppings. Complemented it very nicely. Quesadilla was a bit sloppy  but so gooey and yummy. Pork had a lot of flavor and it was oozing with cheese. Def stop in while in Austin

Pretty damn good  I took the advice of other reviewers and they were right  The migas taco is the way to go.  It s delicious.  I would get 2 or 3 if I went again.     I also got the cochinta pibil and it was good as well. Not spicy at all.  The salsas were good.  The spiciness of the medium and hot weren t all that different but the flavor was.  The medium is a green salsa  more fresh and the hot was orange and a touch smokey.  The guacamole was good as well but a little too much lime for me and maybe the avocados could have been a little more ripe.  Love trying new taco places and this didnt disappoint.  Thanks yelpers

NOTE  Dined in my car on 12 11 2021  but there are outdoor tables there as well  Valet let me park for a short period of time  but you mileage may vary. My apologies for not taking a photo of the migas tacos - they weren t much to look at after unwrapping them and we devoured them VERY quickly.  LA s official food is tacos and deservingly so. I have never been to a single metropolitan area that contains so many different types of tacos stemming from different cultures  techniques  incorporation of unique ingredients... it s honestly incredible. One area that our wonderful city has been lacking in when it comes to tacos are Texmex-style migas. Yeah  we have HomeState  but that s about it. The one complaint I ll hear from Texans who come to visit are that we don t offer good queso nor good migas.   Enter Hot Tacos  brought to us by one of the most popular migas spots in Austin  Veracruz. Now  I actually haven t been to Veracruz in Austin  so I can t really make a comparison  but perhaps that s even better  as I can craft a review from more of a  blind  experience without expectations.  Starting off with something more familiar  and since it was a cold day   we opted to try out the birria. Honestly  it s comparable to most other birria spots in LA  but the consome is REALLY good. Rich  flavorful  piping hot. If you somehow got your tongue stuck on a pole  this is what you would use to lubricate yourself to get out. That would still hurt like crazy  though... so don t do it    The main attraction awaits you when you order the migas here.  Migas  literally means crumbs  but refers to the use of leftover ingredients like stale tortillas or bread in a dish. Now  these tortillas are freshly made if you order flour  so that s the route we selected. If you want it to be more photo-friendly  you can go for the corn tortillas. Those are dyed with beet juice to give your tortilla a signature pink hue. We opted for bacon in one taco and chorizo in the other. For me  the gold standard in chorizo is over at tire shop taqueria. Second place goes to The Chori-man in San Pedro. I enjoy my chorizo grilled until the outside is crispy and has that smokiness imbued into it. The chorizo here is definitely NOT like that. The bacon  though... the bacon is very well cooked. Crunchy and yet still retains some wonderfully indulgent fattiness to it. Perfectly complements the Monterey Jack cheese  black beans  pico de gallo  scrambled eggs  tortilla chips  and a little bit of avocado. Yes  these tacos are JAM-PACKED and you ll be able to taste each element individually as you devour it.   They re a little pricey  but trust me  that bacon one is 100  worth the price of admission. Unfortunately  it looks like the truck is no longer here but hopefully it comes back soon because despite being surrounded by all sorts of delicious tacos in this city  I feel like we re missing something now that Hot Tacos is gone.

I love tacos  And Hot Tacos did not disappoint  I had the Migas breakfast tacos and they were bomb  And they had a pink corn tortilla  so cool  J oh also got a watermelon agua Fresca and it was so fresh and delicious. They had some really yummy other flavors also. I ll have to try the pineapple on my next stop and the citrus pork tacos which sounded amazing  Also staff was great and super friendly. Can t wait to go back

Run don t walk to Hot Tacos AKA Veracruz All Natural of Austin  Texas.  I am extremely picky on newly opened places that I hit up on opening week.  Veracruz All Natural is a heavy hitter in the Austin food scene so much that they have expanded from their humble trailer.  Mr. Jonathan Gold recommended Veracruz All Natural to me when we were both in Austin for SXSW.  Definitely put Hot Tacos on your radar or  must eat list.   This is a taco that is considered among the best of the best in Austin.   The thing you will want to order is the migas tacos  Texas style.  For some reason they decided to tweak their Texas recipe and add carrots. I tasted it  and it s not as good. I repeat  get the migas tacos  Texas style  on a flour tortilla.  You can park at valet for 15 minutes and take your tacos to go. This area is kinda shady and I had trouble finding a  safe  spot in the neighborhood so you might want to pay for parking at the Line Hotel or find metered parking  if you re lucky .   Normally I would find a local park to eat my pandemic era takeout  but I didn t have the patience to search for a decent and safe park in this neighborhood. I just wanted to eat my food freshly made and hot. You don t want to take these home or the chips in the migas tacos will get soggy.  One bite while I shut my eyes  I imagined myself back in Austin having one of the best bites ever.   The texture. The flavor. This taco is sublime.  They gave me their fresh mango agua fresca to try and it is so so good if you re a mango lover -- do not sleep on this either  To complete the Austinite experience  order the Topo Chico.  Go eat here now before the line gets crazy long once more people hear about these magical Tex-Mex tacos

Tried this place after finishing our morning walk with the pup. Got here around noon and got the food to go.   Parking  truck is located inside the line hotel. We just walked in.   Wait  no wait. Food took about 5 mins to come out.   Food  3 5. Just wanted to try it after a walk so I am judging the whole place from its signature taco. I got the migas taco which is their version of the breakfast taco and the medium hot sauce. I ate it at home which is about 5 mins away. By the time I opened it up whole taco was soggy from the beans heat. Flavor was ok  but the salsa overpowers the flavor of the taco so if you try it go easy on the sauce.   Environment  4 5. they got an instagramable set up. Fake grass and bar style tabletops on site is a nice touch.  Service  n a as we got it to go. Wouldn t expect service at any taco truck.   Overall  this place is about average.   7 for a taco seems a bit steep. Competition in the area for tacos is high so you may be more successful trying another place. If you are staying at the Line hotel  this is extremely convenient.

Missing Texas breakfast tacos  Now  you don t have to miss them any longer.  Opened by the famous chefs behind Veracruz All Natural in Austin is Hot Tacos. All of the lunch tacos are made of well-seasoned meat - from chicken  steak and pork. But  what you really need to come here for are the migas breakfast tacos. They are the perfect blend of chips  avocado  cheese and scrambled eggs.

We came for the migas taco which was what all the press has been writing about as a great breakfast  read egg filled  taco  however we were more impressed with the cochinita pibil  marinated in orange juice and achiote. This has easily got to be the best tasting cochinita pibil that we ve tried. Usually  for some odd reason  they end up being dry. We ordered both with flour tortillas.  We d easily come back if we were in the area again to try some of the other options.

If you re in K Town and find yourself hungry for something delicious and Latino  you must stop and try some Hot Tacos by Veracruz.  Their food is the kind that Los Angeles has needed for a long time. I saw them on the KTLA Morning News  and when I found their truck  I headed straight for it       price for  food  Learn their story too

Excellent  servings are generous  juicy and ridiculously good  Birria tacos were excellent and the quality of the instruments was great. Excellent temperature and the consume was absolutely wonderful and added so much flavor

This was a rec from a friend who had been to the Vazquez sisters  Austin restaurant  and holy crap am I glad I listened to him. We had the migas  chicken  and steak tacos and they were PHENOMENAL. Also pretty  so I m attaching a photo   The one less than awesome thing is the location - you re sort of in the driveway of the Line hotel  which is... odd  I m assuming this isn t the permanent location so no dings.

I live in Koreatown and I finally tried this place. The food is really good and the people working here are nice.    5 sounds expensive for one taco but the tacos here are big and filling. I don t think I d ever want or need more than two.

I don t feel it s fair to give this place a rating because I couldn t get any food. Valet said I had 10 minutes and if it wasn t ready I had to move my car. The parking situation sucks  How do you run a business when there is no street parking and what they perpetrate is if they have parking and they really don t. Am I going to pay 10 bucks to buy a six dollar taco  most likely the answer is no. The valets were friendly and courteous but the tone was you can t park here for more than 10 minutes. If the kitchen is backed up I am supposed to move my car. I didn t even want to eat it there  just wanted to order to go. I wish them a Lotta luck and hopefully their next place will have a parking situation that s better
The chicken taco was dry.  However  the Watermelon Agua Fresca was great   Both overpriced   Disappointed.

This is my favorite taco truck so far in Austin. Located conveniently on Rainey Street if you re downtown. The brisket is not only stellar it s the way they grill the taco shell and the meats  I m not sure what there  process  is but there is def a technique  Highly recommend for the brisket taco lover  The chicken  amp  carnitas are good as well but the brisket

Used to love the food here but had a horrible experience tonight. Had tacos from the Rainey location and mentioned these look a little burned and was told to fuck off by your employees working tonight. Both the man working the cash register and the man working the grill.

There s so many options on this street  and this place...nope. We were given the wrong order  but I ll eat anything so whatever.  I thought the portions were small  and I don t eat much. Prices are insane.  18 for 2 tiny tacos and a soda. There s a strange seasoning on the meat and chips that tastes weird. The meat was tender juicy though so it would probably be good if you re drunk. The queso tasted exactly like beer cheese soup. I like that fine with sandwiches  but it s queso. Maybe there s beer in it. If so  I wish I had known that so I would ve known what to expect because that just killed it along with those f d up seasoned chips. This food is not Texas. Head to the food trailer park instead.  This place is some bullshit.
The tacos are good  but they are expensive and small. Hard to justify 3 bites for  8.
Not sure why it doesn t rate higher  you just order from window.  I had brisket taco  was damn good.  Little patio to sit with view of rainy street.  not much to go wrong.
Underserved Overpriced Tacos Ingredients were decent Tacos were half filled  20  Service charge included for a guy taking your order from a window

My husband and I ordered tacos and the service was awful. We were greeted by an extremely rude man with red hair and glasses  who seemed annoyed that we even were ordering food. The food was mediocre at best. Won t come back.
rainey street sucks but this place is worth it. damn good food  plenty of seating  and a nice break from the surrounding permanent shit show. don t blow it nerd
Great food. Just taste something and keep walking. Or they have a little patio. The asador torta was delish

The only reason to go to Taco Bell is quick late night food. So why is it this place always closes early    They seem to close up around midnight  lights are on people are inside  just cleaning and refusing to take orders. I mean if your open till one your open till then    Funny thing last time I went sat in line thinking they were open..... nope each person sat in line  tried to get their attention and had to drive off. Thanks for wasting everyone s time
Mold in my iced tea.  Twice.  Complaint website is down.  This should NEVER happen.

I was wearing a mask when  in the drive-thru  I asked this manager why she wasn t wearing a mask. It literally says in the window that they suggest everyone wear masks. Her ENTIRE staff is wearing masks. She immediately got offended and said she  was vaxxed and boosted . I responded by saying most of us are  I am and vaxxed and boosted too  but thats besides the point. You can still spread the Omnicron to others. She then told me I was not ever welcome to come to this location ever again. I have literally been ostracized from a Taco Bell for asking the manager to be a patriotic American and save the lives of its customers. How fucked up is that  FUCK YOU TACO BELL
Customer should not have to ask for napkins. Handing a burrito out in a paper bag without a napkin is cheap  amp  not acceptable .

Ridiculous quality. Don t give any of your hard earned money to this location. I think the picture speaks for itself. I m not sure why they are struggling so much  but time after time at this location I am disappointed. 6-3-21 Around 11AM. The only thing edible was the Baja blast  and quesadilla which had 2 pieces of meat inside and the outer slices were just tortilla.   Seems like this has been an ongoing process for a while  that hasn t been fixed based on old reviews I read. That being said  I will be going up to the location soon  showing them this review  and leave with a solution or my  20.20 back.

They re usually good but I just had my boyfriend pick up a black bean crunchwrap and a bowl with rice and black beans and ordered literally 10 hot sauce and they gave me no hot sauce and so I ate the crunchwrap with a different sauce and therefore didn t notice THERE WAS MEAT IN THERE. I hope going forward they will pay more attention to vegetarian orders because I ve been vegetarian 10 years and this almost made me throw up. And this has happened at 2 different Taco Bell s as well where they just ignore the fact that it says black bean lol

Horrible customer service. My boyfriend picked up dinner for the two of us at this location today. As he ordered my part of the meal  which was modified due to me being allergic to dairy  the cashier literally laughed AT him without breaking eye contact. Completely uncalled for  humiliating  and rude.

Ordered my dinner from this place.  No sauce packets were included with my meal even though i asked for multiple packs.  I do not like my food without sauce so that was the first part of a really screwed up me.  Ordered 2 burritos with extra cheese  which i paid extra for .  No cheese added at all to either and very minimal beef and potatoes added to burrito.  These burritos were horrible...  Ordered 3 soft tacos which had barely any beef  cheese or onions.  Worst tacos I ve ever had and could only tolerate one.  Threw 2 away.    Ordered cinnamon bun as desert  guess what  it was even included in the bag but not surprised...  Tried calling their business as listed online but no answer even after about 30 rings.  You guys really think you deserve 15 dollars per hour based on your crappy packaging and customer service  lack of .    Wil never eat at Taco bell again.  They have zero pride in their products.
customer service is way better then the other taco bell s in the area. everytime i come to get food at night they are always super nice and my order comes out correct.
they got my order wrong  again  and didn t give me the receipt- also put wrong kind of sauce   this one always gets way too much wrong and it s dirty and gross   never eat here

Food was  fresh that s why they got 2 stars but they completely fucked up my order. I asked for extra cheese on my nachos  they gave me one drop   and gauc and they gave me some watery guacamole forgot the sour cream.

I hesitate to leave 2-star reviews for any business  but this location has been slacking the last 3-5 visits. If they are out of something on the menu  they should post that at the drive-through or remove it from the menu. What keeps happening is that they are out of a menu item that I placed through  3 different  delivery services  and instead of seeing the note for the replacement  the order goes through anyway and they don t replace the item. So the last two times I got a delivery of  Just a drink  or just a side.

I m basing this review under the assumption that everyone knows Taco Bell is a fast food chain.  With that said  it s not the best taco or burrito I ve had  but it s good. I ve always been a fan of theirs. The store is clean  the staff are professional  friendly  happy  accommodating  and hard working.  You can tell staff like their jobs and each other.  They also love dogs. The staff all make a fuss over my baby boy and talk to him through the drive through.  They re open late  it s fast  and cheap. I go here because the quality and service is consistent.  They always get my order right  too.
Bad customer service at this location.  The guy taking the order seemed very defensive.  I don t give a Fu k what issues he has going on.  I m never coming back to this Taco Bell location.

I ordered the taco salad without the rice   they fucked it up. I told then to exchange it. The chicken was bland. No taste to the salad at all. The most horrible salad ever. Should of choose taco cabana   they taste better and so are the prices.  Did I mentioned the mango tea has no mango taste. Never again.

Came in to just get Cinnamon Twists and there s no cinnamon on them.  This has got to be the most collectively retarded group of people to work here to mess this up.   Lobby was dirty and the lobby was humid and hot on top of that.

Don t use the online ordering option. I was surprised at all the customizing you can make on your order like removing ingredients and adding ingredients.  You can also just pick it up at the drive-thru by giving them your name. Easy enough. Well they don t bother customizing your order. They just give you whatever comes standard on their items.  I went back to just get my money back but they couldn t refund due to it being an online order. So I waited for them to correct the order. The online option is a great idea and would boost business if implemented right  but when the employees really don t care it will never work.
Did not give me my full order. Paid  14 dollars for a bunch of tacos and i ordered a grillled stuffed burrito.

When I went there  it had a sewage smell when you walked in. The bathrooms are very dirty and the soap dispensers didn t work  it made you question if the workers washed their hands. The food was sloppy and super greasy  everything would fall out when you picked it up and the food just tasted like it was sitting in pure grease. Overall it was disgusting  I have seen and tasted better Taco Bell.

I work HVAC a hot job.I came here at lunch starving and only had a hundred dollar bill on me soaked in sweat at 1pm ordered over 25  worth of food and was told at 12 30 in the afternoon they would not be able to give me change and I could not order then the manager checked all the cash in other registers where I saw many 20 dollar bills and was told she had no change so this place will not accept large bills bet will check them repeatedly to see if they are counterfeit but will not accept them.
The drive thru services was bad they did not let us talk or get nothing my order came out why do Taco Bell pays them to serve good food not bad food
This taco bell skimps on toppings most of the times. My taco bell here tastes like an empty tortilla  very sad

A true five  And you wouldn t think it by seeing the place  but after years of coming here they have yet to get my order wrong even a single time. Not once. On top of that  the service and friendly faces truly stand out. The WiFi has always been working when I needed it  and it s super chill. Here s hoping they re an app location soon
Love this Taco Bell. We come here all the time and the staff is so nice. Not sure why the reviews are so bad
5 stars for the lady working the drive thru at midnight. Haven t even tried the food yet but we left in such a good mood because of her awesome attitude.     receipt says her name is Lee P

How do you run out of beef        On a Sunday night     Be better prepared. That is simply unprofessional and ludicrous. Get it together Taco Bell. Off to McDonalds I go. You ve lost a loyal customer.
I ordered the 5 dollars special it come with one soft taco and 1 crispy taco I loved it

Where to start  Jessica who is working tonight was completely rude and disrespectful. She should NOT work here if she wants to be rude and disrespectful. I wanted to order a number 4. What she did was put each item on individually which made the cost more. I am not sure if she was pocketing that extra money or not. Yeah it was only .40 difference  but still that is one type of employee I would not want working for my business. Also the taco I got had nothing but brown lettuce.

In a time like Austin Texas were tacos are number one you would think a chain with the name like Taco Bell would do better. Ordered chicken soft tacos got shredded chicken soft tacos such a small portion I was able to put it all in one tortilla since the other ones broke in half. Best part about my lunch was the chicken was ice cold. When I called to talk to the manager they tried to put my name on a list and I responded with no thank you I ll never be eating at any Taco Bell ever again in my entire existence on this planet

It s a regular Taco Bell. When I went in it was deserted since it was an off-time.  But as I waited for my food  some guy came in and was clearly so thankful to the staff for having found his lost cell phone or something.  So I guess the staff is kind and thoughtful.

Around 11pm  the drive-thru took 18 mins and everything I ordered was freezing cold. I also realized a couple miles down the road that I was given the wrong order  but I wasn t about to turn around and sit in line another 20 minutes for that.

Rude service at the drive thru. The shredded chicken burrito taste awful  like chicken gone bad  awful  and they are our of their signature drink Baja blast which is a customer favorite  Too bad there isn t another location closer. Funny how they are holding interviews for positions as I guess most of the good staff left and I would want to work here neither if was the last place on earth

Worst Taco Bell location in Austin  The Man who took my order was rude and when I couldn t hear him because he was talking low on the speaker he yelled at me with an attitude  Then when I got to the window he snatched my money then I had to basically reach over into the drive through window to grab my food  Then not to mention my whole order was wrong  Wtf

Several years ago I stopped my 3 days a week Taco Bell habit.  I explained to my co-workers and family that the meat  beef  tasted different.  I didn t like the texture nor the flavor.   Well  now we all know why    Yesterday  for the first time in months  I stopped in there in a hurry to order a bean burrito.  OMG. I waited in line 10 minutes to order and another 18 minutes to pick up my order.  They spent much of their time refunding folks their money.  It s called fast food for a reason - bring in some staff at lunch time. Tables and floor filthy.
It s taco bell... Nothing special EXCEPT their cheap and filling double deckers  The cherry limeaid Sparkler is the best out there  Mmm carbonation

Caveat reader  I helped serve up delicious mouth-pain at this event for a couple years. That being said  I didn t make any money from it  and I don t think the organizers do  either. I consider this more of a public service than a business  clearing the sinuses of SXSW Interactive attendees. C mon  you look a little stuffed up. Have a taco   So  I know these people  and you won t find a friendlier group of geeks who share a love of very spicy noms. You get to assemble your own taco  soft or crunchy   starting with ground beef that usually comes in  hot    extra hot   and  vegetarian.  There is no mild. There is no medium. You get spicy tacos or you get spicier tacos. Don t be so quick to brush off the vegetarian pseudo-beef as any kind of slouch  either. With no beef fat to soak up the heat  sometimes these end up being the spicier ones on the table.   While I mourn the lack of cilantro and onion for the tacos  the emphasis with the add-ons table isn t really flavor so much as  um   damage control.  Lettuce and tomato might help soak up a little heat  but your best bet is with the cheese and sour cream. I don t like sour cream  so my tacos usually consist of a bit of beef and a huge pile of cheese.   If your balls are much  much larger than your brain  please enter the eating contest. They ll serve up the spiciest batch of taco meat they can make.   Usually there s some kind of worthy cause to donate to via jars on the table.  11 was tsunami relief for Japan and  12 was Caritas in memory of Leslie. Stuff a couple bucks in the jar and thank your friendly taco cooks.   The crowd at Nuclear Tacos is always a blast. I met the  Ow  My Balls   guy here one year. Oh yes  that means that my life is pretty much complete now.   If it comes back next year  drop by and indulge in a little foodie masochism. These tacos RULE.

YeHAW   Nucleartacos hosted a party at SXSW 2009  and it blew the panties off the Austin Hot Sauce Festival.  The party was free to the public with all you can eat tacos  2 complimentary adult beverages  and all you can drink Fuze  Sierra Mist  and Pepsi.  Also  there was a truck handing out free ice cream.    These tacos are HOT.  In addition to regular spices in the meat  they also added heaping scoops of minced habaneros.  The meat came in 2 5 atomic bombs  4 5 atomic bombs  and the veggie came in 2 5 atomic bombs.  There were two men cooking the meat up front.  One of which commented that I should see what else he could do at home.  But them he pointed to his finger and said   But I m married.    I replied   That s okay. I m a lesbian.   The two chicks from Philly behind me burst into laughter.   I started off with just 2 tacos packed with carne  just a bit of cheese  some tomatoes  lettuce  and sour cream sauce.    I ate with the two girls behind me and some other strangers  and yes  I cried.  I had a full cup of the 2 5 mixture straight up.  I think if I had a smaller portion of carne  it wouldn t have been so bad.  After I cooled my mouth  I walked down to Speakeasy for their free food and drink party.  On my way  I spotted Amber D. and asked her to tag along.   Speakeasy s was dead.  I ve never seen a SXSW event so dead.  And there was no food or drinks that we could see 20 minutes after the advertised time.  Amber D. and I made our way back Brush Creek Park for more tacos and drinks.  I had another 2 tacos  and I put the sour cream sauce on them so they were barely spicy the second time around.  Haberno Joy   There was also a taco eating contest  but I already had dinner plans in 15 minutes.    5 stars for   Tacos with a kick  Complimentary Drinks Complimentary Ice Cream and the weather happened to be gorgeous
